Job_Description:
Overview

This position will be responsible for providing an advanced level of support to their unit (dept) working across several simultaneous projects/programs by developing new reports and dashboards, expanding on existing metrics, as well as presenting recommendations for data improvement. Represent unit (dept) in cross functional, high visibility projects involving business partners outside of the department. Responsible for streamlining ongoing activities

Primary Responsibilities
Develop and produce mid-high complexity departmental reports and spreadsheets to include but not limited to project or product strategy analysis, historical reporting, work flow analysis, and financial analysis.
Identify trends, emerging issues and engage relevant stakeholders to develop project plans, organize virtual and physical events, synthesize multiple points of view and communicate findings utilizing such tools as white papers, reports and other relevant formats.
Perform complex analysis and judgment based work over multiple disciplines to support business decisions
Go beyond basic reporting and delivery with the ability to analyze large amounts of data and information to provide meaningful insights and professionally communicate those insights to management.
Drive continuous improvement of existing processes, develop new processes or enhance existing processes where required including maintenance plans, procedural documentation and custom tools for automation. Identify resources that can be utilized to support business operations or improve existing business processes. Provide input and recommendations to management.
Participate in the planning and implementation of new projects, programs, and plans to achieve short and long term business objectives; coordinate of the design and execution of various projects for the promotion and maintenance of the business.
Take a lead role in supporting departmental audits including user recerts, compliance testing.
Manage the planning, testing, and implementation of new projects, systems, products and regulatory changes impacting the unit (dept).
Act as lead for departmental system support, coordinating with business partners, vendors and technology to address issues for the unit (dept).
Experience and Education Required:
Bachelors and a minimum of 3 years related business line experience,

OR in lieu of a degree,

A combined minimum of 7 years higher education and/or work experience.
LocationBuffalo, New York, United States of America

The Sr. Manager Business Analytics will support a large national customer and be a critical role on this center of excellence team responsible for leading the market research work that will inform the business case development for further expansion of Coca-Cola Freestyle. Along with leading the 3rd party research design and sell in this individual will be responsible for cross functional dashboard development and adhoc analysis designed to quickly isolate indicators for opportunity or for the Coca-Cola Freestyle outlets. In a world where knowledge is power and data can be leveraged to accelerate growth this will be a pivotal role for the team going further faster. Travel is required 25-30%.
Conduct a situation assessment of the consumer, operational, competitive and other dynamics that are influencing performance in the market place (starting with three-test markets and expanding for rollout. Analyze these data and develop insights, implications and context for marketing planning.
Build a marketing plan (using the strategy developed thus far) that will stimulate consumer interest and action that will increase sales, cash flow and perception sufficient to compel investment in expanding beyond the test to an expanded rollout.
Deliver a successful test market that demonstrates the vitality of fountain soft drink category growth potential to earn heightened advocacy and agreement for expanded distribution of Coca-Cola Freestyle across the chain
Demonstrate how fountain soft drink marketing can progress beyond product-based benefits to a more robust and profitable interaction-based benefit structure.
Lead development of a marketing plan to support the roll-out based on learnings from the test
Work with customer to make Coca-Cola Freestyle a strategic priority and ownable point of differentiation vs competition

Qualifications

Education Required: MBA or equivalent work experience

Related Work Experience: 15+ years, with analytical experience, classical marketing training and experience, work with agencies (directly). Demonstrated experience: imagining new solutions, embracing innovative marketing process and programing, understanding and being facile with digital and social media milieu and cognizance of the trend and its role in creating relevance.

Technical Skills Required
Brand Marketing Strategy: Practiced experience of developing brand engagement through interaction vs consumer acquisition through the more traditional linear adoption process.
Marketing Research Application: Ability to develop, design, conduct, and mine research for findings that generate actionable insights to advance the core marketing strategy and further grow the business
Marketing Concepts: Knowledge of and ability to Imagine, develop and apply basic marketing concepts (e.g., brand positioning, brand architecture, SWOT Analysis, competitive assessment, marketing objectives/strategies, consumer segmentation) used in the development of marketing plans.
Trend Analysis: Knowledge of and ability to gather, interpret and apply multiple consumer/industry insights and trends used in the development of marketing strategies and programs.
Brief Development: Ability to deeply frame problems utilizing data to draw insights and translate insight into briefs
Creative Concept Evaluation: Ability to evaluate concepts and executions against requirements of brief, strategic alignment, and consumer impact.
Marketing Tools/Information: Knowledge of and ability to use marketing tools/information to identify and define consumer/marketplace opportunities.
Sales Strategy/Execution: Ability to apply marketing strategies to sales management initiatives. Ability to draft compelling presentations, sell and engage with local agencies, Operators, and Headquarter staff to sell in the plan.
Retail Industry: Knowledge of the retail industry (e.g., retailers, competitors, trends, visual merchandising, general business environment) related to multiple channels of distribution (e.g., mass, supermarket, convenience and petroleum, category chains, gifts and specialty).

Our Growth Culture

One of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years is having a company culture that supports and rewards behaviors that lead to growth. Our “Growth Behaviors,” as we call them, are ways of being and working that help to make us successful. Think about how you can bring this to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

Curious
Keep seeking, never settle. Staying curious about what is outside, and two steps ahead inspires us to challenge the status quo. Having the courage to look and leap is the way we grow. Because asking “what if?” pushes us to the next level as people and as a company.

Empowered
Make it happen. True empowerment is the result of taking responsibility. This means giving yourself permission to see it, say it and do it, and owning the outcomes. Because we move forward faster when we all take action.

Version 1.0, 2.0, 3.0
Push for progress, not perfection. There are very few overnight successes. Greatness is borne of many little victories (and failures). Share v 1.0, test it, and make it better. Then create the next version. Because the moment we think something is perfect, it will be obsolete.

Inclusive
Include, value and trust each other. We are smart alone but together we are genius. This means being inclusive, giving the benefit of the doubt and being responsible for each other. Because, for our company to thrive for the next 100+ years, smart isn’t enough. We need genius.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Your role at Sephora: You will play a critical role in helping the organization understand the drivers of business performance, including the interaction between our clients and our beauty advisors in store, beauty advisor education / training, and people analytics for our HR department. This position reports to Business Analytics & Strategy leadership, supporting top initiatives for Sephora by providing insights and recommendations to the executive team and cross functional partners.

The ideal candidate is data-savvy and has an intellectual curiosity to drill deep to uncover business drivers and present insightful, actionable recommendations to the business. We are looking for a data ninja that has strong technical skills, can mine data for insights and present back key findings clearly and effectively. This candidate can successfully build collaborative partnerships across the organization, independently manage projects, and work together with other analytics team members and leadership. The ability to concurrently work on multiple ad hoc and longer-term projects and flexibility to shift focus areas as needed is also key.

In Addition, You Will
Transform business questions into fact-based analyses that deliver clear insights and actionable recommendations
Design and execute complicated and structured analyses from beginning to end, resulting in accurate and impactful findings for the organization
Design and evaluate controlled tests (test & learn) to evaluate the impact of strategic initiatives
Work closely with product management and engineering teams to help optimize data structure and validate data integrity
Execute plans to gather data and develop practical solutions through qualitative and quantitative analyses
Automate reporting to be self-serve and improve processes to increase efficiency
Coordinate analysis for select cross-functional initiatives (e.g. new format roll-outs, launch strategy for new business opportunities)
Demonstrate our Sephora values of Passion for Client Service, Innovation, Expertise, Balance, Respect for All, Teamwork, and Initiative.

We’re Excited About You If You Have
2+ years of experience in an analytical, strategic role
Technical skills: Strong SQL coding skills required (can join/merge data sets with complex relationships); Moderate/Advanced Tableau skills (or comparable data visualization tool) required. Advanced Excel and Moderate/Advanced PowerPoint skills required
Strong analytical skills with ability to perform complex analyses to generate data driven insights
Ability to serve as an outstanding problem-solver with excellent business acumen and critical thinking skills
Great attention to detail and accuracy
Work independently, appropriately escalate or ask for help, and simultaneously manage multiple projects
Comfortable managing ambiguity, navigating organizational complexities and being flexible to respond to changing needs and priorities
High energy, positive attitude. Strong integrity and respect for others.
Experience with client analytics preferred; and experience in retail a plus
Experience with APT software a strong plus
Experience with LMS and Human Capital Management systems (i.e. Success Factors) a strong plus

You’ll Love Working Here Because
The people. You will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams - people you can be proud to work with.
The product. Employees enjoy a product discount and receive free product (“gratis”) various times throughout the year. (Think your friends and family love you now? Just wait until you work at Sephora!)
The business. It feels good to win - and Sephora is a leader in the retail industry, defining experiential retail with a digital focus and creating the most loved beauty community in the world…with the awards and accolades to back it up.
The perks. Sephora offers comprehensive medical benefits, generous vacation/holiday time off, commuter benefits, and “Summer Fridays” (half-days every Friday between Memorial and Labor Day)…and so much more.
The LVMH family. Sephora’s parent company, LVMH, is one of the largest luxury groups in the world, providing support to over 70 brands such as Louis Vuitton, Celine, Marc Jacobs, and Dior.

Working at Sephora’s Field Support Center (FSC)

Our North American operations are based in the heart of San Francisco’s Financial District, but you won’t hear us call it a headquarters - it’s the Field Support Center (FSC). At the FSC, we support our stores in providing the best possible experience for every client. Dedicated teams cater to our client’s every need by creating covetable assortments, curated content, compelling storytelling, smart strategy, skillful analysis, expert training, and more. It takes a lot of curious and confident individuals, disrupting the status quo and taking chances. The pace is fast, the fun is furious, and the passion is real. We never rest on our laurels. Our motto? If it’s not broken, fix it.

Sephora is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. Sephora is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.

Sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

Company Overview

SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

Overview

The Business Insights Analyst position is responsible for collaborating across all business areas in the company to drive strategic growth initiatives through data driven innovation, process enhancement, and prioritization of action-oriented analytics projects. The position works closely with each operational business team to gather requirements for reporting, testing, modeling and data mining exercises, then incorporates all factors of analyzing, tracking, and rationalization to recommend solutions to our business.

Founded in 1978, The Container Store is the nation's original and leading retailer of storage and organization products, offering innovative and multifunctional solutions designed to simplify customers' lives, save space and, ultimately, save time. The Container Store has locations from coast to coast and a thriving online business.


What We Stand For
What you do matters. Experience The Container Store's employee-first culture where you are appreciated, valued, and empowered to work together for a higher purpose. We create exceptional customer service experiences while fulfilling our customer's storage and organization needs and living out the values of our 7 Foundation Principles.



Responsibilities


Develops and supports the Company BI and self-service analytics strategy, including the analysis of sales, profit, inventory management, payroll and marketing performance

Interacts with multiple business departments including Store Leadership, Finance, Buyers, Inventory Planners, Marketing and the Distribution Center

Curates data and insights into a format that can easily tell the story through concise verbiage and visualizations

Utilizes proficiency of data and systems to translate routine and complex requests for proper usage of reporting techniques and systems usage

Responsible for the investigation, validation and cleansing of data sources to ensure the clear and accurate communication of data insights to the applicable audience

Acquires data from multiple sources using business intelligence (BI) and database tools such as MicroStrategy, Oracle, Salesforce, etc.

Responsible for leading the Test & Learn Center of Excellence (CoE) process including the evangelism of Test & Learn to the organization, test design, governance, metrics tracking, and measures of success

Leads strategic and tactical analytics and reporting projects from end-to-end using the Agile Scrum project methodology, including the development, communication and maturation of business requirements

Collects, analyzes and conveys end-user feedback enabling prioritization of enhancements to standard reports

Responsible for developing, deploying and training of any new report or dashboard on multiple platforms including email, web and mobile

Maintains and reviews standard reporting processes and identifies areas for continuous improvement

Produces and analyzes performance trends and make recommendations to the applicable audience

Serves as the first point of contact for incoming data requests and systems questions from business users



The Benefits of Working Here

Our benefits exemplify our commitment to an employee-first culture, ensuring employees and their families are well taken care of, safe and secure. Some of our benefits include:


Competitive Pay

Medical/Dental/Vision Plans

Discount: 50% on elfa, 40% on Merchandise and Gift Cards, 30% on Installation

Paid Time Off plus Holidays

401(k) plan and discretionary match a

Employee First Fund: providing grants to employees experiencing unforeseen emergencies

Job Description

This position is located in the International Health Services division and is responsible for managing and completing complex reporting and analytics projects that support the International Business Teams. The person will retrieve, organize, perform analysis and present results on data pertaining to utilization and claim / fee billing.

Fundamental Components
Ability to interact with business staff to draw out their requirements.
Solves complex problems and takes a new perspective on existing solutions.
Consults on the creation of analytics solutions that effectively weigh business and technical tradeoffs using an intermediate understanding of business strategy as well as relevant big data environment topics.
Consults with internal clients to identify opportunities to implement data science solutions to business problems at an intermediate level.
Develop data/reporting tools to measure and visualize the results.
Presents complex information in a way that multiple levels within an organization can understand and utilize.
Create Hospital/Provider level analytics for contracting/re-contracting, particularly with carve outs.
Build consistent standard and ad hoc reporting processes to satisfy Health Service’s needs.
Acts as an analytics product owner translating business needs into analytics projects and actions.

Background Experience

Knowledge of healthcare data, metrics, systems and standards.
Demonstrated ability to research, capture, cleanse, and visualize data.
Comfortable working with large data sets to report results and/or develop key findings to be reported to a variety of audiences.
SQL and SAS programming abilities in data warehouse or big data analytics environment, including use of statistical analysis techniques or business intelligence application development.
Strong problem solving skills and critical thinking ability.
Understanding of relational databases, data systems, data warehouses and Big Data.
Strong reporting skills using Excel, Access, Word, Tableau, Power BI and/or PowerPoint.

Additional Job Information

Analytical and planning skills. Negotiation/influencing skills. Organizational skills. Time management skills. Critical thinking skills. Oral and written communication skills.

Zibby is looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Business Analytics Analyst. Our team is growing and is looking for an individual who thrives in extracting, developing, implementing and interpreting raw data in order to derive valuable insight for Zibby’s internal team and partners. These insights will be used for decision making, performance measurement and strategic planning across high levels of the business. This position will be based in Plano, TX 

Our company is scaling quickly and it is a great time to join as we build for the future.

Why Zibby? Zibby, is a mission-driven financial technology company with big plans to remake finance from the bottom-up. We build payment products that give 48% of the US population with low and evolving credit a way to get the products they need, from the retailers they choose, online or in-store. We are well-funded by top VC’s and equity partners and led by a team of experienced entrepreneurs and business leaders.

How You Will Make A Difference Every Day:

·    Maintain and enhance current reporting data including operations and performance data

·    Provide periodic analysis on operational activities and trending insights to drive business change

·    Build for the future by supporting reporting efficiencies and automation as we grow

·    Maintain SOP and support for Business Analytics activities to keep us moving forward

·    Assist with ad-hoc deep dives and custom requests that drive business decisions

·    Partner across business functions to create new models and reporting to enhance decision making

Tools That Will Make You Successful:

1.   Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Business or
Economics. Experience can be substituted in lieu of educational
degree.

2.   Results-driven and ability to handle multiple projects - “own it!”

3.   Strong interpersonal and time-management skills

4.   Presentation capabilities

5.   Strong Excel skills and proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Required

6.   Knowledge of SQL or similar data analytics tools (preferred
not required)

7.  Problem solving, detail oriented and collaboration mentality


What Zibby Offers You:

·    Fast paced environment where no two days are alike!

·    An environment where you will be able to create and
motivate others to be the best that they can be!

better!

Strong team and culture that allows you to have immediate impact

insurance, 401 K, and generous flexible time off policy.

·    Opportunities to grow and develop!

Herff Jones, A Varsity Achievement Brand, is looking to add a Sr. Business Analytics Analyst to our team. This role will play a crucial role in building the sales operations function at Herff Jones. This position will play a key role in transforming the way we understand and manage the business. The person in this role will be uniquely positioned to add value by bringing support to sales leaders and working with Business Intelligence (“BI”) to ensure actionable insights are distributed and communicated, ultimately helping to grow the business. What we want you to accomplish:
Design and implement efficient tools to communicate the ‘what’ AND ‘why’ of sales performance to the leadership team and the sales management team.
Work closely with the BI team to improve the effectiveness of sales reporting and analytics available within sales and sales operations.
Draw deep insights and analytics to drive sales performance while striving to build a scalable reporting infrastructure for sales leadership.
What you'll do on a daily basis:
Design, maintain and monitor sales performance reporting for the enterprise.
Develop and report key sales performance metrics, deliver insights and recommendations to sales leaders and management.
Performs deep analysis of historical performance and develops findings into data visualizations or automated reports.
Partners with plant management and finance to strengthen and enhance forecasting processes.
What you'll bring to the table:
Ability to thrive and work independently in an unstructured environment while prioritizing effectively.
Displays relentless curiosity and possesses a passion for bringing new ideas and turning them into action.
Strong communication skills and experience working with cross-functional teams.
Strong data analysis skills: experience with SQL, Excel power user required.
Data science skillset is a plus, R modeling experience preferred.
Experience developing dashboard and KPI’s in Power BI, Tableau or other data visualization tools.
3+ years’ experience in business intelligence or intensive analysis.
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or Applied Analytics or Related Field
Masters Degree Preferred
ABOUT HERFF JONES
Indianapolis-based Herff Jones is the leading provider of graduation and educational products and services designed to inspire achievement and create memorable experiences for students. A division of Varsity Brands, Herff Jones’ products include class rings and jewelry, caps and gowns, yearbooks, diplomas and announcements as well as motivation and recognition programs. Focused on building long-term relationships through a nationwide network of over 2,000 employees and sales partners, the professionals at Herff Jones have been helping elevate the student experience throughout the lifelong journey of education for more than 99 years. For more information about Herff Jones or Varsity Brands, please visit www.herffjones.com or www.varsitybrands.com. Herff Jones strives to maintain a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and harassment, where associates are treated with respect and dignity.

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

The Business Analytics Senior Manager is responsible for overseeing Cigna’s annual HEDIS (Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set) process for its commercial and Marketplace business (non-Medicare/Medicaid), ensuring that all aspects of HEDIS implementation are timely and well-executed.

As an Agile organization, this individual will act as the HEDIS “Product Owner” within our Agile delivery framework by providing leadership, prioritization and coaching to the broader HEDIS Agile team that includes an IT development team.

Key Responsibilities
Manage all aspects of the annual HEDIS reporting project (excluding medical record review activities).
Be accountable for development and delivery of HEDIS data in alignment with NCQA and Auditor guidelines, vendor requirements, and internal stakeholder needs.
Ensure compliance with the HEDIS Audit and other governmental regulatory requirements.
Assure the timely submission of HEDIS data and supporting documentation to NCQA and others as required by regulators.
Ensure final results are accurate, complete and submitted within defined deadlines.
Support our internal partners that are accountable for executing on the medical record review activities required for HEDIS reporting.
Be accountable for reporting results to management, along with timely identification of risk and opportunities.
Manage a team of 5 HEDIS data analyst.
Serve as key contact to Cigna's external HEDIS vendor.
Serve as team member for activities focused on HEDIS performance improvement.
Identify opportunities for improvement in the efficiency and effectiveness of the project, and recommend process improvements.
Stay informed of future developments both internal and external to Cigna that may have an impact on the project, and take appropriate actions.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and at least 8 years’ experience in a health plan-related field, or equivalent work experience.
Preferred experience in a supervisory role.
Preferred knowledge of NCQA HEDIS data collection and reporting requirements and processes.
In depth knowledge and experience overseeing, managing, and/or implementing data collection and reporting.
Preferred experience working within an Agile organization.
Experience working with data management and reporting vendors.
Experience and expertise in quality data analysis, measurement, and reporting.
Skilled in managing large projects with multiple elements and expectations
Skilled in analytical reasoning and interpretation and evaluation of complex information and problems.
Ability to guide others in adhering to deadlines and meeting timeliness expectations.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Strong communication skills: oral and written
Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex (including pregnancy), childbirth or related medical conditions including but not limited to lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital or familial status, genetic information, status with regard to public assistance, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by applicable equal employment opportunity laws.If you require an accommodation based on your physical or mental disability please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com. Job_Title: Sr. Finance Analytics, Business Strategy & Analytics
Job_Description:
The RealReal is leading the way in authenticated luxury consignment, online and in real life at our brick and mortar locations. Founded in 2011, we’re growing fast and fundamentally changing the way people buy and sell luxury — a multi-billion dollar industry. With a team of in-house experts who inspect every item we sell, our commitment to authenticity sets us apart and creates a foundation of trust with shoppers and consignors. Our mission to extend the life cycle of luxury items is leading innovation in sustainable fashion. We’re proud to promote the circular economy and to be the first luxury member of the Ellen MacArthur Foundation’s prestigious CE100 USA.

Employees at The RealReal are dedicated, collaborative and innovative, and we’re looking for exceptional talent to join our team. Build your career with us and enjoy 401K matching, health, dental and vision insurance, commuter flex spending, healthcare flex spending, generous PTO, a mother’s room, flexible work hours!

The goal of the Business Intelligence team is to drive business value through the innovative use of data. The full potential of data in e-commerce has yet to be realized and our challenge is to continuously create new ways to leverage data to add value to our customers and consignors.

As a member of the BI team, you will effortlessly navigate between the ‘what’, the ‘why’ and the ‘so-what’ of data & analytics. You will be a key partner to our Finance team to understand the current state of the business and uncover opportunities for growth.

This position is based out of San Francisco, CA and reports to the Head of Business Intelligence.

Duties & Responsibilities
Be the lead data partner to our finance team to execute monthly financial reporting and be the lead data expert for annual audits – Your team is the source of truth for our financials.
Pioneer new tech and methodologies that will move the needle.
Create, manage, and maintain critical KPIs and dashboards for stakeholder s
Spearhead architecture builds that will create a more sustainable financial structure for this next stage of our company
Champion automation projects across the financial data flow that include monitoring changes to our underlying data model that could impact financial reporting and building data structures to enable audit and reporting.
Drive selection and automation of KPIs, reporting, and analytics.


Requirements
5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 3 years and a Master’s degree; or equivalent experience in an analytics, finance, engineering or management consulting field.
Mastery of SQL (BigQuery, SQL Server, MySQL, Postgres)
Proficient in Python or other scripting language
Experience with data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Amplitude, Google Analytics)
Familiarity with database designs and optimizing query performance.

The RealReal is committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or Veteran status. We will consider qualified applicants for a position regardless of arrest or conviction records, consistent with legal requirements.

Overview

We are looking for a great data scientist for our Quickbooks Online (QBO) business. Quickbooks is used by over 5MM SMBs globally to run their businesses and we are the team responsible for using our data to answer the most critical questions facing the QBO Product Managers and Marketers. Everything from understanding the trends in our subscriber growth to shaping our product strategy through A/B testing and more happens within our team and we need top data scientists to help the business deliver the best possible product to our SMB customers. We are growing rapidly and need great people to support our analytical efforts in both Product and Marketing.

What does it take to thrive on our team? You need to be a top-notch problem solver and problem identifier. It’s also a good idea to know the standard suite of analytical tools - SQL, R/Python, some sort of data visualization tool – but we’re more interested in your ability to quickly learn new tools as the set of tools available is constantly evolving. Last, knowing that in most cases done is better than perfect is important - getting the current problem right to the sixth decimal place is almost always less impactful than getting to the next problem.

If this role sounds interesting go check out the product (https://quickbooks.intuit.com/) and if you find this exciting, then we look forward to hearing from you!

Responsibilities
Solve marketing and product analytics problems by doing work such as developing data structures, pipelines, and data visualizations that enable us to find insights and take action by working with click data, product-generated data, user provided data, third party data, and more
Perform analyses that inform decisions on everything from retention strategy to product experience using predictive and descriptive analytical techniques
Apply predictive modeling and ML techniques to problems such as predicting conversion and retention as well as customizing communications with customers
Communicate findings from analyses in a way that enables business leaders to make better decisions
Design and execute product and marketing experiments through A/B testing
Qualifications
7+ years of experience in generating and sharing insights from product/marketing data
Technical experience including SQL, some form of coding (Python, Scala, etc), and ETL/scheduling such tools as Airflow
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Superset, etc.
Experience working with SaaS-based subscription metrics including conversion, retention and product usage is preferred
Entrepreneurial spirit and passionate about data
Undergrad Degree in Quantitative Field (Masters preferred)

Job_Title: Senior Marketing Analytics Partner (Reporting & Business Performance Analytics)
Job_Description:
We are looking for an experienced business intelligence professional responsible for developing reports, business trend analyses, and custom business intelligence solutions for the Whole Foods’ Marketing organization. They will develop scalable BI tools which enable analysts and marketers to identify marketing opportunities, spot business trends, and assess marketing program performance.

This individual must develop deep knowledge of a variety of data sources, including customer, transaction, marketing, digital, and third party competitive data. They will document business requirements, integrate data sources, create custom database tables, build data pipelines, develop data visualizations and interactive dashboards, and automate report refresh and report distribution processes.

Above and beyond strong data and technical skills, the right candidate for this position will have a strong understanding of business and marketing performance. The position is located in Austin, TX.
Senior Marketing Analytics Partner (Reporting & Business Performance Analytics)

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced business intelligence professional responsible for developing reports, business trend analyses, and custom business intelligence solutions for the Whole Foods’ Marketing organization. They will develop scalable BI tools which enable analysts and marketers to identify marketing opportunities, spot business trends, and assess marketing program performance.

This individual must develop deep knowledge of a variety of data sources, including customer, transaction, marketing, digital, and third party competitive data. They will document business requirements, integrate data sources, create custom database tables, build data pipelines, develop data visualizations and interactive dashboards, and automate report refresh and report distribution processes.

Above and beyond strong data and technical skills, the right candidate for this position will have a strong understanding of business and marketing performance. Position is located in Austin, TX.

Responsibilities

The following duties are essential in successful execution of the position:
Work closely with a group of cross-functional stakeholders, translating business questions into requirements, analyses, reports, and BI tools which inform business decisions.
Establish data pipeline for BI tools, including integrating data sources, creating custom database tables, creating efficient data structures to support interactive reporting, refresh reports and automate data pipelines and report distribution.
Identify key business drivers of business performance to answer ad hoc questions, in complex situations involving multivariate analysis. Consider and explore multiple hypotheses to explain data relationships and trends.
Define and manage validation processes for data and reporting deliverables. QA data accuracy and help ensure consistency in metric and data attribute definitions.
Translate data into clear, persuasive reports and presentations for senior leadership.
Leverage analytic capabilities available through third party vendors.

Desired Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in IT, Statistics, Business, Economics, or related quantitative discipline. Advanced degree is preferred but not required.
4-6 years professional experience in BI, IT, analytics, marketing, or business analysis, Loyalty program analytics or related fields.
Strong knowledge of SQL and Tableau. Knowledge of Python scripting and automation methods strongly preferred.
Experience working with large enterprise databases, with demonstrated ability to independently query and prepare data for analysis and reporting.
Experience with brick and mortar retail is a plus.
Exceptional analytic skills coupled with solid business thinking.
Self-directed, innovative thinker. In addition to a strong attention to detail, strong candidates will also be able to see the strategic implications for the business in the big picture. You are fluent in telling the story to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong candidates will have a curious mind, a passion for synthesizing information from multiple sources, the ability to interpret data through the lens of shopper behavior, and a habit of translating data into insights that drive action.
Sense of humor a plus.

About Us

Whole Foods Market attracts people who are passionate about great food, the communities they live and work in, how we treat our planet and our fellow humans – and who want to bring their passion into the workplace and make a difference.

We offer great benefits beginning with a full complement of medical and other traditional group health plan coverage, 401k plan, and a 20% discount at our stores. To learn more, apply your passion today.

At Whole Foods Market, we provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all Team Members and candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, marital status, disability, or any other legally protected characteristic. Navigant Cymetrix unites the strengths of four category-leading companies to address the complexities of today's healthcare system. We design, develop and implement integrated, patient-centered solutions for sustained improvements in performance and profitability, working collaboratively across a spectrum of customers that encompasses hospitals, health systems, physician practice groups and payers.

The Patient Account Representative Specialist is expected to perform specific areas of billing, follow up, account resolution, cash posting, adjustment refunds and scanning as required. This position works with other departments to facilitate the meeting of both departmental and facility goals and objectives. This position is responsible for verifying that payments received are correct per our contract and for ensuring customer satisfaction and demonstrating the ability to find solutions to problems and keeping management informed of patterns regarding payments and or other issues with specific payers.

The Patient Account Representative Specialist has an extensive knowledge of billing, managed care, timely filing guidelines and the ability to effectively review remittance advices and electronic billing reports from payer to determine the action required. This position performs any and all related job duties as assigned.

**Duties and Responsibilities**
Contacts third party payers and guarantors electronically and via phone to resolve account balances on all assigned accounts.
Works all correspondence within 24 hours or receipt. Detail notes regarding correspondence must be entered into the system.
Works all denials within 48 hours of receipt taking whatever action may be required to obtain account resolution.
Appeals all accounts denied for medical necessity, authorizations, length of stay and timely filing issues.
Monitors all denials for trends and issues and reports finding to supervisor.
Bills or re-bills as necessary.
Ensures the hospital is in compliance with all state and federal rules and regulations both billing and HIPAA.
Assigned special projects will be completed within the time frames given
Attend training sessions and seminars offered by the Hospital and Third Party Payers.
Appropriately documents each account worked in patient accounting system.
Reviews same day and 72 hour admission report to determine if accounts need to be combined.
Makes necessary corrections in electronic billing system.
Forwards all address and / or plan changes to the appropriate persons to ensure the integrity of the insurance master is maintained.
Adjusts billings based on audits and or changes in diagnosis or DRG.
Updates patient accounts with corrected demographic or insurance information.
Downloads and processes all electronic remits.
Verifies the account number the payment is to be posted to and apply the appropriate payment.
Posts adjustments.
Calls insurance companies to obtain correct information when unable to identify if account payment is to be posted.
Reconciles cash posting with batch posting control totals.
Handles all customer calls both internal and external in a professional and courteous manner.
Returns calls as soon as possible, but must be returned within 24 hours.
Works with patients on establishing a payment plan based on the policies of the facility.
Follows the mission state and values established by the facility
Government Patient Account Representative Specialists
Reviews Medicare Direct Data Entry daily and makes corrections to claims that are returned to provider (T-File).
Bills or re-bills as necessary using electronic billing or Medicare online system.
Keys or makes corrections on claims as necessary in electronic billing system or Medicare online system.
Stays current with HIM trends, relevant rules, regulations, and directives from regulatory agencies and third-party payers.
High School Diploma
3 years billing or follow-up experience in Healthcare field.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Experience with Microsoft Excel and Word.
Requires prolonged sitting position and data entry.
Occasionally lifts supplies and equipment up to 25 pounds.
Requires good eye hand coordination and manual dexterity, mobility and hearing to normal range.
Occasional reaching stooping, bending, kneeling and/or crouching.
Requires the use of office equipment such as computer terminals, telephones, fax machine, calculator and copy machine.
Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills
Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently
Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment to coordinate work
Frequently travels by airplane, train or car as necessary to perform work at another location

Job_Title: Risk, Retail Credit Risk Underwriting/Policy Role, Analyst, Dallas
Job_Description:
RISK

The Risk division is responsible for credit, market and operational risk, model risk, independent liquidity risk, and insurance throughout the firm .

Job Description

We are seeking an analyst level candidate to join the Credit Risk division team. The role will focus on data analytics, data insight generation, trend identification and data visualization to help understand credit risk drivers, create guardrails and monitor the performance of unsecured consumer lending assets such as personal loans and credit cards.

Typical Responsibilities And Duties Include The Following
Support credit risk management senior leadership in partnering with business units and broader Credit department to assess data availability, data sufficiency, and reporting needs
Design and write data queries to extract credit data from various systems and conduct analysis of portfolio performance, deep dive analysis of trends, summarize findings and recommend changes
Provide support for portfolio credit risk oversight and governance by tracking the actual performance of risk appetite and credit risk management metrics against approved guardrails
Create Management reporting using Tableau or other cutting-edge visual interface-based tools to monitor portfolio performance at portfolio segment level (e.g., product, vintage, risk segment, score band, or marketing channel)
Be up to date on applicable regulations and compliance requirements in consumer lending and support Senior Leadership during interactions and updates to internal and external regulators
Adhere strictly to compliance and operational risk controls in accordance with company and regulatory standards, policies and practices
Address internal audit requirements and findings in a timely and appropriate manner

Responsibilities And Qualifications

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS/DEGREE AND FIELD:

Strong Quantitative/ analytical skill with Master’s degree (U.S. or equivalent) in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science/Analytics or a related field like Information Systems, Business Analytics.

Minimum Years Experience Required

0-3 years of experience in the related industry or in dealing with similar quantitative techniques.

Prior Work And Academic Experience Must Include
Use statistical packages like SQL, SAS, R, Python etc., tools to mine, manipulate & aggregate complex consumer and transaction level data on big data platforms such as Hadoop, Spark etc.
Use complex statistical techniques such as decision trees, regression modeling, machine learning, testing techniques and time series data analysis techniques.
Visualizing information/ trends from raw and complex data using visualization tools such as Tableau, and communicating results to a wide variety of audiences
Using advanced Microsoft Office skills, specifically Excel (including creation of pivot tables, logic functions), PowerPoint and Word
Strong writing, presentation and communication skills; technical writing and documentation experience desired
Strong project management / organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments concurrently across various stakeholders with ability to do end-to-end project delivery.

About Goldman Sachs

The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

In this role, the Analyst for Category Insights will be responsible for providing technical and analytical support to the Category Insights department and cross-functional partners such as Sales, Supply Chain, Marketing, Product Management and other key business partners. This role is an analytical resource to coordinate the development, consolidation, tracking and reporting of point of sales, units, GMROI, and other sku performance metrics to capture trends and collect, analyze and report related information to support in increasing sales and SKU productivity. This role is also to support assortment analysis on an on-going basis to provide recommendations for sku optimization and rationalization.

This role is responsible for implementing and producing weekly, monthly, quarterly & ad-hoc reporting packages, supporting development and usage of new and existing reporting within the data models, and completing ad hoc category analysis as required. This role will also assist in providing in-depth sales and category analysis to develop insights leading to sales & category growth opportunities. Success in this role is dependent upon one’s ability to synthesize sku performance data to extract key insights that lead to better decision making.

Responsibilities

Assist management in the development and evaluation of rolling POS & category reporting, which includes offering insight into sku optimization, rationalization and assortment recommendations.

Identify, evaluate and implement data analysis models to most effectively measure from various time periods as needed. Integrate POS and causal data to provide insights and recommendations to sales, product management & marketing.
Identify, evaluate and implement category analysis methods to most effectively draw insights that lead to sales and category growth opportunities.
Partner with marketing and supply chain to support new product innovation, demand planning efforts, and the constant optimization of our existing product portfolio and related categories.
Sales Analysis
The position will require timely communication and in depth analytical support focused on business solutions. The person is expected to develop a good working knowledge of reporting systems and demonstrate the ability to capture information and incorporate into spreadsheets and Power Point presentations to provide regular updates to sales and marketing.
Perform analytics & insights that assist in the category and GTM projects including business reviews, PLR’s & category management.
Lift key findings from technical analytics, connecting functional area performance and creating possible scenarios for the future; owns tracking and measuring of key business indicators.
Develop and implement automated systems for reporting of data.


Requirements
Bachelors degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, or Finance
1-3 years of Retail/Consumer products industry experience
Requires experience working with retail POS data in a CPG environment
Retail/Consumer products industry experience a must

Demonstrated skills working on small projects and basic analytic assignments required.
Advanced user of Excel, Access; knowledgeable in Cognos and MicroStrategy; JDA analytics experience preferred
Must be self-motivated, possess excellent communication and organization skills, project a professional image, and interact effectively with all levels within the organization.
Detail Oriented
Results Driven

About Us

Headquartered in Denver, CO, Ibotta (“I bought a...“) is a free app that's transforming the shopping experience by making every purchase rewarding. The company partners with leading brands and retailers to offer real cash back on groceries, travel, electronics, clothing, gifts, home and office supplies, dining out, and much more. Additional Details
This position is located in Denver, CO and includes competitive pay, benefits package (including medical, dental, vision), 401k, commuter stipend, and equity.
Ibotta provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, and genetics.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

The Company

Legends is a holistic agency that specializes in delivering solutions for legendary brands. We approach each project with our 360-degree service solution. Our Global Planning, Global Sales, and Hospitality service solutions collaborate on every project to ensure success across each of our six verticals including professional sports, collegiate, attractions, entertainment, international, and conventions.

Our intellectual property is our people. It's our expertise that makes up Legends. We know what it's like to be on the team, business, or athletic department side, which drives our passion in creating solutions for our partners. Collectively, our leadership has over 300 years of experience in sales and sponsorship, analytics and valuation, hospitality and operations.

THE ROLE

The Data Scientist is responsible for the design and supervision of all historical and predictive Analytical Data Models, Analytics, and Data Science. This position is responsible for conducting and supervising modeling, data mining, and database analytics using advanced algorithms and tools. The position will be responsible for using cutting edge technologies and methods to deploy supervised and unsupervised prediction algorithms, statistical models, and applying statistical rigor to Legend’s existing data sets. The position will work with all Legends’ functional areas to build new and validate existing methods and models. It will also work with customers to validate the models, tune them on a regular basis, and monitor usage and effectiveness.

Responsibilities
Design and supervise historical and predictive Analytical Data Models, Analytics, and Data Science.
Work with analytics division to create new models and validate concepts and models in the current analytics pipeline.
Monitor data activity, utilization, and model efficacy.
Take the lead role in working with various project teams (including analysts and business designers) to discover and develop actionable, high-impact data analytics in a variety of customer business types including but not limited to Food & Beverage, Ticket Sales, Finance, and Primary Research.
Maintain accurate and complete documentation on data models.
Formulate policies, procedures, and standards relating to model development and management.
Facilitate the design and implementation process for new products/projects, and evaluates impacts on the operation, informing senior executive of alternatives.
Assist in establishing standards and guidelines for the design & development, tuning, deployment and maintenance of information and advanced data models.


Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, the successful candidate must be able to perform each essential duty above at the highest levels. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Required
Bachelor’s degree in behavioral or natural sciences, business analytics, applied mathematics or comparable field.
Minimum 5+ years of experience in programming, data mining, statistical analysis and modeling at an expert level.
Experience with Linear and Logistic Regression, Generalized Linear Models and Generalized Linear Mixed Models.
Experience with Neural networks, decision tree algorithms, Naïve Bayesian models, Association Rules, Sequence Analysis, and Support Vector Machine models
Experience designing and deploying models for clustering analysis, segmentation and anomaly detection.
Strong foundation in statistical theory and practice.
Model validation management experience.
Must have high energy level; be self-motivated, with a results-oriented demeanor.
Experience with R, Python, STATA, SPSS, S+, SAS Enterprise Miner or similar tools.


Preferred
5+ years of hands-on experience with Python, Microsoft Machine Learning, IBM I2, STATA, SPSS, S+, SAS Enterprise Miner or similar tools.
5+ years of hands-on experience with SQL development.
2+ years of hands-on experience with Microsoft SSIS and SSAS in 2012 and above.
Experience in successfully developing and implementing data models in a non-education setting.

Legends is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, or genetic information.

STARZ (www.starz.com), a Lionsgate company (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B), is a leading global media and entertainment company that provides premium subscription video programming on domestic U.S. pay television networks and produces and distributes content for worldwide audiences, including its investment in the STARZ PLAY Arabia OTT service.

STARZ is the ultimate destination for obsessable TV, movies and more. Characters who pull you in and stories that stay with you. From bold Original Series to the best movies, whatever you love, STARZ ignites your passions.

STARZ offers a competitive compensation package and an attractive benefits program to all eligible employees including a variety of healthcare plans, dental and vision insurance, 401k, life/disability insurance. Eligible employees will enjoy paid time off in the form of vacation and company holidays.

STARZ is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This means that all applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of gender, age, race, national origin, disability, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, STARZ will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

The Company

JUUL was founded by former smokers, James and Adam, with the goal of improving the lives of the one billion adult smokers. We envision a world where fewer people use cigarettes, and where people who smoke cigarettes have the tools to reduce or eliminate their consumption entirely, should they so desire.

JUUL's mission is to improve the lives of the world’s one billion adult smokers by driving innovation to eliminate cigarettes. JUUL is the number one US-based vapor product. Headquartered in San Francisco and backed by leading technology investors including Tiger Global, Fidelity Investments and Tao Invest LLC, JUUL Labs is disrupting one of the world’s largest and oldest industries.

We’re an exceptional team with backgrounds in technology, healthcare, CPG and biotech, and we’re growing rapidly to deliver on our mission. We’re actively looking to hire the world’s best scientists, engineers, designers, product managers, supply chain experts, customer service and business professionals.

Role And Responsibilities

JUUL Labs is seeking Business Liaison/Solution Manager, Global Supply Chain to support its rapidly scaling global operation. As a key member of the Global Supply Chain Management (SCM) team, you will partner with leaders across the organization including demand planning, strategic sourcing, manufacturing, process engineering/automation, logistics, and customer service, as well as other external stakeholders, to prioritize and drive the Supply Chain Data Analytics Strategy. This is a high-visibility role that will provide an opportunity to interface with the top executives in the Global Supply Chain organization. This role will work with cross-functional teams, comprised of senior leadership, process owners, Strategic Program Managers, IT Architects, and analysts to define problems, understand impact, design/deploy new solutions, and actively manage lifecycle of existing solutions. You will also partner with the operations teams and IT to design effective performance dashboards and work towards seamless automation of data delivery systems. This will include all KPI’s from daily operations management systems to senior leadership performance metrics reporting.

This role will foster transformational culture with rapid prototyping, agile methods, and influence common architecture across Supply Chain Strategy and IT partners with the goal of simplifying, enhancing capabilities, and driving productivity. You will take ownership of multi-year architecture and solution roadmap.

Specific Responsibilities May Include
Developing, implementing, and maturing the governance structure to monitor, align, and support execution of Supply Chain Analytics Strategy
Monitoring the health of the SCM Data project portfolio
Tracking project adherence to scope, schedule, and budget parameters
Provide technical leadership deploying data products, lead training, and cultivate the operational technology (OT) community across JUUL’s Supply Chain
Partner and lead teams to enable, adoption, and retire solutions (where needed) to realize productivity across Material Planning, Inventory Management, Delivery and Cost teams. Co-develop and influence platform evolution and long-term platform strategy
Collaborate with IT and Supply Chain Strategy in support of what’s best for the business
Mentor junior Solution Managers, Business Analysts, and Data Scientists to understand system architecture, solution development approach, and best practices


Personal And Professional Qualifications

The ideal candidate has 10+ years of relevant Business Analytics and Solution Management experience in a challenging, fast-paced global manufacturing or logistics environment, with a demonstrated ability to coordinate effort between multiple cross-functional teams, simultaneously. The qualifications that make a candidate successful in this role include:

Description

Position Objective

As part of the Analytics Center of Excellence, the "Analyst of Advanced Analytics" will support the business strategies by providing analytical services to support their various initiatives. In this role, the individual will support the design and implementation of short and long term strategies and tactics to develop an analytics platform to support the business to enable an insights/analytics-driven decision making process. This individual will own relationships and lead tracking, analysis and results reporting of various initiatives within Aramark to support management decisions and strategy development.

This individual will work collaboratively across numerous functions, including Operations, Human Resources, Marketing, Business Development, Finance, Information Technology, Culinary, and Retail teams in our consumer facing businesses.

Responsibilities
Partner with our various businesses to support their efforts to grow revenues and control costs
Translate data into action and push out meaningful insights to our individual business units
Develop approaches and build models to optimize labor, food and other direct costs through analytics and statistical approaches
Build models to support organic growth initiatives such as pricing, driving volume and improving retention
Build test and learn models to drive revenue from "other" levers such as menu mix, menu board designs and communication programs
Discover new opportunities to optimize the business through analytics and statistical modeling.
Identify relevant external data to help tell "The Story" and augment our analytical models to achieve greater impact
Leverage existing data warehouses to develop business intelligence reports and analysis that supports the Analytics team's strategy
Think strategically and recognize opportunities
Have a "hands-on" involvement with the analysts
Serve as a key member of various project teams of cross-functional resources to implement analytics strategies – with internal and external partners.
Effectively partner with internal or external resources, with expertise in statistical and predictive modeling, to analyze and look for patterns within customer behavior and/or business performance data and summarize findings.
Perform trend analysis, predictive analytics and data mining to provide actionable insights that inform strategic and tactical decisions and lead to improved consumer experience and business results.

Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering or related field.
Minimum 1 year of experience in Business Analytics, Insights Data Modeling or in related disciplines.
Be able to work independently and collaboratively
Excellent interpersonal skills: collaborating, networking, influencing; able to work effectively in virtual international and cross-functional teams
Ability to program in SQL, R, SAS, SPSS or Python
Comfortable working with large, complex data sources
Experience in data mining and building data models
Experience in building predictive models
Experience with test & learn methodologies
Strong organizational, project management and time management skills
Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated ability to solve problems
Ability to present complicated analytical material in a concise and compelling manner to a non-technical audience
Ability to work with large transactional databases across multiple platforms.

Excellent communication skills: clear oral and written skills; effective questioning; active listening

Business Analytics Lead

San Francisco

Strategy & Analytics – Analytics

Full-time

Fleetsmith puts the manual parts of device management on autopilot — deploying new devices, inventory, patching, security and compliance enforcement — so IT teams can take on more interesting, valuable, and rewarding work.

Our product vision, design-forward thinking and world class engineering have put us at the forefront of the space. We’re excited to grow our team so we can continue to raise the bar for what people expect out of a world-class device management product.

As a Business Analytics Lead at Fleetsmith, you’ll be an integral part of setting direction for our rapidly growing business. You’ll work with others to set analytics strategy for the entire company and partner with business leadership by providing insight that will inform how we scale and run the business. This is a highly dynamic role that touches many different parts of the business, so you’ll use a broad set of analytical skills and have extensive strategic impact. You’ll also have the opportunity to build out and manage a world-class business analytics team as Fleetsmith scales.

Who you are

You have 4+ years of relevant experience in a business-focused analytical role, preferably at a B2B SaaS company
You have experience in hiring and leading a team of analysts
You have the technical skills you need to perform impactful analysis and be a technical leader for your team:
Excel, SQL expertise required
Experience doing data science work in Python or R is a plus
You have experience running A/B tests and have a strong foundation in statistics
You’re a great written, visual, and oral communicator and can tell stories with data
You have a strong business sense and can break big questions down into manageable pieces
You have some familiarity with the principles of data engineering
You’re results-oriented and motivated by seeing the business grow

What you’ll do

Work closely with analysts and company leadership to build data foundations and set Fleetsmith’s analytics strategy
Partner with business leadership to build a culture of data-informed decision making through setting frameworks for metrics, experimentation, and forecasting
Identify key revenue opportunities by leading deep analysis across our business and spotting areas for improvement
Lead the process of building models for LTV, lead scoring, and other key business signals
Build a team of business analysts to scale with Fleetsmith’s rapid growth

Who we are

We’re highly collaborative. This is something every company seems to say, but everyone who has joined Fleetsmith has been consistently blown away at how collaborative of a company we are. We actually work together across teams at Fleetsmith. And it’s beautiful.
We’re extremely product-driven. We’re focused on building a product that turns things that were previously downright painful into experiences that are legitimately delightful. As you might imagine, this is really hard to execute on. Which brings us to the next point…
We’re passionate about what we do, and we strive to be world class in each of our domains—regardless of whether that’s in EPD or business…. but that said;
We have a culture of intellectual curiosity and playfulness. We’re not stoic. We don’t take ourselves too seriously, and know how to poke fun at ourselves.
We have have strong values around clear, effective, professional communication. Among other things, we train all employees on how to give and receive effective feedback most effectively. We understand strong communication is a competitive advantage.
We pair an idealistic vision for the future with incredible respect and rigor around execution. We realize the best ideas are worthless if the execution doesn’t live up to the dream. We set ambitious goals and measure our progress against them using OKRs.
We believe a competition of ideas, paired with low ego, leads to the best outcomes. We value and encourage evidence based debates.

Who you'll be working with

This is a highly cross-functional role — you’ll be working with leadership from across the business on a regular basis, as well as with analysts from throughout the company!

Our commitment to diversity

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Closing thoughts

If you're excited about this role and you think you've got the chops, you should apply. Finally and most importantly—to prove you read this job description, please include a smiley face :) in front of your name when you apply, and also include a short cover letter.

We actually read the cover letter, so please don't just do a copy/paste job—we'll be able to tell :)

Job_Title: Senior Manager, Business Analytics - Sales Force
Job_Description:
Summary Of Major Responsibilities

This position is responsible for developing the sales force analytics capability at Exact Sciences using customer-level promotion response data, salesforce interaction data, profile data and other information. This position is responsible for collaborating with internal stakeholders and external partners to measure and optimize the effectiveness of salesforce promotion. This position will assess and optimize the impact of the salesforce when they employ specific tactics, strategies, and messages. This role will also complete additional ad hoc analyses as needed by the business.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Develop and drive proactive data-driven insights and make recommendations to optimize salesforce promotion and communication with HCPs, as well as internal reporting with key stakeholders such as sales and marketing leadership
Collaborate with marketing and sales to understand the objectives, content, and strategy of promotion and develop key business questions surrounding sales-force promotion
Design, apply, and interpret statistical models that help stakeholders measure and optimize promotional effectiveness
Design custom analysis and proactively synthesize and communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key stakeholders (Sales, Marketing, Multichannel Customer Excellence, FP&A) to optimize and inform future promotions
Develop sales force dashboards to measure and guide field performance in collaboration with operational, functional, and end-user stakeholders
Develop and implement key performance indicators based on stated corporate priorities to measure and ensure accountability among salesforce representatives
Design and implement operational best practices for the design, maintenance, and distribution of salesforce reports, dashboards, and recurring analyses
Partner with relevant cross-functional groups to ensure that essential data is available to internal and external stakeholders and leadership to assess the impact

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required; Master's degree a plus
At least 8 years’ experience working in a commercial/marketing/multi-channel insights capacity preferably gathering and analyzing transactional quantitative data
Strong understanding of advanced promotion optimization methods including segmentation, promotional response, market mix modeling, regression analysis and predictive modeling
Excellent vendor management skills, including demonstrable experience scoping work, appropriately resourcing a vendor team, roadmapping/planning to business priorities and managing budget
Strong computer aptitude and ability to learn systems quickly
Functional knowledge of statistical programming and/or query languages (Python, SQL, R) preferredStrong attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset
Moderate experience with the Microsoft Office suite of programs required
Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship

Preferred Qualifications
Biotech/pharma experience preferred
Consulting experience and skill set strongly preferred
Strong understanding of marketing and multi-channel (relationship marketing and digital) execution, KPIs and associated data; statistical methods and testing; and test/control design; understanding of sales promotion strategy and execution also desired

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other status protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Applicable portions of the Company’s affirmative action program are available to any applicant or employee for inspection upon request.

Job_Description:
Company Info

Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!

Job Description

The Analyst, Advanced Analytics will report to the newly appointed head of Advanced Analytics in the Global Analytics and Data Management organization and should be a generalist who leverages a broad suite of analytics capabilities to derive business insights from data and translate them into actionable recommendations. The Advanced Analytics team is responsible for applying new capabilities to accelerate analytics-driven support for critical commercial business decisions and is responsible for framing a long-term analytic strategy and identifying accompanying resource requirements. The team will address unmet analytic needs in the areas of Resource Allocation, Marketing Mix Optimization, Patient Data Analytics and other areas presenting novel business problems to the Commercial teams – Global Portfolio, Regional Marketing and Sales, Brand Teams, and other key stakeholders.

The ideal candidate is passionate about analytics and data science with a deep understanding of the potential value of, as well as the issues and challenges with, using data to support decision-making. They should be able to support the team lead in recommending and developing analytical solutions, demonstrating curiosity and creative thinking as relates to the use of data.

Principle Responsibilities

Execute on a range of projects employing data analytics to address business problems – pipeline strategy, patient dynamics, portfolio segmentation, analog analysis, etc.

Proactively query datasets to uncover actionable insights and business opportunities / Use data visualization tools to illustrate results and clarify analyses

Keep up to date on relevant datasets, tools and methods that could enhance commercial analysis / Maintain a database of projects, models and reports that can be continually leveraged

Demonstrate analytical thinking, attention to detail and the ability to discern patterns in data / Translate data and analyses into a tangible, compelling story for non-analytical stakeholders

Be highly collaborative and work effectively with others on matrixed teams / Demonstrate comfort working in a global environment

Work successfully in complex, ambiguous and rapidly changing environments

Qualifications

Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or quantitative field from an accredited college or university
3 + years in an analytically oriented role in the pharmaceutical or health care industry
Working knowledge of pharmaceutical data sets (sales data, claims data, patient level data, etc.)
Experience in conducting marketing and sales analytics (promotional response, marketing mix, etc.) / Expertise in statistical techniques (regression analysis, cluster analysis, etc.)
Experience in building fit-for-purpose models for data analysis and simulation / Proficiency in Microsoft suite of business software including Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Knowledge of business intelligence visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik or equivalent


Function

Marketing

Sub Function

Market Research/Intelligence

Reports To

VP, Global Analytics & Data Management
