Abiomed, an innovative medical device company, is focused on recovering hearts and saving lives. We have a single guiding mission: “Patients First.” With corporate headquarters in Danvers, Massachusetts, offices in Aachen & Berlin, Germany and Tokyo, Japan, Abiomed’s 1,300 employees form one of the fastest growing medical technology companies in the world. Abiomed attracts and retains exceptional talent with our collaborative culture, passion for our work, and a strong commitment to employee professional development.

Abiomed is looking for a Commercial Business Intelligence & Analytics Leader to work with internal stakeholders to advance commercial analytics maturity across the enterprise. You’ll help us create and deliver commercial insights that advance our competitive position in the market, you’ll collaborate across the organization to advance not only our visibility to data, but to insights that drive the business forward, all while aligning to strategic goals and core priorities. You’ll be capable of understanding the underlying problems we’re trying to solve, thinking creatively of the most insightful ways to solve them using analytics and continuing our progression up the analytics maturity curve towards pervasive predictive and prescriptive analytics.

You will be tasked with optimizing our CRM (Salesforce) by leading simplification and automation projects, supporting reporting/ dashboarding requirements for the business, developing & reporting on metrics and KPIs, translating data into high-value, actionable insights for senior leadership and business partners, developing and refining new analyses in response to business needs, and bringing expertise on emerging trends in data analytics and predictive modeling. The core tenets focus around driving analytic insight, data modeling, data literacy and advanced analytics for our commercial team.

The ideal candidate has not only hands-on experience analyzing large-scale data sets but also demonstrated examples of translating data analyses into insights that drive transformational business outcomes. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally to bring a single source of truth and self-service analytics to the commercial organization. You will partner with business stakeholders to evaluate business questions, design and implement analytical solutions that provide actionable insights on financial performance, sales leading indicators, marketing programs, customer acquisition & retention, marketing efficacy and other related topics.

We’re looking for a leader who thinks strategically, thrives on data, works well through ambiguity, and is willing to dive into the details to execute.

Essential Responsibilities
Manage Salesforce data integrity, reporting, and lead optimization projects
Develop and provide analytics, insights into trends and BI
Support reporting/ dashboarding requirements for the business, developing & reporting on metrics and KPIs
Use a data science approach to identify correlations to drive growth
Establish and implement a vision and strategy for gathering and managing data requirements and disseminating performance metrics & analytics for the commercial team
Partner with business stakeholders on projects to develop methodologies, reports and dashboards that provide business insight into leading indicators and provide recommendations that improve operations & enhance business decision making
Define projects, objectives and prioritization for specific areas of assigned responsibility.
Drives project milestones to completion. Build partnerships, define accountability, and lead the activities which operationalize key findings.
Develops tools, tests, and dashboard to enable implementation of insights. Supports testing, training, and development of new business practices.
Enable Abiomed employees with data literacy to improve self-service analytics across the enterprise
Recommend, design and operationalize predictive & prescriptive analytic solutions in conjunction with team members
Skilled at clearly communicating results and direction to a diverse audience of technical and non-technical stakeholders
Own communication path on timelines, analyses, enablement and manage expectations with internal stakeholders
Ad-hoc analysis as required to aid management decision making and business planning
Create and deliver impactful presentations for mid-level and senior-level audiences


Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or related field
8+ years working in analytics with a track record of delivering insights and business impact
Prior management experience required
Expertise using data analysis and visualization tools such as Domo, Tableau, Looker, Qlik, MSPower BI
Proficient in SQL, R, Python or statistical modeling and/or SAS/SPSS
Prior experience with Salesforce.com, ERP, CRM & HCM technologies and data from disparate systems
Solid understanding of data structures and transformations, experience in data quality processes a plus
Advanced analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
Experience with advanced analytic techniques, such as financial & predictive modeling, regression analysis and ROI measurement
Team spirit, excellent interpersonal skills, and a customer service orientation
Track record of managing and improving complex processes, managing through ambiguity and very strong organizational and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and storytelling skills; experience in communicating with senior stakeholders in an open, direct and professional fashion
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Abiomed is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce. Abiomed will not discriminate against any worker or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy, gender reassignment, non-job related mental or physical disability, genetic information, veteran status, military service, application for military service, or membership in any other category protected under law.

Company Description

We believe the economy is better when everyone has access. When everyone has room to grow. No one should be left out because the cost is too great or the technology too complex. We started with a little white credit card reader but haven’t stopped there. We’re empowering the independent electrician to send invoices, setting up the favorite food truck with a delivery option, helping the ice cream shop pay its employees, and giving the burgeoning coffee chain capital for a second, third, and fourth location. We’re here to help sellers of all sizes start, run, and grow their business—and helping them grow their business is good business for everyone.

Job Description

In Risk Strategy & Analytics at Square, you'll design, build, and operationalize systems and processes to root out high-risk activity across the Square platform. We are looking for an Analytics Lead to join our Risk Strategy & Analytics team, which is directly responsible for the organizations most important cross functional projects and engagements.

The Strategy & Analytics Lead will be directly responsible for the management of major risk areas. You will focus on building and evolving risk strategy, balancing safe growth across Squares products and markets with a seamless customer experience. You will leverage your analytical skills and experience to optimize decision making across our risk processes.

You Will
Lead a team of 4-6 Analysts and Program Managers who directly handle risk strategy and policy. Help guide and optimize their work through problem structuring, progress management and communication improvements. Develop their analytical skills and business expertise through investing time in coaching and identifying and promoting opportunities for growth
Manage cross-functional working groups with Product, Engineering, Operations, and Data Science teams to address our major risk areas
Optimize risk decision making, balancing loss mitigation with growth and seller experience
Design and report on KPIs to leadership throughout the company
Deliver key parts of our annual planning, from opportunity identification to enabling resource allocation decisions
Proactively identify, scope and deliver initiatives to improve the performance of the organization
Manage multiple complex projects, often with timelines that require prioritization

Qualifications

You have:
Excellent academic background in a mathematics/statistics or science-related field
At least 8 years of highly quantitative experience. Experience with Risk and/or Payments desired.
Experience managing multiple functions concurrently with at least 5 direct reports
Ability to structure complex problems, drive to data-driven solutions and project-manage their implementation.
Proven track record of managing relationships and delivering projects in partnership with a wide variety of teams and functions within a medium-large company
Expertise in statistical analysis, forecasting and modeling, with an interest in new analytical techniques and their applications to improving quality and efficiency.
Experience with SQL, Python and Looker are strong plusses, excellent Excel skills are essential
Ability to translate quantitative data into actionable business recommendations and communicate complex data concepts to both senior and junior levels within the organization. Strong written and presentation skills are important
Familiarity with data engineering concepts, construction and management of data pipelines

Additional Information

At Square, our purpose is to empower – within and outside of our walls. In order to build the best tools for the businesses and customers we support all over the world, we have to start at home with a workforce as diverse and empowered as our sellers. To this end, we take great care to evaluate all employees and job applicants equally, based on merit, competence, and qualifications. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

Job_Title: Supply Chain Services Strategic Manager - Operations
Job_Description:
The Strategic Supply Chain Operations (SCS) Manager for Baylor Scott and White Health (BSWH), under the direction of the Strategic Supply Chain Operations System Director, provides leadership for all aspects of inventory management, operational process improvement, business analytics, and project management. The SCS Operations Manager leads initiatives and projects, performance indicators, budget and cost reduction analyses, inventory management/optimization, and innovative process improvement while ensuring high level customer service to service line and supply chain leadership members.

What Is Expected (essential Functions)

In addition, the Supply Chain Services Manager for BSWH has the following responsibilities:

ï¿½ Performs leadership role in all facility SCM inventory management and related lean management processes. Ensures efficiencies in logistics and practices. Oversees all functions of inventory management processes of supply chain managed inventory. Assists facility SCM director/manager in establishing, maintaining, and managing policies and procedures. Maintains orderly and organized work area to facilitate efficient processes.

ï¿½ Provides strong leadership/ownership role in System inventory management. Leads in preparation and department education of inventory process method, definition, and standardization. Leads in preparation, review, and submission of inventory updates into ERP. Reviews reports, makes corrections, and analyzes variances. Focus on exceptions in Fill Rate, stock outs, excess and obsolescence.

ï¿½ Engages in problem-solving/improvement techniques during daily operations. Leads in definition and implementation of Stock level planning. Proactive review of accuracy of min/maxes, par levels, reorder points, demand/consumption, Quantities on Hand, and cycle counts process.

ï¿½ Develop, Analyze, and resolve all necessary SCM reports to support inventory management and performance measure initiatives. Oversees accurate process documentation to support lean management culture.

ï¿½ POU inventory system management

ï¿½ Lead or participate on project teams as assigned; coordinate team activities, develop/implement/execute project plans. Develop reports and associated materials to update project status.

ï¿½ Ensures standardization of processes based on SCS best practices to maximize efficiencies od SCS as a whole.

ï¿½ Participates in project meetings to include presentation of analyses, information, or procedures. Teams with the SCS System Directors in development/implementation/execution of the metric related improvements and best practice initiatives.

Job_Description:
The Sr. Digital Analytics Specialist is responsible for developing relevant and actionable narratives and insights on behalf of automotive manufacturers as it relates to the influence of their sponsored advertising products. The role provides performance and optimization-related insights for campaigns across Cox Automotive Media Solutions digital properties to enable the sales teams to go to market in a consultative manner. This position analyzes digital media performance and on-site behavioral effects, and is responsible to explore and incorporate other available/new data sources to proactively create and present directly to the client, customized challenger sales presentations, program recaps, and solution recommendations and optimizations to support revenue driving initiatives.

This position reports to Sr. Manager, Analytics and work in partnership directly with Sales and other Analytics groups to understand client business issues, to creatively evaluate the Cox Automotive Media solutions/programs designed to address those issues, provide insights into how to improve those solutions/programs, and to build client-facing narratives to bring these insights to life. You will work autonomously to produce creative analytic solutions for non-routine client questions and client-based requests, and develop proactive insights approaches.

In this position you will serve as a liaison to Product, Operations, Sales Operations, Analytics, and other internal partners throughout the organization. The Sr. Digital Analytics Specialist interacts with a variety of other internal teams (e.g., Product, Ad Ops) to represent Sales Analytics’ needs (e.g., proper tagging, labeling, data access) to ensure that downstream data capture and insights generation processes are enabled.

As the Sr. Digital Analytics Specialist, you be keep up-to-date with developments in the Digital Analytics field (e.g., tools, techniques, KPIs, trends), and the latest trends in the advertising and automotive industries to ensure that insights and narratives are evaluated in the proper context. Key Responsibilities:

Apply expertise with digital analytics technology and data assets to proactively generate unique client-facing insights that support revenue-driving opportunities and protect existing business.

Connect insights to these client business issues, and work with Sales teams to bring to life stories/narratives that challenge conventional thinking enable effective interactions with clients to help drive revenue growth.
Incorporate understanding of client business issues to creatively evaluate and align the Cox Automotive Media solutions/programs designed to address those issues.
Develop client-ready presentations, dynamic dashboards, and reports that provide key insights on KPI performance, utilizing visualization and storytelling techniques and best practices.
Inform sales strategies, by proactively providing quantifiable recommendations to drive growth.
Present directly to clients and internal stakeholders articulating coherent stories and analytical concepts.
Present client insights to internal teams to highlight optimization opportunities and inform the creation of new client product solutions to meet individual client’s specific goals and measurements.
Transform analysis into product/industry case studies and best practices to enhance knowledge of internal teams and individuals within the organization (eg: Sales, Product, Finance, and Marketing).


Enhance Analytics Capabilities and Insights:

Leads the development and creation of new KPI’s/Reports/Dashboards by leveraging existing and incorporating the use of new datasets and analytics platforms.
Lead moderate to large analytics sized projects involving cross-functional teams.
Partner with key stakeholders and cross-functional peers to formulate plan and execute solutions for analytic needs of the client and internal Sales partners.
Manages the development of unique innovative analyses and methodologies that will help support Cox Automotive client revenue goals.
Creates queries and basic statistical analysis (SQL, RStudio etc.) to develop analyses in response to inquiries from internal customers and partners.
Leverages the latest state-of-the-art data mining tools and modeling techniques while staying abreast of industry-wide best practices.
Manages the extraction, analysis and interpretation of site traffic, industry and/or survey data using sophisticated data methods, exploration, analysis, and visualization tools.

Qualifications:
Required:

Bachelor's degree or an equivalent combination of education and work-related experience.
5+ years of related analytics experience.
Expertise with digital analytics tools and business intelligence systems (e.g. Adobe Analytics Suite, Moat, DFP, Microstrategy, Tableau, Amazon Web Services)
Advanced Excel skills required, including custom formula development, functions, pivot tables, and visualization techniques.
Proficiency using SQL, Python, or equivalent to capture and manipulate complex datasets.
Strong analytical skills, including an understanding of cause and effect and basic statistical methods available to enhance findings.
Must be able to understand, analyze data, and synthesize large volumes of data into a coherent narrative or story to answer non-standard/complex questions.
Leverage mathematical and statistical principles to inform and validate analyses.
Strong communication skills, including experience in clearly and effectively presenting to internal stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to effectively multi-task and prioritize in a deadline-driven atmosphere.
Experience leading moderate to large analytics projects involving cross-functional teams.
Ability to solve problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.


Preferred:

Bachelor's degree from four-year College or University.
Experience in an automotive, advertising and/or internet environment.

About Cox Automotive

Cox Automotive Inc. makes buying, selling and owning cars easier for everyone, while also enabling mobility services. The global company’s 34,000-plus team members and family of brands, including Autotrader®, Clutch Technologies, Dealer.com®, Dealertrack®, Kelley Blue Book®, Manheim®, NextGear Capital®, VinSolutions®, vAuto® and Xtime®, are passionate about helping millions of car shoppers, tens of thousands of auto dealer clients across five continents and many others throughout the automotive industry thrive for generations to come. Cox Automotive is a subsidiary of Cox Enterprises Inc., a privately-owned, Atlanta-based company with revenues exceeding $20 billion. www.coxautoinc.com

Job_Title: Analytic Consultant 4 - Analytic Quality Review (AQR) Wealth Investment Management (WIM) and Wholesale
Job_Description:
Job Description

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Data Management and Insights (DMI) is transforming the way that Wells Fargo uses and manages data. Our work enables Wells Fargo to empower and inform our team members, deliver exceptional experiences for our customers, and meet the elevated expectations of our regulators. The team is responsible for designing the future data environment, defining data governance and oversight, and partnering with technology to operate the data infrastructure for the company. This team also provides next generation analytic insights to drive business strategies and help meet our commitment to satisfy our customers’ financial needs.

The Enterprise Analytics and Data Science team is looking for a new team member for the Analytic Quality Review (AQR) team, which plays the critical role of performing advanced quality review of high-risk data analysis activities including customer remediation population identification and complex regulatory and legal data requests.

Key Responsibilities Include

As part of a team focused on the preserving the customer experience across the organization, this Analytic Consultant will be responsible for review of complex data analyses that span multiple lines of businesses and/or products to
Understand business objectives and provide credible challenge to analysis requirements
Verify sound analysis practices and data decisions were leveraged throughout planning and data sourcing phases
Conduct in-depth research within complex data environments to identify data integrity issues, and propose solutions to improve analysis accuracy
Ensure comprehensive documentation exists supporting the end-to-end analysis approach and execution
Communicate results to business partners
Ensures adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies.
Data involved may be very large, structured or unstructured, and from multiple sources.
Analytics involved generally span multiple functional areas/business lines/data sources.
In addition to a demonstrated ability using and coaching for analytic programming languages, the ideal candidate should possess a natural analytic curiosity and be able to apply critical evaluation to challenge assumptions, formulate a defensible hypothesis, and ensuring high quality analysis results.

Required Qualifications
6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modeling
3+ years of SQL or SAS experience

Desired Qualifications
Extensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysis
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
6+ years of SQL or SAS experience
Experience in gathering, analyzing and interpreting large datasets
Knowledge and understanding of consumer lending data and analytics
Knowledge and understanding of Shaw, ACAPS, FDR, ECaR, and/or other Consumer Lending applications
Ability to manage complex data collection and analysis activities including conducting extensive source-to-target mapping exercises
Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and across all organizational levels, where flexibility, collaboration, and adaptability are important
Ability to work cohesively and collaborate with analytic functions throughout the organization
Ability to make timely and independent judgment decisions while working in a fast-paced and results-driven environment

Other Desired Qualifications
Expertise in data profiling and research
Demonstrated ability to provide direction, coach and mentor less experienced staff
Ability to play leadership role in large and complex analytical projects
Expertise in data profiling and research
In-depth knowledge of business systems (Shaw, AFS, FDR, EIW, BMG, Brickyard, HELMS, HOGAN) and data structure
Home Lending, WIM or Wholesale Bank experience preferred
Experience in historical data analysis, customer remediation, or regulatory reporting


Job Expectations
Ability to travel up to 20% of the time

Street Address

IA-Clive 13733 University Ave - Clive, IA
AZ-Tempe 1150 W Washington St - Tempe, AZ
MN-Minneapolis 600 S 4th St - Minneapolis, MN
TX-Irving 5000 Riverside Drive - Irving, TX

GA-Atlanta 3579 Atlanta Ave - Atlanta, GA

All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.

Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.

Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

ENT FINANCE
Reference Number
5505857-4

Apply Now

Qualifications
Advanced degree (MBA, MS, PhD, etc.) in Economics/Mathematics/Physics/Statistics/Operations Research
5-9 years of experience with advanced analytics and statistical techniques such as multivariate regression / predictive modeling, classification and regression tree (CART/CHAID), factor analysis, correspondence analysis, clustering, discriminant analysis, and Random Forest
Experience in driving sales excellence and using analytics to advance commercial outcomes
Experience designing and running “agile” analytics programs that prove business impact even in absence of well-structured data
Confidence dealing with less-than-perfect data (e.g., cleaning, fusing, extrapolating)
Experience in mixed modeling and working with big data techniques is desirable
Experience in probability theory, optimization techniques, and optimization algorithms
Familiarity with Advanced Analytics software tools (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS, Alteryx)
Ability to identify implications and drive toward business recommendation
Strong communication skills with demonstrated ability to present in clear and concise manner
Strong multi-tasking abilities, flexibility and patience in a fluid environment
Team oriented and collaborative approach in working across teams and clients
Passion for analytics and problem solving
Ability to travel up to 75%

Who You'll Work With

You will be based in Atlanta, Chicago or Waltham and will be part of our Marketing & Sales practice.

The Marketing & Sales practice strives to help clients in both consumer and business-to-business environments on a wide variety of marketing and sales topics. Our clients benefit from our experience in core areas of marketing such as branding, customer insights, marketing ROI, digital marketing, CLM, pricing, and sales and channel management. The Sales and Channel Management Service Line helps clients make lasting improvements to the effectiveness of their sales investments and interactions with customers across all channels to drive sales growth. We help clients in achieving and sustaining profitable growth through sales and channel management excellence.

Our practice offers an exceptional opportunity to work at the intersection of marketing, sales and consulting. Focusing on issues like redefining marketing and sales operations and commercial transformation, our people help clients build capabilities and transform how companies go to market - moving them to customer centric organizations.

As part of this role, you will work with product & technology and client service teams in designing and executing advanced analytic approaches that identify growth and pricing excellence opportunities for McKinsey clients. Founded in 2007, Periscope® by McKinsey is an award-winning technology platform that enables better commercial decisions by uncovering actionable insights. The Periscope platform combines world leading intellectual property, prescriptive analytics, and cloud-based tools to provide more than 25 solutions focused on insights and marketing, with expert support and training. It is a unique combination that drives revenue growth both now and in the future. Customer experience, performance, pricing, category, and sales optimization are powered by the Periscope platform.
What You'll Do

You will help clients identify growth and margin opportunities through advanced analytics as well as help them transform their commercial processes to capture these opportunities.

As a seasoned data scientist, you will lead project design and delivery. You will bring creative approaches to gathering, structuring, and fusing data and then building and running analytic models that provide insight into critical commercial processes. This may include cross-sell, churn reduction, dynamic pricing, etc. You will also leverage relevant statistics and analytics software tools and help train junior team members on analytic best practices. Additionally, you'll apply practical judgment on how to deal with less-than-perfect data to hypothesize opportunities and help clients construct commercial pilots that validate value creation opportunities.

You will help ensure that data and analytic models are embedded at clients. In particular, you will advise clients on how to adapt analytic models into their commercial system environments. Working with software engineers and product managers, you'll advance Sales Solutions software assets and you'll also work with our McKinsey Digital teams to leverage capabilities in third-party software.

Furthermore, you'll develop and maintain standard analytical models and analytical approaches that can be re-used across clients, as well as analysis cases/demos environments highlighting specific use cases. You will have the opportunity to develop and codify industry-level insights/knowledge and identify new areas of application/use cases.

Your success will be measured in the ability to deliver analysis and business changing insights to clients, as well as their ability to turn “one off” models into repeatable and more standard analytical approaches and models.

Post to LinkedIn - Yes

Job Description

Do you love data analysis? Are you passionate about bringing meaning from the numbers to tell stories, build insights and ultimately drive strategy? We’re starting Data Strategy and Analytics team at McCain Foods and have a great career opportunity for you to be in at the ground floor of building this function for our business!

The Advanced Analytics & Visualization Modeler will assist in the design, build, and ongoing enhancement of the Greater North America (GNA) reporting dashboards and tools used to help drive the business. This role will span across all functions within the GNA organization and will report to the Sr. Director of Data Strategy & Analytics. The Visualization Modeler’s output will be the foundation for driving better insights, developing enhanced reports and analytical outputs to allow the business to be more predictive vs. reactive in its day-to-day management of the business. Most importantly this role will allow the business to better harness data in a user-friendly way to uncover the “so-what” from the financial and operational results captured across the multitude of systems currently deployed. This role is brand new to the organization and requires someone that is proactive at taking initiative and solving problems, while having the personal and business acumen to manage and be the intermediary between the core business functions and IS group. Furthermore, this role will be drive better visibility into the data and accountability of the performance of the business, while allowing the GNA leadership to identify and root cause issues at a much more rapid rate than current reporting capabilities allow for today.

Core Accountabilities
The Visualization Modeler will be responsible for designing, building, and mining the data and analytical outputs using visualization software such as MicroStrategy. The Modeler will be accountable for driving insights and performance improvement opportunities for the functions while providing dashboards and tools to allow GNA leadership to track and highlight key metrics, KPIs, and other quantitative measures.
Will be required to maintain and enhance the tools, templates, and data cuts to meet the needs of the business while helping service their needs through root cause analysis and other ad hoc reporting requests.
Coordinate across functional areas to create standard reporting packages and views that can be utilized in the creation of the GNA Master Dashboard that will serve as the primary tool to track and measure performance across all functions within the region
Liaise between the MDM Analysts, ISC/Ops Modelers, and Data Scientists to implement a sustainable process to start managing data and analytics within McCain GNA. Identify barriers and gaps in data that are both system and skill based, and help develop new processes and procedures to address these challenges
Train other Business Analysts, Super Users, and quant-driven resources in the functional areas on the tools and processes that have been developed to drive greater accessibility, adoption and accountability of data and analytics in the business while helping to close the skill and knowledge disparity that exists today.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or relevant coursework.
MicroStrategy (or other visualization software program) expert with the ability to build and automate dashboards and other reporting packages
Strong background in the food or CPG industry with experience building functional dashboards and tools to drive insights and performance. In a previous role, this person should have developed the appropriate skills to develop and enhance analytical outputs through easy to use and navigate visualizations. With extensive experience driving Business Intelligence (BI) insights, this person will need to be is able to build models, write code, and use existing software suites to develop better ways to manage the business.

Company

McCain Foods USA Inc.

Job_Title: Product Manager, Business Model and Monetization Strategy
Job_Description:
Job Description

This is the team that made the initial business case for applying a SaaS business model to our creative products ­– a move that has been credited with driving our record high stock price. We’re a high visibility group responsible for making strategic recommendations that have a significant financial impact. As such, the right candidate will find an outstanding opportunity to grow and develop in this role.

What You’ll Do

Our team designs and optimizes business models and pricing for Adobe’s Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud. We are responsible for generating revenue growth by:
Determining monetization strategies for new services
Exploring new business models for existing services
Optimizing existing product lines
Improving market penetration via refined segmentation

What You'll Need To Succeed

We are looking for an ambitious and results-oriented individual -- a strategic thinker with quantitative talent and leadership potential.
Must be currently pursuing a MBA degree required
Most successful candidates will have strong skills in a variety of disciplines such as strategy, marketing, pricing, and finance.
A proven ability to quickly frame issues and draft executive level business cases is key.
Adobe is a highly matrixed organization, and this team interacts with a wide variety of business partners ranging from analysts to SVPs, so poise, leadership ability, and solid influencing skills are essential.
Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills are required. Substantial experience in financial modeling and complex data analysis is desirable as is experience with data science, market research, web analytics, etc.

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

Outstanding opportunity for a Data Analyst/Scientist to work with one of our leading clients. You will assist in the client s efforts to expand analytics capabilities. This role will use analytical, statistical, and programming knowledge to collect, analyze and interpret large data sets.

3 years+ experience in data analytics, data mining and statistical analysis with a Bachelor s degree from an accredited university in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics or related field is required. SQL experience is a must. Expertise building machine learning algorithms using at least one of the following languages: Python, R and Scala required. Exposure to any reporting tool Shiny, Tableau, WebFocus (Tableau preferred). Strong understanding of basic statistics, linear algebra and calculus is essential. Description

K12 is a technology-based education company that offers proprietary curriculum and instructional support services to students in kindergarten through 12th grade. As the leader in K-12 online education for more than a decade, the company uses virtual public and private schooling methods to provide families with alternatives to traditional "brick and mortar" classrooms, giving children access to a high-quality education no matter where they are in the world.

We pride ourselves on maintaining the highest level of integrity. We have the same high expectations for our employees as we do for the students who are in our programs. These are just a few of the values that make K12 a great place to work.

This role will be responsible for compiling the consolidated volume forecast for the business unit. Preparing and analyzing sales forecast and performance to plan. Prepare analysis and recommendation to drive demand generation. Analyze and recommend strategies to improve forecasting accuracy, and lower cost of acquisition. The role will manage the demand generation budget in support of the Director for Marketing for the business unit. The role requires hands-on leadership, contributing individually while at the same time managing and developing various dotted-line teams. Responsibilities will encompass managing or performing analytical projects in addition to presenting results to both executives and non-technical stakeholders..

Supervisory Responsibilities: This position has no formal supervisory responsibilities. The role will supervise 1-2 analysts via dotted line in the creation of reports and analyses for K12's Marketing and Enrollment subject areas, pertaining to the Private Pay business units.

De afdeling Business Analytics & Insights (BA&I) ondersteunt onze klant in het omgaan met informatie, van informatie governance tot Business Intelligence (BI) en analytics.

Wat doe je concreet?

Je ontwikkelt de BI solutions voor en samen met de partner, startend na de high level intake tot en met de oplevering, activatie, industrialisatie van de BI solution.
Je levert een BI solution op die voldoet aan de wensen en de vraagstelling van de partner en die gebruikt wordt in de organisatie.
Je volgt richtlijnen, het schrijven van documentatie, het beantwoorden van informatie- of adviesvragen, het beschikbaar zijn voor ombudsdiensten.
De afdeling Business Analytics & Insights (BA&I) ondersteunt onze klant in het omgaan met informatie, van informatie governance tot Business Intelligence (BI) en analytics.

Jij leidt en coacht een team rapporterings- en Business Intelligence experten aan. Een leerrijke job en breed netwerk!
Je staat aan het roer van een van drie teams die Business Intelligence en rapporteringsondersteuning geven aan de verschillende afdelingen binnen deze divisie.
Je team bestaat uit ongeveer 15 personen, die de BI en rapporteringsnoden van onze partners analyseren, de requirements vastleggen, de nodige oplossingen bouwen en deze nadien ook onderhouden.

De opdracht bevat ook andere rollen zoals

Je doet het project management van de Business Intelligence opdrachten: je maakt afspraken met de partner, volgt op, coördineert en documenteert het geheel.
Je verzamelt alle requirements op het vlak van de gewenste inzichten, usability (visuele en grafische aspecten), de metrics, de benodigde data, non-functional requirements (gebruikers, licenties, wie mag wat zien, service model, ...). Je verkrijgt het akkoord van de partner op de specificaties, maar laat voldoende ruimte voor verfijningen tijdens sandbox en mockup fase.
Je bouwt de BI sandbox, je zet de data klaar op juiste granulariteit, je begeleidt de partner, je documenteert de sandbox.
Je ontwerpt, onderhoudt en documenteert het logisch data model en de logische data flows, je stelt test scenario's op, je voert user acceptance, regressie en systeemtesten uit.
Je ontwerpt en ontwikkelt de business laag en de visualisaties via een mockup, zowel functioneel als technisch. Je stelt test scenario's op, je voert user acceptance, regressie en systeemtesten uit. Je test deze iteratief/Agile af met de partner en verkrijgt finale goedkeuring vd solution. Je levert de BI solution op in productie. Je documenteert de BI solution en maakt indien nodig een gebruikershandleiding en opleidingsmateriaal aan. Je bent bereid opleidingen te geven.
Je levert advies en support op de BI solutions (functioneel & technisch) en maakt mogelijks deel uit van de ombudsdienst in 2e lijn.
Je werkt, waar van toepassing, samen met het data management team die de data op een kwalitatieve manier aanleveren en opgeleverde data modellen aftoetsen, met informatie stewards die je helpen met de definitie van de data, met business analisten die de noden en strategie van de partner zeer goed kennen en met data scientists die analytische modellen opleveren als input voor de BI solution.
Je maakt deel uit van het BA&I-kernteam en begeleidt mee de strategische evolutie naar multidisciplinaire teams.
Je beheert het account van een of verschillende interne partners en ondersteunt hun maturiteitsgroei in het omgaan met informatie en inzichten
Je bouwt een breed netwerk uit binnen Colruyt Group.

Kortom, deze functie is een uitstekende gelegenheid om je helemaal te verdiepen in de uitdagende omgeving van een beursgenoteerde familie van bedrijven.
Je werkt in Halle en kan 1 à 2 dagen per week je regionaal werken (in Deinze of Haasrode).

Technische kennis

Technieken voor requirements analyse
Agile werken
User experience op het vlak van dashboards en rapporten
SQL
Kennis van Business Objects, Tableau, Sybase, Powerdesigner, PowerCenter, SAS eguide
Data modellen en dataflows
Modelleren met de nadruk op dimensioneel modelleren
Metadata, Informatica
Talenkennis : Je beheerst het Engels en Nederlands of Frans heel goed en hebt een degelijke kennis van de andere taal.

Portfolio Analytics Overview

As an Analytics Analyst you will be one of Enova's most valuable resources. You will develop, enhance and test the company's models for use in determining the appropriate lending criteria and verification procedures. At times, you may be asked to conduct ad hoc analysis using statistical and financial tools to recommend for risk management, marketing and operational strategies. You will demonstrate the ability to interpret and organize data, and communicate it effectively to cross functional teams to solve business problems, provide requirements and support implementation. And through all of this, you'll mentor analysts and disseminate your technical knowledge throughout the Analytics team.

Qualifications
A Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field or equivalent experience, required
1-3 years of experience in analytics or related field
Advanced programming skills and the ability to write customized programs for meaningful data analysis (Python or R are preferred)
Experience working with relational databases, such as SQL
Knowledge of statistical/predictive modeling


Our Analytics Team

Enova's Analytics team consists of over 50 quantitative professionals dedicated to using the latest cutting-edge techniques to drive business value. We are a shared service for the entire company and operate in four core Analytics workgroups:
Portfolio Analytics – we focus on building cutting edge risk, pricing, and underwriting models to optimize our lending decisions by using advanced modeling and simulation techniques to optimize the performance of our loan products and operations.
Fraud Analytics – analysts on the fraud team use advanced data mining techniques to identify and fight online fraud.
Marketing Analytics – the marketing analytics team is focused on applying statistical analysis and predictive modeling to help our marketing teams acquire and retain more valuable customers.
Research and Platforms - the RAP team builds and maintains all of our technical tools and platforms. They help investigate new analytics methodologies, use cases, and data sources, to institute new and best practices within the department.

At Enova we have a company-wide culture that emphasizes data-driven analysis. That means you spend less time presenting and more time with the fun part, crunching data. We are language agnostic, but primarily use Python, R, SAS, SQL and Mathematica. That means YOU get to pick the tool that works best for you and the analysis at hand.

About Enova

Enova is a leading provider of online financial services that leverages its advanced technology and analytics to provide access to credit for non-prime consumers and small businesses. Our roots are in Chicago, but we have served over 5 million customers through our six businesses in the U.S. and abroad. We pride ourselves on hiring smart and driven people who bring new and innovative ideas to the table. Our philosophy is, "Life's short. Work some place awesome."

Many of us consider our people to be Enova's best perk. But to sweeten the deal, we also have a pretty awesome list of conventional (and less conventional) perks and benefits including competitive salaries, health care benefits, a 401K matching plan, a revamped parental leave program (and brand new nursing rooms for our returning mothers!) summer hours, tuition reimbursement and a sabbatical program. And of course we also have the things you'd expect at a leading tech company in Chicago, such as the snacks, game room, onsite massages/barbers/nail technicians, monthly social events, and sporting sponsorships.

Our goal at Enova is to recruit, hire, develop and maintain a diverse workforce. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all persons and not discriminate in employment decisions by placing the most qualified person in each job, without regard to any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

Job Details

Moffitt Cancer Center is internationally recognized for our focus on personalized cancer care and translational research. The mission of Moffitt is clear, focused, and fully stated in nine words, "To contribute to the prevention and cure of cancer." With a tradition of excellence that began with the first patient admission in 1986, dedicated Moffitt physicians, scientists, and staff members have remained committed to excellence in an atmosphere characterized by kindness, caring, and hope.

Business Intelligence Team is recruiting for a Business Intelligence Developer II in Tampa, FL.

Position Highlights

The Data Quality and Business Intelligence department serves as a center of excellence and provides a centralized service to Moffitt in support of various business, research, clinical and hospital operational needs across the institution. The core value of the department is data-driven decision support through provisioning of administrative, clinical and hospital operational, diagnostic, treatment, outcomes and other health data within Moffitt. The department provides Moffitt enterprise-wide data reporting, advanced analytics, data curation and standards through three main work streams governed under the same centralized business model. Under the direction of the Enterprise Wide Analytics Strategy (EWAS) Steering Committee headed by our VP/Chief Data Officer, all three areas are essential to uphold our core value and missions.

This position is under the work stream Business Intelligence (BI) and works as an integral part of the BI team. The role is responsible for center-wide data extractions, queries, data reporting and data delivery. This position supports strategic initiatives by enabling the analysis of operational data (clinical, research, patient focused, financial and administrative) and report of aggregated information using various BI tools. This position collaborates with Moffitt clinicians, researchers, and operational staff to ensure their data reporting requirements are met through data extraction, reports/dashboards building, using a suit of comprehensive BI solutions.

The Ideal Candidate

The BI Developer II is expected to demonstrate strong competence in utilizing various BI technologies and standards, and be actively and effectively involved in handling complex data requests at any given time. Company Overview

Brookfield Properties has an immediate need for a Geographic Information System Data Analyst at our corporate headquarters in Chicago, IL.

Brookfield Properties is a retail real estate company headquartered in Chicago, Illinois and owned by affiliates of Brookfield Asset Management. Our regional shopping centers are destinations for retail, lifestyle, dining, entertainment and so much more. Our extensive portfolio of properties spans the nation, encompassing over 150 locations across 42 states and representing over 146 million square feet of retail space. All of our properties are strategically located in regional and coastal areas that constitute the "heart" of America.

Our passionate team is comprised of experts across a range of specialties who share a goal of ensuring our properties are continuously evolving and innovating to meet the needs of our communities. Our company culture celebrates collaboration, encourages an entrepreneurial spirit and values diversity. We are very proud to have a team of premier talent who are in it to win it. We invite you to be part of our success story.

Position Overview

As part of our Business Intelligence & Strategy team, the Data Analyst will join a group of strategic professionals who are charged with providing actionable insights and business intelligence to the organization. This position is responsible for managing and reporting on the key data metrics as it relates to the growing real estate assets of Brookfield Properties. Assist the BI&S Data Strategy team in 1) gathering and accurately embedding pertinent property level information across all real estate sectors into a master property database, as well as Microsoft’s Power BI visualization tool 2) partner with relevant teams across all real estate sectors to ascertain core performance metrics and incorporate within the property database and dashboard 3) Assume a proactive role in communicating property metrics data and other real estate based analytics to the all levels within the Brookfield organization.

Key Responsibilities
Prepare and maintain key real estate related data metrics for Brookfield Properties Real Estate assets across all sectors and worldwide geographies
Present information, data insights, and recommendations to management, internal customers, and other key personnel as deemed necessary
Initiate contact and maintain partnerships with relevant data owners of real estate metrics across Brookfield Properties, including proactively leveraging key property level information and key performance indicators from the data owners on a timely cadence as defined by the BI&S team
Maintain current and future database enhancements to ensure accuracy and timeliness of the data
Manage corporate resources effectively and efficiently. Focus resources on corporate goals and on high-success probability projects.

Qualifications
2+ years' experience with developing dashboards in Microsoft Power BI, Tableau or Qlik
2+ years' experience with business analytics, data mining, geospatial analytics, or statistical analysis
2+ years' experience with geo spatially focused analytical software tools (for example Alteryx, ESRI Arc GIS, MapInfo, Tableau, and/or Power BI).
Ability to effectively communicate quantitative analysis to a broad audience
Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills
Bachelor's degree in Real Estate, Geography, Geographic Information Systems, Business Analytics or related field
2+ years’ Experience working for multi-sector real estate firm, covering asset classes in residential, office, retail, industrial and others

Job_Title: Supply Chain Data Insights and Analytics Leader
Job_Description:
Supply Chain Data Insights and Analytics Leader

Job Summary

Job Description

A Working Leader, With Strong Data Analytics And Data Solutions Experience, Providing Guidance To a Group Of Analytic And Data Science Professionals That
Driving the vision of market driven insights and leveraging deep data analytics in making key business decisions across the K-C Supply Chain.
Management of long-term prioritization of the K-C procurement analytical needs, opportunities and solutions needed to drive category specific strategies leveraging deep data.
Understand and translate business needs and requests into data and or analysis requirements.
Manage data from various sources using both traditional and state-of-the-art techniques across both internal and external data sources.
Drive innovation in and provide visual reporting of data and performance metrics.
Perform analytics and provide multi-dimensional analysis by taking data from multiple systems for the functional groups across the Global Supply Chain team that they support to drive differentiated decision making.
Drive effective reporting and dashboards using effective and impactful visualization that span across geographies, categories by taking data from different core systems.
Guide customers to continuously improve their use of metrics and visual reporting.
The leader and team will be responsible for partnering with the Supply Chain Digital Capabilities Team and IT to develop solutions and tools to support their work and their customers reporting and analytics needs.

The team will have specific responsibility to develop and deliver across the following areas:
Managing and continuously improving global dashboards and scorecards.
Department Performance, Metrics, and Financial Benchmarking.
Spend Analytics, Supply Market Intelligence, Data Analysis and RFP Support.
This work relies on knowledge and use of internal K-C systems (SAP, EtQ, MES, WMS, etc.) and external data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, SSRS, PowerBI, etc.).

Responsibilities

Data Insights & Analytics - 50%
Lead the team to collaborate with key stakeholders to understand data and analytical needs to support initiatives and functional strategy development.
Develop list of key priorities in close collaboration with the Procurement teams to ensure that the insights and analytic efforts are adding value to the category teams.
Lead the team to develop capabilities in supply market intelligence, should cost modeling, models for make vs buy, specification harmonization, scenario-based awards.
Lead the team to develop a data driven approach for complexity reduction, data-based negotiations and supplier awards, supplier substitution, supplier development, and complexity reduction.
Collaborate with the other teams in the Procurement Center of Expertise to drive supplier relationship management, process, design-to-value and core capability builds.
Support data and analysis requests and work with team to analyze data and challenge / discuss supplemental or complementary data for customers.
Bring innovation and continuously improve internal and external data gathering, data cleansing and testing (including anomaly detection), analysis and visualization techniques and solutions.

Reporting and Dashboard - 30%
Lead team to develop, sustain and continuously improve standard reports, scorecards and formats that support the stakeholder functions (and where possible automate and allow self-serve usage).
Understand data or metric use to facilitate exploration of the improved visual reporting and representation of data for customers and stakeholders.
Sustain and continuously improve existing digital platforms (together with the Global Process Owner for Procurement, Digital Capabilities Team and IT).
Lead the development of dashboards, establish the governance to limit the proliferation of dashboards across procurement teams.
Be the thought leader, primary point of contact for procurement related reporting, scorecards and visualization needs.
Collaborate with the Global Process Owner team to develop scorecards based on metrics, KPIs that reflect the organization’s performance, opportunities and ability to benchmark against industry.
Benchmark with internal K-C teams and external companies on best practices for reporting, scorecards, dashboards to ensure that procurement team is fully capitalizing on latest technology trends and visualization.

Team Management - 20%
Provides direct leadership and management of team members reporting into role. Responsible for building talent and capabilities within direct and indirect reporting relationships.
Lead a focused on supply market intelligence and data analytics.
Lead the team of reporting /dashboards analysts.
Establish the goals, objectives, and development plans for all team members.
Builds change management procedures for process improvements and enhancements to the team’s processes and tools.
Challenges stakeholders, peers and teams through benchmarking and industry insights to drive the organization to better leverage data and analytics in decision making.

Qualifications

Experience:
Undergraduate degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Math/Statistics or similar is required.
Master’s in quantitative degree (Economics, Statistics, Operations Research, Decision Sciences,) or MBA in Supply Chain, Operations Management, Business / Technology Management preferred.
10+ years related business experience with background in three or more of the following areas: Supply Chain, Competitive Intelligence, Consumer Analytics, IT, Procurement, Finance/Accounting, Project Management.
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytical methods (R, SAS, Optimization, Predictive Modeling, Scenario based analysis).
Preferred to have prior experience in top-tier consulting companies with engagements focused on data driven analytics, action-oriented insights and working closely with senior leaders in supply chain, procurement.
5+ years of experience with advanced data analytics, supply market intelligence, data driven approach by leveraging IT process and systems.
5+ years of experience as a team leader – leading teams of 5+ in a global environment across geographies.

Skills/Capabilities
Strong communication skills.
Experience in data mining, testing and anomaly detection techniques.
Experience in applied statistics, econometric modelling, statistical methods such as distributions, stress testing models, single-variate and multi-variate regression, scenario-based models.
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL; Experience with common data science programs – R-Studio, SPSS, Alteryx and others.
Experience with data visualization tools.
Experience in the development and implementation of digital solutions (global solutions preferred).
Knowledge and experience with these systems/tools is preferred: SAP, Tableau, Microsoft Excel/Access, Azure Analytics, PowerBI).

Location:

The preference is Roswell, GA but strong candidates in other K-C locations will be considered as well.

With annual sales of $15 billion, Ecolab (ECL) is the global leader in water, hygiene and energy technologies and services that protect people and vital resources. Our 49,000 associates help make the world cleaner, safer and healthier by delivering critical insights and innovative solutions to help our customers achieve clean water, safe food, abundant energy and healthy environments at nearly three million customer locations in more than 170 countries.
When you come to work at Ecolab, you get to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges – and have the opportunity to learn and grow, shape your career, make an impact and quickly see the importance of your work.

Responsible for systematic capturing of best practices and standards to reduce time to value of analytics initiatives

Regulatory Reporting Delivery (RRD) is a strategic Finance solution for capturing, validating, transforming, and storing Finance and Regulatory information from various sources (sub-ledgers and financial reporting systems) and distributing that information to various processes and systems for regulatory compliance reporting.

The Regulatory Reporting Delivery Service Management (RRDSM) team is responsible for supporting the collection, validation, and transformation of data required for regulatory reporting; maintaining the OFSAA application; and providing end-to-end process coordination and support. This team must have a holistic view of the data sources, processes, and outputs, and the ability to trouble-shoot and resolve problems related to the numerous data sources being interfaced into the FSDF database.

The team also owns the solutioning of Analytical capabilities and visualization for Regulatory Reporting as well as developing the capabilities for Governance processes like Change and Issue management for the wider Finance Regulatory program.

Responsibilities

This role will be responsible for leading a team (2-3 direct reports and consultants from time to time) responsible for developing the analytical capabilities and delivering visualization experience to multiple Controllership teams involved in Regulatory Reporting. Additionally, this role will manage the development & deployment of Issue and Change Management capabilities for the overall program. This person will play the role of Product Owner for these capabilities and will work closely with different tech teams who are jointly responsible for the solutioning.

This position will report to the Director, Regulatory Reporting Delivery Service Management team, part of the Finance Data Management organization within the Global Controllership Strategy Enablement Group (SEG).

The Responsibilities Of This Role Include
Define Regulatory Analytics vision and roadmap, working closely with regulatory reporting process owners.
Create business requirements document for Regulatory Analytics solution, define features and user stories and work closely with technology team to deliver on the requirements
Design, build, and deploy the appropriate analytical capabilities to allow stakeholders to validate and attest to their data. This includes building OBI (or using other BI tools like Tableau) dashboards and analytical queries used for attestation, validation, and analysis of the base data as well as the regulatory reports.
Design, build, and deploy the appropriate capabilities to manage the Issues and Changes impacting Regulatory Reporting processes.
Lead, support business process transition to operationalize the analytical and governance capabilities developed.
Perform all responsibilities related to Product Ownership under the Agile methodology including Rally updates, PI planning, working closely with Scrum teams, performing UAT, etc.
Provide Functional and Process Subject Matter Expertise on American Express Finance Systems and Sub Ledgers to support the end to end Regulatory Reporting processes on RRD platform.

Qualifications
Experience working as product owner to design, develop a Business Intelligence solution
Experience in Financial Analysis and Reporting function
Previous experience working closely with Technologies (preferably using Agile methodology) to deploy systems, to re-engineer processes and solve complex business problems.
Hands-on experience with reporting tools (OBIEE, BI Publisher or Tableau) is highly desired
Hands-on PL/SQL experience is required
Transformational approach to Process efficiency and effectiveness.
Excellent communication, both written and verbal, facilitation and presentation writing skills. Must be able to communicate results to stakeholders including non-finance people.
Must be a self-starter with an ability to drive changes.
Prior people leader experience will be helpful to keep cross functional teams engaged and motivated to work together and perform.

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

GoHealth is looking for a Data Analyst to join its Business Analytics team. You will be responsible for using a combination of business intuition and advanced analytics to provide executive leadership with actionable insights to drive strategic decision-making and maximize company-wide enterprise value. You will be responding to the live needs of the business, and helping to solve problems and answer questions as they arise. Test hypotheses across functions using measurable, statistically-significant methods to evaluate best performing strategies
Build interactive dashboards and reports that provide insights that can be easily interpreted and applied by business leaders to help improve their performance
Collect, analyze, and evaluate data to track project performance and important developments
Synthesize raw data into digestible and actionable information
Continually think of new ways that data-based insights can help support GoHealth

BS or BA degree
3+ years of experience guiding strategic decision-making in a business context through a combination of descriptive and diagnostic analytics

Job_Title: Risk Analytics Data Scientist Senior Consultant (Liquidity Risk)
Job_Description:
Where good people build rewarding careers.

Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.

 

 
Job Description

 
Risk analytics spans a broad set of empirically-based disciplines (applied statistics, econometrics, applied mathematics, algorithmics / optimization, and machine learning / data science) applied to and across all the major risk silos (credit, market, operational, liquidity, and model risk, with a focus on liquidity risk).  We are seeking experts in these fields to apply their training and experience to optimize risk-and-return business decisions in the Performance and Analytics team within Allstate’s Enterprise Risk and Return Management group.  We place a premium on expert statistical and econometric programming skills/experience with real-world data (e.g. SAS, Matlab, Python, SPSS, R, C++).  A deep understanding of the value/necessity of independent replication and model validation is key, as is the knowledge of multiplicity/FDR issues and the ability and expertise to avoid overfitting.  We highly value a very strong curiosity factor in exploring / understanding datasets containing covariates with complex relationships, appropriately tempered by the need for provable rigor and scientifically defensible and replicable methods based on modular, transparent, and well-documented code.  This is consistent with the value we place on non-siloed, cross-disciplinary solutions to complex, real-world, non-textbook business challenges.  The Risk Analytics Data Scientist is responsible for aligning with and contributing to corporate objectives by identifying and developing growth and profitability opportunities that will enable Allstate to generate profitable market share growth.  He/she is accountable for using data and non-trivial statistical/econometric code that in most circumstances, seamlessly and directly translates into material business decisions for the firm.  This includes building predictive models and developing original-yet-defensible methods that enable Allstate to make better decisions and win in the marketplace.

This role is responsible for leading the use of data to make risk-and-return analytics decisions, with a focus on liquidity risk. This includes, more broadly, the development and management of predictive modeling and the design and development and vetting of original methodology; statistical/econometric empirically-based coding expertise in at least one major relevant language is required (e.g. SAS, Matlab, Python, SPSS, R, C++) as this will serve as the basis by which the abovementioned business decisions are made.  More specifically, this role will leverage the candidate’s experience with various approaches – both established and derived, original methods – to estimating and managing liquidity risk to effectively and efficiently drive capital decisions.  This role will manage complex projects and require some mentoring as it will have direct reports.

 
Key Responsibilities

 

Uses best practices to implement and develop complex statistical, econometric, and machine learning techniques to build risk analytics models that directly address material business needs.

Incorporates independent replication and model validation methods into the model development process and understands the necessity for this, as well as the extreme efficiency gains that result from this best practice.

The ability to boil down, without dumbing down, is critical: communicates effectively to team members, leadership and stakeholders on findings to ensure models are well understood and incorporated into business processes.  Provides stakeholders the opportunity to influence the direction of the work via feedback loops.

Knowledge of, and experience dealing with multiplicity/FDR issues, and the ability and expertise to avoid overfitting, is key.

Develop and execute non-siloed, cross-disciplinary solutions to complex, non-textbook business challenges.

Works on data and complex business problems to drive improved risk-and-return business decisions and results by designing, building, and partnering to implement the right models for the right problems (e.g. Hadoop is not necessary (or desirable) for mere gigabytes of data, and random forests is not necessary (or desirable) when OLS conditions are sufficiently met).

Can identify new areas of data, research and methodology/models that can solve relevant risk-and-return business challenges.

Collaborates the with team to understand the business’ problems to identify the optimal methodological, and modeling (method+language/platform), approaches.

Mentors and develops junior data scientists.


 
Job Qualifications

 

Master’s or PhD degree or concentration in a quantitative field such as statistics, econometrics/economics, data science, applied mathematics, computer science, and/or finance.

Peer reviewed publications & related awards are highly valued / desired, as are technical conference decks.

Academic honors, top standardized test scores, scholarships and fellowships are highly valued / desired.

Serving as referee / reviewer / editor of academic and industry journals is highly valued / desired.

Best-of-breed expertise in working with statistical software such as SAS, MatLab, Python, SPSS, R, C++.

Demonstrated expertise using statistical and econometric modeling and/or machine learning techniques to build models of nontrivial size and complexity that have driven company decision making.

Experience with various approaches – both established and derived, original methods – to estimating and managing liquidity risk to effectively and efficiently drive capital decisions.

Demonstrated experience incorporating independent replication and model validation methods into the model development process.

Demonstrated experience and ability developing and executing non-siloed, cross-disciplinary solutions to complex, real-world, non-textbook business challenges.

Knowledge of advanced modeling techniques, and the experience to know how to select, apply, and test the right models for the right problems.

Demonstrated ability and experience to provide both written and oral interpretation of highly specialized terms and data, and to present to others with varying levels of expertise to achieve ‘buy-in’ to the right approaches.



 
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.

As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.

Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.

Job Title

People Analytics Analyst

Company

Work matters. It’s where we spend a third of our lives. And the workplace of the future is going to be a great place. We’re dedicated to bringing that to life for people everywhere. That’s why we put people at the heart of everything we do.

People matter. Our people have a passion for learning, building, and innovating. Whether you’re an engineer, a sales professional, a finance professional, or anything in-between, our roles aim to provide each person with meaningful impact and plenty of space to grow.

Team

The Talent Insights Team leverages data to help leaders and other stakeholders across ServiceNow make better decisions about people. We are passionate about making ServiceNow an incredible place to work for every employee and helping ServiceNow achieve its mission. We believe leveraging data will help us make better decisions about our most important resource, our talent.

Role

You will play a key role in responding to data requests from key stakeholders, developing tools, identifying strategies and implementing processes that help ServiceNow and the Global Talent Organization access, understand and use data to make decisions. You will design tools, run analyses, automate reports, and create presentations to ensure the right data get to the right person at the right time.

What You Get To Do In This Role
Use data to "tell the story" about our talent
Present and communicate findings and status reports about how things are going related to recruiting, team health and retention
Collaborate with subject matter experts across our Global Talent Team (learning and development, recruiting, talent management, compensation, benefits) to ensure data is used to have impact and drive action
Leverage tools, such as Tableau, SQL, Workday, and Excel to drive efficient insights
Communicate findings to management via presentations, on a periodic/ quarterly/ annual basis
Partner with IT and HR Systems to improve operating efficiencies/effectiveness and works with internal teams to automate or streamline data collection processes
Build Tableau Dashboards and other tools that will help stakeholders understand how things are going and when they need to take action

In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
2-3 Years in Business, Marketing, Finance, Talent, or equivalent analytical work
Experience creating reports in Excel and other analytic tools
Strong business analysis skills including strong written communication, presentation development, and data analytics.
Strong visualization skills, able to “tell the story” in a clear, concise, and clean manner.
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Ability to communicate the results of analyses to multiple stakeholders

Production & Maintenance
- Produce web pages, landing pages, web forms, etc. based on templates and design guidelines for Cox School of Business

Measurement & Analytics
- Monitor and analyze website traffic activity to determine effectiveness and engagement across both content and format

Design

- Collaborate well with designers, photographers, writers to source content for the Cox website
