WACKER SILICONES is one of the world’s leading Silicone manufacturers with silicone-based system solutions with more than 3,000 different products - silicone fluids, rubbers and resins, silanes and pyrogenic silica. At our Charleston, TN site, we are currently looking for a Process Engineer- Online Analytics.

The Process Engineer-Online Analytics reports to the Central Lab Manager at the WACKER Polysilicon plant located in Charleston, TN. This position will manage a "Technical Support Specialist-Online Analytics" to carry out routine maintenance. The Process Engineer-Online Analytics is responsible for providing and improving all online analytics for the site. The Process Engineer-Online Analytics will also assure continuously high product quality and ensure that the WACKER Polysilicon online analytics technology is up-to-date, functioning and operating safely. Also, the Process Engineer-Online Analytics will act as a cross-functional analytical liaison between business units.

Your Tasks
Coordinate the supervision and support services for existing online analytics instrumentation with the technical department, thus ensuring machine uptime.
Translate the overall technology and product strategy into online analytics.
Initiate, define, and conduct projects with internal and external partners to improve online analytics. Provide expert advisory service to other disciplines.
Define SOP’s for handling online analytics equipment and instrumentation. Train employees on how to handle online analytics instrumentation.
Coordinate with quality assurance and instrument maintenance engineers.
Implement proper data storage, data extraction, and data analysis functions for the data generated by online analytics. Troubleshoot inconsistent results.

Your Profile
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, Process Technology, Chemistry, or similar field required.
Master’s degree or PhD in Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, Process Technology, Chemistry, or similar field is preferred.
Minimum number of years of experience: 3 years.
Experience/knowledge in at least one of the following three fields: 1) Online Analytics, 2) Data Handling, Databases, Data Extraction and Data Processing; 3) Process Modeling.
Experience in Chemical industry. Experience in Silane chemistry, especially Chlorosilanes, or silicon-based (or other inorganic) semiconductors is preferred.
Several years of practical experience in the field of Instrumental Analysis (Chromatography or Spectroscopy).
Must have an interdisciplinary mindset and communication skills for developing new analysis methods, in a complex matrix organization.
Must have the talent to plainly explain complex technical interrelationships to colleagues with diverse backgrounds.
Must be a team player, who is able to work with various functions and levels of the organization, and who is keen on practical work orientation and striving for Continuous Improvement.
The ideal candidate should be independent, responsible, well-organized, and a self-starter with a target-oriented work style.
Must have IT knowledge, especially with data bases and standard software.
Be responsible for work leadership of one other employee.

Position Overview:
The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst is a key role that will provide support to numerous initiatives across the entire Organization. This position will provide critical analysis to deliver and implement key activities such as departmental metrics and dashboards, supplier scorecards and KPI’s, supply base intelligence, RFI/RFP preparation and analysis, marketplace indices evaluation, departmental process improvement initiatives, support of standard operating procedure development and supplier management. The BI Analyst will support delivery leads and clients to develop project plans to generate required quantitative analyses and to establish timelines for client deliverables while influence the SDI leadership teams to adopt new approaches. 
  Job Responsibilities:
Company’s departmental dashboards, metrics, and reports. 
Support the development of departmental performance metrics and KPI’s (i.e. savings, spend, contract management, compliance) to drive strategy development and implementation. 
Complete and execute distribution reports on schedule (daily, weekly, or monthly). To accomplish, the BI Analyst must be able to triage multiple on-going tasks and have effective time management skills. 
Manage validation and documentation processes for personal work outputs to ensure reliability of models, reproducibility of results and replication of the production process. 
Contribute to the development and management of the firm’s data and analytics infrastructure, including introduction of new technologies to the firm.   
Supply chain intelligence
Gather and analyze data and relevant information around business insights into supply base changes and market dynamics. 
Run and analyze marketplace indices that effect cost of goods sold and present findings to Organization.
Strive to continuously improve SDI performance by utilizing and understanding best practices, lessons learned and industry trends through participation in industry associations.  
Analytics as a Service. 
Support the development of standard operating procedures for identified key service offerings. 
Oversee, support and manage client specific data flows and reporting.  
Engage and drive client interaction towards the fulfillment of our contractual obligations and management of agreed upon engagement SLAs.  

Qualifications:
Minimum 4-year college degree from an accredited university. 
2-5 years’ work related experience. 
Moderate supply chain experience strongly preferred. 
Advanced Excel and Business Intelligence tools skills are a must.  
Experience and technical proficiency with appropriate analytical tools (SQL, Access,PowerPoint, Microsoft Access, and MS Project).  
Experience with ERP procurement systems is also a plus.  
Strong analytical, business process analysis and problem solving capabilities. 
Financial acumen. 
Excellent communication and project management skills.  
Ability to work and support different business streams and guide them towards a viable technical solution 
Critical thinking skills: Seeing beyond the obvious to provide insights garnered from analysis.

This position will play a key role in current and future networking productivity initiatives and integrations as well as project deployments. Sling TV L.L.C. provides an over-the-top (internet delivered) television experience on TVs, tablets, gaming consoles, computers, smartphones, smart TVs and other streaming devices. Sling TV is the #1 Live TV Streaming Service Sling TV is a next-generation service that meets the entertainment needs of today’s contemporary viewers. Visit www.Sling.com . 1-5 years of experience in Product Development or e-commerce analytics role
1-5 years experience with Adobe Analytics
Experience with additional analytics tools (Google Analytics, etc.), marketing attribution (Kochava, etc.), or tag management (Tealium) is also a plus
In-depth knowledge of Agile process and principles

Str ong initiative for anticipating and meeting business demands, an ability to thrive in a fast-paced and uncertain environment, a high level of intellectual curiosity, and a focus on generating results
As an Analytics Product Manager for Sling TV, you will be responsible for developing the product roadmap, requirements, user experience, governance, and product strategy for the analytics that inform product, marketing, and operations decision-making. Our Product Managers also play a highly visible role in the company and are critical to the development and execution of our growth strategy. You will also be part of forging the way millions of people consume sports and entertainment. We are looking for an energetic, strategic, and user-centric individual who will be able to spearhead product initiatives to achieve business goals.

Final decision maker on design and requirements for web analytics

Communicate timelines and risks of web analytics releases to business and dev teams
Serve as a subject matter expert for analytics product best practices and industry tool availability, with the ability to articulate trade-offs in build vs. buy decisions as well as 3rd party tool comparisons

We’re looking for a Qualitative Researcher who is passionate about digital experiences. The ideal candidate is someone who has worked on digital and mobile consumer products, and bring a quiver of qualitative methodologies to the table (e.g. UX evaluations, contextual inquiries, focus groups, participatory design methods, etc). This will be a 12 month contract.

What You’ll Do

Collaborate as a strategic partner on a multidisciplinary team including Design, Engineering, Writing, Marketing, Business Analytics, Sales, and PM.
Proactively communicate and share your research findings with team members, executives, and other audiences.

3+ years experience researching digital consumer products.
Expertise in conducting end-to-end research on digital products & experiences.

Ability and willingness to travel up to 30% of the time

Description

Position at Pathway Vet Alliance

Pathway Vet Alliance is a Private Equity portfolio company and a leading veterinary management organization overseeing operations for over 200 hospitals in the US. We are currently seeking an experienced Financial Analyst to join our growing Financial Planning & Analysis team. The Financial Analyst will play a key role in supporting our corporate finance functions and enterprise level reporting and budgeting.

Exciting Overview

This position works with a dynamic and brilliant team and is responsible for providing broad analytical and financial support across all areas of the business. This position will play a key role in the company's financial planning process as well as driving operational efficiency through reporting and analysis. The role will partner with business managers to monitor key performance metrics, create and consolidate annual budget and monthly forecasts, perform cash projection and cash modeling and oversee our corporate debt and leverage ratio analytics. In addition, this role will participate in special projects as needed and prepare monthly financial reporting for Pathway’s Leadership team.

Key Area Of Ownership
Cash Tracking & Forecasting for the CFO: Daily Cash Tracking and Cash Forecasting; working with various individuals in the accounting department (AP, Revenue, Payroll, Holdbacks, Rent, etc.), M&A team, and the legal department to track cash activity, forecast cash projections, and develop weekly AP spend through analyzing cash flow. Reporting sent directly to the Chief Financial Officer.
Permitted Acquisition Tests for New Deals: As practices are closing, working on our permitted acquisition test to confirm our leverage ratio stays in compliance. Working with the M&A and legal teams to develop borrowing amounts on our credit facilities
Monthly Financial Reporting Pack: Developing and preparing monthly financial reporting package for Leadership Team and assisting with new reporting requests as needed.
Project-Based Initiatives
CapEx Model: Building new CapEx model for monthly reporting and as a resource for the operations team and procurement team for CapEx spend; Working with the VP of Operations and Operations Analyst to document CapEx process and understand reporting needs. Coordinating with the Director of Procurement to set processes in place for communicating finalized CapEx spend and tracking in the new CapEx model. Building the CapEx model, gathering data, and building reporting for monthly distribution;
Assisting with Cloud-Based Annual Budget Process: Assisting with initial development and build-out of cloud-based budget model in Adaptive Insights and maintaining the annual budget process along with quarterly forecasting; full exposure to new software implementation
Dashboarding in Power BI: Assisting with spearheading and building dashboards in Power BI through collaborative efforts with our operations team and revenue team
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related field
Minimum of 3+ years of relevant finance, FP&A, private equity, and/or public accounting experience
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and able to juggle multiple work streams
Excellent analytical, problem solving, and communication skills
Organized team player with strong attention to detail
Knowledge of budgeting, forecasting, financial modeling and variance analysis
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel preferred
Positive attitude, energetic, and upbeat personality
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications
Retail, Healthcare, Veterinary or comparable industry experience a plus
Experience using reporting platforms and ERP Systems (Workday FDM, Adaptive Insights, PowerBI, Tableau, TM1, SAP, Cognos)
Workday experience is a plus

Purpose Of Role

The Analytic Translator (Sr. Manager) Merchandising Analytics role serves as a business-facing analytics expert, specializing in a department or functional area supported by DACI. They represent overall DACI capabilities to a respective business function. This role is responsible for partnering with the Merchandising business to prioritize a roadmap of analytic solutions to solve strategic, tactical, and/or operational business problems leveraging data and analytics and translating the business intent into actionable analytic solutions.

The Analytics translator will leverage an expansive set of analytic techniques or methodologies that support recommendations for executive level business decisions and their teams. To accomplish this, the individual will lead or guide a cross-functional team to leverage multiple resources, advanced analytic methodologies and data streams linking the four enterprise strategic quadrants (people, process, customer, and financial). This position requires deep knowledge of analytical techniques, disparate data sources both internal and external data and strong domain expertise.

RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENTS
Cultivate a deep business partnership with key stakeholders (e.g., Directors, VPs), maintaining thorough understanding of the business, strategy, and key business questions.
Represents the holistic functions and processes of the DACI organization, serving as liaison to bridge the gap between the business and the analytic experts
Translate the deep business knowledge into high level data and analytic product requirements to support the business partners on solution ideation and selection with Machine Learning/Advanced Modeling, Data Services, IT, and the functional area for which they have responsibility, to identify the use cases for Analytics that will drive the most value for the business
Works effectively within a matrixed organization, demonstrate self-leadership skills, and possess the ability to influence and interact with various levels of the organization
Manage (directly and/or indirectly) individual contributors
Accountable for ensuring that all relevant functions and organizations across Lowe’s are involved in the planning and delivery of any analytic solution, to ensure its successful design and adoption (e.g., Finance, Product Management, Operations, other Technology functions).

Required Education / Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Analytics, or other related field and 7+ years of experience in deep analytic and/or quantitative consulting OR Master’s Degree in Engineering, mathematics, statistics or other quantitative field and 6+ years of deep analytic and/or quantitative consulting
Solid business knowledge about retail

Preferred Experience
Experience with home improvement retailer

Tractor Supply Company (TSCO), the largest retail chain of rural lifestyle products in the United States, is dedicated to enhancing our strong company culture built on our team members’ commitment to our Mission and Values. With over 1,700 stores in 49 states and an innovative e-commerce platform, Tractor Supply ranks in the Fortune 400 with revenues of $7 billion and growing! Come grow your career with us as we serve those who live “Life out Here”!

Responsibilities

Education : Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Statistics, or Econometrics. Master’s degree a plus. Any suitable combination of education and experience will be considered.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Training/Systems
Knowledge of SQL, relational databases and query authoring

Experience with Microsoft Azure, Snowflake, Spark, Hadoop, Hive, Mongo DB

The Project Manager-TechOps Material Planning Analytics is responsible for leading the design, development, preparation, and optimizations of highly complex analytical studies and presentations to support improvement in the TechOps inventory support systems and Material Planning performance. This role will develop actionable analytics for strategic corporate initiatives focused on key performance indicators and aircraft reliability metrics used to drive world class maintenance asset/materials standards. Additionally, the Analytics Leader will provide technical support and project management expertise in the specification, implementation, integration, and optimization of cross-divisional decision support systems and business intelligence tools.
Overall responsibility for inventory support systems and analytics critical to the accurate and timely measurement of material & airline performance. Ensures efficient, safe, and compliant daily Material operations. Must possess, create and implement a strategic vision to improve quality, efficiency, and competitiveness of material services. Supports world class asset/materials standards. Achieve expertise in existing systems through enhancements and improvements, direct problem identification and troubleshooting, and lead in developing next-generation decision support, analytics and process improvements. Technical operations experience highly preferred.

Key Job Functions

Leads high-visibility, high impact projects to improve overall Inventory and Logistics performance. Is responsible for material support process development and implementation of next-generation reporting and automation based on statistical analysis of historical data, predictive modeling, benchmarking, and scenario analysis. Provide project management and lead developer expertise in the creation and enhancement of decision support systems. Leverages emerging technologies and identifies efficient and meaningful ways to communicate data and analysis in order to satisfy divisional needs. Leads inter/intra departmental initiatives that improve usability of data and end-user satisfaction.
Demonstrates characteristics of a leader including frequently representing the team in interactions with other TechOps business units. Provides leadership, training and mentoring to team members and user groups to insure key knowledge, processes, skill sets and capabilities are maintained, documented and perpetuated long term.
Practices safety-conscious behaviors in all operational processes and procedures.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Science, Business/management, mathematics/Statistics, Economics, or other relevant quantitative field required plus 5+ years of experience in analysis, information science, data visualization, or other relevant quantitative field, or Master's degree plus 3+ years of relevant work experience required.
Must have superior technical, quantitative, analytical, modeling, and organizational skills.
Must have the ability to demonstrate critical thinking with respect to cause and effect relationships.
Must possess strong analytical, strategic, presentation, business, finance, and organizational acumen. Must be highly proficient in SAP, SAS, SQL, Microsoft Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint, as well as written and oral communications.
Must have ability to anticipate and plan for competing priorities, and negotiate deliverables accordingly. Must be able to structure and deliver presentations and communications targeted to varied audiences. PMP Certification is preferred.
Experience using statistical methods to measure operational performance
Ability to perform with a high level of accuracy
Ability to work independently and multi-task

Job_Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst/Business Intelligence Analyst
Job_Description:
At Squarespace, our platform empowers millions of people — from individuals and local artists to entrepreneurs shaping the world’s most iconic businesses — to share their stories and create an impactful, design-forward, and easy-to-manage online presence.

**We are currently looking for talented Business Intelligence Analysts across all levels. If you're interested in joining us, please apply here regardless of your seniority, and our team will consider where you can make the biggest impact.**

We are looking for BI Analysts to align with the following functions:
International Strategy & Operations, where you will have the opportunity to drive data driven decisions and impact our growing international business.
Finance, where you will be supporting the FP&A and accounting teams to answer complex, data driven questions related to the companies financial and operational performance as well as data used to record bookings and revenue.
Channels & Services, where you will use data to help develop and scale new products to reach unexplored customer segments including a network of independent service providers who help do-it-yourself and do-it-for-me customers succeed online and launching an enterprise offering.

If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and are excited to impact critical business decisions using data, then this role is right for you. These embedded roles are based in our New York City headquarters.

Responsibilities
Support the Business Operations process, keeping the team focused on data driven deliverables as they pertain to business goals
Provide insights and own reporting, data validation, and presenting data in a format that allows the team and management to make strategic decisions
Search, validate, and maintain data to develop reports and scorecards aligned to business needs and ongoing team initiatives
Proactively identify problems through quantitative and qualitative data analysis and help support the functional team you’re apart of in developing solutions
Collaborate with our Data Scientists and partner cross-functionally across the business to ensure consistent achievement of our operational plan and growth goals


Qualifications
3+ years experience in a Business Operations, Analytics, or relevant data driven support roles
Advanced Excel/google sheets skills including pivots, vlookups, ability to build complex formulas
Mastery of SQL and experience with BI reporting (i.e. Chart.io, Looker) and databases (dimensional and relational), including data ingestion. Python knowledge preferred
Ability to transform data into a digestible and presentable story
Confidence and expertise in communicating effectively with a wide-range of audiences
Strong ability to devise data-driven solutions to business problems
Ability to drive impact by thoughtfully tackling open-ended problems


About Squarespace

Squarespace makes beautiful products to help people with creative ideas succeed. By blending elegant design and sophisticated engineering, we empower millions of people — from individuals and local artists to entrepreneurs shaping the world’s most iconic businesses — to share their stories with the world. Squarespace’s team of more than 950 is headquartered in downtown New York City, with offices in Dublin and Portland. For more information, visit www.squarespace.com/about.

Perks
Health insurance with 100% premium covered
Flexible vacation & paid time off
Equity plan
401(k) plan with employer match
Free lunch and snacks
Dog-friendly workplace
And more

Today, more than a million people around the globe use Squarespace to share different perspectives and experiences with the world. Not only do we embrace and celebrate the diversity of our customer base, but we also strive for the same in our employees. At Squarespace, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Job Description

The ORV Marketing Campaign Specialist is responsible for building, developing and optimizing personalized campaigns across the entire customer journey. In this role you will own, implement and measure automated marketing campaigns and nurturing programs focused on cultivating leads, increasing customer engagement, driving re-purchase and owner advocacy.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Campaign Execution & Reporting
Build marketing strategies and plans to drive personalized customer and lead nurturing programs.
Plan and implement triggered marketing campaigns across the customer journey by utilizing Marketing Automation Platform (MAP). Implementation includes developing targeted prospect/customer lists, designing multi-channel touchpoints, and integrating data-driven triggers/paths.
Design and manage processes for campaign measurement, tracking effectiveness and assessing business impact of marketing programs. Report key findings/results to stakeholders.
Plan and load campaign lists, marketing assets and measurement KPIs into execution platforms.
Share CRM & marketing automation best practices and expertise across the organization.
Closely partner with brand marketing and analytics teams to ensure programs are designed based on data-driven insights, meet business objectives and include proper brand integration.
Collaborate with brand marketing and email teams to develop and manage marketing communication and launch calendars.

Everlane is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Data Science and Analytics team, where you’ll help scale our analytics capabilities by collaborating with stakeholders to produce impactful analyses and insights, strategically building out the reporting ecosystem, and overall help build a better understanding of our customers and product.

Our team is tasked with extracting actionable insights from our data, building predictive data products, and creating self-service analytical tools for teams throughout the company. We use a full-stack set of methodologies and tools to achieve this, taking a data science problem from the initial open-ended business question to the eventual productionization and implementation of a model.

The subject areas that you will impact span the entire company, from helping our Digital Merchandising team build reporting to monitor site performance, to creating key metrics for international.

Your day-to-day:
Work with business stakeholders to create metrics and self-service reporting around key questions.
Partner with senior leaders to provide business insights.
Build tooling and frameworks that enable quicker iteration on data science problems.
Design and analyze rigorous experiments aimed at understanding customer behavior.

We'd love to hear from you if you have:
BA/BS degree in a quantitative or computing focused degree
1-2 years of experience wrangling and analyzing large datasets to solve open-ended business problems
Expertise in SQL extending to the knowledge of database design and warehousing concepts
Strong fundamentals in statistics and probability, including formal statistical modeling and experimental design


At Everlane, we’re rethinking the way retail works. We have no middlemen taking their cut and no brand markups. Instead, we design our own luxury basics and sell them exclusively at a fraction of the traditional retail price. Since launching in November 2011, Everlane has attracted over 1,300,000 members and has been featured in The New York Times, New York Magazine, The Economist, Elle, and GQ.

Please note before submitting an application: as a company, we take hiring very seriously. Interviewing with Everlane may include video and phone interviews, written projects, and/or on-site interviews. Although we are unable to follow-up with each and every applicant, we do our best to run a thorough process for candidates with whom we identify a potential fit.

Job_Title: Risk, Retail Credit Risk Underwriting/Policy Role, Analyst, Dallas
Job_Description:
RISK

The Risk division is responsible for credit, market and operational risk, model risk, independent liquidity risk, and insurance throughout the firm .

Job Description

We are seeking an analyst level candidate to join the Credit Risk division team. The role will focus on data analytics, data insight generation, trend identification and data visualization to help understand credit risk drivers, create guardrails and monitor the performance of unsecured consumer lending assets such as personal loans and credit cards.

Typical Responsibilities And Duties Include The Following
Support credit risk management senior leadership in partnering with business units and broader Credit department to assess data availability, data sufficiency, and reporting needs
Design and write data queries to extract credit data from various systems and conduct analysis of portfolio performance, deep dive analysis of trends, summarize findings and recommend changes
Provide support for portfolio credit risk oversight and governance by tracking the actual performance of risk appetite and credit risk management metrics against approved guardrails
Create Management reporting using Tableau or other cutting-edge visual interface-based tools to monitor portfolio performance at portfolio segment level (e.g., product, vintage, risk segment, score band, or marketing channel)
Be up to date on applicable regulations and compliance requirements in consumer lending and support Senior Leadership during interactions and updates to internal and external regulators
Adhere strictly to compliance and operational risk controls in accordance with company and regulatory standards, policies and practices
Address internal audit requirements and findings in a timely and appropriate manner

Responsibilities And Qualifications

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS/DEGREE AND FIELD:

Strong Quantitative/ analytical skill with Master’s degree (U.S. or equivalent) in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science/Analytics or a related field like Information Systems, Business Analytics.

Minimum Years Experience Required

0-3 years of experience in the related industry or in dealing with similar quantitative techniques.

Prior Work And Academic Experience Must Include
Use statistical packages like SQL, SAS, R, Python etc., tools to mine, manipulate & aggregate complex consumer and transaction level data on big data platforms such as Hadoop, Spark etc.
Use complex statistical techniques such as decision trees, regression modeling, machine learning, testing techniques and time series data analysis techniques.
Visualizing information/ trends from raw and complex data using visualization tools such as Tableau, and communicating results to a wide variety of audiences
Using advanced Microsoft Office skills, specifically Excel (including creation of pivot tables, logic functions), PowerPoint and Word
Strong writing, presentation and communication skills; technical writing and documentation experience desired
Strong project management / organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments concurrently across various stakeholders with ability to do end-to-end project delivery.

The Hired Guns are seeking an ambitious entry-level data scientist for a major publisher of digital news, sports, entertainment and lifestyle content to scale the project at pace with its exploding scope. Bring your Python/R skills to NYC and leapfrog your previous career track.

Nitty Gritty

This mega-print house has a lean team and a large empire, so it can’t grow fast enough, but it sure can grow wisely. A data analyst who can build models and automated tools will help hit their targets in churning, retention, and propensity models, while springboarding their own career.

Can you say DBT? Using your business analytics savvy, you and the data engineers will put together your fluent knowledge of Python and R to run some A/B and iterative tests, analyze training data, summarize marketing’s findings, and properly segment/enact the audience findings for AI/machine learning digestion. Causation and forecasting are a particular focus here, so get ready to discuss your thesis on subscriber propensity.

You’ll work straight with stakeholders, set your own course (though not your own speed), and make key decisions about where to devote your very in-demand time. Learn quickly, and the sooner your grateful boss will be free to do his job, which, in turn, will bestow new responsibilities on you in this fast-track opportunity to put serious miles on your career in a very short time.

What Success Looks Like

In three months you’ll know the systems as if you wrote them yourself. If you have the same duties a year from now, you’ve already failed. Instead, you’ll be calling enough shots to make a notable impact on the shape of the ever-growing project. You’re a data-mountaineer of an environment that will never be so developmental at this scale again in history, and you’re itching to chart its terrain with lots of feedback requested, but very little support required.

Hired Gun Profile

These gurus want to teach someone hungry, eager to learn, and worth their time to teach. Still in your entry-level stage yet already a subject-matter expert, you’re a proud nerd looking for a mentor rather than a babysitter. Your boss is a self-confessed shy guy who’s happy to coach you whether you’re the same or extroverted: “I do a good job empowering people and advancing their careers.”

You want to ditch the “entry-level” appellation before you’re out of the first few years of your career, and even if rapid promotion weren’t the only option for success, you’d dig the duties of this job because you’re a problem-solver whose thrill is navigating multi-stage challenges.

Your background is hands-on math with a blend of data engineering, data science, and maybe something outside the box. It’s given you vision about where your field is going and you’re unafraid to huck big ideas at the bosses. You may even want to cite a sandbox study that backs you up, because they’re going to ask you about a time you applied Python or R to a real-life business case.

Oh, and come ready to write an algorithm for a problem they’re trying to tackle. Nobody expects you to solve it, but if you do, that’s pretty much you hired.

Inside Skinny

An interest in the media landscape itself is the secret sauce to jumping in with both feet.

Net-Net

Want to be a senior director within five years of starting your career? Two years from now you’ll be a lot more than two years further along in your career. That’s a rare opportunity even if it weren’t with a publisher so mammoth it has its own gravity.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, creed, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, marital status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.

The Social Analyst will work on a specific portfolio of brands. Through a strong understanding of social platforms they take an active role in all aspects of a social project—identifying brand’s issues, running competitive benchmark, forming recommendation, building architecture of programs, drafting the budget, defining the drivers of performance and the KPI’s framework.

Responsibilities
Work closely with integrated teams to create measurement plans, goals and KPI’s, and deliver regular analysis on social brands across Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram, and more to clients.
Get your hands dirty pulling together data from social media channels and social listening tools, tying analysis and insights back to business result.
Connect and drive strategy of social data with other media analytics data such as paid, website, traditional PR, and CRM.
Deep dive into social platform analytics tools, both native and third-party, to understand how they work, and translate what their output means for business strategy.

Qualifications

The Ogilvy social team is comprised of 100+ social experts sitting across various locations in USA: NYC, Chicago, Washington D.C., Los Angeles, and San Francisco. We are on a mission to help companies make Social matter for their brands. Every day, we help brands unlock the business value of social in this new, more complex world by bringing together all the skills necessary to deliver best-in-class social: from audience-centric creation, to data-driven distribution, to creative built and optimized for the modern world. For our clients, we deploy our end-to-end offering, which includes intelligence, strategy, creative, and distribution (paid-owned-earned). Job Description

Raytheon IIS/GIS provides Operations and Maintenance support for the Intelligence Community

Job Description

Raytheon is looking for a Signals Analyst to perform signal analysis and processing to produce technical data to a variety of mission customers. These job functions will be conducted in a real-time operations environment and the resulting data reported real-time to the customer community. This individual will utilize sophisticated Digital Signal Processing equipment to preform these daily task. The position requires the Signals Analyst to quickly identify complex waveforms and various forms of modulation, to determine signal structure and the appropriate method for signal processing. Additionally, the Signal Analyst will be required to perform task as a Technical Advisor to the customer, conduct Database maintenance, provide OJT, conduct system Trouble shooting, and assist with Anomaly resolution.

Required Skills

Data Visualization & Analytics Advisor

Location: Arlington, VA

Position Category: Direct hire, paid in US

Posting Date: 08/22/2019

Deadline Date: 08/25/2019

Description

John Snow, Inc. (JSI) is a technical assistance and research organization that works to advance public health in the US and globally (www.jsi.com). The JSI Center for Health Information, Monitoring and Evaluation (CHIME) is a technical assistance, research, and knowledge group within JSI dedicated to improving the quality of health information and increasing evidence-based decision making in the health sector. We respond to the growing demand for information-driven health services planning and management and the use of data for program improvement, adaptation and innovation. The Center provides assistance and resources within JSI and to governments and other health-focused organizations to strengthen collection and use of high-quality data to improve health program and system performance. We also coordinate JSI resources and experience in health information systems (HIS) as well as monitoring, evaluation, research and learning (MERL) to ensure access to essential tools and techniques, and support peer networks.
The CHIME Data Visualization & Analytics Advisor, based in JSI’s Arlington, VA, office will provide leadership in the International Division and technical assistance to various projects related to research, evaluation, data visualization, communication design, and data use, focusing on the development of charts and graphs, infographics, data dashboards, and other information design and visual content. The ideal candidate will be able to easily work with program and research teams to design or support research and data analysis activities, distill concepts, research and data, and effectively communicate them through visual design to make a meaningful impact. The Advisor also leads a portfolio of data visualization and analytics work, coordinates a team of professionals, and advances JSI’s practice in data visualization and analytics. The role involves both program-focused technical assistance, and strategic and managerial responsibilities related to JSI technical assistance and strategy, as well as internal and external networking and communication.

Responsibilities

The Data Visualization & Analytics Advisor works under the supervision of the CHIME Director and/or Technical Advisor to carry out a range of activities to support JSI projects and corporate teams and advance data use strategies through visualization of health information, training and advocacy. Major areas of responsibility include: coordinating a team of data visualization advisors after a transitional period, providing technical assistance to JSI projects in data analysis and data visualization, leading internal capacity development activities on data visualization design, strategic planning for JSI communications focused on health analytics and data visualization, and new business development, including identifying and managing relationships with potential visualization partners.

Specific Responsibilities Include

Coordination of the CHIME data visualization team and portfolio:
Providing leadership on technical standards and quality related to data visualization and visual analytics
Serving as the focal point for the Center’s data visualization work portfolio, work planning, support for other advisors providing strategic and technical support within JSI teams and projects, and after a transitional period, supervision for a small team working on data visualization activities and
Training and orientation of new data visualization staff
Leading Center policy, technical and strategy discussions related to data visualization and data use
Liaising with external professional groups, partners and funders to advance and advocate for JSI’s work in data visualization
Contributing to CHIME's work in maintaining strong, collaborative and supportive communication with the other JSI centers, working groups, centrally funding and bilateral projects (i.e. information sharing meetings, listservs, etc.)
Representing JSI/CHIME at meetings, events, and conferences, and contribute to CHIME’s work maintaining strong collaborative and supportive communication with other JSI centers, working groups, and projects
Contributing to key functions of CHIME such as strategic planning for JSI MERL, HIS activities, data visualization and new business development
Providing data visualization and analytics technical support:
Providing a focal point for technical assistance requests within JSI related to data visualization
Providing technical assistance on research and analytics related to JSI projects and new business proposals
Advising projects and corporate teams on data visualization, design, and analytics, including supporting discrete project activities and broader strategic thinking and framework development
Developing data visualization guidance, reports, and publications, as required
Understanding the story within data, and developing clear, accurate, and engaging information design products and tools in a variety of formats that organize data, research, concepts, processes and other information into a cohesive visual story
Leveraging knowledge of design to translate ambiguous concepts, complicated problems, and/or complex data, into clear and compelling visualizations to reveal insights and facilitate decision-making
Approaching information design from an audience-centered perspective, focusing on who the target audiences are, what information they need, and how they access information in order to make concrete, practical recommendations for different visual products
Participating in project strategy and discussions, and leading facilitation sessions with teams to translate data into stories and visualizations to meet project requirements.
Working with the JSI communications team to ensure consistency with the overall branding requirements to serve funder communications goals
Building internal data visualization design capacity:
Leading internal efforts to build JSI staff capabilities in data visualization design, including facilitating routine training sessions, providing direct training and coaching to teams, and managing a repository of data visualization tools and resources for JSI staff
Providing routine capacity building and advocacy for data visualization across JSI promoting the uptake and use of data for decision making through visualization, developing training materials and facilitating hands on workshops
Facilitating trainings on data visualization (and use) and related topics; supporting remote coaching with field based staff, including taking creative approaches to providing training support in low-bandwidth environments, and advocating within JSI for data visualization.
Building excellent relationships with teammates and stakeholders across projects, and provide guidance, knowledge sharing, and capacity building, including through facilitated workshops
Researching and recommending software, data visualization, and design techniques to improve core visualization practices and expand information design services.

Qualifications
Master’s degree in public health, international development, information design, communications, statistics, or related with a concentration in data visualization, monitoring & evaluation, or a related field.
8+ years of professional design experience working in the field of data visualization/ information design.
Experience coordinating teams and managing/supervising professional staff, developing scopes of work with clients, and managing projects and client relations.
Experience developing materials for and facilitating training on basic or advanced data visualization design principles
Strong design eye and demonstrated experience in understanding and interpreting complex ideas and/ or data into visual information.
A strong design portfolio with samples of information design work, highlighting strengths as a visual communicator.
Experience networking professionally and expanding ties within professional and global health networks.
Advanced experience using Tableau. Experience using Power BI a plus.
Advanced experience using Microsoft Excel. Experience creating dashboards using Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) a plus.
Experience using Adobe Creative Cloud software highly preferred.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to work independently and manage a wide range of activities on a daily basis with limited supervision.
Ability to solve problems creatively and work under tight deadlines.
HTML 5 / CSS 3 / Javascript knowledge and web page design experience a plus.
English fluency. Fluency in foreign language a plus.
Experience working in international development, preferably global health a plus.

Salary commensurate with experience.

Interested candidates should submit their resumes and cover letters online by 08/25/2019.

No phone calls please.
Principals only please.

Network Quality & Innovation Senior Manager – Group Participation Management
Business Analytics Senior Manager

The Network Quality & Innovation Manager leads a functional area responsible for overall performance and quality of Provider data. This includes the critical thought leadership and direction of a team performing analytical processes that produce key information and measured results in a matrix environment with multiple platforms. The Network Quality & Innovation Manager is involved in the design, tooling, execution and development of new processes, policies and solutions to address highly complex Provider data issues.
This role leads a team to work on complex analytical processes utilizing judgment, fact, and discretion within a larger business organization. This functional leader compiles and analyzes results for identification of improvement opportunities, provides actionable information and executes various analytic techniques on issues related to business people, processes and technology to facilitate improvement in data quality and data remediation.
The Network Quality & Innovation Manager develops, produces, gathers, improves and executes business processes and then utilizes business scorecards populated with decisive and distinct information. Defines and consults on measurement strategies, tools, and execution. Provides measurement and cost savings support for data management accuracy as well as overall data quality accuracy of the portfolio of data.
Actions have significant impact on key department objectives.

Responsibilities
Contributes to the creation and delivery of the management strategies for Network Quality & Innovation identifying areas of improvement for gathering data, conducting analysis and recommending controls or other actions to ensure accuracy of Provider data for consuming use.
Managing multiple complex, time sensitive execution designed to deliver targeted outcomes:
Organizes departmental efforts to identify, prioritize and assess the impacts of business process problems and consumption defects
Leads efforts to develop data collection plans and data acquisition
Leads and train a team in performing analysis activities to deliver to defined objectives
Leads the evaluation of business process and technology through the use of rigorous methods to identify causes of variation, improvement opportunities and solutions considering both upstream inputs into business process and downstream consumers of data
Identifies opportunities for improvements based on fact based analysis
Summarizes results of analysis and effectively communicate to management recommendations for actions to resolve business issues
Communication of Critical Information
Utilizes process maps to map data flow through business processes
Gathers and defines baseline business metrics primarily to illustrate impact of business outputs to customers
Utilizes trending analysis to identify opportunities in business processes resulting from information in Balanced Scorecard
Working in close partnership with business partners is a highly matrix environment
Utilizes information garnered from analysis to partner with Process Owners to identify gaps in business processes.
Works with vendors, suppliers and outside processes to facilitate cleansing and validation processes
Works with internal partners to orchestrate remediation
Establishes a mentoring program to advance maturity of baseline quality assurance methods to move towards a more outcome based quality program.
Partners with departments to develop metrics, analyze problems and recommend improvement opportunities associated with business processes
Can effectively communicate the results of analysis
Coach and develop colleagues
Translate business needs into practical applications and solutions
Execute processes through effective staff management
Qualifications
Advanced degree or equivalent and at least five years of experience in related health care analytics and data
Proven leadership capabilities and competencies with the ability to collaborate with others and establish working relationships, communicate effectively across the organization and at different levels, think and act strategically and influence key leader
Skills in Excel and Access
Exposure to reporting tools such as Hyperion/Brio, Business Objects, SAS or COGNOS ideal
Strong communication skills – oral, written, and interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively within diverse groups
Deep healthcare data analysis experience and demonstrated understanding of health care and delivery systems processes
Ability to successfully navigate and contribute in a highly matrix environment
Ability to develop a performing effective team
Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, age, disability, sex (including pregnancy), childbirth or related medical conditions including but not limited to lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital or familial status, genetic information, status with regard to public assistance, citizenship status or any other characteristic protected by applicable equal employment opportunity laws.If you require an accommodation based on your physical or mental disability please email: SeeYourself@cigna.com. Do not email SeeYourself@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI) has an exciting opportunity for an individual with 3-5 years of insurance experience & data warehousing skills to join our growing data team as a Business Intelligence Engineer. This individual will assist with the strategy and associated implementation of the global data warehouse as we are in the initial stages of defining and implementing long-term analytics and reporting platform strategy.

The Business Intelligence Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, maintaining, monitoring and extending the data warehouse and analytics architecture to meet BHSI’s reporting needs. The design and development focus includes, but is not limited to: dimensional data model design, Extraction Transformation Layer (ETL) frameworks and processing, metadata management, operational data integration, master data definition and data quality, data auditing and profiling, and business intelligence reporting solutions.

The new team member will partner with data architects and various business partners to map the technical vision for applications in the Enterprise Data Warehouse employing SSIS, SSRS, SSAS and SQL server. Additionally, they will be responsible for reviewing, analyzing, modifying, and creating ETLs, utilizing SSIS, testing, debugging, integration and implementation processes. Responsibilities also include documenting technical needs for ETL processes and databases, and ensuring optimal technical infrastructure is utilized.

Essential Functions
Collaborate with multiple business teams to review and prioritize deliverables.
Translate and communicate technical requirements into well designed solutions that meet the business and technical goals defined by business stakeholders.
Design, develop and optimize enterprise level reporting, OLAP and other business intelligence solutions, and cross train others in the use of the tools.
Debug and troubleshoot data quality problems using SQL tools.
Develop test plans and test scripts to ensure alignment with business objectives and overall BHSI testing strategy.
Coordinate upgrades and rollouts of moderate scope including specific duties related to training and monitoring performance.
Coordinate interdepartmental activities and assist in problem resolution to ensure that BHSI meets internal and external customer requirements.
Requirements
Extensive experience in data warehouse reporting and ETL tools.
Experience in handling technology projects/programs in Insurance Domain.
Experience with P&C Solutions such as Duck Creek, Guidewire or similar.
Experience with managing on shore/off shore teams.
3-5 years of P&C insurance experience
Minimum 5 years’ experience using SQL Server 2012 or higher preferred.
Experience with SSRS, Power BI, and other visualization tools.
Strong analytical, problem solving, and conceptual skills with ability to work across business areas.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to express business concepts in technical terms, and complex technical solutions in business terms.
Passionate and professional demeanor that supports a collaborative and team-oriented environment.
Ability to articulate basic project methodology concepts using either SDLC or Agile.
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience.
NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Team Member may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

Ciox Health, a health technology company, is dedicated to improving U.S. health outcomes by transforming clinical data into actionable insights. With an unmatched network offering ubiquitous access, Ciox Health can release, acquire, enhance and deliver medical records and discrete clinical data from anywhere across the United States. At Ciox Health we offer all employees a place to grow and expand their current skills so that they can not only help build Ciox Health into the greatest health technology company but create a career that you can be proud of. We offer you complete training and long-term career goals. Our environment is what most of our employees are the proudest of and our IT Group is comprised of some of the brightest and talented individuals. Give us just a few moments to explain why we need you and hope you will help us change how the health Industry manages its’ medical records. Ciox Health is looking for experienced Data Scientists to lead large-scale Machine Learning and NLP initiatives and deliver end to end in a cloud native environment. The Data Scientist’s primarily purpose is to develop AI/ML models to solve complex problems in the healthcare domain ranging from clinical text extraction, document identification and cohort selection for clinical data abstraction.

Responsibilities

Data exploration and discovery of potential usage of Ciox Data Assets such as Provider Data, EMR Data Feeds, Electronic Health Records and Medical Record Documents Develop AI/ML/NLP models for Operational Forecasting, Search Optimization and Clinical Text Extraction from unstructured medical record documents Partner with Business and Product Management to identify new data assets in order to improve the efficacy and efficiency of our existing ML Models and develop new ML Models Work in close partnership with Ciox clinical data abstractors and other subject matter experts to identify opportunities and develop machine learning models to improve Cohort Selection and Document Identification for clinical trials Partner closely with ML Engineers and Application Developers to help operationalize the NLP and ML models to execute at scale in Production environment Develop hypothesis and Model Training pipelines to continuously evaluate, explain and improve the performance and efficacy of the models Perform data analysis using ML packages and frameworks such as Spark, Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, AWS Sagemaker etc and visualization tools such as Tableau Keep abreast and up to date with the latest trends and techniques in AI, ML and Deep Learning space

Qualifications

6 or more years of work experience in practicing ML and data science in healthcare domain, with more than 10 years of overall IT experience Strong quantitative knowledge, problem solving and critical thinking Data Visualization, presentation and communication skills to clearly articulate the problem statement, proposed hypothesis, solution and explanation of machine learning models to business and technology leaders Experience using NLP Tools and Techniques with exposure to Clinical Ontologies Proficient in Python, SQL, Java and Shell with strong data wrangling skills utilizing packages such as pandas, numpy etc Strong experience using ML Packages and Tools such as scikit-learn, Keras, TensorFlow, OpenNLP, AWS Sagemaker, Jupyter Notebooks, Zeppelin etc. Experience with Predictive Analytics algorithms such as Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forest, xgboost etc Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative or relevant field (Statistics, Math, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science)

Job_Description:
Commercial Analytics Lead

At ResMed (NYSE: RMD, ASX: RMD) we pioneer innovative solutions that treat and keep people out of the hospital, empowering them to live healthier, higher-quality lives. Our cloud-connected medical devices transform care for people with sleep apnea, COPD and other chronic diseases. Our comprehensive out-of-hospital software platforms support the professionals and caregivers who help people stay healthy in the home or care setting of their choice. By enabling better care, we improve quality of life, reduce the impact of chronic disease and lower costs for consumers and healthcare systems in more than 120 countries. To learn more, visit ResMed.com and follow @ResMed.

Let's Talk About The Team And You

Enable the development of a commercial analytics strategy and execution plan to support customer facing initiatives for ResMed’s Sleep, Respiratory care and SaaS business units. This will be achieved through the provision and development of innovative technology solutions that guide decision making, uncover business optimization opportunities and enable commercial offer development and contribute to driving competitive advantage in the marketplace.

Primary interfaces for this role are the VP Business Analytics, Chief Information Officer, Digital Health Technology leadership team, Solutions Consulting team, internal stakeholders and the commercial and operational teams within ResMed’s commercial regions.

Let's Talk About Responsibilities
Partner with business stakeholders to develop and deploy a multi-year commercial analytics strategy that is responsive to the changing needs of the commercial organization and customer environments to enable ResMed’s long-term strategic goals
Develop dashboards, reports, data visualizations and insights that allow ResMed to more effectively engage and partner with customers to highlight the benefits of utilizing technology and service solutions and allowing customers to optimize their business operations
Manage the development of joint business-analytics solutions to identified business opportunities
Drives operating excellence across the function to ensure technology investments and processes are optimized
Focus on value creation and contribution to the P&L by delivering against expectations, managing resource allocation, controlling expenses and investing to maximize returns on these resources
Develop opportunities and monetization models to extract value from ResMed’s data ecosystem in conjunction with business stakeholders
Collaborate with key stakeholders across ResMed’s SaaS businesses to ensure a strong alignment in the use of commercial analytics technologies
Engage with customer stakeholders to fully understand how ResMed can add value to their day-to-day operations through the creation of insightful analytics
Champions a systematic and data driven decision-making approach to all aspects of commercial analytics
Develop a consistent visual analytics solution tool set and develop a commercial analytics brand that is aligned with ResMed’s Brand
Lead the transformation of the customer facing analytics approach from unstructured ad hoc data delivery to a structured, targeted, multifaceted analytics delivery solution
Focus on the development of the right technologies and integration strategies to ensure the accuracy and completeness of data and analytics delivery in a timely manner
Effectively support and manage the processes associated with conflicting priorities of different stakeholders within DHT and within the business across multiple geographies and business units
Continually evolve the vision and the strategy for commercial analytics in line with changing the business needsStakeholder management: ability to lead the commercial analytics strategy development across multiple functional disciplines and geographies
Collaboration: ability to work effectively within and across organizational boundaries
Leadership: create an environment that empowers others to give the best, take risks and unlock value
Problem solving: able to work with complexity and ambiguity to find creative solutions to problems
Cultural diversity: strong knowledge and understanding and sensitivity to different cultural perspectives

Let's Talk About Qualifications And Experience
Degree in business or related disciplines
Significant broad-based analytics experience
Experience of working in commercial analytics across multiple business units or geographies
Preferred:
Medical devices and/or Technology sector experience
Postgraduate qualifications and/or MBA

Okay, so what’s next?

Joining ResMed is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. Our hope is that each day you’ll uncover a new reason to love what you do. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now!

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

BASIC FUNCTION AND RESPONSIBILITY
The UI Carver College of Medicine is seeking an Business Intelligence Analyst / Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join the Software Application Services team to help answer questions through a better understanding of data. We are looking for someone who is curious and has a desire to work with others to show them what is possible. This technical position will work closely with faculty and staff to provide data centric solutions to enable better decision making. Primary responsibilities will involve development and support of ETL processes, complex SQL, reporting and visualization.
KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

Review data, analytics and modeling requests and requirements.

Analyze data integrity and make recommendations regarding the validity of data.
Perform intermediate data analysis techniques.
Design solutions and programs using data analysis tools and platforms.
Provide complex operational end user support.
Train technical team members on use of solutions and platforms.
Design, implement, and provision data solutions via modeling, schema development, ETL and data quality processes.

Ability to work with a variety of individuals and groups in a constructive and civil manner while appreciating the unique contribution of individuals from varied cultures, race, creed, color, national origin, age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity.
Ability to utilize existing resources and learning to achieve or exceed desired outcomes of current and future organizational goals/needs. Able to demonstrate ethical behavior in diverse situations while producing results.
Ability to meet or exceed customer service needs and expectations and provide excellent service in a direct or indirect manner. Ability to effectively transmit and interpret information through appropriate communication with internal and external customers.
Technical Competencies
Knowledge of a variety of tools and toolkits for development and support of data analytics.
Knowledge of and experience with activities, tools and techniques for converting business requirements and logical models into a technical design.
Knowledge of and experience with defining, implementing changes to, and supporting a production data.
Behavioral Competencies
Models open, respectful, accepting and supportive behaviors with all team members and external contacts.
Adjusts to and develops self to prepare for a variety of assignments, processes, people and priorities as organizational needs dictate.
Capable of communicating in alternative ways to accommodate different listeners.
Supervision Received
Administrative supervision is received from the Software Application Services Manager for CCOM.
Supervision Exercised
None

Experience with relational database concepts
Experience with database design and or data warehouse techniques
Experience developing and supporting complex SQL queries
Experience developing and supporting ETL processes
Experience with data management and cleansing techniques
Demonstrated understanding of Business Intelligence tools (SQL Reporting Services, Tableau, Power BI)
Basic experience providing customer service to technology users of varying abilities
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills; the ability to explain computing concepts to non-technical staff
Proven record of technical curiosity and problem solving skills
Ability to work independently and with multi-disciplinary teams
Strong focus on customer service

Experience with design, development and support of data warehouses

Experiences with SQL Server Analysis Service (SSAS)

Performs research and analysis of complex healthcare claims data, pharmacy data, and lab data regarding network utilization and cost containment information. Evaluates, writes, and presents healthcare utilization and cost containment reports and makes recommendations based on relevant findings.

About HUB

In a rapidly changing world, HUB advises businesses and individuals on how to prepare for the unexpected. As one of the world’s largest insurance brokers, our focus is dedicated to providing our customers with the peace of mind that what matters most will be protected — through unrelenting advocacy and tailored insurance solutions that put our clients in control. Our growing team of professionals across North America represents a broad, deep and one-of-a kind aggregation of entrepreneurs and leaders recognized for their excellence throughout the insurance community.

Why Choose HUB?

Throughout our network of more than 450 HUB offices in North America, we offer a competitive, exciting and friendly work environment that strategically positions our employees for longevity and success. At HUB, we believe in investing in the future of our employees, and provide continuous opportunities for growth and development . Our entrepreneurial culture fosters an environment that empowers our people to make the best decisions for our customers and organization, focusing on expanding the industry knowledge of our insurance professionals to better serve our valued clients. We are committed to providing you with competitive and flexible benefits options that are rooted in your current needs, yet evolves as your needs change over time. Join us in taking the first step toward creating a future that combines a diverse, challenging work environment with financial security and career satisfaction.

are seeking a progressive work environment at a rapidly growing organization

believe in integrity and building success by developing relationships with others

The Lead Web Analytics Engineer will serve as the domain expert in Google Analytics across the university for marketing and technical users. This position will be responsible for administering and implementing all technical and functional capabilities of enterprise Google Analytics 360. This role will provide thought leadership, influence architecture and business processes, and collaborate with marketers, analysts and developers.

The Lead Web Analytics Engineer ensures taxonomies, tags and integrations with other systems are leveraged to support data collection, analytics, insights and targeting. This position creates custom tracking solutions based on a measurement plan, documents solution design and maps analytics variables to defined requirements. This role defines key performance indicators (KPIs) and implements solutions enabling stable architecture for capturing robust data. Creates data layer specifications and Tag Management System rules using Google Tag Manager for best practice implementation of website and media analytics tracking. This position employs, promotes and documents tagging, segmentation and targeting best practices at Indiana University. Manages native and API integrations of web analytics and marketing tag implementations. This role collaborates with other analysts and engineers to combine and interpret data from multiple sources to uncover relevant insights, trends and optimization criteria. This position must be comfortable explaining how web analytics data is collected, processed and reported, and have the ability to document expertise and train others. Evangelizes the usage of enterprise Google Analytics 360 across the university.

Ideal candidates will be comfortable working within a matrix organization with discrete brand teams and shared resource teams.

Knowledge Preferred

Demonstrates significant experience working with analytical models or techniques and the ability to apply such methods to an applicable challenge within the public sector. This background should include:
Statistical analysis and techniques;
Advanced proficiency in at least one programming language, such as R, Python, or SAS;
Visualization techniques and tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or R Shiny;
Advanced analytics techniques such as predictive modelling, simulation, artificial intelligence, and machine learning;
Business and operations analysis using quantitative techniques;
Human capital analytics, financial management, or advanced data visualizations.
Knowledge of defense, national security, financial, healthcare, international development, or state and local government environment.

Skills Preferred

Demonstrates thorough skills and/or proven success in a role participating in projects including the following:
Analyzing large and complex data sets, including a thorough aptitude for conducting quantitative and qualitative analyses;
Selecting and applying the appropriate analytical techniques in order to increase organizational efficiency;
Contributing as a team member: understanding personal and team roles, contributing to a positive working environment by building solid relationships with team members;
Identifying and addressing client needs, building relationships with clients, demonstrating flexibility in prioritizing and completing tasks, communicating potential conflicts to a supervisor;
Communicating effectively to various audiences (including various levels of management and external clients) in a professional environment;
Coaching and collaborating with associates who assist with this work, including providing feedback and guidance on work performance.

Luther Burbank Savings has an exciting opportunity for a Business Systems Analyst I in either our Irvine or Manhattan Beach office. If you are ready to move your career forward, read on.

What we are looking for:
A detail-oriented individual who will work closely with business units to identify and perform analysis and research to implement new products or services, resolves issues, or streamlines processes. Gather requirements, analyze and interpret the results and present solutions. Work with teams to help them execute and deliver these solutions.

What will your day look like? You will:
Translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications.
Perform system research and debug production issues.
Resolve tickets via phone and / or ticketing system in a timely and professional manner. Escalate issues within a predetermined time if the issue is not resolved or no resolution is in sight.
Provide excellent customer service in responding to user questions. Ensure ticket resolutions and problems are properly documented.
Multi-task and prioritize problems based on business needs.
Collaborate with other staff members when presented with a challenge beyond your expertise and learn from their experience.
Assist other team members with on-going projects and complex issues.

Assist business areas in developing reports, automating and scheduling reports.

Develop and maintain documentation, standards and best practices.
Design and execute system changes in line with established change management processes.
Design test scripts, execute and document test results.
Perform system releases and prepare release reports for distribution to end-users.
Oversee and/or participate in the migration of platforms and applications to production.
Provide ongoing training and systems support to business groups as the needs arise.

Experience in a strategic, analytical, and operational role within the financial industry.  
Ability to build strong collaborative working relationships with business partners and department leads; ability to be a self-starter capable of driving business results without significant supervision;
Excel in analytics and problem solving, basic Excel and coding skills;  Skill in designing, improving, and documenting workflows;
Will consider an entry-level person with a college degree (statistics/finance, computer/data science, and/or communications field), or someone with 2 - 5 years experience supporting a Loan Origination System.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

We are experts in originating multifamily and residential real estate loans funded by retail savings deposits. We have an established reputation of high integrity, responsive delivery and competitive pricing.

What’s in it for you?
At Luther Burbank Savings, our mission is to improve your financial future – whether you are a customer, employee or shareholder. You’re worth more here.

Since opening our doors in 1983, we have recorded profits consecutively since our second quarter of operations.  Consequently, we have grown to a $7 billion institution with branches and loan offices in California, Oregon and Washington. Here at LBS, we foster an environment that encourages our team members to grow and develop in their career. Each of our locations is staffed with individuals that are dedicated to providing our clients with superior products and service.
