Cerner Intelligence is a new, innovative organization within Cerner focusing on creating contextual, intelligent experiences by leveraging the power of data to discover new evidence-based insights and workflow interventions that drive client value and help achieve the quadruple aim in healthcare. We seek the best and brightest talent to join the team – individuals who thrive on analytical problem solving and data-driven analysis who are smart, ambitious, and inquisitive.

As a Data Scientist, you will discover and develop mathematical models to improve clinical, financial, or operational outcomes at an individual, facility, or population level using advanced mathematical, computational, and machine learning techniques. A few of the responsibilities include supporting feasibility studies, applying modern data storage techniques, discovering explanatory features in high-dimensionality collections of data, exploring data using scientifically valid techniques to applying a modern software or analytic development lifecycle methodology.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Master’s Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Analytics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Software Engineering, or equivalent relevant work experience.
At least 3 years of data mining, quantitative analysis, and/or statistical modeling including predictive performance and algorithm optimization work experience
Experience working with data mining algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, association rules, clustering, and neural networks
Experience programming in multiple languages (ideally Python and/or R)
Experience with MapReduce programming (Hadoop)
Experience with data warehousing and business intelligence systems, cluster and grid computing
Preferred Qualifications
Ph.D. in Statistics, Computer Science, Analytics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Software Engineering, or equivalent relevant work experience
At least 3 years of machine learning methods and the principals of visually encoding data work experience
Experience with relational databases and SQL; NoSQL databases (hBase, Cassandra, MongoDB, Couch DB, Riak) and unstructured data; Spark; Pig and Avro
Experience with agile software development methodologies
Expectations
Must be currently residing in or willing to relocate to the Malvern, PA metro area
Willing to work additional or irregular hours as needed and allowed by local regulations
Work in accordance with corporate and organizational security policies and procedures, understand personal role in safeguarding corporate and client assets, and take appropriate action to prevent and report any compromises of security within scope of position

Some Cerner positions may be obligated to comply with client-facing requirements and occupational health requests, including but not limited to, an immunization set, an annual flu shot, an annual TB screen, an updated background check, and/or an updated drug screen.

Cerner is a place where people are encouraged to innovate with confidence and focus on what is important – people’s health and the care they receive. We are transforming health care by developing tools and technologies that make it more efficient for care providers and patients to navigate the complexity of our health. From single offices to entire countries, Cerner solutions are licensed at more than 25,000 facilities in over 35 countries.

Job_Description:
THE DIVISON’S STORY
Do numbers tell you stories? Can you relay complex information in bite-sized nuggets to non-researchers? Do you enjoy influencing business decisions by providing fact-based recommendations infused with intuition? Our Research and Insights Team is comprised of wizards who practice the craft of “art and science.” We spend much of our time looking back at performance — and even more time looking forward making actionable recommendations for growing our business. We specialize in content, audience and revenue insights across all platforms. Come check out our pioneering work in predictive modeling, performance marketing and algorithms. Pocket protectors not required.

THE ROLE: Mgr/Sr. Mgr., Portfolio Analytics

The Portfolio Analytics team is responsible for three primary areas:

Assessing global A+E portfolio performance Supporting A+E content sales to drive revenue Performing external analyses and forecasts

A Vice President leads the team of three, which includes a Director and Analyst.
Assess global A+E portfolio performance
Content mix and consumption
Run ideal content mix models that consider ROI, brand, and ratings taking into consideration cost of content, revenue generated by the content and impact on brand equity. Calculate and track ROI of content globally
Collect and normalize global video consumption of A+E content to determine holistic audiences
Competitive ecosystem
Track A+E’s share of the audience, position in the marketplace vs competitive set (e.g., number of top 10 shows in all of cable, in all of television, etc.)
Synthesize the impact on A+E’s traditional C3 delivery from A+E content distribution across all platforms (broadcast and cable syndication, SVOD, AVOD)
Capture and forecast A+E corporate viewership and brand stories with best competitive context across A+E for corporate PR and finance teams
Support the A+E content sales process
Determine demand for content among new distributors (e.g., Pluto)
Support the sales pitch process and collateral
Test content with potential buyers (e.g., Hulu)
Perform external analyses and support forecasting
Forecast and contextualize industry trends such as overall media consumption across platforms, cable subscription trends, and technology and their impact on A+E core business
How people are spending their time
Genre trends that are impacting the business
Modelling
Average consumption by minute among OTT competitors (e.g., Netflix)
Impact of non-traditional distributors on the industry
Strategies
Develop proactive off-net syndication strategy
Help identify potential revenue streams from DTC products and services
Thought leadership
Write and present white papers and positions regarding industry trends

More About What You’ll Do
Build strategic partnerships with research and business colleagues (finance, PR, revenue management, international, etc.)
Navigate multiple data sources, including Nielsen, Inscape, set-top-box data, etc.

What You’ll Learn

As the media industry grapples with fragmentation and disruption, a key facet of Research is to be the driving force in helping their company capture, report on, monetize, and understand audiences. An opportunity lies in Research to work across divisions and departments to create a unified language that ensures that internal clients understand—and take advantage of—complex metrics. The key is giving the necessary context so that decisions can be made. While this sounds disarmingly simple, it is a challenge to get the majority of the company to speak the same language and understand new vernacular. Research is a central force within the broader organization in gaining an objective perspective for a wide array of complex questions. It may sound academic – and certainly there is a portion of the job that requires a love of learning – but the primary attribute that will bring you success is curiosity. For example, you’ll gain a deeper understanding of what motivates someone to tune into a show, buy a product based on placement of an ad, become a fan on social media, or why certain types of programs are successful across regions of this country and abroad. Ultimately, each research candidate gets a better understanding of the rigor that goes into making business decisions by uncovering not boulders, but pebbles along the path to connecting to A+E Networks core asset, its content.

YOUR STORY [+BEHAVIORS] (what you need to have)
Expertise
Sophisticated use of audience data (e.g., Nielsen, comScore, Adobe Analytics, MRI), business data (Kagan, Moffett-Nathanson, SEC reports), primary research
Experience with smart TV/set-top-box data sources
Proficient analysis of content across linear, digital and SVOD/AVOD platforms
Competencies
Strategic thinker with strong presentation skills
Strong leadership and team-building capabilities
Excellent written and verbal skills
Curious and self-motivated work style
Strong work ethic and detail-oriented
Collaborative
Passionate about the business
Education and experience
College BA/BS degree (master’s degree preferred)
3-5 years of progressive experience in programming/revenue research with significant business acumen (preferably 2+ years in cable/syndication)
THAT SOMETHING EXTRA: If you’ve read this far, you’re likely a great fit for us…and maybe you’re fluent in sign language, have studied the circus arts or are currently writing a screenplay. If you have a special skill or backstory that might directly or indirectly help you succeed in this role, we’d love to hear about it in your cover letter. * * * * * A+E Networks is proud to uphold an equal opportunity employment policy and employs personnel without regard to race, creed, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, age, physical or mental ability, veteran status, military obligations, and marital status. This policy also applies to all employees, consultants, and third-party workers. A+E Networks, LLC. is a joint venture of Disney-ABC Television Group and Hearst Corporation. We are proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veterans.

Job_Title: Supply Chain COE Network Design & Optimization Sr. Specialist
Job_Description:
Position Purpose & Summary

The Network Design and Optimization group is a small central team that provides consulting services to businesses and is well-versed in the design and optimization of business networks and processes. Thought leaders in network design and optimization, this team will be part of or lead optimization projects for businesses to find synergies, reduce costs and drive growth. This challenging role requires not only deep expertise in Network Design and Optimization, but the ability to apply the knowledge and teach others, to achieve business transformations. Network Design and Optimization is a critical part of the Supply Chain Planning Function in BOSC and this work is critical to the success the planning space and the businesses. The work of this group will enable Cargill to leverage strong foundational processes to drive efficiencies across the organization.

The incumbent of this position will have key responsibilities in developing and deploying business optimization tools. Responsibilities include project planning, model development, deployment, and long-term support of the optimization tool. Your ability to provide technical expertise in the development of advanced mathematical models for optimization problems in a practical way is critical to success. The incumbent needs to define the technical project plan and approach, and then collaborate with business partners to deploy and sustain the technical solution. The tools you develop will bring insight to our operations and supply chain management to optimize costs on both a strategic and tactical level.

Principal Accountabilities

60% - Develop and deploy optimization models to drive strategic and tactical decisions across Operations, Supply Chain Planning, Transportation and Logistics, and Finance areas with various businesses across the globe.

15% Data and Analytics - management of the data and utilization of information in appropriate areas.

15% - Manage project and coordinate tasks with other project team members in Operations, Supply Chain, and Finance

10% - Communicate model results to a variety of stakeholders including supply chain analysts, operations leaders, and commercial leaders

Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.

Required Qualification

4-year degree from an accredited college/university, preferably in Supply Chain Management, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields

Theoretical and practical knowledge of developing advanced optimization models

Demonstrated experience in developing complex models with commercial optimization software (LLamasoft SCG, JDA Strategist, LogicNet+, CPLEX, Gurobi, AIMMS, etc.)

At least 5 years of business experience in areas relevant to supply chain optimization, such as operations research, supply chain management, logistics with minimum 2 years’ experience in Network Optimization and Design

Strong Data and Analytics capabilities – Well versed in end-to-end data and analytics: mining and extracting, cleansing and formatting, structuring and analyzing, and garnering information and insights. Ability to leverage large amounts of complex data sets to support business decisions by telling the story with data.

Demonstrated experience in creating a collaborative environment to achieve project goals

Curious and self-taught, must be self-motivating and driven to achieve business success

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, including ability to convey complex technical information to multiple audiences

Preferred Qualification

Masters/PhD degree from an accredited college/university, preferably in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Operations Management, Supply Chain Management, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields

Experience in industries with continuous processing (food, chemicals), batch processing and packaging operations

Experience working in an Ag Supply Chain

Experience with visualization software such as Tableau

Previous supply chain consulting experience

Strong database skills

Other Relevant Information To The Position

Ability to Travel 10-25% of time - globally

Job_Title: Program Manager, Voice of the Customer – Nordstrom Product Group
Job_Description:
Job Description

A Day in the Life...
Develop NPG’s capability to leverage the voice of the customer (and store employees) in the design and development of brands and products; engage customers in the design and development process to improve financial outcomes, increase customer satisfaction, and grow customer retention
Assist NPG in building a customer obsessed culture by reducing reliance on one-off analysis of customers and customer needs and operationalizing the regular, systematic use of customer data and insights, enabled by standardized and/or automated tools, reports, and systems
Partner with NPG stakeholders (e.g. designers, product merchandisers, etc) to identify and prioritize user needs for voice of the customer data, insights, and engagement
From user needs, develop relevant business requirements for data, reporting, and other capabilities and identify test-and-learn opportunities to bring these business requirements to life through internal partners (e.g. marketing, digital analytics, advanced analytics, and customer insights teams) and/or vendor direct partnerships (including, potentially, social listening, crowd sourcing, etc)
Partner with Nordstrom cross-functional teams and stay in tune with industry developments to understand new data, technologies and analysis/reporting methods that could increase our ability to leverage voice of the customer in NPG
Use Tableau and other existing data / reporting tools to design and develop reporting that supports Voice of the Customer objectives through the use of available Nordstrom data (customer data, site reviews, social media data, marketing data, etc)
Manage a portfolio of Voice of the Customer projects by leading analysis, financial modeling, business case development, strategic storytelling, and cross-company facilitation for a variety of initiatives
Execute rapidly through small prototypes and proofs-of-concept, develop KPIs and ensure data accessibility to keep a constant pulse on project performance, and package for scalability, as appropriate
Lead project implementation and ensure project success through close coordination with cross-company partners, pan-NPG stakeholders, and external vendors
Learn and proactively implement the Nordstrom Product Group Continuous Improvement principles and beliefs to foster an innovative and efficient culture
You own this if you have...
4+ years of experience leading through influence in complex fast-paced environments with progressively larger responsibility
Bachelor's degree required; MBA or related Master’s degree a plus
Experience in the field of Voice of the Customer or other customer data and insights role
Strong data skills and solid understanding of data management (data architecture, integration, and applications of data science and AI)
Experience with technology implementation projects; able to develop business requirements for technical projects and products
Familiar with agile development / agile project management methods
Knowledge of fashion, retail, and/or fashion design and development a plus
Demonstrated experience as a strategic problem solver and turning insights into actions
Demonstrated ability to engage with business executives, vendors and peers through effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills
Able to make rapid, practical decisions by synthesizing insights and critical thinking, and by creating structure, process, and prioritization to manage through ambiguity
Excellent communicator with a demonstrated ability to present a compelling story across all levels of the organization
Customer obsessed with an eye for continual improvement
Advanced Excel skills (e.g., pivot tables, modeling), Tableau skills (e.g. development of reports), and PowerPoint skills (e.g., story-telling)
We’ve got you covered…

In the modern digital economy, our clients are looking to differentiate their businesses and seize the enormous growth opportunities that digital makes possible. In addition, we are hiring for various roles. If you are passionate and driven about being involved in shaping next generation digital solutions, give us a shout.

Title – Oracle Financial Services Engineer

Location – Charlotte, NC

Travel – No Travel will be needed as all work will be done onsite

Key Technologies – Oracle Financial, SQL Server, and Funds transfer pricing (FTP)

The Project
Current split solutions of Enterprise Risk Appetite (ERA) and Key Indicator Program (KIP) in SHRP Platform are not meeting the needs of Risk Measurement program.
Enterprise Risk Measurement Program is requesting a technology platform to support their program, enforce ERMP Policy and provide efficient and accurate reporting to remediate Consent Order gap 22, milestone 22.3.
The SQL Server databases are used in the daily data processing of data by the line of business; to process data and to compile liquidity results for daily regulatory reports such as but not limited to FR 2052; risk and collateral management and Recovery & Resolution.
Technical resources with SQL Server programming expertise are essential to successfully maintain and enhance the legacy application code in EIT managed platforms and processes, with assured functionality and performance

Skills Required
Implement ORACLE OFSAA COTS product as FTP platform calculation engine - Enterprise Fund Transfer Pricing (FTP)
Implement ORACLE EXDATA product as FTP Platform database repository
Implement the FTP platform data integration capability using INFORMATICA product features
Implement the FTP platform custom capability using open architecture based developments

The Atlanta Journal-Constitution is building a Digital Product & Technology team to support its mission of great journalism in the city of Atlanta. We are focused on building great consumer experiences to keep our community connected and informed. We expect each member of our team to constantly keep our readers top of mind, and to innovate how to deliver the most engaging news and experiences on all platforms.

How We Work

We believe in agile, self-organizing and highly performant teams that have a strong understanding of the business needs and the skill sets to deliver solutions iteratively and incrementally.

All our team members are empowered to collaborate and innovate, bringing new ideas to the table and encouraged to ask tough questions while engaged in data-driven debate.

We all work cooperatively within cross-functional teams and across departments and use our expertise to guide and support our teammates in service of the AJC’s overall mission.

Role Summary

We are seeking Technical Product Managers with focus in each of the following digital product areas: Content, Revenue, Email & Push Marketing, and Social & Search. Each Technical Product Manager is responsible for understanding and improving the overall health of our digital business as it relates to their area of focus. They will be supported by Data Integration Engineers to help them aggregate and reconcile data from multiple sources.

The Technical Product Manager for Revenue is the Product Manager and Technical leader for advertising, subscriptions, account management, and revenue data.

The Technical Product Manager for Content is the Product Manager and Technical leader for content creation, including CMS, video player & video management, special projects, and web-to-print workflow.

The Technical Product Manager for Email & Push Marketing is the Product Manager and Technical leader for email and push marketing platforms, including email templates, native and web push infrastructure, open rates, native app adoption, related integrations & data.

The Technical Product Manager for Social & Search is the Product Manager and Technical leader for social and search platforms, including open graph, AMP standards, and referral traffic from these important platforms.

Successful candidates will have a unique blend of technical, business and marketing savvy. They should have some background in a technical field or as a business analyst or specialist in their area of focus. In their area, they will identify opportunities, and translate those opportunities into product requirements or into best practices to be shared with their colleagues in the newsroom, sales, marketing, and/or consumer revenue teams.

Responsibilities

Take ownership of KPIs and evangelize for winning strategies to move the needle on performance within your area of focus

Work with other product management teams et al. to ensure alignment and rapid consumption of services released

Understand and analyze market offerings and competitor capabilities

Ensure product marketing, marketing & channel and strategic partners have all relevant product information to launch products and updates successfully

Act as the go to person for all product, roadmap, and data information needs related to your area of focus

Engage with external parties (vendors, business partners) from the product and technology perspective.

Translate market requirements into technical requirements for engineering teams

Collaborate with members of the product delivery team to drive product strategy, design, innovation and overall product direction.

Understand the product vision and evaluate various approaches to implement effective solutions.

Drive innovation by translating thoughts and ideas into tangible product requirements in the form of features, epics and user stories.

Actively participates in iteration planning, including the coordination of dependencies

Review/demonstrate data, analysis, or general functionality with external stakeholders and customers.

Consistently manage stakeholder expectations.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Business, Sales or Marketing, or equivalent work experience

4+ years of experience as a Specialist in your area of focus, or as a Developer, Product Owner, Business Analyst, Product Manager, or in a field related to product delivery, or any combination thereof.

You’re comfortable working with and analyzing data and drawing insights to inform and educate your teammates in service of your shared overall mission.

Welcomes solving problems with a positive attitude, teamwork and innovation.

An effective and persuasive communicator (written, verbal, presentation, e-mail, etc.), who is skilled at leading meetings and making presentations within all areas of the company.

Highly collaborative and comfortable with both high-level planning and tactical execution.

Experience gathering and writing formal business/functional/technical requirements, documentation, creating mock-ups, etc. including a solid understanding of financial metrics and analytics.

Unique blend of business and technical savvy skills, a big picture vision and the drive to make that vision a reality.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with lots of moving parts where information, resources, and priorities can change quickly and where information must be readily digested and decisions made expeditiously.

Strong customer and user intuition.

You pay attention to details and take great pride in your work.

You proactively identify project, people and organizational problems and provide well-thought-out solutions to them.

The Senior Content Marketing Specialist - SEO helps plan and create Workiva marketing materials based on search trends. As the digital expert of the content marketing team, you can identify keyword and subject matter opportunities, and turn them into compelling, click-worthy content that raises brand awareness and drives lead generation. This position is also responsible for defining requirements and recommending website changes that increase quality traffic, maximize site performance, improve search result listings, and ultimately drive revenue for the business.

What You’ll Do

Develop and Support the Content Marketing Strategy
Provide SEO insights and perspectives to help create marketing and thought leadership content, including: blogs, white papers, infographics, e-books, product brochures and videos, web content, and more
Play a primary role in our SEO initiatives, including site audits, keyword research, content and technical recommendations, reporting, analysis, forecasts, and cross-team operational guidance
Perform keyword research in coordination with business objectives to optimize existing content and uncover new opportunities
Ensure brand consistency and flawless execution across all tactics
Implement local/regional SEO best practices throughout content creation process
Review monthly report data on traffic and rankings, analyzes the results, document observations, and makes recommendations for adjustments in strategy
Research and evaluate keywords, market behavior, trends, and competitors to identify opportunities to maximize marketing effectiveness
Optimize Digital Content Performance
Creates and reviews technical audits; prioritizes technical issues and makes recommendations for the most effective solutions
Identifies areas for on-site improvements in site structure, internal linking, and information architecture
Ensures all content is optimized for search and user experience across all channels
Designs and conducts rigorous A/B experiments on the effectiveness and efficiency of different SEO actions that will inform long-term strategy
Sets and maintains content governance standards and tagging/taxonomy structures for web content, tracking programs, and other marketing content hosted in our marketing asset portal
Manages Key Processes and Stakeholders
Manages multiple initiatives simultaneously and ensures the successful completion of each under tight deadlines
Supports the overarching integration of the marketing activities throughout the company by ensuring that all affected departments and/or offices are kept in the communication loop on project status
Develops ROI and performance measurements for marketing tactics

What You’ll Need
B.A./B.S. degree in marketing, advertising or communications, or equivalent combination of education and experience
M.B.A. preferred
5+ years experience
Experience with marketing for B2B audiences, SaaS, or technical products, and complex audience segmentation
Multiple examples of developing clear, successful communications on complex topics (samples or portfolio required)
Demonstrated ability to analyze data and a track record of influencing business results through SEO strategy
Excellent writing, editing, and business communication skills
Motivated to take initiative and bring new ideas for consideration
Accurate, meticulous, with high attention to detail
Solid understanding of the technical aspects of SEO, such as how semantic markup and canonicalization of content affect performance
Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics, including the ability to effectively create and use Advanced Segments and Custom Reports, and diagnose data issues
Working knowledge of SEO tools, such as Moz, Screaming Frog, SpyFu, and Google Search Console
Experience with CMS platforms - Drupal is a plus
Experience working with back-end SEO elements such as .htaccess, robots.txt, metadata, and site speed optimization to optimize website performance.
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
Ability to travel up to 10%

Where You’ll Work

We firmly believe our people are our greatest asset, and our unique culture gives employees the opportunity to not only make a difference, but BE the difference. Employees at Workiva develop and provide cutting-edge solutions and services to the business market. We hire smart, talented people with a wide range of skills who are hungry to tackle some of today’s most challenging problems. Workiva offers a creative culture and open-minded leadership. We want you to thrive, which is why we provide you with perks like:
Fantastic Benefits: With coverage starting day one, choose from competitive health, dental, and vision plans on the largest physician networks available.
Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Purchase company stock at a 15% discounted rate.
Casual Dress: Workiva has a casual work environment, most people wear jeans to the office.
Work-life Balance: Start with 40 hours of paid time off on your first day, accruing up to 120 in your first year and increases based on years of service. Many departments allow team members to work remotely on an as needed basis.
Health & Wellness: Need a break? Hit the relaxation room, or take a bike ride.
Extras: Free healthy snacks and drinks, Friday social hours with stocked fridges, awesome team outings, and even four dog-friendly offices (Ames, Bozeman, Missoula and New York City).
Learn more on the Workiva LinkedIn page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/workiva/life

The IT Solutions Delivery Program Manager reports to the team’s Director and maintains both managerial and delivery responsibilities. The Program Manager directs a team of Project Managers and Business Analysts, and is responsible for capacity planning and work assignments, as it relates to projects and programs within their assigned programs and portfolio. The Program Manager also directs initiatives characterized as enterprise-wide, resource-intensive and critical to the business. Beyond staff administration and program management, this individual develops and practices a range of capabilities to meet the standard of world class Program Delivery and Planning including, but not limited to: analytics/management intelligence, demand management, internal/external partner management, market & competitive intelligence, best practice research, business partner satisfaction/experience, communications, quality, change management and continuous improvement.

Key Areas of Responsibility

Direct resources to plan, build, and run technology-based solutions consistent with CDW’s implementation methodology.
Leverage administrative tools to assign work and produce reports such as project dashboards, capacity plans, heat maps and resource utilization.
Manage large, complex programs which are highly visible and critical to the business.
Budget and manage resources – both human and financial – to run programs, projects and the team within stated targets.
Use enterprise and business unit direction and goals to drive technology innovation
Serve as a conduit with business partners, Finance & Planning, and IT to effectively govern projects from intake through implementation to ROI measurement.
Manage key strategic internal relationships with business stakeholders and senior leadership, and interact at a high level with decision-makers
Generate commercially relevant analytics and management intelligence (MI) for business partners where the focus is value, business enablement, and the optimization of IT resources.
Practice Demand Management on a portfolio and program level, ensuring the effective pairing and brokering of supply (e.g., competencies, bandwidth) and demand (project intake).
Communicate and execute change management activities at all levels of the organization
Oversee internal and external providers of application, hardware, and/or integration services, including relationship management and measurement, statement-of-work or license administration, and work product review/acceptance.
Has a strong understanding of where our industry is trending from a tools and overall IT standpoint, and has the ability to produce market and competitive intelligence position papers on subject matter relevant to CDW strategy as directly requested by business partners and/or IT leadership.
Conduct meaningful talent management practices with peers and project/program resources assigned to efforts within assigned portfolio, including timely and honest performance feedback, assessment of potential, and career planning.
Mentor and coach direct report coworkers and ensure their professional development through continuing education and participation in domain, trade, or industry affiliations/associations.
Instill a learning culture among coworkers through knowledge sharing activities such as internal/external guest speakers, lunch and learns, training debriefs, and general team collaboration and knowledge sharing on experiences.
Maintain a working knowledge of best practices.
Conduct business partner satisfaction/experience evaluations on a frequent basis and apply feedback and insight to the Program Delivery and Strategy Team.
Assemble and deliver ongoing business partner and intra-departmental communications, including memos, newsletters, and/or presentations.
Become familiar with and sponsor quality and continuous improvement initiatives where process excellence is the goal by means of disciplines such as Six Sigma, LEAN and ISO.
Support the Senior Director of Program Delivery and Strategy in his efforts to build a world class function

An IT Audit Associate is responsible for completing tasks assigned by supervisory personnel. As a core member of the audit team, the IT Audit Associate develops an understanding of basic business processes and builds technical skills in general risk areas. The IT Audit Associate spends a majority of time conducting interviews, compiling and analyzing data, and documenting findings. Through interaction with audit customers and audit team personnel, the IT Audit Associate develops professional relationships that contribute to exceptional client service. The successful IT Audit Associate learns effective time and task management, takes ownership of assignments and accepts responsibility for team results.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: A list of roles and responsibilities for an IT Audit Associate are included below. Other duties and special projects may be assigned.
Perform operational, financial, compliance, or information technology (such as infrastructure, data bases, operating systems, applications) audits.
Review and evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls.
Review and evaluate compliance with corporate policies, procedures, and plans.
Prepare work papers to adequately document audit work performed and to support conclusions reached.
Apply control concepts and assess the exposures resulting from ineffective or missing control practices.
Identify, and clearly define, audit issues and root causes, recommend improved internal controls and business processes and ensure that corrective action plans are developed and implemented.
Apply analytical skills and knowledge of current auditing developments and standards to formulate appropriate solutions to problems.
Assist IT Senior Auditors and IT Audit Managers in execution of audit assignments and review activities.
Support external auditors as assigned.
Perform special projects and analyses of company operations as requested by management.
Maintain or acquire sufficient knowledge of Information Technology (IT) and Information Security (IS)auditing, banking regulations, or other fields as required to complete audit assignments.
Performs all other job related functions as assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: None

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS/COMPETENCIES: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Professional Competence and Industry Knowledge
Seeks to understand expectations of them on the project and takes steps to deliver on expectations.
Demonstrates a strong work ethic and takes initiative in solving problems and presenting solutions.
Seeks additional work when assigned work is complete.
Understands basic business processes and related risks, as well as other technical areas.
Comprehends the reasons for the tasks to be performed.
Learns IAD policies and methodologies.
Takes responsibility for the development of own skills.
Sets annual personal and professional goals and measures progress toward them.
Builds and maintains a habit of continuous learning.
Learns effective time management.
Analyzes specific feedback on performance and acts upon it.
Takes responsibility for personal training by attendance and active participation in training meetings.
Works toward obtaining appropriate professional or technical certifications.

Customer Focus
Understands engagement protocol and expectations, and interacts appropriately with audit customer personnel.
Responds to customer requests in a timely manner.
Audit customer values contributions to engagement.
Develops written communication skills to ensure audience understanding.
Uses listening skills to build rapport and good working relationships with audit customers.

Teamwork and Leadership
Cooperates with and values the efforts of other team members.
Models appropriate behavior to contribute to an effective team environment.
Interacts with others in a manner demonstrating knowledge of personnel policies and appropriate professional demeanor.
Facilitates teamwork by contributing to team effort, sharing responsibility for team results, and exhibiting a positive attitude.
Understands expectations on the engagement team.
Sets individual goals and prioritizes workload.

Drives for Quality and Results
Develops good basis business skills and appropriate industry knowledge.
Seeks opportunities to be creative and innovative.
Learns about the audit customer's business processes.
Understands how to identify and evaluate control effectiveness.
Develops basic interviewing techniques that enable primary risk identification.
Utilizes 95% of time on assurance and advisory engagements.


Minimum Education, Experience, And Certifications
BS/BA degree in Accounting, Business Administration, IS/IT, or related field.
0-3 years related experience.
In process of obtaining CIA, CPA, or CISA or other relevant certification required.
Working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Visio and PowerPoint; Cloud Computing, Data Analytics, TeamMate, ACL & MS Access a plus.

We are building a culture that inspires people to drive change, stand up to challenges, and embody the daring spirit to outperform yesterday’s best. We are partnering in possibilities to unlock our greatest potential, together.

As our Specialist - Data Scientist, one is held accountable to, however not limited to, the following job functions:
Solve complex business problems through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining, and visualization techniques and contribute to the build and development of Revantage’s data infrastructure to provide insights, reporting, and analysis for stakeholder decision-making.
Translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements to support executive decisions and workflows.
Proactively mine data to identify trends and patterns and generate insights at the portfolio company level and across asset classes.
Research and implement cutting-edge techniques and tools in machine learning/deep learning/artificial intelligence to make data analysis more efficient and meaningful
Provide input on new use cases, capabilities, and initiatives to inform the Data and Analytics strategic roadmap development and execution

Enhance information visualization through development of dashboards and user interfaces
Establish best practices for data-based experimentations across Technology teams

5+ years of experience using data visualization and business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, Business Objects, Cognos)
Deep proficiency in R, Python, or related languages
Deep proficiency in SQL and ability to optimize queries
Experience with various types of data repositories (e.g., data warehouses, data lakes, data marts), metadata management, dimensional modeling, and ETL / integration
Experience analyzing real estate portfolio assets and/or financial statements

Who We Are.

American National is a successful and stable corporation guided by five core values: Financial Strength, Integrity, Respect, Service and Teamwork. We are among America’s Most Trustworthy Financial Companies according to Forbes. We’ve spent the last 110+ years earning this reputation and we work each day to expand this legacy. The growth, innovation and success of American National are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering exceptional service to our clients. Success begins and ends with our people. Their loyalty and dedication to American National is why we’re successful.

If you share our values and can contribute to our mission of providing the highest quality service to our clients, we want to hear from you!

Why join us?

We know that our employees’ lives encompass much more than the time they spend at work. To help them maintain a healthy work/life balance, we’ve compiled a generous benefits package, including: medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life insurance, flexible spending account, matching 401(k), paid time off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement and referral bonuses.

We’ve also incorporated unique benefits like our volunteer program where employees are provided PTO for giving their time to a non-profit of their choice. Healthy employees are productive employees so we also have a comprehensive wellness program that includes onsite fitness centers and classes or discounted gym memberships, free health screenings, free flu shots, and more.

Data Scientist

Data Scientist utilizes their analytical, statistical and programming skills to collect, analyze and interpret large datasets and develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges. This position requires the individual to be very analytical, methodical and have a passion to work with large amounts of data.

Essential Functions
Collaborate across the business to understand IT and business constraints.
Understand new data sources and process pipelines, and catalog/document them.
Acquire access to various databases, and other source systems such as SQL or graph databases, help to create data pipelines for more efficient and repeatable data science projects.
Apply statistical analysis and visualization techniques to various data, such as hierarchical clustering, T-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE), principal components analysis (PCA).
Generate hypotheses about the underlying mechanics of the business process. Test hypotheses using various quantitative methods.
Display drive and curiosity to understand the business process to its core.
Network with domain experts to better understand the business mechanics that generated the data.
Apply various ML (machine learning) and advanced analytics techniques to perform classification or prediction tasks, integrate domain knowledge into the ML solution; for example, from an understanding of financial risk, customer journey, quality prediction, sales, marketing.
Test ML models, such as cross-validation, A/B testing, bias and fairness.
Collaborate with ML operations (MLOps), data engineers, and IT to evaluate and implement ML deployment options.
Assist with integrating model performance management tools into the current business infrastructure. Assist with implementing champion/challenger test (A/B tests) on production systems.
Continuously monitor execution and health of production ML models.


Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math or related field.
0-2 years’ experience as a Data Scientist in a reputed organization.
Advanced Statistical Analysis skills. Should be familiar with SPSS or SAS or Emblem tools.

Job Description

Passionate about the development and execution of online and offline marketing strategies? Do you revel at the thought of being a core member of the digital team that looks to you for input on shaping the go-to-market success of a new and innovative business platform? If so, this might be the next step in your career.

How will you make an impact?

You will develop digital strategies in collaboration with business leaders to attract and retain customers within Aon’s Affinity businesses. As a key member of the digital customer experience team, you will help build and manage websites that will promote the brand, introduce our products, generate leads, and, ultimately, produce sales and revenue in this growing segment of our business.

What will your day look like?
Apply your experience in reviewing and fine-tuning marketing, customer acquisition, nurturing and retention strategies in the digital space
Collaborate with the Marketing Analytics team as you apply your web analytics skills to fine-tune and improve the performance of the Affinity websites
Ensure we produce user-centric designs to maintain clear, logical and concise information that invites an attractive ROI using results and reports developed by the Analytics team and interpretation of site traffic, email campaigns, activities, results, and usability to improve visitor experience
Optimize online marketing activities based on metrics of testing, such as A/B and multi-variate test and product strategy along with third-party software to positively impact lead generation and conversions
Function as a project manager as you collaborate with IT to create new website templates, launches/relaunches, business requirements, site mapping, navigation structure, imagery, copy direction, testing and tracking – all the good stuff that differentiates us from the competition
Wear your editing hat as you ensure content is optimized for SEO, grammatically correct, customer-oriented, compliant with appropriate laws and insurance regulations (e.g. GLBA, HIPAA, CAN-Spam) and consistent with certifications (e.g. Webtrust), and aligned with branding initiatives for our programs or clients
Effectively communicate and collaborate vision and opinions with diverse teams and communicate complex technical concepts in an approachable way

What attributes would help you be successful in this role?
Deep knowledge of developing marketing strategies and maintaining compliance with internet usability standards
Track record of creating and editing CSS, HTML and JavaScript for website design
Experience with responsive design websites for optimal mobile experiences
Proven skills in managing and improving SEO and SEM strategies and tactics for both organic and paid search programs
A passion for the digital customer experience, where you strive in seeing the best possible approach
A keen ability to effectively and efficiently manage time and self-direct on projects as well as delivering on operation requests and tasks across various leadership levels and stakeholders
Project management skills that keep projects on task

A Few Additional Skills That Would Be Helpful
Experience in Kentico content management system
Experience with user testing

Required Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent years of industry experience
5+ years of experience in a marketing strategy and execution role
Experience conducting A/B tests for campaigns and driving customer insights a major plus
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies

We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon

Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer.

Job_Title: Economic Services Management & Policy - Data Analyst
Job_Description:
What You'll Be Doing
The Economic Services Data Analyst is part of the Social Services Data Management team. This role develops data management tools and data retrieving mechanisms for all Social Services programs in the Division: Medicaid, Food and Nutrition Services, Employment Services, Work First, Child Care Subsidy, Child Support, Adult Protective Services, Adult Guardianship, and Adult Care monitoring.

Essential Functions
Produces reports for each program area to track the program's workload and performance measures. Tracking these objectives involves assisting with the management of data mining and validation efforts, maintaining documentation, and creating custom queries from the state, county, and other available data systems
Provides accurate information to Program Managers and Supervisors to assist in the management of daily work, staffing assignments, and staff performance
Produces reports which track the performance of each program on identified measures such as timeliness and quality at the program, supervisor and case manager level
Identifies trends in demand for service, staffing, and achievement of performance measures
Other Duties Include
Assisting Program Managers with creating ad-hoc reports needed for management purposes
Manages program level dashboards to track daily and monthly workload outputs which are used to populate the Division dashboard
Acts as a resource to Program Managers and Supervisors for data related requests and consultation.
NOTE: Wake County Human Services employees are required to be in their current role for a minimum of one (1) year to be eligible to apply for another Human Services position. Upon acceptance of employment you acknowledge that (i) you will rescind your application for any other positions within Wake County Human Services, (ii) after accepting your position with Wake County Human Services you must remain in your role for one (1) year before you are eligible to apply for another position within Wake County Human Services, (iii) if you work in the Health Clinics and Public Health Division, influenza immunization is a condition of initial and continued employment, subject to compliance with federal law, (iv) actively supports and participates in department emergency preparedness and response activities, which may include temporary changes in responsibilities and working hours.

About Our Team

Wake County Human Services (WCHS) is a consolidated agency that provides an array of public health and social services that include public health and healthcare clinics, child welfare and economic services, housing and transportation, and other related services. Our mission: In partnership with the community, we will facilitate full access to high quality and effective health and human services for Wake County residents. In addition to our many standard programs, WCHS is engaged in a number of special initiatives that impact services and programs throughout our entire agency and communities. Whether legislated down from the changing regulations on the Federal or State level or bubbling up from the entrepreneurial spirit of our staff, you can always look forward to WCHS implementing new and exciting enhancements to our services and programs.
Socials Services Data Management is responsible for performance tracking and measurement of all programs in the Division. This involves developing business analytic tools utilizing the latest technology and software in data analytics, collaborating with our internal clients to aid in the management of the various program areas, and preparing and presenting outcomes to management in a variety of formats.

The Basics (Required Education And Experience)
Bachelor's degree in Business or Public Administration or related field.
Two years of experience in fiscal, policy, and management
Equivalent education and experience combination accepted
Beyond The Basics (Preferred Education And Experience)
Data Management experience working with large data sets
State or County Department of Health and Human Services work experience or interactions; with an understanding of processes and accountability needed
Demonstrated experience creating data management tools and end user training
NC FAST, Client Services Data Warehouse, OnBase, and other databases used in Economic Services

AEG Worldwide is the world’s leading sports and live entertainment company with operations in the following business segments:
AEG Facilities, which with its affiliates owns, manages or consults with more than 120 venues
AEG Presents, which is one of the largest live music companies in the world dedicated to live contemporary music performances, including producing and promoting global and regional concert tours, music events and world-renowned festivals
AEG Sports, which is the world’s largest operator of sports franchises and high-profile sporting events
AEG Global Partnerships, which supports each of AEG’s divisions through worldwide sales and servicing of sponsorships including naming rights, premium seating and other strategic partnerships
AEG Real Estate, which develops major sports and entertainment districts worldwide

With offices on five continents, the company uses its global network of venues, portfolio of powerful sports and music brands, ticketing and content distribution platforms and its integrated entertainment districts to deliver the most creative and innovative live sports and entertainment experiences that inspire athletes, teams, artists and fans.

Position Summary

The AEG Presents Strategy Group partners with the executive team and leaders across the company, to address critical challenges and develop and execute strategies that drive business improvement. The Data Analyst works with the Chief Strategy Officer, two strategy directors, and a data scientist, across all strategic and operational areas of the AEG Presents business, with a focus on quantitative/statistical modeling and business performance analysis.

Essential Functions
Develops predictive and statistical models to analyze and improve business performance.
Lead implementation of data models into production, working collaboratively with digital team and business stakeholders to define requirements and develop underlying data structures.
Design and execute analysis and reporting of business performance, using operational, transactional, and financial data.


Required Qualifications
A minimum education level of: BA/BS Degree (4-year)
2+ years experience in a data analysis role or higher education program in statistics/data analytics
Strong quantitative analytical skills, with the ability to derive insights from large data sets, exceptional attention to detail, and a desire to creatively solve challenging problems.
Solid written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present findings from technical analysis to non-technical audiences
General business acumen, with the ability to analyze the live events industry and recommend business improvements
Ability to learn quickly and manage projects independently
Proficiency in data science programming languages (Python and/or R)
Proficiency in SQL, experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI)


Preferred Qualifications
Music or other entertainment experience a plus, as well as a passion for music and knowledge of artists and industry trends
Familiarity with basic financial statements (profit and loss, balance sheet)

In building this environment, we strive to attract students, faculty and staff from a variety of cultures, backgrounds and life experiences. Carnegie

UNF is a Carnegie Community Engaged Institution. This designation celebrates the University's collaboration with community partners from the local to the global level. It reflects UNF's mission to contribute to the public good and prepare educated, engaged citizens.

Faculty Initiatives

The University of North Florida promotes the quality and effectiveness of education and strives to maintain the highest standards of academic excellence in all phases of instruction, research/scholarship/creative activity, and service.

General / Primary Purpose

The Data Scientist, under the direction of an Assistant Vice President or above, designs, develops, and executes data analytics projects and initiatives, and delivers findings and recommendations therefrom. The Data Scientist also initiates policies and procedures to ensure effective application and coordination of data analytics initiatives to support the mission of the university.

Essential Duties

Job Function

Leverages large volumes of data from multiple university sources into advanced custom predictive and prescriptive models that assess, inform, guide, measure, and monitor the University's strategic and operational initiatives.
Employs appropriate descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive methods such as statistical modeling, data mining, machine learning, and data visualization to analyze, predict, understand, and improve a variety of institutional outcomes, including but not necessarily limited to academic enrollment, engagement, retention, graduation, and key institutional performance metrics.
Works with leadership in Strategic Analytics to derive specific insights and recommendations from analytics modeling that can improve institutional decision-making, and to identify opportunities for leveraging University data and data analytics to drive improvement.
Prepares analytics findings for university constituents outside of Strategic Analytics in a manner that is understandable by personnel who do not have analytics expertise.
Develops processes and tools to evaluate analytics model performance.
Identifies needs for additional data and for additional data capturing and analytics infrastructure that can improve organizational efficiency and effectiveness.
Assists in the acquisition and integration of organizational data and in the development of the university's enterprise data warehouse.
Provides input to Institutional Research, Assessment, and Information Technology Services as those units improve the delivery of analytics findings to the university community.
Fully documents the approaches and techniques used in each analytics project, and develops, stores, and deploys data sets, programming code, spreadsheets, and other analytics derivative works, such that follow-on effort and organizational learning are facilitated.
Writes and presents regular status reports, summaries, and research briefs regarding analytics projects and findings.
Guides data analytics specialist(s) and other affiliated staff on appropriate techniques for analyzing data.
Maintains an understanding of new and leading data analytics methods, practices, trends, implementations, and developments that could improve University performance.
Maintains compliance with institutional policies and standards on data privacy and security.
Maintains a high level of confidentiality in managing data.
Participates and engages in efforts to further develop and implement the goals of Strategic Analytics, and to building an institutional culture of data-driven decision-making.
Performs work thoroughly and with close attention to detail.
Performs special projects and other miscellaneous duties as assigned.
During declared campus emergencies, this position may be required to perform specific job related duties at a designated off campus location or place of residence.

Percentage Of Time
100

Posting Detail Information

Marginal Functions

N/A

Required Qualifications

A Master's degree from a regionally accredited college or university in a directly related area of specialization and four years of experience directly related to the job functions; or a Bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited college or university in a directly related area of specialization and six years of experience directly related to the job functions.

Departmental Requirements

Faculty Position Required Qualifications

Preference shown to applicants who meet the required qualifications and also possess the following:
Master's degree in data analytics, data science, business analytics, operations research, statistics, or a related quantitative research field from a regionally accredited college or university, and at least two years of full-time work experience directly relevant to advanced data analytics, or
Bachelor's degree in data analytics, data science, business analytics, operations research, statistics, or a related quantitative research field from a regionally accredited college or university, and at least five years of full-time work experience directly relevant to advanced data analytics.
Demonstrated mastery of SAS , R, SPSS , and/or other relevant predictive and prescriptive modeling software.
Knowledge of advanced statistical and data mining techniques (e.g., multiple regression, discriminant analysis, logistic regression, Tobit) and their proper usage, and experience with applications.
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (e.g., clustering, decision trees, random forests, neural networks) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
An advanced understanding of quantitative research and mixed methods approaches as well as an ability to manage multiple projects.
Strong work ethos with high personal and professional ethical standards.
High level of energy, flexibility, initiative, and creativity.
Excellent interpersonal skills and written/oral communication skills.
Ability to self-start and self-learn.
Proficiency in Windows and Microsoft Office computer systems.

Job_Description:
Description About Us

As a not-for-profit organization, Partners HealthCare is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. Founded by Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital, Partners HealthCare supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. Several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of Harvard Medical School, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.

We’re focused on a people-first culture for our system’s patients and our professional family. That’s why we provide our employees with more ways to achieve their potential. Partners HealthCare is committed to aligning our employees’ personal aspirations with projects that match their capabilities and creating a culture that empowers our managers to become trusted mentors. We support each member of our team to own their personal development—and we recognize success at every step.

Our employees use the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.

General Overview

Working for the Partners HealthCare at Home (PHH) Finance Operations Manager, the Financial Analyst will be responsible for performing financial and operational analysis, in support of the annual operating and capital budget process and throughout the year as needed by leadership. The duties will include monthly reporting such as for the monthly financial close process, as well as ad hoc requests to provide decision support to clinical and business leadership throughout the organization.

Principal Duties And Responsibilities
Assist in the preparation of the annual Operating and Capital budgets process (including system design/maintenance, training, and submission review).
Assist in the preparation of monthly analytics and financial reporting for PHH leadership as well as other audiences.
Compile, analyze and report on volume/statistical, FTE/Salary performance against budget including monthly close summary package.
Track and report on key metrics that evaluate business performance.
Coordinate and support department’s and temp agencies interface with accounts payable.
Prepare ad hoc analysis/presentation packages for management review and perform additional projects as required. Provide detail in the analysis to identify relevant trends in the business.
Support business-planning efforts through analytics and research.
Participate in team-based projects for various initiatives as needed. Such projects can range from system enhancements and implementations to acting as Finance Operations liaison as deemed appropriate by the Manager or Director.
Uphold and demonstrate high Service Excellence standards in all aspects of the position at all times.
Use/s the Partners HealthCare values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. These values guide how we get our work done: Patients, Affordability, Accountability & Service Commitment, Decisiveness, Innovation & Thoughtful Risk; and how we treat each other: Diversity & Inclusion, Integrity & Respect, Learning, Continuous Improvement & Personal Growth, Teamwork & Collaboration.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

EEO Statement

Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Economics

Experience: Some experience in health care finance/accounting or related experience preferred

Skills/Abilities/Competencies
Strong analytical skills (financial or accounting skills a plus)
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively as a member of a team.
Organized with a consistent ability to meet deadlines
Detail oriented
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and pivot tables
Microsoft Access, Tableau, Hyperion, or data ware house experience a plus
Ability to maintain utmost confidentiality
Seeks constructive feedback

Job_Title: Social Media Insights & Analytics Apprenticeship, Methods+Mastery (a FleishmanHillard company) (Fall 2019), Washington, D.C.
Job_Description:
Position Overview And Responsibilities

Methods+Mastery, a FleishmanHillard company, has an immediate opening for an energetic, self-starting Social Insights & Analytics Apprentice to join our team for Fall 2019. Our new analytics Apprentice will have the opportunity to contribute to a variety of global social media campaigns, and analyze and synthesize data to provide our team with actionable insights and strategic recommendations for our clients.

Methods+Mastery is an entrepreneurial, collaborative environment that values talented, creative people who like to work with others to create cutting-edge programs for our clients.

We believe a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

Responsibilities
Play an active role in daily social media listening for a variety of national and global clients.
Assist in developing social insights from primary and secondary market research, business analysis and competitive data.
Work closely under senior analysts’ guidance to recommend social and digital strategies and ensure implementation.
Conduct analysis through the use of social listening tools, audience intelligence tools and owned analytics tools.
Assist in developing client KPI’s.
Stay current with the latest social measurement trends, as well as relevant industry trends.
Qualifications
Candidates must be a graduate and display an eagerness to expand their skills in social-focused communications, marketing, advertising and project management and be available to work full time Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Specifically, the candidate should also have some experience in the following areas:
1 year of experience gained in social media, planning, communications and/or analytics, with specific experience executing social media listening programs, and delivering reports that inform internal and client teams.
Experience utilizing social media monitoring tools such as: Crimson Hexagon, Quintly, SocialRank, Tracx, Spredfast, Simmons, etc.
Strong analytic skills: Must be willing to learn how to analyze and interpret social-related data from standard software packages and client databases.
Ability to multi-task and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Excellent research, writing and organization skills
Excellent communications and critical-thinking skills
Experience using web analytics packages such as Google Analytics, Omniture, and WebTrends.
Experience utilizing tools such as Excel, Tableu, Power Pivot, Quantivo
Ability to work easily in both large team environments or independently
A positive attitude and willingness to learn from our industry-leading team of counselors

About Methods+Mastery

Methods+Mastery is committed to equal employment opportunity and affirmative action. Methods+Mastery does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Methods+Mastery does business.

About The FleishmanHillard D.C. Office

FleishmanHillard’s Washington, D.C., office is one of the most prominent public relations offices in the D.C. metro area. With eight practice areas covering health communications & behavior change, social & innovation, creative, public affairs, crisis, brand & corporate reputation, media relations, and tech, the D.C. office touches a unique portfolio of clients across a wide variety of sectors. Employees in the D.C. office come from a variety of backgrounds in public relations and government policy to provide the highest-quality counsel for our clients.

About FleishmanHillard

FleishmanHillard specializes in public relations, reputation management, public affairs, brand marketing, digital strategy, social engagement and content strategy. We have been named PRWeek’s Global Agency of the Year and Best Places to Work; a “Standout Agency” on Advertising Age’s A-List; NAFE’s “Top 50 Companies for Executive Women” for six years running; and among our firm’s award-winning work we’ve taken home 5 Lions in the past two years at the Cannes International Festival of Creativity. We’re also more motivated by what we can give than what we receive, and in our 70th year we’ve initiated a worldwide service commitment to support social inclusion in the communities in which we work and live. Visit us at www.fleishmanhillard.com .

FleishmanHillard is committed to equal employment opportunity and affirmative action. FleishmanHillard does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where FleishmanHillard does business. Our policy is to employ, advance, and reasonably accommodate all qualified employees and applicants. Any person who feels that he or she has been subjected to discrimination should immediately report the matter to Talent Development or to a supervisor.

Any reported incident will be investigated. Retaliation against an employee or applicant who makes a good-faith claim of discrimination is prohibited. Employees and applicants may bring good-faith complaints, ask questions, and raise concerns without fear of reprisal or retaliation.

About Omnicom Public Relations Group

Omnicom Public Relations Group is a global collective of three of the top global public relations agencies worldwide and eight specialist agencies in public affairs, marketing to women, fashion, global health strategy and corporate social responsibility. It encompasses more than 6,000 public relations professionals in more than 330 offices worldwide who provide their expertise to companies, government agencies, NGOs and nonprofits across a wide range of industries. Omnicom Public Relations Group delivers for clients through a relentless focus on talent, continuous pursuit of innovation and a culture steeped in collaboration. Omnicom Public Relations Group is part of the DAS Group of Companies, a division of Omnicom Group Inc. that includes more than 200 companies in a wide range of marketing disciplines including advertising, public relations, healthcare, customer relationship management, events, promotional marketing, branding and research.

Position Specific Description
We are seeking a Financial Analyst I to join our Power Delivery Team at Florida Power & Light Company (FP&L) to develop and maintain key metrics as it relates to productivity and financial analysis and to communicate recommendations and influence decisions for the Business Unit. Power Delivery is responsible for the safe, reliable delivery of power for FP&L. Within Power Delivery, Business Services is responsible for financial forecasting, analysis and compliance for Power Delivery's ~$2.5 B annual budget. Business Services works across the different departments within Power Delivery to ensure that the business unit meets or exceeds its financial commitments and provides advisory services to the organization.

Candidates Applying For This Position Should Possess The Following
Strong analytical and collaboration skills - including but not limited to expertise in Excel, PowerPivot, PowerBI, SQL and SharePoint;
Analytical Problem Solving and Innovative thinking;
Financial and data analytics experience;
Strong communication skills - interpersonal as well as the ability to create and deliver presentations;
Ability to work on matrixed team in a fast paced environment;
Ability to operate under pressure and multi-task, must demonstrate strong bias for action, follow-through and personal leadership;
Self-motivated and self-starting individual;
Six Sigma Yellow/Green Belt Certified and Project Management Professional (PMP) preferred.

Employees in this role supports Senior Management decision making via financial modeling, including but not limited to, revenue requirement and customer bill impacts, discounted cash flow analysis and financial statement modeling. This position identifies and conducts moderately complex analyses of financial impacts of issues and/or decisions facing the company and proposes strategies to maximize financial performance of company.

Identifies, analyzes, and communicates to management the impact on the Company's financial structure, profitability, financial integrity, and competitive position utilizing relevant analytical methods and/or department's forecasting models
Provides financial analysis support for various projects, calculating revenue requirements, net present value, customer bill impact, etc.
Provides expertise, support, and financial training for the company departments requiring these services
Performs financial analyses as required by management or regulatory bodies
Prepares PowerPoint presentations to be provided to Senior and Executive Management
Performs other job-related duties as assigned

Experience: 3+ years
