Job_Title: Digital Product Manager, Performance and Analytics
Job_Description:
Description

At quip, we design and deliver delightful products and services that help keep your mouth healthy. Over the past 3 years, we have sold over 1 million toothbrushes and toothpaste through our direct to consumer and retail channels. We are always looking for superstars in their field of work or study to join our team.

quip is looking for a Product Manager: Performance & Analytics that is dedicated to the delivery of insights within the product team. This PM will be responsible for the delivery of analytic insight around product strategy, outcomes, and velocity. These projects will include cross-functional work across quip’s Technology team with a special focus on web-based performance.

Responsibilities
Effectively embed into multiple Product teams
Drive opportunity sizing and impact reviews on product releases
Develop and execute a scalable analytics regime for Product at Quip
Develop and manage a backlog of performance-based product experiments for quip’s DTC web stack
Liaise with Marketing, Creative, and Content teams to anticipate key business milestones, scope supporting site updates, and plan work into technical sprints
Track project progress using Agile techniques with project management software and tools
Work with Sr. PMs to manage the product roadmap of quip’s DTC web stack
Work with Digital Product Designers to research, propose, and validate new features and feature improvements for getquip.com

Requirements
Have 2+ years of consulting experience or 2+ years of analytics experience
Are proficient in SQL
Are proficient in BI tools i.e. Looker
Experience working in an Agile environment and with JIRA and Confluence.
Are able to ask the right questions to accurately analyze situations.
Can acquire data from multiple and diverse sources when solving problems.
Experience uncovering the root causes of difficult problems.
Have a working knowledge of Python [is a plus]

Benefits
You'll be working in a high energy, fast-paced environment helping us make oral care simple and effective!
An office located in the heart of DUMBO with breathtaking views of Manhattan Bridge
Wifi-enabled rooftop
Fully covered health insurance (with an option to opt into a premium internal dental program)
Commuter benefits for parking & transit
Offer competitive paid parental leave policy for qualifying employees
Flexible work from home options
Open vacation policy
Dog-friendly office space
401k Contribution
Competitive compensation package with stock options at a high-growth startup
Fully stocked kitchen with snacks (make sure to use your quip after snacking!)
Your very own quip with an unlimited subscription plan
The opportunity to help us make oral care more simple, effective and accessible!

About Quip

Most of us aren’t brushing our teeth correctly, either because we don’t know how to do it right, or because we just don’t feel like it. At quip, we design delightful products and experiences to help you care for your mouth better. Our initial product is a beautifully simple electric toothbrush and toothpaste that was featured by Time Magazine as one of the 25 Best Inventions of 2016. With refill brush heads and toothpaste arriving on a 3-monthly schedule. We pride ourselves on great design and our brand values of simplicity, honesty, and accessibility, which are applied throughout our community.

quip is committed to promoting equality, inclusion, and diversity beyond your brushing routine. We believe our company is better equipped to care for every mouth when we listen to fresh perspectives from every voice, and in doing so, we build an equal-opportunity team of the brightest minds (and mouths)—regardless of race, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, identity, or any other trait that makes you you. By celebrating and supporting our differences, we will thrive in our mission to improve oral health for all.

Overview

Product Manager I, II, III or Senior

Portland, Oregon

The Product Manager job family is responsible for creating the business and product plan, and articulating the product strategy, vision, design, development and ongoing oversight of products that support the launch and growth of businesses within the Cambia family of companies. These roles are responsible for all phases of new product development and management activities including defining business requirements, leading product development, implementing and sustaining the strategic product roadmap, pricing and budget models, competitive positioning and product design for both existing and next-generation product offerings.

These roles are inherently cross-functional – and require close work and collaboration with counterparts in product development, data science and data engineering, user experience, operations, program, and strategy to ensure all teams are delivering high-quality products that solve real market needs.

This specific role is responsible for understanding the current and future trends in medical plan design and related innovations that are ancillary but important to employer and broker customers. The candidate should have insights into market changes, network hybrid products, competitor strategies and associated differentiators. The unique set of skills require some financial and underwriting knowledge, a capacity for innovation, ability to scan and digest market movement, leadership presence, and excellent communication skills.

At Cambia, our values are fundamental to achieving our Cause of transforming the health care industry. They guide our actions and bring diverse perspectives together to improve the health care journey better for those we serve. All eight values are equally important and linked to the others: Empathy, Hope, Courage, Trust, Commitment, Innovation, and Accountability. These values are not just words on paper - we live them every day.

General Functions & Outcomes

Responsibilities & Requirements

Adept at working and creating health plan designs, plan differentiators and estimating impact of the design differentials to plan cost/spend. Identify innovative plan designs ensuring a balance between risk and conservative plans.
Manage the product roadmap and prioritization process, including defining the deliverables into discrete commitments (sprint planning). Contribute to the long term product vision.
Stay current on emerging risks, issues, major industry trends or events, and changing state and federal laws and regulations in order to make sound underwriting decisions that are vital to meeting client needs and maintaining overall profitability.
Understands the target market and primary user needs for a product. Directs the product management activities for products to meet business, market segmentation and financial goals.
Synthesizes business requirements from multiple sources including or may include customer segments, healthcare product experts, brokers, and sales teams into requirement documents and agile project plans. Define business requirements from multiple sources, focusing on largest measures of success.
May conduct market research by working with internal teams and visits to customers and other relevant companies
Provides direct support to Sales, participate in product training for sales, as well as ongoing go to market efforts.
Assist in development, preparations and presentation of data and analytics that will support marketing and sales, as well as department scorecards and general product success measurement.
Continually help to assess and recommend enhancements to streamline processes and provide a superior Employer and Member experience.
Manage a products life-cycle from planning to tactical activities to cross company go to market planning and product sunsetting.
Collaborates with team to develop and deploy strategies for improving customer acquisition, engagement, and retention.
Ensures that all issues are identified, reported, tracked and resolved in a timely manner.

Minimum Requirements
Proven record of creating successful products based on a balance of user needs, business goals, and technical constraints.
Concrete experience managing complex products (preferably in healthcare) through a product development lifecycle
Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills with demonstrated ability to lead teams and build effective working relationships with individuals and groups at all levels.
Demonstrated project management skills including effective planning, organizing, and administration of multi-functional work responsibilities.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize features and enhancements, and are data driven and a student of test driven design.
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing, including formal presentations and the facilitation of group planning sessions.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize findings, prepare reports, create executive level documents and recommend solutions.
Demonstrated track record in developing and managing highly successful products for healthcare preferred.
Experience with analytics, forecasting, and developing business cases.
Ability to negotiate and resolve issues with diplomacy and persuasiveness.
Ability to work within cross-functional teams.
Ability to operate independently to navigate organizational complexities and to obtain resources needed to move initiatives forward.
Ability to write executive level documents and make executive level presentations.
Demonstrated excellent attention to detail including proven ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in parallel.
Ability to learn new technology concepts quickly.
Ability to think strategically and execute methodically.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired.

Additional Competencies And Requirements For The Product Manager II
Analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases. Ability to clearly communicate these data insights to others through written and other forms of documentation.
Ability to work within and lead cross-functional teams.
Ability to effectively manage multiple, diverse and/or complex projects and deadlines.
Strong sense of market priorities and ability to appropriately push back against group think that will negatively impact company position in market place or marketability of the portfolio.
Demonstrated ability to dive deep in understanding the product, business, and market trends (including the competitive landscape).

Additional Competencies And Requirements For The Product Manager III
High attention to detail including proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Experience managing complex products with multiple end-user and purchaser persona and stakeholders.
Ability to develop and lead cross divisional processes and clearly articulate complex information to achieve common goals.
Ability to negotiate and resolve complex and sensitive issues with diplomacy and persuasiveness.

Additional Competencies And Requirements For The Senior Product Manager
Demonstrated broad knowledge of product management and product development, management principles, strategic and operational planning, project implementation and performance monitoring, and financial analysis.
Demonstrated ability to move abstract concepts and early product ideas through product development phases to deliver effective and successful product solutions with strong ROI.
Comfortable using big data to uncover previously-unknown customer insights as well as building and defending data models.
Ability to mentor other junior team members in areas of domain, process, strategy, and communication within the organization.

Normally To Be Proficient In The Competencies Listed Above
The Product Manager I would have a BA/BS in Business Administration or relevant field with 4+ years’ experience in a product management position in healthcare, or equivalent combination of education and experience. For technology specific roles experience in consumer-facing software & services or a start-up environment preferred.
The Product Manager II would have a BA/BS in Business Administration or relevant field with 6+ years’ experience in a product management position in healthcare or equivalent combination of education and experience. For technology specific roles experience in consumer-facing software & services or a start-up environment preferred. MBA preferred.
The Product Manager III would have a BA/BS in Business Administration or relevant field with 8+ years’ experience in a product management position in healthcare, or equivalent combination of education and experience. For technology specific roles experience in consumer-facing software & services or a start-up environment preferred. MBA preferred.
The Product Manager Senior would have a BA/BS in Business Administration or relevant field with 10+ years’ experience in a product management position in healthcare, or equivalent combination of education and experience. For technology specific roles experience in consumer-facing software & services or a start-up environment preferred. Must have experience that aligns directly to the products being managed. MBA preferred.

About Us

Regence employees are part of the larger Cambia family of companies, which seeks to drive innovative health solutions. We offer a competitive salary and a generous benefits package. We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug and tobacco-free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by law. A drug screen and background check is required.

Regence is 2.2 million members, here for our families, co-workers and neighbors, helping each other be and stay healthy and provide support in time of need. We've been here for members more than 90 years. Regence is a nonprofit health care company offering individual and group medical, dental, vision and life insurance, Medicare and other government programs as well as pharmacy benefit management. We are the largest health insurer in the Northwest/Intermountain Region, serving members as Regence BlueShield of Idaho, Regence BlueCross BlueShield of Oregon, Regence BlueCross BlueShield of Utah and Regence BlueShield (in Washington). Each plan is an independent licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association.

If you’re seeking a career that affects change in the health care system, consider joining our team at Cambia Health Solutions. We advocate for transforming the health care system by making health care more affordable and accessible, increasing consumers’ engagement in their health care decisions, and offering a diverse range of products and services that promote the health and well-being of our members. Cambia's portfolio of companies spans health care information technology and software development; retail health care; health insurance plans that carry the Blue Cross and Blue Shield brands; pharmacy benefit management; life, disability, dental, vision and other lines of protection; alternative solutions to health care access and free-standing health and wellness solutions.

Job_Description:
Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.  

This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.  

Marketing Coordinator or Sr (Direct Marketing)

Preferred locations: Office-base in one of the following Anthem offices:  ME, NH, CT, NY, CO, NV, GA, IN, OH, KY, MO, VA WI, or CA)

Other Locations: Strongly prefer office-based.  May consider candidates from other areas who are not able to work in an Anthem office at management’s discretion.  
Position may be filled Marketing Coordinator or Marketing Coordinator Sr level.  Manager will determine level based upon incumbent's relevant education, skills, and experience.
Role Summary

Coordinates digital direct marketing activities and initiatives that are focused on driving sales for Anthem’s business segments

The successful candidate will be organized and detailed-oriented with marketing experience in complicated, highly regulated industries such as insurance or financial services  
Responsibilities:

Responsible for collaborating with Marketing Managers to help execute enterprise direct marketing strategies to support business line growth.  Primary duties and responsibilities include but not limited to:


Proof SEM ad copy and campaign launch documentation to ensure accuracy and alignment with business goals.


Assist with development, implementation and testing of tracking and tagging requirements to measure campaign performance.


Review campaign reports and ensure Google Analytics, Tableau or DoubleClick data is accurate


Manage SEO work intake process including logging, tracking and seeing task level requests through to completion.


Assist with SEM landing page and public website content reviews; Assist with vendor landing page testing


Coordinate and assist with SEO testing including but not limited to testing of meta descriptions, headings, URL naming and internal linking and content.


Ensure accurate materials and assist with proofing Direct Marketing materials. Comply with all DOI regulations.


Comfortable working in different systems and databases.

Marketing Coordinator

Marketing Coordinator Sr

Extremely organized and able to multi-task, managing multiple projects with overlapping deadlines in a high-pressure environment.


Detailed oriented with proofing experience.


Experience with digital direct marketing strategies (SEO, SEM, landing page optimization, and online media).


Experience partnering with an IT team to ensure marketing requirements are implemented accurately and on time.


Knowledge of the Agile framework a plus.


Relevant experience in the insurance/financial services industry or other related highly-regulated field preferred.


Analytical, data driven, results oriented personality. Able to provide interpretation of data and to present findings to others.


Comfortable working in different systems and databases.


Ability to manage complex projects across different business areas.


Ability to take direction and be accountable to deliver quality work, on time.
 

Key skills and leadership competencies  


Acts with a sense of urgency; builds and adjusts plans to deliver results to meet or exceed expectations


Strong attention to detail


Deals effectively with ambiguity and change


Collaborates and seeks out varying perspectives and alternatives


Maintains flexibility to plan revisions to support changing business needs


Challenges tradition and conventional thinking when appropriate


Acts with integrity and courage

Job_Title: Analytic Consultant - Conduct Analytics - San Antonio
Job_Description:
Job Description

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Consumer Banking is an industry leader in supporting homeowners and consumers in addition to operating one of the most extensive banking franchises in the country. We serve mass market, affluent, and small business customers; as well as provide home and personal lending. Our focus is on delivering an exceptional experience for our customers through financial advice and guidance coupled with providing the products and services that will help them realize their financial hopes and dreams. We’ve built our team of top professionals by rewarding their accomplishments and ensuring they have what's needed to succeed.

The Role
Consumer Control Monitoring & Surveillance Analytics is responsible for developing and implementing data driven self-assurance monitoring, reporting and metrics to increase and evidence control effectiveness. This individual contributor position will collaborate across Consumer Bank Conduct and Conduct Control partners to design and implement data-driven monitoring in support of Self-Assurance Activities. The candidate will support the creation of risk detection & monitoring strategies across systems, business processes, allegations, conduct, and interactions, using traditional risk analytics as well as advanced analytic techniques.

Responsibilities Include
Collaborate with business partners and other analytics teams to develop robust actionable analytics, metrics and reporting to monitor conduct risk.
Develop data analytics to identify anomalies, outliers, emerging trends and conduct risks across the Enterprise. Primary areas of focus include Regional Banking, Auto Lending and Home Lending.
Leverage both structured and unstructured data from multiple sources and “Big Data” analytic tools and platforms to provide insight into risk trends.
Leverage text analytics techniques to extract value and insights from unstructured conduct data.
Conduct behavioral trend analyses to identify potential areas for monitoring of conduct related behaviors and activity.
Partner closely with other Conduct and Sales Practices teams to support reviews, examinations, legal casework and other activities providing data analytics as required.
Working cross functionally to define business requirements and analytical needs.
Consulting and performing very complex analyses/analysis design involving data mining from multiple sources.
Interpreting and presenting results of analyses and recommendations to our business partners.
Ensure integrity of analyses through rigorous attention to detail and validation of data including adherence to policy, security and documentation protocols.
May facilitate meetings to gain consensus across stakeholders and provide partners with delivery of findings and recommendations.
May participate in model development and performance monitoring for models.
May partner with Corporate Model Risk to ensure alignment with relevant policies, guidelines, and best practice.
May lead project teams and provide guidance to less experienced team members.
The Team
This position will report to the Conduct Analytics Leader, Consumer Control Monitoring and Surveillance Analytics.

The Candidate
This candidate must be a strong analytics professional with experience designing and building monitoring, surveillance and other analytical processes in a large, distributed, diverse organization. The successful candidate will have a strong analytical foundation to synthesize information regarding allegations, customer interactions, team members, conduct risk, sales and services and sourced from multiple systems/data sources. The successful candidate will also have demonstrated leadership among peers.

Location(s): Minneapolis, MN; Des Moines, IA; Charlotte, NC; San Antonio, TX; and Chandler, AZ. However, other Wells Fargo approved locations may be considered.

Required Qualifications
6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling
Desired Qualifications
Extensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysis
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to create and improve process through strategic thinking
Ability to exercise independent judgment to identify and resolve problems
Ability to negotiate, influence, and collaborate to build successful relationships
Experience with text mining or text analytics
Teradata experience
Other Desired Qualifications
Demonstrated ability to design and lead very complex projects/analyses
Demonstrated ability to perform very complex activities related to business analysis and modeling
Ability to share both technical and analytical knowledge and mentor lower-level staff
Knowledge of Consumer Banking products, sales processes, conduct risk, and allegations management.
Must possess strong collaborative skills
Ability to communicate powerfully and prolifically to business partners and simplify the complex
Demonstrated SQL expertise including the ability to write complex queries and database knowledge in order to analyze data sources across a variety of sources
Experience with enterprise data environments, particularly BMG, EIW, CBDW, C2T, and CMIRP
Demonstrated data visualization experience using BI tools e.g., Tableau, Microsoft BI, etc.
Demonstrated expertise with SAS, Python or R

TrueData ( is the leading Mobile Data Platform, partnering with mobile app publishers & developers to capture deterministic mobile data. Using those data inputs, we build the most accurate mobile data products in existence, and put them to work with the brands, agencies, and ad:tech companies who need data & intelligence for ad targeting, optimization, and measurement. We provide app publishers with a platform to safely capture data, generate user analytics & insights, and drive incremental revenue, while delivering mobile marketers & technology companies high quality mobile data and intelligence products that boost campaign & product ROI, at scale.

We are experiencing tremendous momentum and on the back of our Series B we are aggressively expanding our Team. The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst is a key hire on our product team and will report directly to our Director of Product Development.

Background

High quality data will power the AI and algorithms of the future, and TrueData is at the forefront of this trend. We’re looking for a dynamic, highly-technical Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst that will use their skills to unlock the next phase of growth for TrueData. In this role you’ll transform a wealth of raw data into actionable insights and intelligent reports & dashboards, empowering all areas of our business to make the right decisions. You’ll work closely with the business and technical teams in order to understand business requirements, develop technical documentation and manage the implementation of new reporting requirements. This will be a highly visible role that will be responsible for driving key metrics that the business uses to make decisions.

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone with 1-2 years of experience who is looking to get in at the ground level of a startup and work on projects that drive significant value for the business. We believe in finding the right person for the job and then letting them shine.

What You'll Do
Manage creation, implementation, validation and ongoing support of data visualization tools and recurring reports
Ensure the user interface, system communication, design and implementation are on target and supporting the business
Collect, analyze, and share data to help business teams drive improvements in key business metrics, customer experience, and business results
Partner with business users and engineers to identify the metrics and attributes required to address broad business needs
Analyze business and functional requirements and translates these requirements into robust, scalable, operable solutions
Manipulate/mine data from database tables (ex. Redshift, MySQL, Oracle) using SQL.
Develop analytical tools: deep-dive tools, UIs, metrics, and dashboards
Perform deep-dives and root cause analysis to answer business questions
Use analytical and statistical rigor to solve complex problems and drive business decisions.


Requirements
Bachelor's degree of a quantitative nature (Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, etc.)
1-2 years of relevant work experience
Experience with BI analytics/ reporting/visualization tools (preferably Tableau or Looker)
Experience analyzing large data sets using SQL, spreadsheet software, R, and other quantitative and statistical modeling technologies and tools.
Skilled at translating business requirements into technical requirements and managing the implementation of BI/reporting tools across the organization
Excellent organizational, written, and communication skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks to completion within established deadlines
The ability and strong desire to innovate with strong problem solving, technical and communication skills
Excited about working with terabyte sized data sets to design scalable, robust analytic solutions


Benefits
Salary . $click apply per year, depending on experience
Equity . Options, award amount will depend on experience.
Full Benefits. Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, H1B Sponsorship, Take-What-You-Need Vacation Policy.

About_Berkeley

The University of California, Berkeley, is one of the world's most iconic
teaching and research institutions. Since 1868, Berkeley has fueled a perpetual
renaissance, generating unparalleled intellectual, economic and social value in
California, the United States and the world. Berkeley's culture of openness,
freedom and acceptanceacademic and artistic, political and culturalmake it a
very special place for students, faculty and staff.

Berkeley is committed to hiring and developing staff who want to work in a high
performing culture that supports the outstanding work of our faculty and
students. In deciding whether to apply for a staff position at Berkeley,
candidates are strongly encouraged to consider the alignment of the Berkeley
Workplace Culture with their potential for success at .

Application Review Date
The First Review Date for this job is: July 30, 2019

Departmental_Overview

UC Berkeley Extension is the continuing education branch of the University of
California, Berkeley. Extension offers more than 2,000 courses per year in a
variety of subjects both online and in the classroom. Extension's
administrative departments and units include student records (transcripts),
registration, scheduling, international student services, facilities, financial
services, and the cashier's office. In addition to the main Berkeley center, it
has responsibility for the maintenance and operation of regional centers in San
Francisco (Spear Street), Belmont and other leased facilities in the San
Francisco Bay Area.

The Marketing Department is a multi-function marketing service provider to the
Extension school as well as other UC Berkeley clients. It is responsible for
the branding, engagement, enrollment, awareness building, and lead generation
for over 70 domestic and international programs. Once a primary point for
transactional operations, the unit has shifted towards an entrepreneurial
approach dedicated to solving complex problems, driving enrollments and
revenue, and generating awareness for new programs. The goals and objectives of
the Marketing Department are to provide excellent, comprehensive services to
students, staff, faculty, and the general public in our efforts.

The Digital Marketing team is responsible for meeting these goals through paid
and organic deliverables across online platforms. The Digital Marketing team
works alongside content marketing, recruitment and advising, and analytics/
research teams. The person in this role will utilize product and brand
campaigns on social media to drive enrollments, revenue, awareness, leads, and
growth across online communities for UC Berkeley Extension's domestic and
international initiatives. Ultimately, this person will drive revenue, growth,
and facilitate engagement with the community while helping shape the narrative
of the UC Berkeley Extension brand as a leader in continuing education.

Responsibilities
Under general supervision, plans, develops, and implements paid and
organic social media campaigns and/or community engagement campaigns
across channels.
While working with Creative Service to draft, schedule and/or edit posts
for paid and organic campaigns.
Ensures good customer service through providing appropriate information
to answer questions, including providing data for reports to justify the
value & contribution of social communities to institutional KPIs.
Identification of new digital technologies and vendors; assisting with
implementation, maintenance, & optimization of digital technologies.
Identification of new & existing opportunities for optimization through
A/B tests, target audiences, best times to post, relevant subjects for
content generation, etc.
Regularly monitor Google Analytics, Social Media Management & Social
Analytics Platforms for insights to campaign performance, website
performance, revenue and other leading indicators.
Conducts basic market research and/or sales and generates and uses
marketing and/or sales reports for the purposes of optimizing campaign
performance & engagement.

Required Qualifications
Solid knowledge of social media and digital marketing best practices,
concepts, and strategies
In-depth knowledge and understanding of social media platforms such as
Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn, WeChat, niche
communities, blogs, stories, etc.
Knowledge of paid social media advertising channels and tools, including
Facebook Business Manager, LinkedIn Ads, Instagram Ads, etc.
Strong ability to identify and write clear, engaging, and cohesive
messaging with a sharp eye for high-quality, impactful content and
imagery.
Familiarity with Google Analytics or other web or social analytics
platforms, including creating custom reports and troubleshooting common
issues.
Familiarity with digital marketing ad platforms and practices like Google
Search and Display Ads and Microsoft Advertising.
Familiarity with SEO best practices.
Passion for educational products and continuing education.
Knowledge of best practices for targeting and tracking social paid and
organic posts.
Knowledge of the campus, including its mission, vision, goals, and
objectives.
Written and interpersonal communication and client management skills.
Strong analytical and reporting skills and comfort with regularly
reporting key KPIs.

Education/Training
Bachelor's degree in related area and/or equivalent experience/training.
1-3 years marketing, content, and/or social media experience, with a
solid understanding of engaging an audience and growing the user base of
a product or brand.

Preferred Qualifications
Preference given to those who hold Google Certification for Digital
Advertising products and/or have managed multiple social campaigns with
different revenue objectives.

Salary_&_Benefits

This position is a non-exempt, bi-weekly paid position. Hourly pay for
this role is commensurate with experience.

Job Description

Payment Analytics & Fulfillment Manager

A job-seeker is needed for a contract Payment Analytics & Fulfillment Manager position in West Chester, PA. As the Payment Analytics and Fulfillment Manager, you will assist in analyzing the company's private label credit card programs’ performance trends while partnering closely with the internal business team and Synchrony Bank to fulfill marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities Of The Payment Analytics & Fulfillment Include
Lead the marketing fulfillment efforts (improving the process, timeliness and quality control for targeted/mass lifecycle campaigns and new cardholder acquisition campaigns)
Front end data Fulfillment of Marketing campaigns for the company credit card. Includes but is not limited to: data querying and compiling of existing customers (or potential company credit card Customers) that might be eligible for the campaign
Analyze data to determine eligibility, transfer lists to/from Synchrony and/or 3rd party printers/email vendors, etc.
Back end data fulfillment of Marketing campaigns. Includes but not limited to: gathering lists of customers that potentially qualified for offer; partner with Synchrony bank to determine final qualification; work with internal teams to ensure discounts/credits are applied accurately; track usage, timing and breakage of offers
Create and communicate robust fulfillment reports in conjunction with Synchrony which includes: querying sales data, discount, usage, pre & post-purchase behavior information based on the specific objective of the campaign
Conduct efficient data manipulation with company tools including SQL, SAS, R, Tableau, AQT, MS Access & Excel etc.
Creation of robust and consistent company credit card analytics across organization.
Create automated and flexible queries that can be leveraged to provide accurate, timely and rich data to track and report performance results and forecast expectations
Close coordination with the Synchrony analytics team to share data, insights and performance trends of the portfolios
Cross departmental coordination with key internal stakeholders to develop enhanced data sharing capabilities (short term manually, and long term automated)
Prepares business performance reporting and analysis in a timely and accurate manner and in accordance with the existing/internal analytical methodologies;
Create queries and data extracts that will allow for the creation of standardized and centralized reporting to accurately track forecast vs actual performance, ROI on Card projects
Execute ad-hoc data queries, analyses and presentation slides centered around the credit card program for key internal and external stakeholders
Develop, launch and coordinate a structured data sharing project that delivers:
Improved granularity of data shared between the company and Synchrony
Reduced fulfillment timelines for marketing campaigns
Increase quality control of data used to qualify and fulfill marketing campaigns
Deliver robust insights through enhanced analytical capabilities to drive fact based decisions for profitable growth of the credit card program

Required Qualifications

Requirements of the Payment Analytics & Fulfillment:
Demonstrated analytical skills. Ability to quickly derive and apply insights from research and analysis
Experience with data querying and reporting tools such as Hyperion, Tableau and other key internal/external database systems
Ability to interface comfortably in technical systems environments
Ability to both influence and collaborate with others, adjusting quickly to changing priorities, aggressive timelines and multiple objectives.
Proactive, self-directed individual with proven ability to independently manage multiple projects
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; proven executive communication skills (both written and verbal).

At Coca-Cola, we're looking for technologists who understand the fundamentals and principles of technology and who want to solve business problems on a global scale in a large, complex environment. We care less about your knowledge of a particular technology and care more about your passion and aptitude for utilizing the right tool for the right job, even if that tool hasn't been created yet.

Don’t worry if are you are interested in several different areas - our goal is to match the best people to the right opportunity. If you also have a business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Who You Are...
Passionate with an aptitude to quickly learn new and emerging technologies ?
Self-starter willing to jump into difficult situations ?
Insanely curious, analytical, and loves solving problems
Agile and adaptable Strong verbal and written communication
Able to obtain results from cross-functional teams

Growth Behaviors
Growth Mindset: ?Demonstrates Curiosity. ?Welcomes failure as a learning opportunity.
Smart Risk: ?Makes bold decisions/recommendations
Externally Focused: ?Understands the upstream and downstream implications of his/her work. Tracks and shares external trends, best practices, or ideas.
Performance Driven & Accountable: ?Has high performance standards. Outperforms her/his peers.
Fast/Agile: ?Removes barriers to move faster. ?Experiments and adapts. Thrives under pressure and fast pace.

Job Conditions

Standard Monday-Friday work week. ?Work will be done from TCCC Atlanta Office but may also include coordination with resources on a global basis, which may require early or late conference calls to accommodate different time zones. ?

Relocation: ?

No relocation expenses paid.

Our Growth Culture

One of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years is having a company culture that supports and rewards behaviors that lead to growth. Our “Growth Behaviors,” as we call them, are ways of being and working that help to make us successful. Think about how you can bring this to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

Curious
Keep seeking, never settle. Staying curious about what is outside, and two steps ahead inspires us to challenge the status quo. Having the courage to look and leap is the way we grow. Because asking “what if?” pushes us to the next level as people and as a company.

Empowered
Make it happen. True empowerment is the result of taking responsibility. This means giving yourself permission to see it, say it and do it, and owning the outcomes. Because we move forward faster when we all take action.

Version 1.0, 2.0, 3.0
Push for progress, not perfection. There are very few overnight successes. Greatness is borne of many little victories (and failures). Share v 1.0, test it, and make it better. Then create the next version. Because the moment we think something is perfect, it will be obsolete.

Inclusive
Include, value and trust each other. We are smart alone but together we are genius. This means being inclusive, giving the benefit of the doubt and being responsible for each other. Because, for our company to thrive for the next 100+ years, smart isn’t enough. We need genius.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Consulting Associate (2019 Start) San Francisco, CA

About Charles River Associates
Charles River Associates is a leading global consulting firm that provides independent economic and financial analysis behind litigation matters, guides businesses through critical strategy and operational issues to become more profitable, and advises governments on the economic impact of policies and regulations. Our three main services – litigation, policy and management consulting – are delivered by practice groups that focus on specific areas of expertise or industries. Learn more about how CRA can help you Launch your career.

CRA’s Life Sciences practice helps pharmaceutical, biotechnology, diagnostics and medical device companies achieve optimum performance across key aspects of their business, including innovation, commercial success, organization, and reputation, all for the long-term benefit of patients, clinicians, employees, and shareholders. We work with life sciences businesses directly as well as with their legal counsel, industry associations, government organizations, and advocacy groups from the earliest stages of research into new therapy areas, through product development, to the delivery of products that will achieve commercial success and fulfill the expectations of our clients and their key stakeholders.

Essential Functions
Associates and Consulting Associates are important members of CRA project teams and work together with experienced Senior Associates and Principals to deliver consulting, strategic marketing, and market research projects to clients. In this role you will own and personally deliver components of the client engagement, contributing to the overall success of each engagement. As you demonstrate strong advisory and project management skills, your responsibilities will grow rapidly.

Responsibilities
Will be a part of an integrated team that executes and delivers across a wide variety of consulting projects through:
Work closely with senior colleagues to deliver policy consulting projects that address specific client needs
Conduct independent research to identify, collect, manage and analyze data
Contribute to internal discussions that build insights from the analytical process and you will help integrate findings into the broader project work
Conduct telephone or face-to-face interviews with clients or external stakeholders
Assume responsibility to generating sections of client reports, presentations and other client deliverables (e.g. excel Workbooks) whilst under close supervision
Proactively developing your knowledge of the life sciences industry as well as consulting methodologies
Work on multiple projects at the same time

Job Qualifications
Graduates of top MBA or other top Master’s programs with 2-3 years of relevant work experience
Graduates of PhD programs
A strong analytic focus and a background in one of the following disciplines (or related disciplines): Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Psychology, Sociology, Bio-engineering, Public Health, the life sciences, or business
Experience or keen interest in the life sciences and healthcare
Experience with business analytics or computational data analytics (“big data”) is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Eye for detail and self-motivated to deliver high quality work on time
Some knowledge of essential consulting methodologies, tools and techniques ideal but not required
CRA is proud of our ability to managing work/life balance. However, some travel is inevitable and successful candidates will have to show a willingness and ability to travel to client locations when required

How to Apply:
To be considered for this role, please submit your resume, cover letter.
Please note we are looking for candidates who can start in 2019

Talent Acquisition Manager at Essense of Australia
Essense Designs is an international bridal wholesaler with key offices based in Lenexa, Kansas and Perth, Australia. Our growing organization also operates in the United Kingdom, Europe, Canada, and New Zealand. We have been a global leader in bridal fashion for over 20 years and our designs are currently sold in over 1,500 stores worldwide. With innovative designs and a strong customer service approach, Essense Designs is a dynamic and rapidly-expanding company that rewards excellence, drive, and collaboration.

We are looking for a competent Logistics and Compliance Coordinator to help facilitate our supply chain logistics. This position will deal with coordination of the transportation and distribution of goods between our warehouses, factories, trade fairs, and retailers.

The Role

The successful candidate will be responsible for handling day to day aspects of monitoring shipping routes and delivery, resolving logistics issues expeditiously to minimize disruption in day to day business activities, estimating transit costs and lead-times, logging and tracking data around shipments, and providing summary reports on shipment history. Essential qualities to possess in this position include staying on top of all logistics accounts, being a proactive communicator to resolve issues, and providing information and visibility to other departments.

What We Expect
Coordinate and monitor supply chain logistics, working to ensure smooth operations.
Serve as a primary point of contact for external and internal departments regarding transportation and scheduling, handling day to day logistics queries and issues.
Work with carriers to ensure prompt pick-up and delivery of shipments within established deadlines, and to identify and avoid capacity constraints.
Supervise and create export documentations, such as commercial invoices, to ensure compliance regulations are being met and shipments arrive in a timely manner to the customer, without customs delays.
Resolve logistics issues or shipping delays with a sense of urgency and manage corrective action plans for mis-shipments.
Develop and maintain proper internal processes to maximize customer service, productivity and profitability. Ensure quality of all services and consistency of processes within the corporate offices.
Streamline shipping and transportation processes through continuous improvement to gain efficiencies.
Proactively identify potential export compliance risks, develop risk assessment corrective measures.
Track critical shipments, investigate discrepancies and monitor service levels.
Keep logs and records of shipment activity and invoices for management approval.
Continually review freight costs and transportation rates to ensure timeliness and accuracy of billings and to enhance customer account profitability.
Prepare accurate business analytics and reports for upper management for defined lanes of responsibility.
Comply with any export and import documentation retention procedures.
Logistics Projects and Operations Support.
Analyze logistic options for various domestic projects, including gathering freight quotes and estimating rates or lead-times across carriers and service types (small parcel, ground, LTL, freight, ocean).
Assist in building strong relationships with a network of carriers and freight forwarders, sourcing new domestic providers and negotiating preferential rates for US, UK, and EUR intra-country freight lanes.
Assist with other administrative responsibilities and coverage for team members as needed.

What We Are Looking For
2-3 Years of experience in a logistics or transportation environment
Must have the ability to handle multiple tasks and possess strong practical and technical skills as well as the ability to communicate and present information in a clear and persuasive manner
Experience dealing with freight forwarders, customs brokers, supply chain, purchasing, and logistics
Exposure to inbound and outbound logistics across a variety of movement and service types
General knowledge of laws, regulations and ISO requirements as it relates to logistics
Understanding of receiving process, discrepancy handling, and inventory control
Strong coordination and organization skills with attention to detail
Procedural mindset with a talent for recognizing opportunities for process improvement
Ability to clearly document processes for communication and training throughout organization
Ability to provide ongoing oversight of very detailed processes
Excellent analytical and decision-making skills
Strong problem-solving skills
Ability to build relationships with customers (external and internal), and solve problems quickly and efficiently, excellent oral and written communication skills
High degree of desktop computer proficiency and familiar with ERP and standard business systems
Exceptional Excel skills and the working knowledge of the full suite of Microsoft Office products.
Strong team player - willingness to assist supply chain members and other teams with tasks as requested by upper management

Highly Preferred Experience
Export and import documentation experience
Experience in creating and reviewing contracts and other export documents
Experience working with brokers to classify commodities in various countries

What We Offer

We look forward to welcoming the successful candidate to our fast-growing global team! In return for your skills, we offer you the opportunity to join an international industry leader and be part of a creative and collaborative culture that empowers its people, promotes teamwork and embraces sustainability. We recognise and reward excellence, innovation, and loyalty. Our goal is to offer an inspirational and modern workplace that allows for talented individuals to thrive. As such, we provide competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, with significant opportunity for exceptional team members to grow with us as we continue to expand.

If you have the skills and drive to help us further our growth, please go to https://www.essensedesigns.com/careers/ and follow the prompts to submit a cover letter, resume, and online application. Please note: We believe cover letters are important to help us understand why you are interested in this position and your unique story and qualifications. If you sincerely desire to work with us, please take this into consideration when submitting your materials.

The HFS Graduate Academy

Are you a recent graduate looking to start out in business research? Are you enthusiastic about exploring the potential of emerging technologies and digital business models? Or perhaps using your analytics capabilities to help develop real insights from data? Then the HFS Graduate Academy could be the perfect fit for you!

Here at HFS Research, we’re committed to developing world-leading research analysts that will help us continue our work to disrupt the analyst industry. We’re looking for enthusiastic and passionate graduates to join our recently launched development program in two streams covering Emerging Technologies and Digital Business Models, and Data Analytics.

This structured training program is designed to provide you with the tools and support you need to build up your knowledge and skills, and by the end of the program, progress to the role of Senior Analyst in your chosen field. You will be working with some of the best and brightest analysts and researchers in the industry and will have the opportunity to work with clients from some of the world’s leading enterprises. All the while researching some of the emerging technologies and trends that will transform the business landscape.

HfS’ mission is to provide visionary insight into the major innovations impacting business operations: automation, artificial intelligence, blockchain, digital business models and smart analytics. We influence the strategies of enterprise customers to develop operational backbones to stay competitive and partner with capable services providers, technology suppliers, and third-party advisors. Headquartered in Cambridge UK, HfS Research was named Analyst Firm of the Year 2017 by the IIAR (International Industry Association of Analyst Relations) and is the highest impact research analyst in the IT and business services industry, with a growing international reputation, with operations in the US, UK and India.

A Research Analyst in the area of IT and Business Services will research, develop and apply their knowledge of emerging digital business models, enabling technologies, start-ups and established technology and business solutions suppliers, to provide actionable insights to our clients, with focus on specific industry sectors.

An HfS Research Analyst demonstrates exceptional writing, analytical thinking, developing public speaking skills, and ability to provide relevant insights to technology and business leaders.

In this role you will:

Research and gather data to provide insight and analysis into areas related to digital business models, disruptive technologies impacting business operations. This will involve the major innovations impacting business operations: automation, artificial intelligence, blockchain, digital business models and smart analytics.
Provide actionable insights to business operations and IT leaders on how to monitor, manage, and optimize their increasingly complex digital business operations.
Perform qualitative research by networking and engaging with enterprise customers of services and technologies, industry contacts, suppliers and analyst colleagues
Participate in research meetings, and conduct interviews, surveys, and reviews of statistical analysis.
Create thought leading written research.
Respond to client inquiries as required, providing individualized advice to business and IT leaders and supplier clients.
Define, lead and conduct industry webcasts and teleconferences.
Present at multiple conferences as an industry expert.
Provide sales support by speaking to prospective and existing clients by telephone and through face-to-face sales calls.
Take press calls relevant to research expertise areas to promote the HfS brand.
 To be successful in this position you need:
 Graduate or Post-Graduate degree
Academic or working experience that includes strong elements of research, writing and analysis. Experience working within an IT or Operations role an advantage, but not essential.
Strong ability to define and articulate solutions to business problems
Passion for learning new areas and writing about them
Strong ability to derive and interpret information from HfS survey data, annual reports, financial reports, news reports, corporate presentations and other sources
Strong intellectual curiosity and interest in tracking technology and business services trends
Ability to teamwork and collaborate on analyst reports, presentations and public speaking opportunities
Ability to challenge current thinking about business and IT topics; unafraid to voice strong opinions when backed up with facts and data
An entrepreneurial spirit, with problem-solving skills, creativity and innovation, analytical depth, and great interpersonal skills
Willingness to travel internationally or nationally at least once per month to support HfS events, other industry conferences and client requirements


Applicants must have the right to work in the US.

Job_Title: Global Product Manager, Smart Outdoor Lighting Control and Smart City Solutions
Job_Description:
Description

Xylem |ˈzīləm|

The tissue in plants that brings water upward from the roots;
a leading global water technology company.

We’re a global team unified in a common purpose: creating advanced technology solutions to the world’s water challenges. Developing new technologies that will improve the way water is used, conserved, and re-used in the future is central to our work. Our products and services move, treat, analyze, monitor and return water to the environment, in public utility, industrial, residential and commercial building services settings. Xylem also provides a leading portfolio of smart metering, network technologies and advanced analytics solutions for water, electric and gas utilities. In more than 150 countries, we have strong, long-standing relationships with customers who know us for our powerful combination of leading product brands and applications expertise with a strong focus on developing comprehensive, sustainable solutions.

For more information on how Xylem can help you, go to www.xylem.com

Sensus, a Xylem brand, helps a wide range of public service providers – from utilities to cities to industrial complexes and campuses – do more with their infrastructure to improve quality of life in their communities. We enable our customers to reach farther through the application of technology and data-driven insights that deliver efficiency and responsiveness. We partner with them to anticipate and respond to evolving business needs with innovation in sensing and communications technologies, data analytics and services. Learn more at sensus.com and follow @SensusGlobal on Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter.

The Role: Sensus, a Xylem brand, seeks to hire a Global Product Manager, Smart Outdoor Lighting Control and Smart City Solutions. Sensus is a market leader in delivering Smart Infrastructure solutions to water, gas and electric utilities, and municipalities in the global market. These end to end solutions are comprised of sensors and control devices (such as meters); secure robust communications networks; software applications and analytical capabilities; and a full suite of complimentary services. The Global Product Manager will be responsible for managing, developing and driving profitable business growth for the Sensus Smart Outdoor Lighting Control product line and Smart City Solutions. This role manages its products through the whole lifecycle by gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product roadmap, value proposition and working closely with R&D to deliver winning products to the market in close collaboration with other marketing functions, operations / supply chain and sales. This position has primary responsibility for developing and executing strategies to maximize product line profitability including; managing strategic pricing, developing strong value propositions, defining value-engineering priorities, identifying products to be discontinued, matching profitable product lines to suitable applications and analysis of competitive offerings.

Essential Duties/Principal Responsibilities
Develops the global product roadmap including business case covering product positioning, value proposition, volume and price to serve as input into product development, and marketing.
Understands and specifies market requirements, competition, market and technology trends for current and future products. Conducting product related market research, Voice of Customer, customer visits in collaboration with local-regional sales and marketing resources.
Monitors sales, orders and standard margin with the aim to reach targets, identify gaps and collaborate with other functions (e.g. sales) to develop countermeasures to close the gap
Provides strategic pricing guidelines across markets. Being responsible for updating and distributing list pricing.
Manages the entire product life cycle through phase-out and is responsible for keeping it competitive, providing ideas for technology development and initiating Value Engineering projects to maintain and expand profitability
Minimum Qualifications: Education, Experience, Skills, Abilities, License/Certification:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Marketing preferred or equivalent work experience
MBA preferred or equivalent work experience.
10+ years of experience, five or more in Product Marketing or Product Management with a successful technology oriented company.
Must have the ability to organize, implement and maintain multiple strategies and programs.
Strong interpersonal, teamwork and problem-solving skills in order to effectively work with customers, business partners, staff and management from a variety of skill levels as well as different authority levels.
Flexible individual, able to operate in a fast-paced environment with extensive travel.
Excellent communication, presentation and negotiation skills
Action and results oriented, able to communicate strategies and tactics, identify obstacles.

Physical Demands

Regularly required to sit or stand, reach, bend and move about the facility

  Junior Product Manager
 Job Overview: 
Working with the VP of Business Development, the Junior Product Manager will help define the user experience, monitor product use and performance, author detailed specifications and requirements, and ensure that the delivered product meets the business goals for CollegeData, 1st Financial Bank USA’s affiliate site. 

This position requires being proficient in the tools of product management and a deep working knowledge of user experience, interaction design, web technology, user acquisition, mobile applications, and online marketing, including Search Engine Optimization (SEO). This needs to be coupled with proficient web skills and the ability to connect the design of the site to the business goals of the site.

The individual hired will also incorporate product solutions and strategy, ensuring that their product road map supports CollegeData’s business goals and overall marketing strategy.
This position will have a significant impact on the future success of CollegeData, developing new site features and discovering ways to enhance the existing tools on the site to provide our users with an exceptional college planning resource.

Create page wireframes to explore multiple user experience options
Work closely with CollegeData’s content creators, user interface design, engineers, and quality assurance to ensure that projects achieve the desired business goals
Prioritize product enhancements and triage bugs
Work with CollegeData’s UI/Visual designers, providing support, prioritizing design tasks, and reviewing work progress
Complete user acceptance testing of new features and enhancements

Who We Are.

American National is a successful and stable corporation guided by five core values: Financial Strength, Integrity, Respect, Service and Teamwork. We are among America’s Most Trustworthy Financial Companies according to Forbes. We’ve spent the last 110+ years earning this reputation and we work each day to expand this legacy. We know we’re not just selling insurance, we’re providing security and peace of mind to our 5 million policyholders.

The growth, innovation and success of American National are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering exceptional service to our clients. Success begins and ends with our people. Their loyalty and dedication to American National is why we’re successful.

If you share our values and can contribute to our mission of providing the highest quality service to our clients, we want to hear from you!

Why join us?

We know that our employees’ lives encompass much more than the time they spend at work. To help them maintain a healthy work/life balance, we’ve compiled a generous benefits package, including: medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life insurance, flexible spending account, matching 401(k), paid time off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement and referral bonuses.

We’ve also incorporated unique benefits like our volunteer program where employees are provided PTO for giving their time to a non-profit of their choice. Healthy employees are productive employees so we also have a comprehensive wellness program that includes onsite fitness centers and classes or discounted gym memberships, free health screenings, free flu shots, and more.

Data Scientist

Data Scientist utilizes their analytical, statistical and programming skills to collect, analyze and interpret large datasets and develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges. This position requires the individual to be very analytical, methodical and have a passion to work with large amounts of data.

Essential Functions
Collaborate across the business to understand IT and business constraints.
Understand new data sources and process pipelines, and catalog/document them.
Acquire access to various databases, and other source systems such as SQL or graph databases, help to create data pipelines for more efficient and repeatable data science projects.
Apply statistical analysis and visualization techniques to various data, such as hierarchical clustering, T-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE), principal components analysis (PCA).
Generate hypotheses about the underlying mechanics of the business process. Test hypotheses using various quantitative methods.
Display drive and curiosity to understand the business process to its core.
Network with domain experts to better understand the business mechanics that generated the data.
Apply various ML (machine learning) and advanced analytics techniques to perform classification or prediction tasks, integrate domain knowledge into the ML solution; for example, from an understanding of financial risk, customer journey, quality prediction, sales, marketing.
Test ML models, such as cross-validation, A/B testing, bias and fairness.
Collaborate with ML operations (MLOps), data engineers, and IT to evaluate and implement ML deployment options.
Assist with integrating model performance management tools into the current business infrastructure. Assist with implementing champion/challenger test (A/B tests) on production systems.
Continuously monitor execution and health of production ML models.


Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math or related field.
0-2 years’ experience as a Data Scientist in a reputed organization.
Advanced Statistical Analysis skills. Should be familiar with SPSS or SAS or Emblem tools.

Job Description

Applied Systems, Inc., a worldwide leader in insurance technology, is currently searching for an Insurance Marketing Automation Specialist to facilitate the implementation and optimization of Applied’s Marketing Automation product for our clients, ensuring a smooth implementation and ongoing successful utilization. The Insurance Marketing Automation Specialist interacts with the customer to create a shared sense of direction and establish a trusted working relationship. During the implementation cycle and beyond, services are provided to ensure Applied’s products are fully functional, and remain a value-add, within the customer’s organization.

Responsibilities
Coordinate entire project lifecycle with each customer; accurately assess client needs, identifying any unique priorities of the customer and determining appropriate implementation path between “standard” and “customized”
Develop and maintain implementation project plans for each agency deployment, revising to meet changing needs and requirements
Handle “customized” projects including but not limited to, applying knowledge of industry best practices, drafting and submitting statements of work (SOW), and providing consulting services as outlined in the SOW
Communicate project information, including difficult/sensitive information, to customer, team, and management
Assist with development of training materials, consulting documentation and end user resources through collaboration with internal teams
Manage customer expectations against industry marketing benchmarks for what is considered successful outcomes, such as open rates, sales conversions, etc.
Serve as a Subject Matter Expert to share information between customers and various departments at Applied
Maintain advanced knowledge of product functionality, keep current on insurance trends/legislation, and participate in ongoing product readiness efforts
Utilize OpenAir to effectively manage Services deliverables, record work effort, etc.

Qualifications For This Job
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
2-3 years’ experience in marketing automation, general marketing, or lead generation
Knowledge of group insurance and employee benefits
Property & casualty/risk management knowledge a plus
2-3 years’ experience in software training, implementation and consulting or another related customer service field is a plus
Proven ability to build and cultivate positive client relationships
Motivated, self-starter individual willing to show their leadership potential and flexibility in developing process and documentation for newly defined role
Solid interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills; experience writing SOW’s a plus
Strong group facilitation skills as well as demonstrated skills in training, group/individual presentations, etc.
Ability to manage multiple projects with strong organization skills and detail orientation.
Strong general computer skills, including advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office business software
Intermediate to advanced skills in Internet technology and usage

Who We Are
LEADING GLOBAL PROVIDER OF CLOUD-BASED INSURANCE SOFTWARE - Applied Systems develops the top two Insurance Agency/Broker Management software products in the world. In addition, we also provide innovative mobile apps, Data Analytics, Customer Self-Service, Insurer Connectivity & Rating, eServicing, Benefits Design, and CRM software products. By automating the insurance lifecycle, Applied’s people and products enable millions of people around the world to safeguard and protect what matters most.
CLOUD SOLUTIONS & PROFESSIONAL SERVICES - We offer cloud solutions, implementation and education services, 24x7 technical support, and consulting services that are built specifically for our clients.
AWARD WINNING TECHNOLOGY - We have been voted the 2019 Best Cloud-Based Software Solutions Provider in the insurance industry (2019 Corporate Excellence Awards), the 2019 Digital Service Provider of the Year (Corporate Insider) and are ranked #56 in the Cloud Top 500 report for the largest cloud application vendors in the world (Apps That Run the World).
GOOGLE’S INVESTMENT IN APPLIED - Google/CapitalG made a minority investment in Applied that will spur AI, machine learning, and digital marketing innovation in the global insurance industry.
CLIENTS - We provide technology to over 160k users within insurance agencies, brokerages, and carriers throughout the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland.
EMPLOYEES - Applied currently has 1,700+ employees across the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland.

Company Culture & Perks
JOIN A GREAT TEAM - We believe that success comes from a dynamic working environment that offers professionals an opportunity to grow and succeed alongside extraordinary people. We encourage idea sharing, problem solving, and teamwork in our environment.
RELAXED DRESS CODE - Applied allows for a relaxed dress code where jeans are permitted; we call this “Dress for your Day”!
FUN PARTIES & PERKS - Fun perks are a staple at Applied, including holiday parties with games and contests, summer celebrations employee appreciation events, art contests, employee discount programs, free bagel and fruit on Tuesdays, and more!
OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCEMENT - We are a growing company that offers career opportunities, and not just “another job”. Applied believes in growing our employees and promoting from within, offering many opportunities for professional advancement along the way!
CAREER STABILITY & LONGEVITY - Our average employee tenure is 14 years!
CULTURE OF RECOGNITION - Applied provides a culture of employee recognition with our Circle of Excellence program, and our internal social network recognition program.
APPLIED CARES - We have a culture that embraces and promotes volunteerism. Applied encourages our employees to help local charities and communities through the ‘Applied Cares’ program

Benefits & Rewards
BENEFITS FROM DAY ONE - Applied offers Medical, Rx, Dental, Vision, Virtual Doctors’ Appointments, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Accounts, Critical Illness, Group Accident, and Wellness Incentives to ensure employees are covered from day one.
FINANCIAL PEACE OF MIND - In addition to wellness benefits, Applied offers traditional and Roth 401k options, with employer match. Accidental Death & Dismemberment, Short and Long Term Disability, and Business Travel Accident insurance are also offered.
WORKLIFE BALANCE - There is more to life than work: that is why Applied offers benefits to help balance your work and home life. We offer competitive paid vacation time, personal/sick time, paid holidays, paid parental leave, volunteer time off, and a free day off for your birthday!
TO LEARN MORE
