The IBM North America Global Markets team is seeking highly talented individuals to fill a consultative, client-focused, relationship apprenticeship role.

At IBM, we’re motivated by more than just selling solutions. We want our clients to succeed. Our clients have the future in mind and your job is to help them get there. As part of IBM’s sales team, you will work with clients as they transform organizations and disrupt entire industries. As an IBMer, you will have access to the entire organization to team with as you develop creative ideas that help clients build the world they envision.

As a Technical Solution Seller Apprentice, you will work to build skills to actively:
Engage clients to develop trust and credibility
Help clients of all sizes and markets grow their businesses by solving strategic and tactical business problems with IBM’s proven cognitive and cloud technology solutions
Demonstrate consultative sales techniques, technology solution knowledge and industry expertise to influence client decisions, add new value and meet immediate and long-term business requirements
Engage client decision makers to drive alignment and consensus on IBM solutions via social, phone or in-person interactions
Identify potential new buyers and solution opportunities within the client organizations using IBM tools and other social business resources
Collaborate with IBM sales, technical, executive, product development, financial, and other support resources to deliver extraordinary client engagements
Continuously maintain and grow skills and knowledge in consultative sales, technical solutions and industry applications, applying expertise to demonstrate IBM’s thought leadership during client engagements

This position requires a challenger mentality and a real passion for client success, sales achievement, and daily collaboration with clients and other IBM teammates. You may work with any of the following business units: Analytics, Business Partners, Cloud, Global Finance, Internet of Things, Security, Services, Systems Hardware, Talent & Collaboration Solutions, Watson Customer Engagement. You may work in one of the following markets: Communication, Distribution, Federal, Financial Services, Industrial or Public.

What is an Apprenticeship?
IBM Apprenticeship is an “earn while you learn” training program. IBM Apprenticeship Program is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor (DOL). Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.

During the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been outlined to ensure you are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role. You will be able to learn and grow at your own pace, but we expect most apprentices will complete their learning within 18 months. Once you graduate and receive your certificate from our apprentice program, you will be eligible to apply to available full-time roles at IBM.  

Who you are
An apprenticeship is about learning. We’re seeking candidates who have the following requirements, but we know you’re just getting your career started, and we’re committed to helping you learn and grow. If you are a highly curious individual, with a passion for client success and strong desire to win, you’re exactly the type of candidate we’re looking for.  

To be successful, you need:
Aptitude to learn and use innovative selling technologies (e.g., analytics, social media) to network, engage clients, identify new business opportunities, and translate business requirements into technology solutions
Conversant and knowledgeable about technology, trends and how technology is being applied to address business challenges
Team collaboration and leadership
Motivation to accomplish sales and business objectives
Professional verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
Empathy and skills to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction

What’s the experience?  
As an apprentice, you'll join with other apprentices in a local cohort. You'll go through the program together, learning about IBM and the skills you'll be attaining throughout your apprenticeship. Then, you'll work with your managers and mentors to progress through your personal skills roadmap, learning and demonstrating new knowledge and competencies through hands-on application with your project teams. You'll complete milestones along the way, earning digital credentials to validate your skills, and will come back together with other apprentices to participate in on-going training and development focused on your professional and technical skills. Best of all, you are a contributing member of your team, putting forward ideas, taking on responsibilities and making choices about how you get the job done just like any other IBMer.

This role is open for the following locations: Atlanta, Bethesda, Chicago, Coppell, Dallas, Herndon, Littleton, New York City, San Francisco, Washington D.C,

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship. No relocation is available for this position.

Description

Enterprise Account Developer

Location: Salt Lake City, UT

The NICE inContact Enterprise Account Developer is responsible for generating new business opportunities and getting in touch with key stakeholders to set up discovery calls for our enterprise sales team. Enterprise Account Developers utilize professional sales skills to investigate prospective clients’ company structure, industry positioning, and any other relevant information. This information is used to penetrate the company by setting up a discovery call between the regional District Sales Manager (DSM) and the prospect with the intent of discovering a sales opportunity. They will hold a quota for the number of opportunities generated within their assigned territory and for the number of discovery calls set up within a given month. They will be assigned a mentor when they begin and once they have attained tenure in their position will be responsible for acting as a mentor for the new Enterprise Account Developers.

As an Enterprise Account Developer, a Typical Day Might Include the Following:
Generate new business opportunities through prospecting into potential customers in the assigned territory aligned with Enterprise RVP.
Make calls to key prospects found during prospecting efforts and create enough value in NICE inContact's product suite to have them agree to a discovery conversation with a DSM with the intent of uncovering a sales opportunity.
Nurture a pipeline of prospects that are too early in the process or require nurturing in order to be ready to engage with them when their timeline for a purchase arises.
Effectively and efficiently log leads and sales interactions in the NICE inContact contact management software tools.
Meet or exceed Discovery Call and Opportunity Creation quotas as defined by management.
Maintain functional knowledge of current and future NICE inContact products and services offered.
Interact frequently with assigned territory sales team to ensure they stay engaged in the prospecting efforts and make decisions on how to penetrate key accounts.
Attend meetings and trainings as required to maintain a high level of constantly improving skills in prospecting.
Act as mentor and assist sales leadership as necessary for new Enterprise Account Developers.
Participate in other lead generation campaigns as defined by management.
Works with moderate supervision with much latitude for independent judgment.

To Land This Gig You'll Need
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Management, Communications or similar field or equivalent work experience required.
4+ years of sales experience required with demonstrated success or equivalent education
1+ year lead generation, sales development, or equivalent experience.
Excellent targeted questioning skills.
Superior verbal communication skills and confidence in interacting with senior level executives.
Self-discipline and responsible time management.
Full-cycle sales process knowledge.
Advanced computer usage skills including prior usage of a CRM tool, preferably Salesforce.com.
Ability to present NICE inContact products when necessary.
Ability to find opportunities through tactical dialing and research.

Bonus Experience
Advanced skills in Data.com, Rainking, Toutapp, linkedin, and any other tools deemed appropriate by management.

ABOUT NICE inContact: NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s No. 1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

NICE is committed to provide an environment based on equal opportunity for all qualified applicants and employees. It is the policy of NICE to afford equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals, regardless of age, race, color, creed, religion, citizenship, ancestry, national origin, sex, gender, pregnancy, mental or physical disability, marital status, veteran status, service in the Armed Forces, sexual or affectional orientation, atypical hereditary cellular or blood traits, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic or sexual violence, and/or any other status protected by any applicable federal, state and/or local statute or regulation.

Position Title:Visiting Assistant/Associate Professor of Information Systems and Business Campus:Portland City, State:Portland, ME Department:Business Administration - PBUS Bargaining Unit:AFUM Salary Band/Wage Band:N/A Work Schedule:academic year Statement of Job: The Department of Business Administration at the University of Southern Maine seeks to fill a visiting position at the rank of Assistant or Associate Professor in Information Systems and Business Analytics. The appointment is for Spring 2020 and also the academic year 20-21. For more information about the undergraduate and graduate programs in the School of Business, please visit our website at usm.maine.edu/sb . Responsibilities include: teaching introductory management information systems and business analytics courses; teaching upper-level business analytics courses in a new undergraduate major; teaching and developing face-to-face and online courses; applied research and professional development in areas of specialization; University service, in the context of collaborative relationships within the university and the external business community; advising undergraduate business students; We live our USM Service Promise Student Focused Every Day and we are looking for a faculty member who understands that promise and supports our values: Respect & Care, Integrity, Equity and Responsiveness. We are the University of Everyone – committed to building a culturally diverse team of leaders, faculty and staff. We welcome applicants who are multi-lingual. Women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans are encouraged to apply. Qualifications: Candidates must have a Ph.D. in information systems, business analytics, or a related field from an AACSB accredited institution. ABD candidates will be considered. Candidates must have had an academic appointment at the assistant or associate level. Additionally, the candidate will have formal training in information systems, statistics, management science, or analytics. Preference will be given to candidates familiar with R. Other Information: The University of Southern Maine provides a highly competitive benefits package that includes: Paid Time Off (Holidays, Vacation, & Sick), Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Life Insurance, Short and Long Term Disability Insurance, Tuition Waiver Program for Employee & Dependents, a 403(b) Retirement Plan, and more. Benefits Information Summary Want to know more about employment, benefits and local resources? Our Employment webpage has additional information to help you become more familiar with developing a new career at USM as well as exploring everything the Greater Southern Maine area has to offer. To Apply: Materials must be submitted via "Apply for position." You will need to create an applicant profile and complete an application. You will need to upload a cover letter, a curriculum vitae, and a list of contact information for three references. A representative from USM will be at the AMCIS conference to answer questions and informally meet potential candidates. Interested parties should contact Hirotoshi Takeda at hirotoshi.takeda@maine.edu All required materials must be submitted by September 30, 2019. Appropriate background screening will be conducted for the successful candidate. The University of Southern Maine is an EEO/AA employer, and does not discriminate on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender expression, national origin, citizenship status, age, disability, genetic information or veteran’s status in employment, education, and all other programs and activities. For inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies: Equal Opportunity Office, 101 North Stevens Hall, University of Maine, Orono, ME 04469-5754, 207.581.1226, TTY 711 (Maine Relay System). Job Description

The Auto Club Group (ACG) provides membership, travel, insurance and financial services offerings to approximately 9 million members and customers across 11 states and 2 U.S. territories through the AAA, Meemic and Fremont brands. ACG belongs to the national AAA federation and is the second largest AAA club in North America.

Primary Duties And Responsibilities

Responsible for defining, developing, evolving and executing a clearly defined strategy for Digital Marketing Campaigns and communications that supports ACG business sales goals and growth, and enhances brand equity and awareness across our membership/club, insurance and travel business. Directs, organizes, staffs, trains and oversees all digital marketing operations to achieve our corporate objectives centered on sales, growth, profitability and visibility. Creates, manages, coordinates and executes all marketing strategies and implements tactical plans across business lines.

Defines strategy and leads execution of Omni-channel Marketing Attribution and Channel mix modeling approach to optimize acquisition-retention-nurturing. Leads the way in defining key success metrics and supports business by using analytics to align Digital and non-digital marketing efforts to business metrics (growth, sales / online funnel, targeting / retargeting etc.)

Directs the formulation, communication and implementation of marketing strategy for insurance, membership and travel. Leverages business and industry knowledge along with consumer insight to direct marketing execution of tactics to achieve Insurance, Membership and Travel goals and objectives. Collaborates with channel experts, legal and compliance to drive digital marketing effectiveness in accordance with all laws and corporate guidelines. Builds and protects the AAA Masterbrand and all sub brands. Ensures the most efficient and effective utilization of all Insurance, Membership and Travel digital marketing resources. Builds relationships with Insurance, Membership and Travel senior business leadership.

Acts as liaison between Corporate Management and the Digital Marketing Department to ensure dissemination of information and necessary cooperative action.

Represents ACG on various industry committees.

Supervisory Responsibilities

Leads a team of Marketing managers, professionals and support staff with a focus on transitioning to digital marketing platforms to reach organizational goals.

Preferred Qualifications

MBA or other advanced degree preferred. Experience developing and executing Digital marketing attribution approach and Omni-channel marking mix optimization Work Environment:

Works in a temperature-controlled office environment. Occasional (up to 25%) travel required with exposure to road hazards and temperature extremes.

Bachelor’s degree from a four-year university in Marketing, Business Administration or a related area. Experience:
8 years developing, evolving and executing digital marketing campaigns and communications strategies.
Experience working within a marketing business intelligence environment.
Experience analyzing strategic and tactical marketing objectives and campaigns.
Creating, managing, and executing marketing strategies and tactical plans

Owning and executing a wide variety of engaging digital marketing projects to drive member awareness and build new member pipeline
Delivering proven results as demonstrated by sales growth, profitability and visibility initiatives

Working closely with Sales to analyze top lead sources

Problem analysis and decision making
Organization and planning

Business relationship marketingKnowledge and Skills:

Job Title: Director of Inside Sales and Market Intelligence

It’s your turn to grow the business AND your own success. We’re hiring a Director of Inside Sales and Market Intelligence who can lead a team of Inside Sales Managers and Market Intelligence Specialists and the retention strategy to build meaningful connections and connect customers to Best-in-Class solutions. As the industry leader with dominant market share across all our products and service offerings, CSC provides the opportunity to learn from the best and gives you the tools you need to succeed.

As Director of Inside Sales and Market Intelligence, you’ll be an important part of what works.

Your Days May Include

Your primary responsibility will be managing the Inside Sales Community Direct and the Market Intelligence teams to ensure the use professional selling skills and the Company’s systems and processes to drive revenue, execute customer acquisition tactics, increase the account base, acquire new leads and earn a premium return on our investment. This position will have thorough understanding of overall business including market trends and analytics and will provide consulting and interpretation of market and consumer/customer research data to the organization.
Providing leadership and management guidance on the delivery of key sales and business initiatives.Developing specific sales strategies to achieve telephonic sales performance metrics.
Overseeing team assignments and prioritizing all new and renewal accounts.
Management of the day-to-day selling activities of the team.
Management of team activities against budget forecasts, revisions, capital reports, and capital/pipeline management.
Partnering with Branches to ensure alignment of sales and operations efforts.
Executing targeted monthly outbound sales campaigns.
Identifying and qualifying high value prospects.
Managing team goals by accurately tracking progress in CRM solution.
Recruit, hire, and manage assigned team; delegate duties and assign/schedule work to meet deadlines
Establish team and individual employee goals
Manage employee performance; support employee development and provide training as needed
Ensuring customer follow up via literature, email, call or appointment.
Providing integrated marketing analytical solutions across customers and channels, contributing to in-market action plans.
Developing and implement market research plans and relationships to market research suppliers/partners.
Developing business intelligence reports.
Driving deep consumer/customer understanding.
What it means to Be Part of What Works

How we do things at CSC is just as important as what we do. Our values empower every team member to provide the highest level of service to our customers and live their full potential. Our core values are a part of what differentiates us as Best in Class.
Safety Awareness
Customer Focus
Integrity, Trust, & Respect
Drives Engagement
Teamwork & Collaboration
Follows Through on Commitments
In this role, you’ll need:
Bachelor’s degree in Business; or 5-7 years of previous experience in a service industry with focus on cross functional team approach; or equivalent combination of education and experience; master’s degree preferred.
5+ years of previous experience in Inside sales or directly related experience with B2B sales
Experience and demonstrated success negotiating service agreements.
Ability to prioritize opportunities and execute an enterprise account plan accordingly with dependability and ownership
A thorough understanding of C-level client executive working challenges and relationship strategies a plus
Extraordinary critical thinking skills with the ability to work within a matrix structure and in cross functional teams
Exemplary communication skills (verbal, written and client facing presentation)
Full PC literacy including the customer relationship management system (SFDC) and MS office
Travel - up to 10% of the time
The CSC ServiceWorks Story

At CSC, we’re in the business of making things work, for our team members, our clients, and our consumers. We’re the leading provider of commercial laundry services and air-vending solutions throughout the United States, Canada, and Europe. Our Best in Class team of 3,000 dedicated professionals benefit from work that’s steady (but never boring), time to enjoy what matters, appreciation and rewards in return for hard work and accountability, and support in growing a fulfilling career. Our work takes us to apartment, condominium, education, hotel and hospitality, and convenience and gas environments around the world. CSC is built on a company legacy that goes back to 1927, and today, we make life easier for over 40 million residents and consumers, property managers, and owners every day.

CSC ServiceWorks is a dynamic, global leader in laundry solutions and air vending services. We have over 3,000 team members who are driven by one goal — being best-in-class. Job Summary

Analyzes and synthesizes complex information in support of System strategic, operational and quality projects. Collaborates with facility executives, service line leaders and operational managers and translates business needs into analytic and reporting strategies through the development, execution and resourcing of routine and project specific plans for analytics delivery.

Essential Functions
Assists in the direction and execution of multiple, concurrent projects with regular supervision from leadership.

THIS POSITION IS LOCATED IN DALLAS, TEXAS

As the foundation of our Revenue Accounting team, the revenue accounting analyst is responsible for recording and maintaining revenue and related accounts at USACS. The revenue accounting analyst is involved in monthly estimates, forecasts, analysis and annual budget preparation. The position will be directly involved in improving model performance and accuracy though design input working with Business Analytics, Accounting, Finance and Operations leadership.

Position Responsibilities
Record monthly revenue using key indicators as provided by the Business Analytics department.
Validate and challenge past and current revenue projections at payor and site level.
Work with payer contracting team to analyze impact of new contracts, tax ID consolidations and other changes to specific locations.
Collaborate with operations teams to understand what impacts revenue and provide indicators of changing revenue markets.
Contribute to the revenue and business analytics team in developing and improving upon the revenue model.
Work collaboratively with groups across various geographies and provide value-added analysis to business leaders.
Develop, validate, challenge and explain key trends, indicators and performance.
Articulate assumptions, risks, opportunities and variables in the revenue projection at monthly and ad hoc meetings with Accounting, Finance and Operations leadership.
Communicate techniques, assumptions and models verbally and in written format.
Reconciles transactions by comparing and correcting data.
Increases productivity through process improvement (data gathering, models, schedules)
Protects operations by keeping financial information confidential.


Education And Experience

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or another related field. MBA a plus.
1 - 3 years of related experience in finance or accounting.
Health care industry experience required.
Strong computer knowledge and skills including Advanced MS Excel and PowerPoint.

Required Skills And Abilities
Excellent knowledge of GAAP
Knowledge of revenue recognition in the healthcare industry.
Strong analytical and financial modeling skills
Strategic thinking
Excellent presentation skills
Ability to influence and persuade
Knowledge of ERP systems and related technologies
Excellent time management and organizational ability
Ability to multitask and meet constant deadlines

Supervisory Responsibility: None

Travel Requirements: Occasional travel will be required

Where do you belong?

Your career is more than just a job, it's part of your life. Whether you prefer hospital medicine, emergency medicine, or non-clinical support positions, at USACS you'll feel a sense of connection, working with clinicians and office staff who share your interests and values.

US Acute Care Solutions employs emergency room clinical staff throughout the United States with 4,000 employees nationwide. Our corporate office is located in North Canton, Ohio and Dallas, Texas. Come check out our high growth healthcare organization that staffs both corporate and clinical opportunities.

The University of Maryland, Baltimore School of Dentistry (UMSOD) has an opportunity for a Financial Analyst*as part of the Financial Shared Services team. The mission of the Financial Shared Services team (FSS) is to continue to strive for excellence by actively partnering with Department Chairs and their support staff to provide oversight, guidance, and information in all financial activities. The FSS Financial Analyst will work under the supervision and guidance of the FSS Manager and work with the team and Department Chairs by proactively building relationships within each of the departments in a spirit that encourages a culture of collaboration, knowledge sharing, accountability, diversity and civility.
UMB offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to eligible employees. This position receives an annual leave package that includes accrual of 22 vacation days, 14 floating and observed holidays, 15 sick days, and 3 personal days; comprehensive health insurance and retirement options; professional learning and development opportunities; and tuition remission for employees and their dependents at any of the University System of Maryland schools.
_Essential Functions:_*
Support critical analyst role during budget preparation periods. Engage with Department Chairs, Research Administration, and Dean’s Office to review and establish Institutional Baseline Salaries according to UMB and UMB SOD policies. Establish operating budgets for each Department.
Develop monthly Department financial performance reports and provide variance analysis, especially in regards to labor and impact of grant activity. Monitor all monthly activity to ensure proper funding profiles are established and followed.
Initiate and lead discussions with Department Chairs to review annual operating budgets against actual performance on a monthly basis. Identify early warning triggers and support the Chair to develop remediation plans when necessary. On a monthly basis review:
Analysis of actual and encumbered expenses
Revised Projection
Comparison of projections to budget and prior year performance
Ensure UMB and UMB SOD compliance in all transaction related activities, including general ledger maintenance, procurement, travel and other financial related tasks
Manage budget progress updates via budget amendment process and funding profile updates
Establish relationship with payroll to understand processes and procedures to ensure accurate and timely accounting of and payment to personnel
Conduct behavior and interactions with others that display behaviors and characteristics that are reflective of the University’s core values. Establish effective relationships throughout the School of Dentistry based on those core values.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Education:* Bachelors in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, or business related field.
Experience:* Three (3) years of progressive experience in accounting, budgeting, auditing, data management, or data analysis with one (1) year of experience in financial analysis, management accounting, budgeting, or auditing.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Solid foundation and working knowledge of basic accounting principles.
Experience with establishing and monitoring budget performance, financial reporting, and variance analytics.
Willingness to encourage open dialogue across multiple levels within the School of Dentistry to support an environment of transparency and collaboration.
Desire to drive collective competence and team spirit through universal accountability.
Ability to embrace self-directed change when necessary to support University core values.
Hiring Range:*Commensurate with education and experience.

Role Overview

Otis is seeking a Data Scientist who will have responsibility for exploring various operational, product and customer data sources and leading data analytics studies and application development for internal users. Join Otis’ team of data scientists to analyze Otis operational, passenger traffic, equipment sensor and market data and to define strategy, improve performance, recognize latent trends, and identify market growth opportunities.

Essential Responsibilities
Determine and apply the right analysis method for a given business problem.
Work with legacy data systems and integrate data analysis accordingly.
Develop and deliver data analytics applications for use for end-users in operations, engineering and marketing.
Conduct data analysis exploration to uncover insights and trends.
Work with stakeholders to understand how to integrate with and transform business processes.
Work with internal customers to gather and document requirements.
Build common platforms and applications
Define data warehousing strategy in the context of legacy data systems.
Manage data quality issues.
Interpret data analyses.

Education/Certifications
Advanced degree with5-7+ years’ experience in Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or comparable field with strong focus on Machine Learning and Data Analytics.

Basic Qualifications
Background on methodologies at the forefront of Machine Learning and Data Analytics.
Deep knowledge on the applicability of different data analytics methodologies.
Proficiency with analytics tools including: data warehousing and querying tools, statistical scripting/programming languages and libraries, data mining, dashboarding/visualization and business intelligence.
Proficiency with integrating analyses from legacy data sources and building data quality measures.
Ability to interpret results from complex technical analyses and present results in a form that is understood and actionable by operations, product or marketing stakeholders.
Excellent team, interpersonal and presentation skills required to lead and manage projects and communicate at all levels of the organization.
A methodical and logical approach to work, as well as problem-solving abilities and confidence when working with data in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent command of English, both spoken and written.

Preferred Qualifications
PhD preferred with experience in Operations Research, Mathematics, Computer Science or comparable field
Experience with commercially-available and publicly-available toolchains and libraries.
Experience with developing tools integrated with business processes and legacy databases.
Experience with developing data analytics and visualization applications that are integrated with legacy database systems.
Experience with mediating data quality issues including measuring data quality, determining sources of quality issues and solving data quality issues.
Experience with developing tools and analyses that are used by end-users not familiar with Machine Learning.

Otis, a United Technologies company, is the world leader in reliable, efficient and technologically advanced elevators, escalators and people-moving systems. Our revolutionary Gen2® elevators, energy-saving ReGen™ drives and NCE “green” escalator have clearly set the industry standard for innovation, safety, and performance. More than 2.4 million Otis elevators and escalators are currently in operation throughout 200 different countries. We are proud to have a global team that continues to rise to the challenges of a fast-moving company. Together, the people of Otis are creating new ideas and opportunities by collaborating across time zones, geographies and cultures. So just imagine where we can take you!

About Us

Valen Analytics is a rapidly expanding advanced data and predictive analytics company headquartered in downtown Denver. Valen’s state-of-the-art analytics and predictive modeling products are built on Valen’s unique industry-wide consortium data platform, specifically designed for property and casualty insurance carriers. If you want to help build an industry-changing company and you thrive in a fast-paced environment where the only rule is to WOW customers, colleagues and shareholders, then we encourage you to submit your resume. This is not a job. It is an opportunity to advance your career by helping to build an innovative, growing and highly respected organization. The right candidate will be entrepreneurial, driven and passionate about being successful and absolutely committed to making Valen successful.

We are currently looking to fill the following position in our Denver, CO office:

Applied Analytics, Solution Architect

As an Applied Analytics Solution Architect, you'll be a subject matter expert (SME) leading our client work, bringing both deep understanding of the business of insurance and the analytics that can drive success. SMEs use their knowledge and creative thinking to develop solutions to business problems and are experts at communicating those solutions to diverse groups with varying perspectives and levels of technical knowledge. Valen SMEs have the responsibility to act as thought leaders within Valen and in the larger insurance space, helping traditional insurers update their capabilities to enhance their existing competitive positioning, and new entrants build tools to support their business models.

What You'll Be Doing
Partner with carriers to understand their business and develop analytics designed to solve critical business problems. Work with data science teams to build advanced analytics that aid insurers in optimizing decision-making along the insurance value chain.
Act as a translation layer between business and analytic / modeling teams, and work with technical implementation teams to execute an approach to ensure the application will be used.
Present results to various levels of leadership and influences key decisions that have business unit or enterprise impact.
Utilize industry best practices to quantify individual risk and aggregate exposures.
Oversee the development of complex systems and programs that measure individual and aggregate risk exposures.
Apply innovative and scientific/quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make recommendations to answer business objectives and drive change.
Act as an industry thought leader, understanding current industry issues and trends and educating on the opportunities for advanced analytics.
Direct and/or perform a variety of advanced statistical analyses including data mining and actuarial research techniques. Identify & creatively use conventional and non-conventional data sources independently.
Direct multiple complex research projects simultaneously as well as large and complex initiatives. Analyze/interpret data, draw business inferences and clearly articulate findings for target audience.
Proactively maintain an understanding of industry developments, market conditions, and jurisdictional issues.
Direct industry analysis and benchmarking studies. Adjust strategy as appropriate to anticipate, respond to, and manage trends.
Develop and maintain effective relationships with business partners.
Direct the development of new approaches to business problems.
Partner with peers across the company to ensure consistency and alignment where appropriate.

What You'll Need
Education Required: BS/BA
Education Preferred: MS/MA/MBA
Experience Required: 5+ years of experience in P&C insurance industry
Experience Preferred:
3+ years in underwriting or as a product or LOB analyst
BOP, Commercial Auto, GL/Package and Workers’ Compensation
Underwriting, rating, and rate-making experience in personal auto, multi-peril homeowners
Claims
Product Management or product analyst experience a plus
Competencies

Technical
Solid familiarity with actuarial rate-making procedures, exposure, premium and loss types, premium and loss adjustments and modifiers, loss cost multipliers, experience rating, policy limits and reinsurance, rating bureau provisions, loss costs and development factors, filing process and content, data reporting, statutory and regulatory knowledge.
Working familiarity with SAS, R, Matlab, Python or similar platforms.
Consulting and client engagement/ownership
Management consulting experience a plus
Creativity, developing practical, implementable solutions for challenging business problems
Capable listener, identifying client business problems and synthesizing into a delivery solution
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, demonstrating the ability to present predictive analytic concepts to the executive management of our clients
Contract development
Relationship management
Project management/oversight/budgeting/contracting knowledge and skill sets
Project management discipline and tools
Agile, Design Thinking, and Kanban product and project management experience a plus

Other Pluses Include
3+ years consulting company experience with end-to-end client ownership
CPCU or actuarial certifications or exam passage
Predictive modeling knowledge and/or exposure to advanced analytic techniques (e.g., machine learning / deep learning)
Knowledge of reinsurance
Data, Reporting, R, SAS, SQL and programming skills

Product Overview

Valen is an advanced analytics company for property and casualty insurers. We build data consortiums, predictive models, data products and a modeling deployment platform that help insurance companies make more informed decisions for customer acquisition, pricing, claims and handling. Valen’s InsureRight Platform includes:
Manage: A portfolio management tool for executives and underwriting managers
Predict: A risk selection and pricing tool for underwriters
Platform: A deployment platform that allows insurers to deploy, monitor and measure models in production
Valen primarily serves the following insurance lines of business: workers’ compensation, commercial auto, commercial package, business owner policy (BOP), personal auto and homeowners.

What You’ll Get

RTD EcoPass | Collaborative Culture | Competitive Salary

Flexible Hours | Growth Opportunities | Generous Time Off

Comprehensive Benefits | 401K Matching | Great Location

The IBM North America Global Markets team is seeking highly talented individuals to fill a consultative, client-focused, relationship apprenticeship role.

At IBM, we’re motivated by more than just selling solutions. We want our clients to succeed. Our clients have the future in mind and your job is to help them get there. As part of IBM’s sales team, you will work with clients as they transform organizations and disrupt entire industries. As an IBMer, you will have access to the entire organization to team with as you develop creative ideas that help clients build the world they envision.

As a Technical Solution Seller Apprentice, you will work to build skills to actively:
Engage clients to develop trust and credibility
Help clients of all sizes and markets grow their businesses by solving strategic and tactical business problems with IBM’s proven cognitive and cloud technology solutions
Demonstrate consultative sales techniques, technology solution knowledge and industry expertise to influence client decisions, add new value and meet immediate and long-term business requirements
Engage client decision makers to drive alignment and consensus on IBM solutions via social, phone or in-person interactions
Identify potential new buyers and solution opportunities within the client organizations using IBM tools and other social business resources
Collaborate with IBM sales, technical, executive, product development, financial, and other support resources to deliver extraordinary client engagements
Continuously maintain and grow skills and knowledge in consultative sales, technical solutions and industry applications, applying expertise to demonstrate IBM’s thought leadership during client engagements

This position requires a challenger mentality and a real passion for client success, sales achievement, and daily collaboration with clients and other IBM teammates. You may work with any of the following business units: Analytics, Business Partners, Cloud, Global Finance, Internet of Things, Security, Services, Systems Hardware, Talent & Collaboration Solutions, Watson Customer Engagement. You may work in one of the following markets: Communication, Distribution, Federal, Financial Services, Industrial or Public.

What is an Apprenticeship?
IBM Apprenticeship is an “earn while you learn” training program. IBM Apprenticeship Program is an official registered apprenticeship recognized by the Department of Labor (DOL). Every graduate of a Registered Apprenticeship program receives a nationally-recognized credential from the DOL.

During the apprenticeship duration, you will be required to complete specific learning hours and on the job training that has been outlined to ensure you are developing the skills and competencies essential to the role. You will be able to learn and grow at your own pace, but we expect most apprentices will complete their learning within 18 months. Once you graduate and receive your certificate from our apprentice program, you will be eligible to apply to available full-time roles at IBM.  

Who you are
An apprenticeship is about learning. We’re seeking candidates who have the following requirements, but we know you’re just getting your career started, and we’re committed to helping you learn and grow. If you are a highly curious individual, with a passion for client success and strong desire to win, you’re exactly the type of candidate we’re looking for.  

To be successful, you need:
Aptitude to learn and use innovative selling technologies (e.g., analytics, social media) to network, engage clients, identify new business opportunities, and translate business requirements into technology solutions
Conversant and knowledgeable about technology, trends and how technology is being applied to address business challenges
Team collaboration and leadership
Motivation to accomplish sales and business objectives
Professional verbal, written, and interpersonal skills
Empathy and skills to achieve high levels of customer satisfaction

What’s the experience?  
As an apprentice, you'll join with other apprentices in a local cohort. You'll go through the program together, learning about IBM and the skills you'll be attaining throughout your apprenticeship. Then, you'll work with your managers and mentors to progress through your personal skills roadmap, learning and demonstrating new knowledge and competencies through hands-on application with your project teams. You'll complete milestones along the way, earning digital credentials to validate your skills, and will come back together with other apprentices to participate in on-going training and development focused on your professional and technical skills. Best of all, you are a contributing member of your team, putting forward ideas, taking on responsibilities and making choices about how you get the job done just like any other IBMer.

This role is open for the following locations: Atlanta, Bethesda, Chicago, Coppell, Dallas, Herndon, Littleton, New York City, San Francisco, Washington D.C,

This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship. No relocation is available for this position.

System Administrator (Analyst I) - About The Job

If you agree that climate change is one of the biggest issues facing the world today and want to be able to do something contribute to climate change mitigation, then working for Nexant’s Business Processing team is for you.

The Nexant Business Processing Technology team’s goal is to increase the efficiency, speed, and quality of application processing while providing an exceptional customer experience. We work to configure and maintain instances of Nexant’s iEnergy/DSM Central, which is used by our Data Specialists to process applications and provides a front end for consumers to apply for rebates. Additionally, we support the ancillary systems that are used by the Business Processing group. We process demand side energy efficiency applications helping consumers and businesses reduce their carbon footprint. Leave work every day knowing that you, personally, have made an impact on the world.

Nexant is looking for a System Administrator (Analyst I) to maintain, upgrade and manage our software, hardware and networks. Resourcefulness is a necessary skill in this role. You should be able to diagnose and resolve problems quickly. You should also have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary teams and users. This position will support under the Utility Services and Rebate Processing group in our Murray, UT office.

Duties And Responsibilities

Build, configure, troubleshoot, diagnose and correct software and hardware enhancements, application deployments and infrastructure upgrades in accordance with DevOps and ITIL practices.
Perform all patching, scanning, and imaging in accordance with standard Change Management and Government processes.
Add, remove, or update user account information in various systems.
Perform project lead responsibilities for all new technologies which may require interfacing with customers, VIPs, Business Process users, and participate in weekly status meetings.
Provide hands-on system administration support, system maintenance and operations support, field questions pertaining to user inquiries/present solutions, and ensure timely resolution of all Service Requests.
Create and maintain continuity documentation, and manage Licensing for software systems.
Recommend software and hardware enhancements, and verify proper system operation through observation to detect errors.
Ensure Business Processing System uptime during business hours and when Business Processing Systems go down, investigate and resolve within defined SLAs.

Work with 3rd party groups to ensure support and resolution of Business Processing Systems
Process Onboarding/Offboarding and update asset databases
Process flat files
Work with knowledge management to document support of all systems.
All duties and responsibilities of a Technical Support Specialist
Other duties as assigned.

6 years of work experience, Bachelor's or technical degree plus 2 years of work experience, or a combination of education and work experience in IT, data analytics, database administration, or system administration.
Strong understanding of Excel formulas and logic.
Experience with problem management, incident resolution, and providing root cause analysis.
General understanding of troubleshooting, software, hardware, networks, etc.

Fluent in both written and verbal English. As well as excellent communication skills with clients, contractors, and all levels of internal employees.

Salary And Benefits (U.S.)

Nexant offers competitive salaries based on candidate's qualifications. Nexant also offers three weeks paid vacation per year, eleven paid holidays per year, a 401(k) plan with employee matching funds and an overall comprehensive benefits package.

About Nexant

Nexant is a globally recognized software, consulting and services leader that provides innovative solutions to utilities, energy enterprises, chemical companies and government entities worldwide. Founded in 2000 and headquartered in San Francisco, Nexant and its 500+ employees work from 32 global offices providing deep technical expertise and regional knowledge to improve customer engagement, boost operational efficiency, reduce costs and achieve superior business results.

CVS Health is looking for a talented and agile analytics professional to join the Retail Customer and Marketing Analytics team. This team is focused on enhancing the corporate understanding of the CVS Pharmacy patient and measuring communication initiatives across multiple channels..

The Marketing Analytics Advisor will focus on gaining deeper understanding of CVS Pharmacy customers and maximize the effectiveness of customer centric marketing strategies by leveraging advanced analytics. Key responsibilities will include analyzing patient behavior, developing and implementing test designs, building predictive analytics models, measuring the business impact of marketing programs, evaluating business trends and leveraging data to make business recommendations. Build predictive models in statistical programming tools (SAS, R) using advanced data science concepts (e.g., regression modeling, time series forecasting, classification, data clustering, advanced machine learning techniques)

Develop and recommend new digital KPIs that tie back to incremental offline behavior change
Evaluate Paid Search and Social partners and recommend in-campaign optimizations to drive incremental results
Develop and implement campaign test designs that will enable effective measurement and insight into efficacy of marketing programs
Develop and execute approaches to analyze information relating to patient behavior, including segmentation, migration, and valuation
Integrate consumer data from multiple internal and external sources to create awareness of business opportunities and support the development of new marketing initiatives
Produce scorecards and enhance customized reporting to enable better decision-making by internal teams

Job_Title: Data Scientist, Marketing and Analytics - Resort Sales and Marketing - Orlando
Job_Description:
Here at Universal Parks & Resorts™, you can enjoy an exciting culture where creating our unique Universal brand of thrilling experiences is a top priority. We are passionate about what we do and take pride in the exclusive ways we deliver fun.

Comprised of Universal Orlando Resort, Universal Studios Hollywood, Universal Studios Japan, Universal Studios Singapore, and a new destination coming in Beijing, China; we are proud to offer a universe of extraordinary opportunities. It takes a special kind of person to work at all of our destinations. We value individuals who know how to be part of a team, who embrace fun and are serious about their work. It takes hard work, dedication, knowledge and just the right amount of Universal spirit to open our doors of opportunity. We champion the power of cultural diversity and inclusion and continuously strive to maintain a team that is a reflection of our global audience.

Being a part of the Universal family also comes with extraordinary perks. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, career development, excellent growth opportunities, free park admission, complimentary passes, and more!

Join us if you want to collaborate, innovate, develop, and deliver the most compelling entertainment experiences imaginable that drive growth for the Universal brand around the world. Experience a workplace that will inspire you to be Bold! Apply today.

JOB SUMMARY : Lead, develop, and enhance the science of resort revenue management systems, pricing, and tools through data integration, advanced analytical modeling, and decision analyses. Develop hotel forecast models to incorporate into current forecasting environment. Oversee, provide direction, and guide the team to execute these initiatives.

Major Responsibilities
Validate, calibrate, and optimize the Revenue Management System assumptions and settings through the use of advanced analytical and statistical models.
Trouble shoot forecast and optimization anomalies in the Revenue Management System through the use of statistical and mathematical optimization models. Develop testing to detect and reduce anomalies.
Mine and collect data (both structured and unstructured) to detect patterns, opportunities, and insights that drive our business by utilizing SQL, Access, Excel, SAS, and other statistical programs.
Enhance resort pricing systems through the use of advanced demand and sensitivity analytics, and measure the impact of pricing decisions on profitability.
SCOPE: Develop Revenue Management models and solutions for revenue management system and tools to further enhance the profitability of Universal Orlando Resort Hotels.

EDUCATION: Master’s degree in Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics.

EXPERIENCE: Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in the field or in a related area.

Qualifications
Operating experience with revenue management systems.
Proven track record in creating advanced statistical modeling, particularly with forecasting and pricing model.
Experience in data analysis with heavy emphasis on data driven decision making and the ability to communicate and simplify complex concepts to leaders.
Proficiency in Tableau, SQL, and Advanced Excel skills required. R, Python, Java, and Oracle preferred.
Additional Information
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills
The ability to work through complex problems
Capable of communicating and expressing ideas clearly and concisely, in both written and oral formats.
Strong interpersonal, technical and presentation skills required.
Your talent, skills and experience will be rewarded with a competitive compensation package.

The Lead Data Scientist uses mathematics, statistics, modeling, business analysis, and technology to transform high volumes of complex data into advanced analytic solutions. The Lead Data Scientist works on problems of diverse scope and complexity ranging from moderate to substantial.

The Lead Clinical Data Science Translator has a strong intuitive grasp of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) as well as core product skills (strategy, roadmaps, prioritization, etc.). DSIMs help identify and prioritize the highest value applications for machine learning and do what it takes to make them successful. The DSIM, plans and executes the necessary AI/ML-driven process changes and initiatives necessary to deliver a complete solution to a stated business problem.

Owns key initiatives & deliverables especially in Data Science application development & deployment in cloud-based environments.
Act as an “external facing” business translator whose combined expertise in technology and AI enable the development of custom solutions
Partner with project and product managers to assemble a cross-functional team of data experts, data scientists, and technology experts to design and deliver a solution to meet a business need

Job_Title: Commercial Analytics Team Lead - Research & Development
Job_Description:
What We're About

We're creating an airline people love. It begins with each Alaska Airlines employee, bringing unique strengths and energy to our work in the air and on the ground. Every day, we go beyond what's expected and reach for the remarkable, together.

YOUR ROLE

Role Summary

The Commercial Analytics Team Lead - Research and Development is a subject matter expert in advanced modeling and/or forecasting at Alaska Airlines and Horizon Air. This role works on exciting projects that push the business forward, creates reporting and analysis, and maintains existing processes.

As a Commercial Analytics Team Lead, you should be a highly technical analyst who is motivated in leading people, projects, and ideas. You will manage your own complex projects with executive visibility, while developing team members through mentorship and training. You will work with the manager side by side, prioritizing the team's work as well as helping translate business questions into methodical action plans. You will be responsible for managing stakeholder relationships and ongoing project meetings, thinking critically about solving business problems and suggesting ideas for improvement.

Scope & Complexity

As an individual contributor, this lead role exercises considerable judgment to make decisions to tackle complex data analysis problems and projects. This role builds models and forecasts that enable the analytics team to create data driven solutions to business problems while supporting the development of others within the organization, both helping to develop the team and also supporting increased performance in stakeholder groups.

Key Duties
Promotes a high performance culture by motivating team members through mentoring and training.
Track projects to completion and assist newer analysts to ensure team success.
Own development and performance of company-wide models and forecasts, including the company's revenue forecast and customer segmentation model.
Lead regular meetings and project timelines to improve data-driven decision making processes, business optimizations, and predictions across the company.
Proactively identify opportunities to improve forecasts, models, and measurements methods in strategic and planning processes throughout the company.
Develop a deep understanding of the commercial airlines business to recommend ideas and solutions to give stakeholders what they need to be successful.
Define and develop KPIs, forecasts, and metrics to guide the business's strategic initiatives.
Develop strong collaborative working relationships across various workgroups (business, operational, technical).
Design and create tools, processes, and analyzes that assist the team and stakeholders in executing and measuring strategies on a recurring and adhoc basis.
Break down complex problems, create plans, and meet targets.
Communicate findings, develop solutions and provide deep insight to stakeholders in a concise and effective manner.
Adhere to a high standard of precision and quality control, ensure that reports and analyses are timely as well as accurate.
Maintain knowledge of all available data sources used in forecasting, modeling, and measurement of company initiatives (e-Comm, customer, flight etc.)

Job-Specific Skills, Exoerience & Education

Required
4 years of experience in advanced modeling, statistics, and optimization techniques including the use of said techniques with very large quantities of data to solve real-world business problems.
Bachelor's degree in business, math, economics, engineering or other fields of a technical nature.
Demonstrated success with peer leadership without direct reports through training and development of analysts or improving existing processes.
Experience managing ambiguous problems and converting into actionable timelines / plans through other teams.
Experience managing multiple projects through standard process.
Ability to work independently and proactively with business partners with minimal direction.
Excellent communication skills, including experience presenting to other groups and explaining complex ideas in an understandable manner to management.
Experience with open-ended and highly leveraged technical projects with hard deadlines.
Experience using software or tools on large sets of data to model and analyze complex problems.
Tableau (or other similar data visualization software) experience.
Experience in utilizing PowerPoint to present complex ideas to non-technical audiences.
SQL experience manipulating large data sets.
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office applications (including Excel, Word, PowerPoint) to organize aggregated data and to present complex ideas to non-technical audiences.


Preferred
Master's degree in business, math, economics, engineering or other fields of a technical nature.
1+ years airline industry experience.
Experience leading a team of analysts.
Experience working cross-functionally across various business groups.
Experience in airline revenue management, pricing, customer analytics, and/or demand modeling.
Experience using object oriented languages to process and perform statistics and/or optimization on large quantities of data.
1 year of airline industry experience.
Experience with Alteryx.

Job-Specific Leadership Expectations

Embody our values to own safety, do the right thing, be kind-hearted, deliver performance, and be remarkable.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

Horizon Air and Alaska Airlines are equal opportunity employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Horizon Air and Alaska Airlines will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with applicable Federal, State, and local laws.

Horizon Air and Alaska Airlines participate in E-Verify, a service of the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and Social Security Administration (SSA), where required.

Description

Enterprise Account Developer

Location: Salt Lake City, UT

The NICE inContact Enterprise Account Developer is responsible for generating new business opportunities and getting in touch with key stakeholders to set up discovery calls for our enterprise sales team. Enterprise Account Developers utilize professional sales skills to investigate prospective clients’ company structure, industry positioning, and any other relevant information. This information is used to penetrate the company by setting up a discovery call between the regional District Sales Manager (DSM) and the prospect with the intent of discovering a sales opportunity. They will hold a quota for the number of opportunities generated within their assigned territory and for the number of discovery calls set up within a given month. They will be assigned a mentor when they begin and once they have attained tenure in their position will be responsible for acting as a mentor for the new Enterprise Account Developers.

As an Enterprise Account Developer, a Typical Day Might Include the Following:
Generate new business opportunities through prospecting into potential customers in the assigned territory aligned with Enterprise RVP.
Make calls to key prospects found during prospecting efforts and create enough value in NICE inContact's product suite to have them agree to a discovery conversation with a DSM with the intent of uncovering a sales opportunity.
Nurture a pipeline of prospects that are too early in the process or require nurturing in order to be ready to engage with them when their timeline for a purchase arises.
Effectively and efficiently log leads and sales interactions in the NICE inContact contact management software tools.
Meet or exceed Discovery Call and Opportunity Creation quotas as defined by management.
Maintain functional knowledge of current and future NICE inContact products and services offered.
Interact frequently with assigned territory sales team to ensure they stay engaged in the prospecting efforts and make decisions on how to penetrate key accounts.
Attend meetings and trainings as required to maintain a high level of constantly improving skills in prospecting.
Act as mentor and assist sales leadership as necessary for new Enterprise Account Developers.
Participate in other lead generation campaigns as defined by management.
Works with moderate supervision with much latitude for independent judgment.

To Land This Gig You'll Need
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Management, Communications or similar field or equivalent work experience required.
4+ years of sales experience required with demonstrated success or equivalent education
1+ year lead generation, sales development, or equivalent experience.
Excellent targeted questioning skills.
Superior verbal communication skills and confidence in interacting with senior level executives.
Self-discipline and responsible time management.
Full-cycle sales process knowledge.
Advanced computer usage skills including prior usage of a CRM tool, preferably Salesforce.com.
Ability to present NICE inContact products when necessary.
Ability to find opportunities through tactical dialing and research.

Bonus Experience
Advanced skills in Data.com, Rainking, Toutapp, linkedin, and any other tools deemed appropriate by management.

ABOUT NICE inContact: NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s No. 1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

NICE is committed to provide an environment based on equal opportunity for all qualified applicants and employees. It is the policy of NICE to afford equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals, regardless of age, race, color, creed, religion, citizenship, ancestry, national origin, sex, gender, pregnancy, mental or physical disability, marital status, veteran status, service in the Armed Forces, sexual or affectional orientation, atypical hereditary cellular or blood traits, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic or sexual violence, and/or any other status protected by any applicable federal, state and/or local statute or regulation.

Business Group Highlights

Intelligence

The Intelligence group provides high-end systems engineering and integration products and services, data analytics and software development to national and military intelligence customers. Serving federal agencies and the Intelligence Community for more than 50 years, the Intelligence group helps our clients meet their mission needs by providing trusted advisors, leading-edge technologies, and innovative solutions.

Responsibilities

The position is supporting Perspecta's NUO contract. The contract covers all aspects of SETA support including architecture, systems engineering, business processes, program control, information security and operations support. The overall customer organization provides critical communication functions within the intelligence community. The program has evolved over the past 20 years and consists of a group of smaller projects that each use various communications paths and sets of resources. Each project is supported by a SETA team that works closely with development contractors and other government entities to develop mission systems that meet the ever growing needs for critical, secure communications. The NUO SETA team supports the program across all phases of develop, starting with capturing user requirements and transitioning all the way through deployment and operations.

Specific Program Responsibilities

The specific position responsibilities will include support to operations, working with users to understand their needs and requirements for projects related to planning and scheduling of communication systems, performing analysis to ensure the system and segment designs are meeting user needs, developing procedural updates for operations, addressing systems anomalies through technical investigations and working with development contractors. Other duties include technical facilitation and preparation for weekly engineering review boards, leading all related activities from a customer perspective, of key missions including leading site acceptance testing, end-to-end system tests and preparation and facilitation of period Operations Readiness Reviews (ORRs). Duties also include coordination between the customer, other government stakeholders and program office SETA, while working toward further integrating multiple systems into a single customer office and eventually into the same functional baseline. This position provides the government operations customer with technical support for all facets of mission operations, focused on flawless mission execution. This position does not require 24x7 support, but on occasion, may require off-hour support in the event of a significant outage that requires an anomaly team response.

Qualifications

Requires 8 to 10 years with BS/BA or 6 to 8 years with MS/MA or 3 to 5 years with PhD.

Required

Familiarity with System Engineering processes – full system lifecycle experience, especially in transition to operations and operations support, risk management, verification and validation, etc.
Excellent Problem solving ability
Excellent communication skills
Excellent ability to work within team structure
BS in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Math, Computer Science or similar technical degree
TS/SCI w/ Poly

Desired

RF communication systems knowledge – specifically for mission management and scheduling of users within the systems capabilities.

Prior experience with the customer agency and the primary systems being used by the customer.

#LI

About Perspecta

What matters to our nation, is what matters to us. At Perspecta, everything we do, from conducting innovative research to cultivating strong relationships, supports one imperative: ensuring that your work succeeds. Our company was formed to bring a broad array of capabilities to all parts of the public sector—from investigative services and IT strategy to systems work and next-generation engineering.

Our promise is simple: never stop solving our nation’s most complex challenges. And with a workforce of approximately 14,000, more than 48 percent of which is cleared, we have been trusted to just that, as a partner of choice across the entire sector.

As the Learning Management System (LMS) Administrator you are responsible for providing technical and functional support for CORT’s learning management system.

You are responsible for data governance, system administration and reporting of the LMS.This includes content management, consistency in data input, maintaining platforms, security, learning records, historical training data, eLearning deployment and the creation and management of reporting.

LMS Operations

Responsibilities
Act as the primary technology interface and manage day-to-day operations to ensure full functionality of the LMS environment for all users.
Identifies and solves problems that are causing issues on the LMS system or inhibiting users to access the system or training.
Perform routine systems maintenance and configuration administration.
Assist in the design, review, testing and implementation of LMS updates and enhancements.
Ensure system availability, research and resolve issues related to the LMS that are reported by the end user.
Provide end-user technical support to ensure adoption and LMS utilization with all users.
Ensures clients are informed of the status of their support request, including implementation, updates, changes, and completion.
Create and deliver training to additional system admins and users as necessary, including orientation and training for new hires.
Supports all scheduling and logistics for training events and works with the L&D facilitators to ensure a successful learning experience for employees.
Coordinate L&D programs, including Onboarding, business skills, leadership skills and technical skills.
Provide recommendations for system improvements that would enhance the learning experience.
Create and maintain automated custom emails for automated notifications.
Seeks opportunities to increase internal/external customer satisfaction.

LMS Governance
Maintain LMS test environments.
Manage all LMS user accounts and profiles, including data migration from HRIS and SSO sources.
Sets and maintains security roles and access levels
Manage permissions, systems preferences, licenses and software updates.
Document user procedures, guidelines, processes and policies as needed to establish consistent use of the system.
Upload and test eLearning SCORM and AICC compliant modules.
Assign activities, courses and curriculums to LMS learners through defined audience rules.
Monitor the accuracy and integrity of data entered and maintained within the LMS and resolve data inconsistencies.
Support the maintenance of categorization and visibility of all content in the LMS.
Ensure accuracy in training completion records.
Set up, organize and maintain curricula and/or certification paths.
Manage content within the LMS and ensure all material is current and up to date.

LMS Reporting
Work with business partners to design reporting specifications and create necessary report(s) to drive learning analytics.
Develop and maintain reports in CORT’s Business Intelligence tool to push data to the LMS.
Develop and maintain reports in CORT’s HRIS reporting engine to push data to the LMS.
Run standard reports at an enterprise level (top-down) as well as custom reports as needed.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in any field.
Minimum of four (4) years experience performing systems configuration, database management or an equivalent combination of education and experience which would provide required knowledge, skills and abilities may be qualifying.
Experience with online learning management systems and e-learning course authoring software is preferred.
Experience with staff training programs, process improvement, project management and working in a retail organization is preferred.
Experience with SQL report writing .

About CORT

Additional Information

CORT is a subsidiary of Warren Buffet’s Berkshire Hathaway. We are the world’s largest provider of furniture rental, trade show and event furnishings and relocation and transition services. We have locations throughout the US and in the UK, and a proprietary global network in over 80 countries around the world. We are dedicated to helping people make a house a home, an office a great place to work and an event a memorable celebration.

As part of a national company, CORT Furniture Rental offers opportunities for career development, professional growth, a competitive salaries with position specific incentive or commission plans, a comprehensive benefit plan, 401(k) and Profit Sharing, educational expense reimbursement and employee discounts.

CORT conducts drug screening, background checks and MVR checks (if applicable) as a condition of employment. CORT also participates in the E-Verify program.

Job_Title: Programmatic Data Monetization and Vendor Strategy
Job_Description:
Posted by
Virginia Pilosi
Principal Recruiter at Chegg Inc.
Description

Programmatic Audience Monetization Analyst
Location: New York, NY

Goal

To improve the effectiveness of our programmatic advertising stack by focusing on initiatives that combine user and audience data, analytics and revenue optimizations.

Role: Programmatic Audience Data Specialist

We are seeking an experienced programmatic professional who can leverage their skillset to drive additional value from audience data for our digital ad solution. This role will partner with an experienced group of programmatic experts focused on maximizing value in the open exchange.

This role combines individual and collaborative projects working with a team of Programmatic Revenue Analysts, Engineers, Manager and Director. The role reports directly to the Vice President of Advertising.

Qualified candidates will have +5 years of programmatic advertising technology experience with a focus and expertise in data monetization.

Location: Our NYC office

Start date: ASAP

What You’ll Be Working On
Creating, owning and optimizing a data strategy that ensures we’re maximizing the value of our inventory in the open exchange while protecting user privacy
Driving programmatic data efforts and launching new initiatives with ad tech partnerships and platforms
Developing, analyzing and communicating the impact of data focused initiatives and building a roadmap to drive future growth
Partnering with our PMP sales expert to maximize the value of our offering with programmatic data efforts
Evaluating audience segments to understand and recommend specific user experience and revenue optimizations.
Developing a strategy of identifying Chegg users across multiple platforms and domains for increased monetization in the open exchange

Requirements
5+ years of programmatic ad tech experience with a focus on data initiatives and optimizations
Experience working with a Data Management Platform (DMP) and widely used data tools such as LiveRamp
A passion for understanding and communicating trends in performance and large data sets.
Goal oriented and motivated by contributing to improving business performance.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Highly proficient with Excel (Lookups, Array Formula, Conditional Logic).
Proficiency in common data platforms, including Google Analytics, Google DFP, Google BigQuery, SQL, and Elasticsearch/Kibana.
Equivalent training or work experience

What is Chegg?

An ‘always on’ digital learning platform.

Chegg puts students first…Everything we build in this company is student-focused, making us the leading student-first connected learning platform. Chegg strives to improve the overall return on investment in education by helping students learn more in less time and at a lower cost. This is achieved by providing students a multitude of educational tools from affordable textbook rentals to Chegg Study which supplements their learning through 24/7 tutor access, step-by-step help with questions, and more. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG.

Why do we exist?

Students are working harder than ever before to stabilize their future. Our recent research study called State of the Student shows that nearly 3 out of 4 students are working to support themselves through college and 1 in 3 students feel pressure to spend more than they can afford. We founded our business on provided affordable textbook rental options to address these issues. Since then, we’ve expanded our offerings to supplement many facets of higher educational learning through Chegg Study, Chegg Math, and Chegg Internships and more to support students beyond their college experience. These offerings lower financial concerns for students by modernizing their learning experience. We exist so students everywhere have a smarter, faster, more affordable way to student.
