As the Product Manager responsible for every email and push notification Slickdeals sends you will impact the inboxes of millions of shoppers. You will seek ways to increasingly personalize the messages we send to increase the value Slickdeals provides to its members and partners. For shoppers, who seek conveniences and joy, Slickdeals is an online shopping community, that surfaces the best prices and products. You will create a product roadmap that maximizes the output of your research, design, and engineering resources to benefit users and achieve growth goals. You determine what features we launch next and why. If you are a creative thinker who is obsessed with intuitive experiences that benefit humanity you will thrive here.

The Role
Deploy a marketing technology stack that enables machine learning and personalization.
Build, measure, and learn from iterations of email types and rules-driven campaigns.
Exude strong product sense, execution, and leadership skills.
Constantly evaluate how well products serve goals. Identify elements that contribute or detract. Find opportunities to better serve the goals.
Make clear strategic decisions that promote well-defined, timely product releases.
Communicate and get buy-off on those decisions with Product Managers, engineering teams, and other business stakeholders to ensure coordination and completion of responsible products.
Define roadmaps, plan execution of, and deliver innovative consumer products for Slickdeals.
Communicate product strategy across all levels of the organization.
Understand consumer behaviors and needs through research, internal and third-party analytics, and direct interactions with users.
Work closely with Design, Engineering, Content, Marketing, and Business Development teams to manage and ultimately release new or updated product features.
Ensure timely delivery of projects through proper planning, scheduling, leadership, and execution.
Analyze and act on business metrics and data to grow the business.
Be the central hub of communication and facilitate collaboration across all parts of the business related to a product.
Performs other duties as assigned.


The Candidate
Ability to see signals in the noise of your quantitative and qualitative research.
Created products and features from scratch following a path of research, ideation, building, measuring, learning, and iterating.
Experience defining strategy and creating product roadmaps for new features, and communicating those decisions to stakeholders and business owners at all levels.
Ability to write clear and concise requirements and other documentation for initiatives both large and small.
Experience designing simple and intuitive user interfaces, with an ability to create examples through wireframes.
Familiarity with multivariate testing and analysis.
Great process and organizational skills, with strong attention to detail.
Ability to understand the technology behind products.
Excellent verbal and written business communication skills.
Proficiency in analytical thinking and problem solving.
Highly self-directed and self-motivated.
Demonstrated improvement on KPIs via product releases.


Preferred Experience
Experience managing email platforms and customer journeys.
Experience developing e-commerce products, technologies, and platforms is strongly desired.
Track record defining and delivering innovative software products.
Experience designing user interfaces and performing user research.
Excellent organizational and analytical skills with strong technical abilities.
Understanding of project management methodologies; Agile, Lean, Scrum.
Comfortable communicating technical concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience using project delivery software and ticketing systems such as JIRA.
Experience using insights, reporting, and analytics tools like Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Tableau, Lookback, and Hotjar.


Work Authorization

Candidates must be eligible to work in the United States.

As a full-service agency, program operator, and SaaS technology platform, Share Local Media helps tech and e-commerce companies leverage direct mail to achieve efficient direct response outcomes with high quality branding.

Our new media company is looking for an enthusiastic Data Analyst to join the team and help us grow. You’ll be analyzing and reporting on large data sets for all teams and be an integral part of our mission to make direct mail marketing easier for tech and e-commerce brands everywhere.

We’re a startup, so we’re looking for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit, can-do attitude, and willingness to learn!

Responsibilities
Dig deep into our data and create reports that internal and external users can understand. You will be able to expand your knowledge of data infrastructure and shape our data processes. Data touches everything we do, from internal projects to client-facing reporting!
Analyze large data sets and develop custom models / algorithms to uncover trends, patterns, and insights in customer and business data. We frequently work with more data than Excel can handle — you’ll need to select the appropriate tools for the job.
Work directly with clients and vendors to build, maintain, and optimize reporting and help define and setup automated data pipelines.
Evaluate current practices, automate common processes, and take initiative to improve business and finance operations.
Collaborate and work cross-functionally with data partners to understand and elevate the analytics functions of experience development, business development, consumer marketing strategy, margin optimization, etc.
Maintain and improve data-driven targeting models to improve reach and conversion.


Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related quantitative field.
1-3 years of relevant experience in an analytical role.
Excel? SQL? Oh yes! You should be an expert in Excel and have a strong foundation in SQL.
You are passionate about data and innately inquisitive about how you can manipulate data to make it digestible.
Strong analytical skills, including the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
You have at least intermediate level experience with a scripting language (R, Python), and/or use the command line to work with data.
Ability to prepare and visualize information to be understandable by different stakeholder groups, creating easily-consumable reports with accessible findings.
Strong sense of urgency and great time management skills.
Self-starter and problem-solver with a get-it-done attitude!
Experience in a startup environment is a plus.
Experience using a BI tool (i.e. Looker, Tableau, etc.) and setting up dashboards a plus; an interest in visualizing and exploring data required.
Experience using a big data platform for data analysis (Spark, Hadoop etc.) a plus.
Experience with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, Anaconda, etc. as part of your data workflow a plus.


Benefits
Full-time role based in our New York City office.
Ownership and growth opportunities.
Flexible vacation policy.
Robust benefits package.
A fun culture, including team events, happy hours, and trips!
The opportunity to work with a group of passionate, humble, and kind team members!

If you’re looking to be part of something new that is transforming an industry, this is the role for you. You will be empowered to think like an entrepreneur by coming up with new ideas, testing them, implementing them, and then scaling them quickly.

Position Description: Financial Credit Analyst

The Financial Credit Analyst position plays a critical role in the entire credit granting process,
including the consistent application of a credit policy, periodic credit reviews of existing customers,
development of new and improved credit strategies, and the assessment of the creditworthiness of
potential customers with the goal of optimizing the mix of company sales and bad debt losses.

Job Responsibilities

Manage Credit Transactions
• Review, evaluate, and adjudicate a high volume of daily credit submissions
• Recommend the appropriate transaction “risk based” pricing and credit structure
• Identify transactions to be funded via BFC portfolio or third-party funding partners
• Effectively manage a pipeline of “in credit” transactions in a timely manner
• Become familiar with BFC’s core industry assets and business borrowers

Enhance Credit Process
• Assist in the creation, enhancement, and ongoing maintenance of the company credit policy
manual and procedures
• Independently research and recommend asset classes appropriate for new business
generation
• Independently research and recommend credit tools, systems, and data to improve
underwriting process
• Maintain credit standards to ensure compliance with applicable laws

Credit Analytics
• Assist in the development and ongoing enhancement of corporate credit scoring strategy
• Use visualization tools to build dashboards and alerts to monitor key performance
indicators
• Make impactful insights from data sets and develop recommendations
• Analyze credit data and portfolio performance to identify key credit and underwriting
trends, risks, and opportunities

Credit Syndications
• Manage relationships with syndicate bank relationships
• Negotiate improved financing terms and conditions with syndicate bank partners
• Identify new potential syndication bank programs and partners

Teamwork
• Present your credit analytics findings and research to senior management
• Participate in project management by collaborating with cross-functional business
partners on new initiatives, project requests, prioritization, and delivery
• Effectively work with senior management to identify and maintain a strong understanding
of credit business requirements
• Work with data analysts to create proper Tableau reporting, dashboards, and alerts
• Effectively work with sales, collections, and lease administrative staff
• Collaborate with application developers to fix and enhance credit underwriting
technology platforms

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in a major relevant and applicable to this position
• Successful completion of company application and assessment process
• Strong analytical skills capable or identifying risks, trends, and opportunities
• Ability to translate analysis results into clearly defined and implementable strategies/rules
• Strong interpersonal skills including negotiation, relationship building, and oral/written
communication skills
• Strong computer skills and proficient in use of technology

Benefits
• Competitive base salary
• 401K with profit sharing
• Medical, dental & vision insurance

Truckstop.com is hiring a Data Analyst in our Phoenix, Arizona location.

About Truckstop.com

Truckstop.com is one of the largest online freight matching services in the trucking industry, providing a one-stop connection between carriers and brokers. Founded in 1995 as the first freight-matching marketplace to hit the Web, Truckstop.com has grown to provide load planning, transportation management, route optimization, real-time rates, powerful negotiation tools, and other logistics solutions. Click here to learn more about Truckstop.com’s history.

Truckstop.com is backed by ICONIQ Capital, a privately-held financial advisory and technology growth equity investment firm. ICONIQ is a trusted advisor fostering meaningful strategic relationships across industries to source powerful ideas, magnify global impact and support a new generation of entrepreneurs and companies.

About Our Culture

Truckstop is a destination where talented individuals can build an epic career. It is a place where talent feels connected, fulfilled and equipped to do what they do best while having fun doing it. We call our employees Partners because we are deeply interdependent upon each other to achieve remarkable things together. We believe that for talent to be their best selves, we must enable them with the freedom to exercise their own judgment, and provide them with the autonomy to experiment, to innovate, and test where they can go, so they can do something they never thought they could. Each of our Partners is unique. Be you is the message we foster. We look for Partners who are aware of, and who are confident in their talents and who are passionate about serving others. We will achieve massive success when you can be yourself.

E pluribus unum - Out of many, one

We look for Partners who enjoy working in a One Team mindset environment. By combining our unique personalities, experiences, skills and knowledge we can accomplish amazing feats together!

Truckstop.com does not utilize third party vendors for recruiting, nor accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters, staffing agencies or employment firms.

Position Summary

We are looking for a forward-thinking Data Analyst to serve Truckstop.com within a shared services model. With priority focus in helping transform the People and Culture analytics function and strategy. As a Senior Analyst you will work as a consultant to partner with leaders across Turckstop.com functions, understand business needs, wrangle data from various systems, perform analysis, and provide data-driven insights that have tangible actions and outcomes. The role focuses on understanding and enhancing our partner (employee) experience.

Essential Job Functions

This key role will get their hands dirty and thrive on working with data to solve business challenges. Critical to our team’s trusted reputation is our ability to partner with and influence key stakeholders, design and implement the right analysis approach, and provide insights that can be easily understood and used by the business. We will be using data from multiple systems and sources to produce thoughtful analysis with little direct guidance and an understanding that the results may be iterative. Our point of view matters to our stakeholders, so the ability to illustrate complex analysis in a concise and simple fashion using tables, charts, graphs, and stories is important to our success. Most of all, the team succeeds by being curious.

Key Responsibilities Of The Position Will Include
Develop relationships with all areas of People and Culture, partner closely with Finance and other areas of the organization to deeply understand their business and challenges
Serve the business in s shared services model with priority focused on enabling the understanding and use of data and analytics across all capabilities of People and Culture, with Talent Acquisition data analytics and metrics being the priority
Partner with colleagues in Data Science and Data Engineering to scale our impact, push overall People and Culture transformation, and develop new knowledge
Drive projects that evaluate the efficiency and impact of programs and processes


Position Requirements
Bachelor’s degree or higher
2-3 years of experience in analytics or a related area such as applied statistics, research, data mining, data analysis, organizational psychology, or management consulting
Highly proficient and confident in working with data and performing statistical analyses
Strong analytical, problem-solving, relationship building and partnering skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with different levels of management, as well as the People and Culture, business, and technical communities
Extremely adept at integrating disparate sources of information to understand data trends
Must be able to proactively communicate and identify risks
One Team mentality
Must be comfortable with changing requirements and priorities
Must be results oriented and able to move forward without complete information and with minimal supervision
Understanding of and demonstrated ability to apply quantitative and qualitative research methods to business or People and Culture problems is desirable
Proficient in Excel. Proficiency in Tableau/SQL/python/R/ a plus
Experience using Salesforce, Zuora and Ultimate Professional Software (HRIS) preferred


Core Capabilities

Strategic Orientation
Ability to understand the fundamental drivers of the business and the industry at an operational level, anticipating change and seeing competitive opportunities in an evolving and growing marketplace.

Analytics & Problem-Solving
Demonstrates the ability to overlay a structured framework to problems: disaggregate data, abstract key characteristics and dynamics; diagnose/isolate root causes; extrapolate to solutions; able to locate trends and levers, based on data.

Communications & Influencing
Establishes and nurtures relationships to go where data cannot. Projects him/herself through actions, manners and posture to create and deliver a favorable impression of personal credibility and professionalism as illustrated by the ability to change/modify/influence the views of more senior colleagues.
Demonstrates the ability to articulate views clearly and concisely both verbally and in written form under tight timelines and with limited information.
Actively and effectively listens, illustrated by taking actions that avoid potential problems that may have been overlooked or not heard otherwise. Gives appropriate feedback to confirm understanding.

Tenacity
Strong passion for learning and embraces the role of a subject matter expert.
Demonstrates persistence and resiliency to drive deliverables and projects forward, even after numerous setbacks and obstacles that inevitably occur during the course of an assignment.
Persistently works through situations impacted by events beyond his/her control as illustrated by identifying issues, developing an action plan and executing on that plan.


Physical Demands

Minimum physical exertion. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is frequently required to sit, communicate, reach and manipulate objects, tools or controls. The position requires mobility. Duties involve moving materials weighing up to 5 pounds on a regular basis. Manual dexterity and coordination are required over 75% of the work period while operating equipment such as computer keyboard, mouse, 10-key calculator and copier/fax.

Work Environment

Ideal protected indoor office work environment and clean, non-hazardous work area. The noise level in the work environment is typical of most office environments with telephones, personal interruptions, and background noises.

The above description covers the most significant duties performed but does not include other related occasional work that may be assigned or is completed by the employee.

Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest.

In order to build out products to improve the lives of our diverse customer base, we are hyper focused on building a diverse workforce.

As such, we are seeking a Diversity Talent Program Manager to design and scale pipelining programs that increase the diversity of our pipeline. This new role will run all internal and external partnerships and programs to support same.

The Diversity Talent Program Manager will also be responsible for envisioning, scoping, designing, and launching additional initiatives from implementing practices to help us eliminate bias in our hiring process to facilitating companywide URG sourcing sessions to build long-standing relationships with higher and alternative education institutions that support URG populations, such as women’s colleges, bootcamps and HBCUs (to name a few). In this role, you will be a self-starter who has experience working cross-functionally with both technical and nontechnical partners. We’re looking for someone who is passionate and knowledgeable about improving access to technical careers for those from underrepresented groups.

What You'll Do
Act as an end-to-end owner for Diversity Talent team programs, including scoping and intake, recruiting, program execution and evaluation
Partner closely with Talent Leadership to help build and execute a diversity recruiting plan
Identify and implement best practices and initiatives ranging from analysis of diversity data, recruiter training, branding, creation and measurement of diversity recruiting tools, and working with external partners
Earn trust across a range of partners and customers to establish yourself as a trusted SME
Develop strong partnerships across the business at all levels of the organization. Especially focused on collaborating with recruiting, D&I, talent brand, analytics, as well as our technical teams, including engineering and data science
Recruit program participants, and act as their main recruiting point of contact during their program, ensuring an excellent candidate experience from first interview to the final day of the program, and beyond
Collaborate with cross-functional partners to identify post-program career opportunities for program participants
Develop career development and performance benchmarks that map to preparedness for career opportunities at Affirm
Work with Talent Brand and Internal Comms to support programmatic expansion to new business units and functional teams
Drive successful alignment and influence leadership in order to accomplish program goals
Develop and track strategies, operating plans, and success metrics
Gather and use feedback to constantly improve and enhance programs
Dive into data, and understand the story behind the data, to make decisions
Seek diverse perspectives to run complex projects
Connect and inspire people to drive effective work, communication, collaboration, and commitment across multiple groups with competing priorities
As success in this role will be defined by key metrics in widening representation of URGs at the top of the funnel, this role will need to track progress, measure success, report out on results and insights

What We Look For
Creative & inventive: Has a strong sense of empathy for the needs and aspirations of candidates and the organization’s hiring and business plans and marry both perspectives with an eye to innovation
Systematic and operational: translates strategy into a framework for how work should be executed, establish processes to consistently handle and work in a systematic way. Balances creativity and driving progress in a practical and efficient way
Influential: Is able to influence senior leaders and cross functional partners both internally and externally. Thinks creatively about talent outreach and communication strategies with internal & external partners.
Entrepreneurial: Is a self-starter and unfazed by new challenges, reversals, uncertainty; learns quickly how to be effective in rapidly changing environments
Professional experience in talent acquisition/recruitment
Willing and excited to travel when needed

If you got to this point, we hope you're feeling passionate about the job description you just read. Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in Affirm's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways – not just candidates who check all the boxes.

At Affirm, "People Come First" is a core value and that’s why diversity and inclusion are vital to our priorities as an equal opportunity employer. You can learn more about our D&I efforts here .

Experience working collaboratively with internal and external resources to develop strategies that meet department goals within budget and established timelines.
Detail-oriented, highly organized, and client service-oriented.

About Avalara

Avalara helps businesses of all sizes achieve compliance with transaction taxes, including sales and use, VAT, excise, communications, and other tax types. The company delivers comprehensive, automated, cloud-based solutions designed to be fast, accurate, and easy to use. The Avalara Compliance Cloud® platform helps customers manage complicated and burdensome tax compliance obligations imposed by state, local, and other taxing authorities throughout the world.

Avalara offers more than 600 pre-built connectors into leading accounting, ERP, ecommerce and other business applications, making the integration of tax and compliance solutions easy for customers. Each year, the company processes billions of indirect tax transactions for customers and users, files more than a million tax returns, and manages millions of tax exemption certificates and other compliance documents.

Headquartered in Seattle, Avalara has offices across the U.S. and overseas in the U.K., Belgium, Brazil, and India. More information at www.avalara.com

About The Position

About Cognetik

Cognetik empowers digital leaders with insights and products to accelerate decision-making, improve digital experiences, and advance business transformation. To succeed today, organizations must consolidate data from every touch point and generate clear insights to continuously improve every element of their digital business. Our team of thinkers and builders partner with Fortune 1000 clients to help them chart a clear, confident, and data-driven path to get the most out of their analytics operations, gain a competitive advantage, and increase revenue.

What we are looking for?

Cognetik is looking for a Project Manager that will work with our Sr. Program Manager, Account Executive, and various client services practices to deliver analytics solutions to our clients. Your work will be instrumental in helping our clients capture and derive great value and insights from their data.

What will you do?

Day-to-Day Activities
Document and communicate the overall status of each project or workstream assigned to the client and internal stakeholders on a regular basis
Understand the risk and dependencies associated with each project or workstream, and actively work to mitigate those risks and reduce those dependencies whenever possible
Understand and document the team’s capacity, based on the agreement(s) and individual team members availability
Working together with the Account Executive, ensure there is clearly defined work in an organized backlog, and an amount to sufficiently keep the team fully utilized and operating at their capacity in the near future
Plan/schedule work for each team member based on client priority and team capacity
Ensure all tasks are clearly defined, accurately estimated, scheduled, and assigned to the appropriate resource
Follow up with team members as needed to ensure tasks are being competed on time and to company standards
Lead daily stand ups, facilitating communication between team members as needed and taking/circulating notes
Actively work to keep the team unblocked on all tasks
Working together with the Sr. Program Manager and Account Executive, forecast resource needs based on pipeline
Time & Budget Activities
Define tasks for time entry based on scope of work and agreed activities/deliverables to ensure proper time tracking
Follow up with team members as needed to ensure all time is accurately logged to the right tasks on a regular basis
Ensure project is operating within the range of the budget agreed, flagging risks early and often
Maintain time and budget reports, generate as needed by the Account Executive, Finance Director, or client
Maintain external cost reports, generate as needed or requested by Account Executive, Finance Director, or client
Client-Facing Activities
Work face-to-face with clients and other stakeholders to gather, understand, and document the requirements of any given request or project.
Ensure that all solutions delivered meet business requirements and client expectations
Communicate overall status, of work timeline(s), budget utilization, and any risks/blockers on a regular basis.

Requirements

Knowledge & Skills
Outstanding interpersonal, organizational and time/project management skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including presentations and meeting management
Demonstrated leadership and team management skills
Ability to handle high levels of pressure while still demonstrating critical decision-making skills
Energetic, highly motivated, with an inquiring mind and passion for excellence and innovation in pursuit of business growth and success

Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree required
At least 3-5 years of experience with digital analytics and data management
Training & Certification from a recognized Project Management institution (PMI, CSM, etc.) a plus
Digital marketing experience a plus
Prior agency or consulting services experience a plus

Why VillageMD?

VillageMD is changing the trajectory of healthcare by empowering primary care physicians to make informed decisions and engage patients in meaningful ways. We work with thousands of clinicians and healthcare disruptors across the country to build and contribute to our platform to improve patient health while driving down the cost to deliver it.

We are a mission-oriented organization and are thrilled about the work that we do every day. We're transparent, collaborative, and relentless in pursuit of our mission, all while doing so with humility and a low ego. We believe that diverse backgrounds and experiences create the best opportunity for innovation and the community that we are creating is greater than any individual.

We've built our technology using the best of cloud and open-source technologies to create an open, data-first platform that is enriched with analytical models and modernly connected to internal and external apps. These apps drive clinical and operational decision support, patient engagement, and other facilitators of innovative, information-enriched health experiences. Our analytics approach is focused on creating actionable insights that support providers to drive improvements in cost, quality and the experience of their patients.

As a Healthcare Analytics Manager or Senior Manager, you will work with our new and emerging market teams to create analytics that will drive our operations and performance in value- based contracts. This role requires strong attention to detail, the ability to thoughtfully and efficiently drive to recommendations, and the capacity to collaborate across multiple business customers spread across multiple geographies.

What are examples of work that a Healthcare Analytics Manager/Sr. Manager will do at VillageMD?
Mine patient and healthcare provider data from multiple sources, including medical and pharmacy claims data along with clinical data from EMRs to discover key analytical insights for decision support
Build provider and intervention level reports and dashboards to track healthcare quality and efficiency metrics

Partner with our clinical and operations teams to understand market needs, and develop and execute on an analytics agenda
Scope, perform and/or lead analyses, as needed, to drive to optimal decisions
Develop and implement predictive analytics and algorithms to enable population health management to deliver targeted care improving health outcomes and reduce spend

Business acumen within healthcare industry including clinical operations
Challenging the status quo to improve our processes and tools
Self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership and accountability for tasks and people
A low ego and humility; an ability to gain trust by doing what you say you will do

This individual will also have accountability for driving the use of technology in Key’s talent management practices. Additionally, this role will serve as a Talent Manager for select client groups. The Talent Manager partners with the HR Business Partner and Business Leaders for assigned businesses to develop and implement a targeted Leadership Talent agenda and priorities that drive leader, team, and organization effectiveness. The person that we are seeking excels at translating data into meaningful and actionable insights and has some prior experience in advanced level analytic tools and general talent management processes including leader assessments, talent and succession planning, and leader development. This individual must also possess the ability to deliver (and receive) candid feedback, be hard-wired to execute, and has the ability to influence leaders and partners. June 2018, BetterDoctor and Quest Analytics merged, creating the first comprehensive platform that enables health plans to optimize their member experience while complying with federal and state regulations for network adequacy and accuracy. Our provider data management and network analytics services are trusted by the nation’s leading health plans, insurance, regulatory agencies and benefit consultants to provide consumers with convenient access to an adequate network of doctors and hospitals and an up-to-date, accurate directory of providers.

Quest Analytics is currently seeking a highly motivated individual to join our organization as a Data Analyst. In this role, you will work alongside our data scientists, analysts, engineers, and product managers.

Some Of Our Projects
Measuring the quality of different data sources
Relating external public or licensed data to our internal entity representations
Measuring the quality of our algorithms
Contributing to the development of our algorithms
What’s in it for you?
In addition to a competitive salary and benefits, this is a unique opportunity to work with an experienced team of data scientists and engineers in the heart of San Francisco. You’ll be working on an advanced data delivery platform in the healthcare space. You will gain practical experience working with many of the latest tools and systems in the field, including:
Big data processing tools
Apache Spark
Databricks
Business intelligence platforms and tools
Looker
AWS Redshift
Automation and data pipelines tool
Kafka
Jenkins
Docker
Airflow
Here's how you will make an impact?
Collaborate with a team of product managers, analysts and other developers to define and complete data projects from data ingestion, to analysis to recommendations.
Develop methodology to gain insights into our proprietary and external data sets
Support data science team in evaluating quality of our entity creation and mapping algorithms
Understand and perform quality checks of our business intelligence, like discovering inconsistencies in our datasets
Demonstrate ability to work well independently, collaborate with teammates, and influence across organizational boundaries
Play a key role in creating both product and client-facing analytics.
Perform analysis, develop reports, visualizations, statistical analysis and computations using Python, R, or Scala

What you'll need for this role?
Experience working with large datasets
Working knowledge of statistics and visualization.
Expert SQL skills. Able to create and to evaluate complex SQL statements involving numerous tables and complex relationships.
Strong skills working with one or more of the following languages:
Python
R
Scala
Experience working with data frames and data frame modules or tools such as Pandas, Jupyter, Zeppelin, Databricks, or similar.
Fast learner; curiosity about and passion for data.
Bonus Points
Experience with Apache Spark
Practical experience with Databricks
Experience with Healthcare Provider Data

Qualifications And Requirements
Bachelors or Masters degree in a technical field
2 Years of relevant work experience
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship
Ready to Evolve?

We want smart, driven individuals to help us create Quest Analytics future. If you invest yourself in your work, live with enthusiasm, and thrive on results, we want to know you.

What's In It For You

Great benefit package with:

100% paid HDHP Health plan, Dental, Vision for Employee tier and cost sharing for all other tiers

Job_Title: Remote Clinical Documentation (CDI) Specialist- Navigant- Remote Location
Job_Description:
Navigant Consulting, Inc. (NYSE: NCI) is a specialized, global professional services firm that helps clients take control of their future. Navigant’s professionals apply deep industry knowledge, substantive technical expertise, and an enterprising approach to help clients build, manage and/or protect their business interests. With a focus on markets and clients facing transformational change and significant regulatory or legal pressures, the Firm primarily serves clients in the healthcare, energy and financial services industries. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and technology/analytics services, Navigant’s practitioners bring sharp insight that pinpoints opportunities and delivers powerful results. More information about Navigant can be found at navigant.com.
Navigant Business Process Management unites the strengths of four category-leading companies to address the complexities of today’s healthcare system. We design, develop and implement integrated, patient-centered solutions for sustained improvements in performance and profitability, working collaboratively across a spectrum of customers that encompasses hospitals, health systems, physician practice groups and payers.
The **Remote** **Clinical Documentation Integrity (CDI) Specialist** is responsible for conducting concurrent inpatient chart reviews on assigned units to ensure documentation is complete and accurate at the time of discharge to properly reflect the severity of illness and resources consumed for timely, accurate and compliant coding. Initiates queries in a professional, non-leading manner to clarify ambiguous or conflicting documentation, obtain specificity of diagnoses, and connect treatment performed to a diagnosis (if known). Performs coding, working DRG assignment and enters all review activity into tracking software. Perform any and all related job duties as assigned. **This is a 100% remote position that requires some work on weekends.**
Must have strong organizational skills
Must be a Team Player that is able to work independently
Have the ability to interact directly with Physicians
Be proficient with technology
Have effective verbal and written communication skills
Must have ability to accommodate flexibility in work schedule based on physician rounding timeframe
Conducts daily, concurrent review of inpatient records on assigned unit(s), to ensure complete and accurate physician and or clinician documentation is present at the time of discharge for accurate, timely, and compliant coding.
Reviews daily admissions to assigned unit, performs initial code assignment for a working DRG and completes CDI software data entry for initial and follow up case reviews (or worksheet to include code and DRG assignment, and submits to Program Assistant **_daily)._**
Updates “working DRG” as documentation supports or physician query answer supports a change in the DRG assignment.
Communicates to the CDI Coordinator when volume of daily review assignments is too high or low so that CDI Coordinator can assist in adjusting review assignments amongst the team.
Initiates compliant physician queries when documentation is confusing, ambiguous or missing and follows up with MD to seek immediate response to query (utilizing the following AHIMA practice briefs as a guide: “ _Managing an Effective Query Process_ ”, October 2008 _and “Guidance for Clinical Documentation Improvement Programs”_ , May 2010).
Ensures the query verbiage is in no way leading or suggestive in tone and is supported by the documentation in the record to include clinical indications and treatment provided.
Performs follow up on incomplete physician queries to obtain an answer while the **patient is still in-house.**
Analyzes complete clinical documentation from a compliance, coding and/or reimbursement perspective including rationale for the initiation, discontinuation and/or adjustment of treatment modalities utilized in the care of the patient.
Assures physician has sufficient documentation for corresponding diagnosis of all monitored, evaluated or treated illnesses and initiates queries as appropriate.
Ability to identify possible documentation risk areas, including missing orders, patient identification, legibility issues and poor documentation trends.
Provides daily feedback and education to physicians on the quality of documentation and presents examples of how physician documentation can improve compliance based on CMS guidelines.
Promotes accurate DRG classification according to standards set forth by CMS (Center for Medicare & Medicaid Services) to reduce documentation-related-risks associated with DRG-based payers.
Assures record reflects the patient’s severity of illness and risk of mortality (ROM) to improve accuracy of hospital case mix index, national comparisons and physician profiles.
Possess a clear understanding of MS DRG guidelines and required documentation components for accurate code/DRG assignment.
Keeps abreast of Coding Clinic updates, to include code changes, MCC and CC changes and/or changes in the DRG system to effectively educate DI team and physician and clinical team members regarding changes.
Keeps abreast of Recovery Audit Contractor (RAC) review activity to avoid potential risk for the facility.
Assist in developing reports as needed for the review and analysis of facility specific documentation and reimbursement patterns.
Assist in development of physician and/or clinician education.
Provides accurate and up-to-date information on regulatory and reimbursement requirements.
Works closely with case management, physicians, clinicians, and departments to improve communication regarding documentation and reimbursement issues.
Investigates and responds timely to questions regarding documentation or coding issues.
Educates physicians, clinicians, and departments on documentation, coding, and reimbursement guidelines and facilitates understanding of payer and regulatory requirements.
Attends scheduled physician education/training sessions on clinical units and/or MD offices as requested on a daily and/or weekly basis.
Build trustworthy and strong relationship with client staff, physician base and Navigant Cymetrix staff.
Stays current on documentation & billing requirements to ensure compliance with all regulatory and governmental agencies.
Observes confidentiality and safeguards all patient-related information.
Serves as a role model for all co-workers by setting an example of high standards in dress, conduct, cooperation and job performance.
Meets or exceeds established quality and productivity standards.
Check e-mail system at a minimum of three times per day: beginning, middle, and end of working day.
Assists with coding backlogs and performs other duties as assigned.
Must have one of the following certifications or licenses: RHIA, RHIT, CCS, RN, LPN, LVN.
Must maintain credential while employed.
Requires at least 3 years acute care hospital medical records or medical coding experience.
Familiarity with Encoder preferred and DRG assignment.
Strong _clinical understanding of disease process._
Maintains current working knowledge of Coding Clinic Guidelines and federal updates to MS DRG system.
Knowledge of medical terminology, anatomy, physiology, microbiology, and disease processes.
Excellent communication skills, employing tact and effectiveness.
Ability to converse with physicians in sometimes difficult scenarios.
**RN’s** - 5 years inpatient clinical, case management and management experienceand ability to perform code assignment/corresponding DRG assignment in facility encoder preferred.
**Coders** - previous inpatient record review experience preferred.
Frequently communicates with clients and coworkers and must be able to share information effectively
Strong conceptual, as well as quantitative and qualitative analytical skills
Work as a member of a team as well as be a self-motivator with ability to work independently
Flexibility and responsiveness in managing multiple projects in sometimes high-pressure situations simultaneously
Usually remains stationary for the majority of the day
Regularly uses close visual acuity and operates computer equipment to prepare and analyze and transmit data
Navigant** is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, genetic information or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation.
Navigant will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law or ordinance including the Fair Chance Ordinance of Los Angeles and San Francisco.

THE STARTING SALARY FOR ANY NEW HIRE TO THIS POSITION IS LIMITED TO THE RECRUITMENT RANGE OF $74,987 - $99,000
Are you able to analyze various components of the retirement and financial systems? Can you manage large scale system development projects? Do you enjoy analyzing system application issues? If so, the Department of State Treasurer's Information Technology Division has a promising opportunity for you as a Software Developer/Systems Integrator.
The Information Technology Division's (ITD) primary purpose is to plan, develop, implement and support the technology systems that meet the operational needs of DST.
The Department of State Treasurer's campus is located off Atlantic Avenue, is surrounded by many shopping centers and restaurants, has access to a 24-hour 7-day a week free gym on the campus, offers a competitive benefit package, and has free employee parking.
The ITD Web and Financial Services team is responsible for a portfolio of heterogeneous applications composing of web and other cloud-based systems servicing all divisions. The team is composed of one manager and eight full-time developers and systems integrators.

The Team Supports
The Oracle Flexcube Banking System (Flexcube), a critical enterprise-wide system, provides banking operations services and integrated financial General Ledger functionality as well as complete online banking. It consists of all NC Budget Codes, Main Accounts, Cash Concentration Accounts, Disbursing Accounts, Short Term Investment Accounts (STIF), as well as Investment Accounting. Flexcube also maintains an average of 16 million Positive Pay records for all the State agencies holding Disbursing and STIF accounts. Positive Pay is used to prevent fraud and loss of funds. There are approximately 3.5 million warrants written and processed annually. Additionally, more than $2.5 billion is transferred in or out of Flexcube daily.
The department's web infrastructure including internal and public facing websites both cloud and on-premise. These include the department's intranet Compass and public facing sites nctreasurer.com, shpnc.org, nccash.com, and myncretirement.com.
The Unclaimed Property Management System (UPMS) which is the system of record for all properties under the management of the Escheat Fund. The state is currently in possession of more than 11.5 million properties valued at nearly $2 billion. The system also processes all claims against escheated property and produces a "settlement" file, transmitted to the Office of the State Controller for the generation of warrants payable to claimants.
The Retirement Systems Imaging and Workflow System which consists of EMC ApplicationXtender, an electronic document management system, Kofax Capture, a document scanning and indexing solution, and EMC WorkflowXtender, a business process automation toolkit for the routing and monitoring of work activities.
Several ancillary applications in support of all of the above systems.
The Software Developer/Systems Integrator Will
Analyze various architectural components of retirement and financial systems to enhance capabilities, upgrade architecture or ancillary components as needed
Lead the day-to-day administration, systems maintenance and support for Oracle-Financial system software (Flexcube) using various Microsoft, Oracle, and Unisys technologies
Develop and document processes as needed that facilitate on-going support of existing systems
Manage and complete the implementation of a new ASP.NET FTP solution using Microsoft Serv-U manager and integration with Oracle Flexcube using PGP Encryption software
Provide operational support for Microsoft Dynamics GP used by both the Financial Operations and Retirement Systems Division
Analyze issues with financial and retirement systems applications to identify improvements as well as respond to requests from the business users and other subject matter experts
Coordinate with retirement and financial operations business users to maintain the supported applications to keep in compliance with all statutes
Design technical specifications and custom interfacing solutions for both retirement and financial systems based on business requirements provided by the retirement and financial operations divisions
Communicate effectively across the entire Retirement Systems, Financial Operations, and Information Technology divisions
Manage large-scale systems development and/or systems integration projects adhering to proven project management methodologies sanctioned by the Project Management Institute
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / Competencies
Must be an expert in the server architecture to best support the Oracle Financial
Must be an expert in supporting the entire financial systems ecosystem which includes Oracle Flexcube, Axway, X9 Returns, Microsoft Dynamics GP, and Unisys InfoImage.
Knowledge of and must be an expert in the server architecture to best support the retirement systems applications which includes Imaging System.
Knowledge of specialized computer programming languages; and of coding processes and security measures.
Design and analyze the systems security compliance and audit policies (Eg: Certificate Management, Applicaton authentication methods)
Must be an expert in programming in ASP.NET MVC 5 with Razor Views, C#.NET, VB.NET, Oracle database server programming, LINQ, Microsoft SQL Server programming including T-SQL and stored procedures creation and maintenance.
Expert in server and Microsoft IIS configuration as it pertains to internal and public facing websites.
Knowledge of or must independently research and learn any new software development and system integration standards and apply such expertise to supported systems.
Demonstrated ability to evaluate and make recommendations on business needs and any process improvements being discussed and/or requested.
Demonstrated ability to review business requirements provided by the business division and translate those into comprehensive technical design documents
Provide technical expertise to identify and direct issue resolution with external application platforms (digital commons, Google analytics, Sharepoint)
Knowledge of emerging technology domains such as DevOps (Development Opearations), Paas (Platform as a Service) and Saas (Software as a service)
Demonstrated ability to communicate to all levels of the organization, from detailed presentation to senior level management, to guiding business requirements meeting with end users
Knowledge of project management concepts and how to put them into practice running larger scale enhancements and small to medium independent projects.
Management Preferences
Candidate with minimum of five years of hands-on development and system integration experience with large-scale, web-based financial and retirement applications.
Candidate must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Preference will be given to candidates with extensive experience using Microsoft and Oracle on premise and/or cloud computing technologies.
Minimum Education And Experience Requirements

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer information systems, computer engineering, math, engineering or related technical degree from an appropriately accredited institution and four years of experience in business applications consulting or development; or
Bachelor's degree with some computer coursework from an appropriately accredited institution and five years of experience in business applications consulting or development ; or
Associate's degree in computer programming and five years of experience in application consulting or development; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Job ID: 126367
Industry: Healthcare
Location: Denver, CO
Duration: 3 months (Contract to Hire)
Pay Rate Range: Depends on Experience

Position Summary

This senior individual contributor is primarily responsible for driving strategic data-informed decisions, gathering data and information on target variables in an established systematic fashion, and preparing data for analytic efforts. This position drives the execution of creative data analytic approaches leading to actionable outcomes across functional areas, business and/or clinical lines, interprets complex data analyses, and leads the development of advanced analytical and/or statistical models enabling informed business decisions.

Responsibilities
Identifies and evaluates emerging trends in health insurance and health care.
Practices self-leadership and promotes learning in others by building relationships with cross-functional stakeholders; communicating information and providing advise to drive projects forward; influencing team members within assigned unit; listening and responding to, seeking and addressing performance feedback; adapting to competing demands and new responsibilities; providing feedback to others, including upward feedback to leadership and mentoring junior team members; creating and executing plans to capitalize on strengths and develop weaknesses; and adapting to and learning from change, difficulties, and feedback.
Conducts or oversees business-specific projects by applying deep expertise in subject area; promoting adherence to all procedures and policies; developing work plans to meet business priorities and deadlines; determining and carrying out processes and methodologies; coordinating and delegating resources to accomplish organizational goals; partnering internally and externally to make effective business decisions; solving complex problems; escalating issues or risks as appropriate; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and evaluating recommendations made by others.
Interprets complex data analyses by applying findings to contextual settings; and developing insights, reports, and presentations telling a compelling story to stakeholders to enable and influence decision making; participating in peer reviews; and providing context related data interpretations and/or limitations as appropriate.
Leads the development of advanced analytical and/or statistical models enabling informed business decisions by determining data and analytical requirements; translating models and gaining stakeholder buy-in for implementation; creating complex models leading to actionable insights; and testing, refining and validating models.
Drives the execution of creative data analytic approaches leading to actionable outcomes across functional areas, business and/or clinical lines by defining and calculating complex metrics to be analyzed; defining, calculating, and validating algorithms; and conducting complex analyses, including descriptive, correlational, inferential, and/or predictive statistics.
Prepares data for analytic efforts by integrating and consolidating data; ensuring data quality and accuracy; profiling data inaccuracies and recommending process improvements or system changes to enhance overall quality of the data; collaborating with stakeholders and source system owners to resolve data quality issues as appropriate; and cleaning and creating final data set(s) for analysis.
Gathers data and information on targeted variables in an established systematic fashion by validating data sources; querying, merging, and extracting data across internal and external sources; completing routine data refresh and update; developing and/or delivering complex tools for electronic data collection; and providing user training, support and documentation.
Drives strategic data-informed decisions by consulting with clients and leadership to identify and clarify key business needs across functional areas, business and/or clinical lines; developing outcomes and process measures; translating business requirements, determining data/information needs and data collection methods; developing complex analysis plans; evaluating the impact of business decisions on clients, customers, and/or members; partnering with clients and staff to identify opportunities and methods to improve efficiencies with analysis; supporting and training end-users; and documenting processes and deliverables.

Required Qualifications
Master’s degree in mathematics, statistics, engineering, social/physical/life science, business, or related field
8+ years of experience in data analytics

Preferred Qualifications
6+ years of health insurance experience
Certification in one of the following preferred: Oracle Business intelligence (OBI), EMC Data Science Associate (EMCDSA), Certified Authorization Professional (CAP), or Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE)

To Apply

We will not respond to everyone personally - qualified candidates will be contacted for a screening. Please submit your resume in a Word document.

Digital Analytics -Data Quality SME (Adobe) needed for a long term contract opportunity with Yoh’s digital client in Bothell, WA

Scope/Team
Digital Experience division develops a set of reporting & analysis tools that support their business teams with leading edge business intelligence capabilities.
The team’s primary responsibility is to develop & sustain Datamart (eDM ) that is heavily used to track various data including Adobe, clickstream, order, fulfillment and subscriber metrics for att.com
The team consists of Analytics SME’s, Data Analysts, Software Developers and Reporting Analysts

What will this person do? Example
Need someone who needs to be very data quality, data validation heavy. Someone who can focus on the insights of what the data is saying, example- buy-flow process. Collect data from every stop within the user experience: example - consumer clicks on a promotion that comes to client’s e-commerce website, reviews the offering, enters into the shopping cart, and then completes the checkout process. All of these steps are tagged and data collected and analyzed. Promotions that were a success, those that were not, were there hiccups with the transactions along the way, etc. are what needs to checked. This person should be able to then analyze the data to identify what went right and what went wrong and aid in further decision making processes.


Top Skills
Proficient in analytics and tagging quality insurance processes and managing analytics tags with a tag manager such as Dynamic Tag Manager, Adobe Launch, or GTM
Experience with key features of Adobe Analytics including visitor ID service, eVars, s.props, success events, merchandising variables, VISTA rules, SAINT Classifications, raw data feeds, pathing/fallout, segmentation and marketing channels
QA/QC data and report output to ensure accuracy


Key Responsibilities Include
Diagnose issues with existing platform configurations and tags, and provide recommendations for improvement. Work with third parties to resolve discrepancies or platform issues. Centralize and standardize digital tracking, analytics, and associated data quality.
Enhance data quality by validating and troubleshooting information as needed.
Support Digital Experience team by documenting, designing and creating utilities to help through various processes
Performs internal testing and processes related to implementation requirements
Support peers and stakeholders as a subject matter expert (SME) through troubleshooting and analysis of results

Job_Title: Data Analytics Coach / Curriculum Developer, NAVAIR Digital Group
Job_Description:
Are you an enthusiastic coder with the desire to mentor, instruct, and coach others to harness data through coding? AVIAN is seeking an experience data analytics professional to support the NAVAIR Digital Group (NDG) to assemble a ?Learn to Code? program using existing learning and instructional resources for the NAVAIR workforce. This individual will mentor and instruct employees during and after their code training to assist them in the practical use and application in the workplace.
We?re looking for someone who appreciates and values the coding world, and can inspire the workforce to understand the freedom coding can allow to work faster in support of the Fleet. Through coaching, online discussion forums, labs, and instructor-led sessions, this individual will work with the NDG to assess skill gaps and find ways to bridge student?s knowledge between the learning environment and practical on-the-job application of these skills.

Key Duties
Assemble relevant existing data analytics training resources into a valuable curriculum for students
Establish and facilitate online and in-person collaborative environments for coaching students before, during, and after their coding training
Understand the challenges and limitations of operating in the NMCI network environment and assist students with equipment/environment setup, downloading software, and creating the online training environment
Provide feedback to training organizers on behalf of students about known issues or challenges encountered during training execution
Develop or seek out new and innovative ways to educate and train our workforce in data analytics, data visualization
Qualifications
Bachelor?s Degree in computer science or related field
3-5 years experience in data analysis and visualization
Proven experience with Python, R, SQL
Coaching/instructor experience related to data analysis or visualization
Knowledge of NAVAIR and the NMCI network environment preferred
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills
Creative thinker who can work independently with minimum direction
Public Trust eligibility required
Partial telework and/or alternatives to full-time schedule are possible
Desired Knowledge/Skills
How to use software tools that generate, store or process data
Data analysis processes (business problem definition, data collection, data cleansing, data analysis, data visualization, data modeling)
Predictive analytics and statistics
Machine learning, neural networks, artificial intelligence
Company Overview

Headquartered in Lexington Park, Maryland, we relish in the process of cracking open a Maryland blue crab and the delicious reward you get with a little hard work. Our team spans from sea to shining sea supporting the Department of Defense, specifically, the Naval Air Systems Command, the Naval Sea Systems Command, the Office of Naval Research, and the Colorado Department of Transportation.
We?re seeking people that are passionate and excited about creating well-crafted products and memorable experiences with our customers. We are not in the market of automated transactions; we build lasting relationships.

Job_Title: Analytics & Clinical Effectiveness Specialist (1.0 FTE, Days)
Job_Description:
At Stanford Children’s Health, we know world-renowned care begins with world-class caring. That's why we combine advanced technologies and breakthrough discoveries with family-centered care. It's why we provide our caregivers with continuing education and state-of-the-art facilities, like the newly remodeled Lucile Packard Children's Hospital Stanford. And it's why we need caring, committed people on our team - like you. Join us on our mission to heal humanity, one child and family at a time.

Job Summary:
The Analytics & Clinical Effectiveness Specialist will support and influence a comprehensive and innovative clinical effectiveness program focused on clinical process redesign. The A&CE Specialist will create and manage analyses of administrative, clinical, financial and demographic data for use in data driven improvements by the Analytics and Clinical Effectiveness Department. The role will integrate project management and improvement methods to interpret analytic findings, communicate information to interdisciplinary teams and support clinical performance improvement work. This position will perform analysis, interpret results, develop summaries and generate effective and optimal visual display to inform and operationally support LPCH improvement initiatives and priorities. Additional functions include building complex data sets and utilization of those data to inform clinical and operational decision-making based on unnecessary variation, high utilization and patient outcomes. The role will identify opportunities for improvement via evidence-based practices, regulatory and accrediting agency requirements, and current performance in key clinical & financial outcomes.
  Essential Functions:
• Performs data analysis; creates and interprets data displays, including clinical, cost, and patient satisfaction data.
• Ensures the integrity of data being reported and utilized is accurate and valid.
• Evaluates data, makes judgments, and recommendations regarding quality & process improvement work, including, but not limited to resource utilization, physician practice patterns and clinical pathway effectiveness.
• Ensures quality and caliber of efforts to translate information needs into meaningful data displays.
• Researches and designs effective and innovative analytics strategies to measure and improve departmental and organizational goals.
• Works collaboratively with quality & performance improvement teams to develop measures for monitoring and reporting clinical outcomes and process improvement.
• Provides expertise to the department and to interdisciplinary clinical effectiveness initiative teams in LPCH data models and systems.
• Acts as a resource in the interpretation and use of data generated by the department and utilized throughout the organization.
• Designs and develops dashboards and other innovative data visualization using business intelligence tools.
• Provides consultative and analytic expertise to LPCH partners.
• Serves as a representative of the Analytics & Clinical Effectiveness Team and the department/Center at meetings, initiatives and on committees.
 Minimum Qualifications:
Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in a work-related field/ discipline from an accredited college or university.  Master's Degree preferred.
Experience: Three (3) years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience.
  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification.
• Ability to perform complex tasks, prioritize multiple independent projects and meet challenging deadlines.
• Ability to utilize Microsoft programs, Crystal Reports, Cognos, Business Objects, and other applications and databases.
• Knowledge of advanced quantitative skills (advanced Excel, Access, statistical packages)
• Knowledge and ability to use decision support systems such as Access or other relational databases.
• Ability to use statistics to evaluate and interpret data, summarize results and make recommendations.
• Knowledge of project management methodologies.
• Knowledge of and experience with improvement science pedagogies and methods.
• Ability to understand and use information technology to drive process changes.
• Ability to interact effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization.
• Ability to work collaboratively in a multi-disciplinary environment.
• Ability to demonstrate sound judgment and reasoning.
• Ability to maintain discretion in handling confidential and sensitive information.
• Ability to speak, read, write, and understand English effectively at a level appropriate for the safe and effective performance of the job.

Job_Title: Marketing Measurement Marketing Mix Modeling Sr. Analyst (Analytic Consultant 3)
Job_Description:
Job Description

At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.
Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

The mission of Wells Fargo Marketing is to build the best possible brand, experiences, and engagement with our customers and stakeholders that reflect our commitment to our customers and their needs and to driving key business and stakeholder outcomes. In support of this mission, Marketing is responsible for developing integrated marketing strategies across Wells Fargo’s business lines and geographies; leading brand strategy; leveraging deep insights and analytics about consumers and businesses; executing customer messaging across all channels and touchpoints; and building out capabilities that move toward real-time, always-on, personalized and compelling messaging and digital experiences.

Within Marketing, this role is part of the Marketing Strategic Capabilities & Insights (MSCI) organization. MSCI’s role is to lead the creation of world-class marketing technologies, social capabilities & platforms, digital customer experiences and insights and analytics to enable industry leading revenue growth, scale, and efficiency for Wells Fargo.

Specifically this position reports to Marketing Measurement, which is a critical group within MSCI. The team brings accountability to the Marketing organization by empirically estimating the incremental contributions of Marketing to the business and the performance of each campaign and marketing initiatives. Its charter also includes providing guidance to the organization as to the optimal levels of program investments and allocations across businesses, marketing channels, sales channels, audiences and time to achieve forecast sales goals. To that end, the team is charged with developing and maintaining all the Marketing Mix Modeling, Multi-touch Attribution, Test and Control Models, Audience, Targeting Models, Opportunity Sizing, Sales Planning and Forecasting as well as Numerical Optimization Tools that provide the backbone of past Marketing performance measurements and future investment optimizations. All while reducing risk and driving operational efficiencies.

Key Responsibilities Include

Build, maintain and evolve geographic level marketing mix models to estimate the causal impacts of marketing and non-marketing drivers on Wells Fargo's business outcomes in the short and long term
Develop a project plan and timeline to support modeling related activities, such as data preparation and validation, model development and validation, model documentation, model performance tracking, and work with model governance to obtain necessary approvals from Corporate Model Risk and Legal and Compliance
Measure the long-term impacts on customer behavior through evaluation of the relationship marketing spend has with Brand Equity and how Brand Equity influences business outcomes
Develop a robust and repeatable data preparation process that incorporates the automation of input ETL, and creates an auditable trail, including data development documentation
Ability to extract critical insights to identify growth opportunities and effectively communicate outcomes and recommendations
Develop collaborative partnerships and leverage strong influencing skills to communicate insights and recommendations
Engage with marketing partners to establish mutual objectives, priorities, and measures of success
Provide analytical thought leadership and bring cutting edge statistical knowledge to solve complex marketing problems
Lead effective data analysis that may suggest risk or opportunities for Wells Fargo
Provide ongoing support for existing models’ key performance metric reporting

Required Qualifications
5+ years of reporting experience, analytics experience, or a combination of both; or a BS/BA degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 3+ years of reporting experience, analytics experience, or a combination of both

Desired Qualifications
Extensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysis
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

Other Desired Qualifications

3+ years of reporting experience, analytics experience, or a combination of both
3+ years of experience in continuous and discrete dependent variable regression based modeling
2+ hands-on experience programming marketing mix modeling or other regression solutions in SAS
Significant experience coding and maintaining stand along SAS-based applications
Deep knowledge of statistical areas such as ANOVA, Multiple Regression, Time-series Modeling, Principal Component Analyses, Decision Trees, Clustering, etc
Experience on hierarchical Bayesian and MCMC approaches
Ability to perform regression analysis in multiple language such as SAS, R, Python or similar tools
Experience working in marketing/ customer analytics organizations
Demonstrated ability to play a leadership role in large, complex analytical projects
Strong sense of ownership, relentless curiosity, and self-driven approach to problem solving
Experience/exposure to data and analytics in Banking and Financial Services industry
Experience working with cookie level digital data and multi-touch attribution solutions
Ability to work cooperatively as part of a team, as well as independently
Ability to translate business objectives into actionable work flows in terms of data collection, data manipulation, variable creation, and model inclusion
Project management experience (i.e. developing roadmap of upcoming project initiatives and establishing project
timeline)
Expertise in SAS and SQL languages for database access, data extract, manipulation and analysis

Job Expectations
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time

Disclaimer

All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Job_Title: Data Engineer, B2B Data Platform R&D
Job_Description:
Data Engineer, B2B Data Platform R&D

The B2B Data Platform Engineering and Analytics team builds tools to automate both analytical and operational workflows. It also maintains systems that increase productivity across the broader B2B sales organization. We are part of the B2B Insights & Analytics (I&A) organization, which manages the sustainable growth of the B2B sales with a focus on creating lasting relationships between customers and our sales teams.

We are comprised of data scientists, statisticians, economists, business analysts, and analytics engineers that have the shared goal of maximizing profitable, incremental sales revenue. Those who will be most successful in this role are both technically skilled and business-minded. In addition to building new tools, they come to the table with a desire to independently identify and scope initiatives that will have a direct impact on improving Wayfair's bottom line.

What You'll Do
You will productionize code written by data analysts for use in experimental design and analysis (helping ensure their code is performant and well-tested).
You will maintain operational processes in the B2B "Operations Hub", a web app that provides business users with an interface to abstract complex optimization algorithms. (You will learn the basics of web development and container orchestration in Kubernetes!)
You will work directly with analytics, operations, and sales teams to identify problems and scope solutions (we are our own product managers).
You will build internal python libraries to streamline analytics workflows, with an emphasis on intuitive interface design.
You will become a subject matter expert in the B2B data model. In doing so, you will help analysts effectively manage data proliferation (operational, experimental, third-party).
You should evangelize code quality best practices (testing, style, documentation) and help analysts improve the quality of their code


What You'll Need
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field from top-tier institution
Server-side programming experience (we write a lot of Python)
Familiarity with version control techniques and best practices
Experience writing complex SQL (+1 if you have performance tuning experience)
Process-oriented mindset with strong organizational and communication skills
Comfort with prototyping and scoping MVPs for ambiguously defined opportunities
Experience writing unit and integration tests [Nice to have]
Experience developing or deploying containerized apps (Docker, K8s) [Nice to have]


About Us

Wayfair is one of the world's largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we're reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you're looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you'll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking. No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. About The Role

We are looking for patient-inspired, passionate and experienced Neurology Account Managers with demonstrated success in new product launches who are committed to our mission of transforming the lives of patients with unmet needs.
