Brand Partnerships & Acquisition Coordinator

About Nisolo
Nisolo is a sustainable fashion brand that produces footwear and accessories for women and men. We are an early-stage, Direct to Consumer E-Commerce company composed of smart, driven teammates committed to excellence and strategic improvement. We are passionate and compassionate, ambitious and pragmatic. We work together in pursuit of the goal to grow a healthy, household name brand and help push the fashion industry in a more sustainable direction.

About the Role:
The Brand Partnerships and Acquisition Coordinator will work within the Partnerships and Acquisition Department and be responsible for assisting Senior Associates in the management of partner-facing, demand-generating, marketing and sales campaigns for Nisolo through coordinating the execution of partnership channels including affiliates, social media influencers, referral programs, Amazon, wholesale, and press. Success in this role will improve the efficiency and reach of partnership programs, allowing Nisolo to grow brand awareness and ultimately help push the fashion industry in a more sustainable direction.

About You:
You are an organized self-starter who can think strategically in a high-growth environment
You are crazy attentive to detail and can manage a tight deadline in a hands-off environment.
You love to think outside of the box and jump on the chance to brainstorm with other teams.
You are not afraid to execute at a tactical level. There is no task too small or too big for you.
You are hardworking and resourceful. You understand why data is critical to make strategic business decisions and are passionate about analyzing that data with a holistic and open-minded approach.
You’re a team player who can communicate clearly and collaborate cross-functionally within a growing organization.
You respond positively to constructive feedback and adapt quickly, while also being comfortable providing feedback to leaders and teammates.
You ask for help when it’s needed.
You are a learner and see every challenge as an opportunity.
You’re humble, hungry, and smart (in that order). You know what you’re good at while continually striving to improve and grow in all areas.
You are motivated, at least in part, by a commitment to social impact in your daily work. You love fashion and keeping up with trends in the industry, with a curiosity for slow and ethical fashion.
You understand that having fun with what you do is part of the job!

Skills & Qualifications:
Initial responsibilities for this position are listed below. Flexibility, as well as the ability to wear many hats, is essential to success on the Nisolo team. Responsibilities are subject to change depending on changing needs of the business.
Support manager by overseeing the execution of social media influencer marketing and affiliate channels through ongoing recruitment of new partners and revenue/traffic performance optimization of existing relationships.
Adhere to monthly budgets and be fiscally responsible in all campaign execution.
Assist your manager with growing Nisolo Referral Program revenue and traffic.
Perform logistical tasks including but not limited to: scheduling conference calls, keeping a log of meeting notes, drafting contract agreements, fielding inbound requests, creating invoices, sending product samples, collecting image assets for internal use, and recording relevant data metrics to evaluate campaign performance.
Create monthly informational newsletters to share with existing partners.
Track, update, and analyze relevant weekly and monthly KPIs from partnership campaigns, sales events, and advertisements to be presented at departmental meetings.
Securely organize signed contract agreements, invoices, and image file storage across asana, Google Drive, and Dropbox using appropriate file naming conventions.
Actively work with your manager to improve efficiency of ongoing SOPs within your department.
Attend and engage in weekly check-in meetings with your direct manager(s) to share feedback, get support, and track progress to goals.
Assist with research, recruitment, and benchmarking of new and existing brand partners to track towards departmental goals and ensure mutually-beneficial collaboration.
Create and share third-party line sheets to secure on-time seasonal purchase orders from third party partners.
Support internal and external coordination of wholesale and third party drop ship orders and campaigns to ensure smooth brand experience for all participating partners and internal departments.
Support fulfillment team and adhere to standard operating procedures to ensure inventory accuracy through order and transfer processes.
Manage maintenance of Amazon Seller Central account- to include inventory management, publishing branded content, and organizing monthly reports.
Support with community engagement projects and events, including outreach to local brands, food/beverage sponsors, and day-of event operations.
Create quarterly informational newsletters to keep partners informed of Nisolo brand updates, product releases, and other essential information.

Skills & Qualifications:
BA/BS degree or equivalent life experience. Marketing, Advertising, Merchandising, and/or Business related field of study preferred.
Experience preferred in:
Microsoft Excel, Google Suite
Shopify, Amazon Seller Central
Google Analytics
Dropbox
Asana, Basecamp, or Trello
Slack or Teams
CJ or other affiliate networks
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong organizational and detail-oriented skills.
Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills.
Able to work in a fluid, fast-paced, multi-channel environment.
Able to maintain a high standard of confidentiality and professionalism.
Understanding of sustainable fashion, ethical fashion, and/or social enterprise preferred
Customer focused, servant leader with excellent interpersonal and communication skills who actively engages stakeholders at all levels.
Business savvy with the ability to grasp the business model, analytics, and strategic plans of the company
Outstanding analytical, planning, organizing, and problem-solving skills.

Compensation: Based on previous experience and expertise.
Timing: Estimated start date: Summer 2019. Only candidates who pass through to the interview round will be contacted.
Location: Nashville, Tennessee

Next Steps: If you are interested in applying for this position, please email a single PDF document containing a cover letter, answers to the below questions, and a résumé to devon@nisolo.com with the subject line: “Partnerships & Acquisition Coordinator [Applicant’s Name].”

What sets you apart from other candidates for this position?

Job_Title: Junior Marketing Technology Analyst (2019-7985) in San Mateo, California | Careers at Fisher Careers
Job_Description:
The Junior Marketing Technology Analyst is responsible for the coordination, execution and day to day management of projects within the marketing department in accordance with project deadlines. In this role you will be responsible for coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors, consultants and internal IT staff in order to deliver projects according to plan. You will work with management and marketing channels to define a project's objectives and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle.

You would be great in this role if you love learning about new technologies and enjoy the challenges with fixing a wide array of issues that technology can bring. We are currently searching for a highly talented individual to join our marketing team in San Mateo, CA.

The Day-to-Day
Manage all phases of marketing projects from initial design through deployment completion
Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders
Assist with creation, implementation, testing, and ongoing monitoring of new custom tags/pixels
Communicate business changes, enhancements, and modifications – verbally or through written documentation – to senior management, peers, staff, and other employees so that issues and solutions are fully understood
Interact with IT staff or third party vendor to coordinate time estimates, prioritization, business requirements and implementation schedules
Manage technical vendors including platform coordination and integration
Capture and document business requirements for system enhancements from global marketing team
Provide ongoing system support for content management, web analytics, email marketing, project tracking and other tools; conduct trainings and provide ad hoc support to global marketers
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university or equivalent work experience
2+ years of professional experience in marketing technology or IT
Hands on experience with web analytics, digital content management and marketing automation tools required
Ability to read, write and troubleshoot JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Familiarity of web debugging tools like Chrome Dev Tools or Firebug
Requires excellent problem solving, organizational and communication skills
Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Why Fisher Investments

Fisher Investments is a different kind of investment firm. We don’t come from Wall Street, nor do we believe we fit in with most of the finance industry, and we’re proud of that. We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. From unmatched service to innovative perspectives on investing, it’s the people that make the Fisher purpose possible. After all, it’s our people that enable us to offer the level of service that we do. And we invest in them accordingly, offering exceptional benefits like:
100% coverage of premiums for health, vision and dental insurance
A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
20 days of PTO*, plus 9 paid holidays
8 week paid Primary Caregiver Parental Leave
And much, much more
We also provide a cumulative, continuous learning and development framework customized for every employee. This emphasis on personal and professional growth has yielded an award-winning work environment; we’re Great Place to Work Certified, and The Oregonian named us as a 2017 and 2018 Top Workplace.

But in the end, it’s not the perks that keep people here. They stay because they believe in our mission of service—our employees want to make a difference in an industry that can do better.
California employees accrue up to 17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time per year.

Do you enjoy partnering with business units and providing a wide range of analysis? Do you thrive in an environment that leverages your abilities as a fast learner, good listener, and problem-solver? If you love challenges, relish complexity, and have moxie, consider applying your unique talents with a Hawaii banking leader – Bank of Hawaii. You will work with the business to ensure the highest standards of stewardship and control are maintained, all while driving continuous improvement and innovation. Welcome to your tomorrow!

A day in your life as a Commercial Banking Associate

Under the direction of the Manager, the Commercial Banking Associate assists the Commercial Credit Team Leader and Primary Relationship Officer (PRO) with the evaluation of financial and other risks associated with business clients to enable the making of a credit decision. Ensures business unit’s compliance with applicable laws, regulations, regulatory requirements and Bank policies and procedures, including but not limited to those related to Fair Banking, Anti-Money Laundering laws and regulations, Bank Secrecy Act and USA PATRIOT Act.

We’ll Give You These Important Responsibilities…
Spreads Financial Statements, Business Tax Returns and Personal Tax Returns utilizing financial statement spreading software; prepares Loan and Account summary and financial updates to Asset Quality Reports.
Performs covenant compliance and tracking through calculations and documentation on the Compliance Review Worksheet; performs collateral valuations and validates Borrowing Bases or Advances with restrictions.
Analyzes financial statements, evaluates historical operating performance and financial condition, and assesses operational and credit risk in preparing Vendor Financial Reviews and Modified CAMs. CBA II prepares Credit Approval Memorandum (CAM) package and written summaries, including forward looking acceptability of risks, primarily for simple annual line renewals and other credit requests with guidance and close supervision of the Commercial Credit Team Leader. CBA II also completes credit write up and supporting analysis, including cash flow and sensitivity projections.
Assists Commercial Credit Team Leader and/or PRO with research, due diligence, and analysis as requested. Includes preparation of credit amendments (CAM-3) for covenant waivers and/or extensions and establishment or renewal of ACH limits via CR68 or ACH Control Limit Report.
Retrieves and reviews daily overdraft reports and ACH exceptions and recommends appropriate disposition of overdrafts and ACH exceptions with adequate research to support recommendation; communicates with client and PRO as necessary.
Cross trains in Commercial Credit Specialist functions including maintenance of the Baker Hill database, used to track financial statement reporting requirements, distribution of Baker Hill past due and expiring reports and preparation of client letters.
Performs all other miscellaneous responsibilities and duties as assigned.

Job_Title: Public Works GIS Asset Management Project Coordinators
Job_Description:
Close Date: 9/20/19

Working Title: Public Works GIS Asset Management Project Coordinators

Location: 22211 US Highway 19 N, Clearwater, FL 33765

The Public Works Department within Pinellas County is continuing to advance the practice of asset management by following a systematic approach to realizing the value of over $1.37B of assets to support our thriving community. Whether it’s the green light on a traffic signal or a storm water culvert, managing the lifecycle of our public infrastructure is one of our many responsibilities to the citizens of Pinellas.

Currently we are seeking 2 GIS Asset Management Project Coordinators to oversee the data-related analytical and reporting of our 2 largest divisions within Public Works. One Coordinator will be responsible for supporting the Stormwater and Vegetation assets while the other will focus responsibility on Transportation assets. Both positions will perform professional, technical, and analytical work involving geographic information systems (GIS), asset management, technical research, and quality assurance with a primary responsibility for supporting the data-related aspects of the asset management program efforts. There will be an additional emphasis on leveraging GIS and work management information to perform complex analyses that allow each Division/Sections to make informed decisions, such as preventing and predicting failures. Both individuals will be responsible for summarizing geospatial and work management data, evaluating implementation of work standards and methods, and identifying opportunities for process improvements and technical solutions to diverse problems. Develops and supports the documentation of technical and business system processes. This position is also responsible for performing other types of business analyses in support of the annual budget process, various operational activity cost comparisons, and complex reporting

Position Specific Qualifications

Experience - technical and professional level experience in GIS and asset management related analytics in support of an asset management program that includes 1 year of lead worker or supervisory training.
8 years of experience as described above.
Associate’s degree in engineering, environmental science, information technology, economics, health science, math, chemistry, physics, or related field and 6 years of experience as described above.
Bachelor’s degree as described above and 4 years of experience as described above.
Master’s degree as described above and 2 years of experience as described above.
PhD as described above and some experience as described above.


Additional Requirements
Possession and maintenance of a valid Florida Driver's License.
Assignment to work a variety of work schedules including compulsory work periods in special, emergency, and/or disaster situations.

Highly Desirable
Certified GIS Professional (GISP)
Knowledge of ISO55000
Knowledge of Cityworks AMS
Knowledge of SAP Crystal Reports

Illustrative Tasks
Provides detailed analytics and prepares statistical data, progress reports, and summaries for technical reports and asset management plans.
Uses GIS software (desktop & web applications), Cityworks, Crystal Reports, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel, and other software/systems to complete complex analyses against various databases; creates tables, charts, reports, data models, GIS maps and applications to communicate results of analyses in support of business requirements and initiatives.
Uses database tools, GIS desktop, and web applications to perform data documentation, validation, and quality management; applies global updates and maintains standardization of Enterprise GIS data; evaluates and corrects redline edits.
Manages and oversees assigned business analysis projects; this includes being the point of contact facilitating and assisting with defining requirements, identifying business needs, providing recommendations for and developing GIS data models, tracking projects through regular meetings with stakeholders, and monitoring timelines to completion.
Identifies and supports new concepts and approaches for addressing changing business needs, process improvements for increased efficiency, improved productivity, enhanced data accuracy, and greater program capabilities.
Facilitates and assists in the development and deployment of mapping applications.
Supports preparation of budgets, including advanced data analysis and summaries that assist in making decisions (planned/actual, cost/benefit, resourcing, levels of service, internal/outsourced work, etc.).
Summarizes and develops recommendations related to performance metrics and key performance indicators.
Exercises independent judgment in determining and recommending courses of action.


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities
Experience in the Geographic Information Systems (GIS)
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Outlook, Work, Excel, Access and PowerPoint
Knowledge of data gathering methods and analysis techniques
Knowledge and experience with identifying, developing and implementing policy and procedures
Ability to work with minimum supervision under broad guidelines and obtain, analyze, summarize, and maintain asset management data and records.
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing with internal and external customers of varying levels and while developing and presenting technical information.
A team player and relationship builder
Detail oriented with a focus on accuracy and timeliness
Possess strong organization skills
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks/projects
Strong problem-solving skills

Overview

Overview

Topps Digital Services, a division of The Topps Company, is a global leader in providing comprehensive processing, program management and payment solutions for the prepaid, stored value and gift card industries. TDS is licensed to bring to market physical and digital gifts for Netflix, Uber, DoorDash, Hulu, Sling TV, Harry’s, StubHub and Skype among others. TDS provides its digital partners turnkey solutions for monetizing and growing their revenue and brand via gift cards through major retailers across the globe. We provide comprehensive professional services and technology platform solutions for our partners’ global gift card and stored value programs across all retailers, countries, currencies and methods of distribution. TDS also develops individualized strategic retail rollout plans for its physical and digital partners to maximize revenue, branding and marketing results.

TDS develops unique gift card products and delivers them to consumers through a worldwide network of leading mass retailers (e.g. Target, Best Buy, Walmart, Rewe, Tesco, etc.), grocery, drug, convenience and specialty retailers in 46 countries. Headquartered in Encino, California, TDS also has offices in Minneapolis and resources in Phoenix, London, Bordeaux, Sydney, India, Brazil, Mexico and other locations around the globe. Additionally, the Topps Company has US offices in New York and Pennsylvania, and throughout the world in Australia, Mexico, France, Argentina, Italy, Brazil, the United Kingdom and Germany.

The TDS culture and business has been built upon an entrepreneurial drive and created by experienced leaders and a team of people that thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, creative and energetic environment. TDS is looking to complement this team with a Digital Partner Coordinator as described below.

Responsibilities

Job Description

As the TDS Digital Partner Coordinator based in Encino, CA, this individual should be able to wear many hats and pay great attention to detail. Acting as a utility player across the Operations team, this individual will be cross trained in many areas, systems, and processes. As direct support to the Senior Director of Digital Partner Services, you will be assisting on many aspects of the operations side of the business, which includes our technology stack and APIs, monitoring platform alerts, trafficking design, print production, customer service, data and reporting, social media, sales and analytics platform, and more. You will be responsible for managing their prioritized task list, following up with contacts in a timely manner, and effectively communicating with other TDS’ departments. This individual must also be able to balance a fast-paced work environment and stay organized.

Key Responsibilities
Assisting with the day to day needs of various clients
Creating products and data batches for all print runs and digital distribution
Managing the customized Partner store locators and keeping them current
Proofing our Partner’s digital customer journey flows from third parties
Handling customer service inquiries that originate from the client, activator or customer
Creating Partner ad campaigns for upcoming retailer promotions or general awareness
Assisting the Social Media Manager with creating content and posting it on an as needed basis
Providing updated art and text to Service Providers when our Partners refresh their branding and auditing these changes to ensure they take affect
Creating new documentation and fine-tuning existing documentation to ensure it is accurate and current
Creating and monitoring partner accounts to our various tools to ensure we have a current list of personnel and the services are being utilized
Following up on missing merchant IDs and names to enter into our mapping table for reporting
Working with the TDS retail team to help rename and categorize retailers for our sales and analytics tool
Managing your task list and completing those tasks based on priority and deadlines

Qualifications

Requirements:
1-2 years hands on experience in business, payments, digital or entertainment field
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, ability to work with a team and be client-facing
Excels in a multi-tasking role
Able to take direction as well as work independently
Learns quickly and is able to retain a lot of information in order to tackle tasks accurately and efficiently
The ability to pivot and think critically is key to growth in this position
Attention to detail, organized and thorough with desire for continuous improvements is key to this role
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite & Jira
Bachelor’s degree is required

Application
Provide a resume and cover letter

Malwarebytes is the next-gen cybersecurity company that millions worldwide trust. More than 10,000 businesses worldwide use, trust, and recommend Malwarebytes. We’ve created a fantastic culture that our employees love and were recently named in the top 10 of Fortune Magazine’s “Great Place to Work” list. We’re growing fast and are looking for some great people to join us.

Integrity: Doing the right things for the right reasons

About The Role

Platform Analysts create answers to client-driven business problems involving massive data sets (>10s of billions of rows) by designing high-performance analyses, databases, queries, applications, and workflow processes for Enterprise-level customers. We provide and manage a world-class data warehouse and analytics platform to our clients with dedicated analytical support and custom application development.

As a Platform Analyst, you build solutions and are the technical liaison with clients; you will help to solve business pain points, analytical problems and provide solutions that have substantial impact on client's business. You should be interested, willing, and able to learn new concepts, processes and languages quickly. Platform Analysts at 1010data think on their feet, are problem solvers, and self-starters who offer a unique perspective and synthesizing insights to solve real world business problems through technology.

This role will be on-site supporting a client, we are looking for an individual that is highly independent and has had at least 2 years of previous professional client facing experience as a consultant or analyst.

What You Will Take On
Manage full life cycle projects with multiple stakeholders on an embedded client basis
Analyze large data sets and gain unique industry insight using the 1010data platform
Design and implement operational and analytical reporting tools
Create data table transformations, perform data validation
Create clear, concise memos, summaries, design documentation, and presentations
Be the customer advocate and liaison to internal 1010data team


What You Will Bring

Background
STEM or other analytical degree
Experience solving unstructured problems whether business or academic
2+ years of professional experience working with large amounts of data
Experience managing a project with multiple participants


Skills
Demonstrated elite problem-solving ability
Ability to communicate clearly with a strong, crisp message
Understanding of database structure, design, query languages (e.g. SQL)
Ability to design solutions which serve the operational needs of varied businesses
Scripting programming languages (e.g. JavaScript, Perl, Python) to build interactive web applications

Desired
Experience with BI applications, their infrastructure and best practices is a plus
Experience with ERP systems (e.g. SAP) and reporting processes with ERP data is a plus
Knowledge of retail, supply chain or data warehouse applications is a plus
Experience designing systems or performing systems integration is a plus
Experience building production level, customer-facing applications is a plus

Personal Impact
Ability to manage multiple tasks with competing priorities
Exemplary critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Ability to empathize with clients in the process of gathering and evaluating requirements
Ability to both work independently and collaboratively


About 1010data

1010data makes big data discovery easy; we power sub-second responses to run analyses on trillions of rows of data. 1010data is defining the way the world interacts with data.

An essential tool to more than 850 of the world’s top companies including The New York Stock Exchange, Dollar General, P&G, Sam’s Club, Nespresso, Barnes & Noble, and RiteAid; the 1010data platform is a highly differentiated product that is becoming the industry standard for big data discovery and data sharing.

With petabytes of data in our private and public clouds, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the most complex advanced analytics. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance.

Mission

We are hiring software engineers who are passionate about architecting, developing, deploying, and operating the Databricks product. As a software engineer, you will collaborate with our world-class engineering team that is building a platform that unifies data science, engineering, and business. This includes teams that span from working on the Spark cluster management to building out collaborative features for data science and machine learning to building services and tools that manage our multi-cloud infrastructure. Work with a team to deliver features or improve architecture
Develop and extend the Databricks product. This includes: writing software in Scala, Python or Javascript and/or interacting with: cloud APIs (e.g., compute APIs, cloud formation, Terraform), with open source and third party APIs and software (e.g., Kubernetes) and with internal APIs.

About Databricks

Databricks’ mission is to accelerate innovation for its customers by unifying Data Science, Engineering and Business. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Databricks provides a Unified Analytics Platform for data science teams to collaborate with data engineering and lines of business to build data products. Users achieve faster time-to-value with Databricks by creating analytic workflows that go from ETL and interactive exploration to production. The company also makes it easier for its users to focus on their data by providing a fully managed, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure that reduces operational complexity and total cost of ownership. Databricks, venture-backed by Andreessen Horowitz, NEA and Battery Ventures, among others, has a global customer base that includes Viacom, Shell, and HP. For more information, visit www.databricks.com.

Apache, Apache Spark and Spark are trademarks of the Apache Software Foundation.

The Research and Insights (R&I) team at CREtech is a growing team of “data ninjas” who leverage their expertise in real estate, research, and tech to discover emerging trends in global real estate tech (proptech) ecosystem.

The ideal candidate is a team player who enjoys working with and researching startups, venture capitalists, and real estate professionals. This position will leverage your data and business intelligence capabilities to help us accelerate our impact on the industry. We are seeking candidates that are self-starters who can work in a diverse and fast-paced environment. The ideal person will be comfortable in (1) the process of individual contribution (i.e. digging into the data for value extraction), (2) working with senior business representatives, and (3) successfully manage Research & Insights projects.

Key Responsibilities

In the big picture, R&I team members focus on (1) understanding the business needs related to data and technology, (2) work on the identification and extraction of data from multiple data sources, (3) organize the efficient collection, connection and storage of relevant data, and (4) use data technology to extract and deliver/present business value to CREtech globally via reports, analytics and visualizations.

Here are some of the more detailed position responsibilities:
Consult with the various CREtech business lines to assess existing business processes and the real estate tech (proptech) landscape.
Identify business value-add opportunities with multi-functional colleagues and contributes to / leads the design & development of solutions to optimize R&I.
Generate R&I content in the form of content, visualizations, and reports on behalf of clients, media requests, and within CREtech internal functions e.g. Marketing, Growth, Finance, etc.
Independently develop, execute and monitor data and business intelligence processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects.
Develop proficiency in multiple research management disciplines and tools to develop robust and scalable R&I solutions.
Identify and acquire new data and information sources, and perform research discovery to understand values and relationships.
Develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of data across business lines and internal groups.
Relationship management between R&I team and clients.

Qualifications
Passionate about real estate tech and supporting others.
Minimum 2+ years of work experience in the fields of real estate, business intelligence, and/or research.
Bachelor’s degree in Real Estate, Business, or Marketing.
Experience and understanding of real estate, technology, and research.
Exposure to and/or knowledge of CRM systems
Excellent technical, analytical and organizational skills. Project management skills desired.
Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of planning and executing multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment.
Experience working in a diverse working environment and with people management skills within such an environment
Prepared to take on increasing responsibility and leadership for Research & Insights projects.

Job_Description:
Position Summary

The Technical Software Product Manager will partner with business teams, engineers, scientists, and other cross-functional teams to deliver state-of-the-art NGS analytics software solutions for Roche Sequencing Solutions. This individual will be responsible for software product requirements definition and management of the user story backlog for our high-profile NGS analytics products, and will be accountable for requirements decomposition and authoring of acceptance criteria for software.

This individual will represent the Software Product Management team in project meetings, daily standups, sprint planning sessions, retrospectives and other cross-functional meetings. He or she will be accountable for release and sprint-level prioritization of the backlog and will contribute to the overall prioritization process and NGS analytics software roadmap based on a thorough understanding of product strategy.

Responsibilities Include
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements for prototype construction and final product development by engineering teams.
Be the voice of the customer for the product development team throughout the entire product development lifecycle, from definition to sunsetting of the product.
Collaborate with customers, team members, and outside influencers to ensure a solid and well-rounded understanding of products and developing needs.
Maintain in-depth knowledge of the Roche Sequencing Solution’s products and those of our competitors.
Be the high-availability resource for answering questions posed by engineers and designers about stories in the backlog on a day-to-day basis.
Author user stories, acceptance criteria, product, and software requirements documentation.
Ensure that story content and prioritization is aligned to larger strategic objectives.
Attend standups, grooming meetings, estimation meetings, retrospectives and other key meetings for the scrum team.
Manage scope and drive trade-off decisions in conjunction with external stakeholders.
Identify blockers that will impact timeline, scope, cost or other project variables and escalate to the appropriate stakeholders.
Manage requirements lifecycle across multiple tools and systems.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree (Master's degree or higher preferred) in biology, molecular biology, molecular genetics, or a related discipline and 5+ years relevant experience, with practical experience in the life science, clinical research or diagnostics field.
Prior experience in product management/ product marketing for Next Generation Sequencing (NGS), cancer genetics or bioinformatics is strongly desired.
Strong organizational skills, with demonstrated ability to set priorities based on alignment with business goals and strategic direction, define timelines and deliver to commitments.
Experience with Agile processes such as Scrum, Lean and Kanban.
Exceptional oral and written communication skills .
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Summary

Job Description :

This job builds new analytical solutions which inform business processes and operations at the heart of our advanced analytics capability. The incumbent designs, executes and synthesizes point analytics to support specific business questions, programs or initiatives. The incumbent is a data-driven problem solver who understands and utilizes the Organization's business partner's strategies, goals and processes to answer critical business questions by leveraging and synthesizing the large volume and variety of data available to them. Draws on tools and methods from statistics and machine learning to perform analysis, create predictive models, visualize data, and drive projects through to delivery of the intended outcome. Continuously scans and tests new data sources, tools, and analytical techniques and partners with leading institutions and experts to contribute to our portfolio of next-generation analytic projects.

Essential Responsibilities
Work directly with the business to understand their questions, business processes, programs and/ or initiatives, then identifying how analytical solutions could help deliver value for them (e.g., more effective and/ or efficient processes). This would include being accountable for, outlining new use cases, creating high level impact estimates, and identifying the necessary data elements (including proxies) to deliver the analytical solution to complex business problems. Assemble data sets using knowledge of where the required data exists within the Organization's source data system, derived production sets or publicly available sources. Includes securing appropriate access and documenting objectives, assumptions and processes.
Select and apply the appropriate advanced modeling/machine learning techniques to these data sets to deliver business insight, ensuring that the final analysis is well researched, accurate, and documented. This requires technical flexibility, in-depth knowledge and delivery of advanced analytical approaches, for example regression models, tree-based learning, neural networks, clustering techniques, natural language processing.
Consult with the business to contextualize and translate the results of our analysis in a form which the business can understand and take action on. This will be include written reports, presentation and data visualizations, and draws clear lines between the high-level problem specifications, the analyses performed, and how the results link directly back to business objectives. It requires the incumbent to demonstrate their depth of understanding of many areas of the business, the data and the analytical methods through ongoing engagement with a range of audiences.
Plan, prepare and deliver/coordinate all elements of the analysis in such a way that it is delivered on time, to a high standard and ready to implement on a production basis (including dissemination through the Organization's user systems). This includes identifying the best route to implementation (developing the analytical solution accordingly).
Research self- directed new analytical skills and approaches, building relationships internally and externally to transfer knowledge and maintain their position as subject matter experts, consult with follow data scientists and analysts to guide analysis and deliver larger projects.
Other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION

Required
Master's Degree in Analytics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer and Information Science or Engineering

Substitutions
Bachelor's Degree in Analytics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer and Information Science or Engineering with 3 years of relevant experience

Preferred
Doctorate degree in Analytics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer and Information Science, or Engineering

Required

EXPERIENCE
1 - 3 years in Data Analytics
1 - 3 years using Large Data-sets
1 - 3 years utilizing Statistical Software
1 - 3 years in Data Visualization
1 - 3 years in Predictive Modeling
Academic research and/or work experience accepted

Preferred
1 - 3 years in the Healthcare Industry
1 - 3 years in Research and Development
1 - 3 years in a Business Analyst role
1 - 3 years in Consulting

LICENSES AND CERTIFICATIONS

Tumwater, WAAre you highly motivated and looking to be part of a team that makes a significant difference in the lives of others? Join our team at the Department of Corrections (DOC) as a Data Warehouse Administrator
ITS5 within Information Technology.Our mission at the Department of Corrections (DOC) is to 'improve public safety'. With a vast number of innovative sustainability programs, and evidence-based practices used to reduce recidivism (reoffending),, Washington State is highly regarded as a strong leader in the field of Corrections, and we are excited for you to join us in this effort!At the DOC, you will be completing meaningful work that will have a real, positive impact on the community. At the same time, the DOC is invested in creating a working environment that supports our employees. As a member of our team, you will have access to a benefits package to support you and your family.Our team is also dedicated to aiding in employee career growth. Once you are a part of our team, we strive to guide you and grow your skill set in order to advance your career with us. In 2018 alone, Washington's state workforce completed 5,358 promotions, the equivalent of 8% of our employees.At the DOC, we are not only dedicated to bettering our community and improving public safety, we are also invested in bettering the lives of our employees. We would be honored to have you join our team!. For additional information about our agency, please visit https://doc.wa.gov.Application**This position will remain open until filled with a first review date of May 13, 2019.**

To be considered for this position, please attach the following to your online application:A detailed, chronological resumeLetter of Interest that outlines how you meet the qualifications for this positionA minimum of three (3) professional references with your application. A professional reference is defined as an individual who has been paid to supervise your work and can attest to your work performance, technical skills, and job competencies.This position may be filled at the IT Specialist 4 (ITS4) level with an in-training plan to the IT Specialist 5 (ITS5) level.ITS4 Compensation: $5,053 to $6,629 per monthITS5 Compensation: $5,574 to $7,316 per monthEXAMPLE OF DUTIESThe Data Warehouse Administrator (DWA) position serves as an expert technical specialist and works closely with customers across the Department to ensure ongoing and timely access to information needed to maintain efficient and effective operations that support the DOC mission of public safety. This position works directly with stakeholders to gather data requirements, business requirements, develops data structures and populates data structures. The DWA works with IT groups in testing, validating, deploying, and maintaining the data structures. The DWA is responsible for data modeling and database design for the data warehouse and cube environments, performing data migration, and conducting data analysis to ensure quality data. The DWA ensures access to current, timely data by staff across the Department, supports the data needed to respond to external inquiries around DOC population, programs, services, and budget, and contributes directly to the Department's mission of improving public safety.Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Designs, develops, and maintains the Business Intelligence (BI) data infrastructure to consistently and reliably support business needs. Translates the business requirements into a data model.Designs how the data will be processed, stored, and accessed in the data warehouse or cube(s). Creates/maintains Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) packages and processed for migrating data from multiple data sources to data warehouse or cube(s).Leads in data warehouse and cube(s) maintenance and data quality issues. MaintenanceConsults with and makes recommendations to the supervisor on continuous improvement processes. Modifies the data integration processes to include the requested changes. Data Quality Identifies the root causes behind data inconsistencies and data issues, and determines whether it is a local data integration issue or an application issue.Performs key tasks in software and process updates (Maintenance Releases), including deployment and problem-solving when issues arise. Recommends, designs, and deploys continuous improvements to enhance the performance and quality of DOC data warehouse report applications.Understanding the business problems and developing ways and means to solve the problems. Reviews the report queries/stored procedures and applies Smart techniques, and modifies code in order to run the reports more efficiently. Performs database administration, uses Team Foundation Server (TFS) and manages Active Directory security groups administration on the Business Intelligence Group managed data, processes and reporting access. Installs and upgrades Developer Software and tools.Creates and maintains databases and objects as required.Creates and maintains TFS branch, team project collection, database objects, definition and deployment configuration, pre and post deployment scripts, and processes, edits and publishes work items.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSRequired Qualifications ITS5 Level: Four (4) years of experience in Business Intelligence Solutions development, using Microsoft SQL Server Services. Experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Microsoft SQL Server and OLAP cube. Two (2) years of experience directly performing Database Administration on production Microsoft SQL Database Server. Four (4) years of hands-on experience with database design, dimensional modeling, data warehouse and Business Intelligence and analytic tools. Four (4) years of hands-on experience using relational data architecture and reporting tools to design and develop reports to meet specifications for Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services. Proficient in SQL
Query development and performance improvements. Experience in doing data analysis and profiling. Experience in ETL and data integration. Desired Qualifications ITS5 Level: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field from an accredited institution whose accreditation is recognized by the U.S. Department of Education or the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), or foreign equivalent. Experience with innovative Business Intelligence technologies such as Power Viewer, SAS Software, Tableau, and SharePoint dashboard. Exposure to data modeling, predictive analytics, and forecasting techniques. Experience with Agile, Scrum, Iterative, or Waterfall development/project methodologies. One of the following professional level 2 certifications as defined by the Department of Defense 8570.01-M Information Assurance Workforce Improvement Program such as Security +, GIAC Security Essentials Certification (GSEC), Security Certified Network Professional (SCNP) or System Security Certified Practitioner. Experience in resolving data quality assurance issues in connection with information delivery and development tasks. Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert: Business Intelligence Solutions Expert (BISE) Certification. To qualify for the in-training opportunity, the ITS4 required qualifications are as follows: Two (2) years of professional IT experience. Two (2) years of experience in Business Intelligence solutions development using Microsoft SQL Server Services (ETL, SSAS, SSIS and DB). One (1) year of Microsoft SQL Server Database Administration Two (2) years of hands-on experience with database design, dimensional modeling, data warehouse and Business Intelligence Analytic toolsTwo (2) years of hands-on experience using relational data architecture and reporting tools to design and develop data structures to meet agency specifications. Developed and proven intermediate troubleshooting skills.Intermediate knowledge of ITIL processes, specifically in the Service Delivery discipline. Intermediate in the performance of user consultation and assessments on technology needs.Intermediate skills using all Microsoft SQL Server Suite of services. Intermediate skills in SQL
Query development and performance improvements. Intermediate skills doing data analysis and profiling. Intermediate skills in ETL and data integration. Job_Description:
Data Science
DATAS04163
Full-Time
Corporate Headquarters
Las Vegas, NV, USA
### Description
**Summary**
The Data Scientist turns data into high value assets in the form of insights and predictive models that contribute to measurable improvements in business process and performance. This role is responsible to identify appropriate data for the business problem at hand; collect, join, aggregate, validate and cleanse data into training samples for analysis; build, validate and maintain models; as well provide documentation and support for the application of the models in production.
**Minimum Requirements**
Combination of Education and Experience will be considered. Must be authorized to work in the US as defined by the Immigration Act of 1986. Must pass a Criminal Background Check. Visa sponsorship is available for this position.
Education: Bachelor’s Degree
Education Other: From an accredited college/university in one or more of the following: Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Econometrics, Physics, Operations Research or related field.
Years of Experience: Minimum of three (3) years of experience in a technical environment.

Other Requirements

Candidates must be comfortable in conversations and be able to demonstrate the following:
Understanding of applied Statistics, algorithms, modeling techniques as they relate to Data Science as a practice.
Technical experience working with data to include sourcing, extracting, validating, exploring, and transforming data with tools like SQL and Python.
Expert knowledge of the Data Science process.
Initiative, curiosity, and problem-solving skills through personal development projects and ongoing education.
Command of Python and/or R with the ability to mentor and train others.
Command of SQL with the ability to mentor and train others.
Ability to lead, manage and deliver complex Data Science projects with minimal oversight.
Command of applied statistics for Data Science. Master's Degree or PhD.
Credit Check: Yes
**Preferred Requirements**
Master's Degree or PhD
Strong knowledge in one or more of the following fields: statistics, data mining, machine learning, simulation, operations research, econometrics, and/or information retrieval.
Strong knowledge of the data science process and practical experience using machine learning algorithms including regression, classification, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, and decision trees.
Knowledge in airline operations, customer interactions and/or inter-departmental limitations across business units.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, proven presentation skills to all levels of audience.
Strong intellect and analytical aptitude, along with ability to be self-driven.
Demonstrated proficiency in Python, R, MATLAB, SQL or other programming languages or packages.
Comfortable with a fast paced, dynamic work environment.
Strong computer skills including but not limited to MS Office products.
**Job Duties**
Analyze and model airline operations and/or customer data and implement algorithms to support analysis using advanced statistical, engineering, and mathematical methods from physics, machine learning, data mining, econometrics, and operations research.
Interpret business opportunities into Data Science projects and deliverables. Deliver Data Science solutions and quantify ROI/Business impact.
Translate advanced analytics problems into technical approaches that yield actionable recommendations, in diverse domains such as predictive maintenance, delay predictions/recovery and Allegiant products upselling/cross-selling; communicate results and educate stakeholders through insightful visualizations, reports and presentations.
Facilitate conversations for teams to collaborate in removing impediments, empowering teams to self-organize and improve their productivity.
Retrieve, prepare, and process a rich variety of data sources from structured/unstructured cloud and non-cloud sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses, and uncover interesting trends and relationships.
Exercise continuous self-development, education and learning.
Act as an analytical mentor to others in the organization.
Help establish and sustain Data Science culture.
Leverage available research data to stay informed about industry related trends, potential disrupters, and competitive capabilities.
Document various approaches and model metrics to seek iterative means of improvement.
Provide a cohesive end-to-end solution through understanding the “cross-pollination” of technology/engineering/commercial verticals and applying both areas of expertise and areas of knowledge.
Other duties as assigned.
**Physical Requirements**
The Physical Demands and Work Environment described here are a representative of those that must be met by a Team Member to successfully perform the essential functions of the role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the role.
Office - While performing the duties of this job, the Team Member is regularly required to stand, sit, talk, hear, see, reach, stoop, kneel, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer, key board, printer, and phone. May be required to lift, push, pull, or carry up to 20 lbs. May be required to work various shifts/days in a 24 hour situation. Regular attendance is a requirement of the role. Exposure to moderate noise (i.e. business office with computers, phones, printers, and foot traffic), temperature and light fluctuations. Ability to work in a confined area as well as the ability to sit at a computer terminal for an extended period of time. Some travel may be a requirement of the role.
**EEO Statement**
Equal Opportunity Employer: Disability/Veteran
For more information, see Allegiant.com/careers

Join a small team dedicated to development and research initiatives leveraging machine learning and artificial intelligence methods to mine Deerwalk’s seven-million member dataset of post-adjudicated medical and pharmacy claims for actionable insights.

Job Responsibilities
Construct and curate a knowledge base of machine learning techniques and algorithms to help the team scale and grow
Develop models and algorithms that further Deerwalk’s product development and operational goals
Coordinate with product development teams to identify business problems that lend themselves to AI solutions
Interface with offshore machine learning engineers

Deerwalk Inc. (“Deerwalk” or the “Company”) is the leading provider of emerging Big Data analytics solutions to the healthcare industry. Deerwalk was established in 2010 by founders of D2Hawkeye, a pioneer in healthcare analytics, which was acquired by Verisk as its platform in the healthcare analytics space. Deerwalk’s cutting-edge software products are based upon the next-generation Big Data technologies such as Hadoop. The Company’s customizable suite of integrated care management and innovative data analytic applications; enable advanced capabilities and streamlined workflows for Providers and Healthcare IT organizations of all sizes.

Overview

At WellStar, we all share common goals. That’s what makes us so successful – and such an integral part of our communities. We want the same things, for our organization, for our patients, and for our colleagues. As the most integrated healthcare provider in Georgia, this means we pride ourselves on investing in the communities that we serve. We continue to provide innovative care models, focused on improving quality and access to healthcare.

Responsibilities

WellStars Internal Audit Department is hiring for a new role, L ead Data Analytics Internal Auditor ! This person will be responsible for establishing the Data Analytics function within our Internal Audit Department. If you are interested, please apply today!

This is an audit lead role that provides an analytical strategy and approach for developing, implementing and maintaining a data analytics program and analytical tools with the objective of optimizing the use of data to support the internal audit activities (risk assessment, planning, testing, reporting and follow-up) while continuously growing the department’s use of continuous monitoring and auditing strategies as well as supporting the audit team members in the development of analytics.

The primary responsibility of the Lead of Internal Audit Data Analytics is to produce and guide the audit team in the production of analytical solutions including data integration, manipulation and solution design, translating business needs into sustainable and high-quality deliverables. This includes understanding our internal and external customer needs for data and metrics. The Lead works with all level of management and as a working Lead, indirectly supervises the audit team on projects using analytics. The Lead will work with the auditors to grow the data analytics program, automate routine audits, and conceptualize audits of new areas. The Lead is also responsible for performing the audit procedures as outlined in their assigned audit work program.

The Lead keeps current knowledge of audit techniques and principles and meet CPE requirements to preserve professional certification.

Qualifications

Required Minimum Education:

Bachelor’s degree preferably in technology (Computer Science, Management Information Systems), Accounting, Business Administration, Math, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.

Required Minimum Experience
Seven (7) to ten (10) years relevant experience with previous audit or relevant business line and data analytic experience with financial information.
Experiences with ERP Systems, business intelligence, and analytical tools.
Experience working with large complex data sets, drawing conclusions and reporting findings.
Experience in healthcare industry strongly preferred.
Required Minimum Certification

Certified Information System Auditor (CISA), Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), or Analytics Certified Data Analyst (ACDA). Additional certifications are a plus.

Join us for outstanding benefits and development opportunities. We also offer state-of-the-art technology, professional support and advancement, and colleagues that rank amongst the best in the country. The WellStar culture of caring has also been nationally recognized three years in a row by Fortune Magazine as one of the “100 Best Companies to Work For”. Step up to your potential. Find out more and apply today.

WellStar is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status or any status which is protected by local, state or federal law.

Job_Title: Data Analyst for Medicaid Transformation - Raleigh
Job_Description:
Company Description

Computer Consultants International , Inc. (CCI) is an IT Consulting Firm with more than 18 years experience providing effective, expert-level services in industries such as Construction, Technology, Finance, Healthcare, and Government. CCI focuses on building long-term relationships while completing projects from design to delivery. People are CCI's key component for success. Recruiting utmost-quality individuals for our clients, CCI fields a workforce of individuals who are selected not only because of their technical qualifications but also for their achievements as substantial, contributing human beings. In government work and in the commercial market, high standards of ethics and accountability are critical. Therefore our people are chosen for their integrity and ability to maintain relationships, as well as expertise in their field. To learn more about CCI, visit us online at www.cci-worldwide.com.

Job Description

Primary Purpose of the Position

The Data Analyst position reports to the Chief Data Officer (CDO) and uses a diverse set of technical, communication, and coordination skills to enable data-driven understanding of NCDHHS (North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services) programs to evaluate and inform policy. This position communicates with functional business owners to develop requirements and use cases; Provides key research, analytical and reporting functions for NCDHHS; develops and implements research on agency programs such as Medicaid Transformation; applies advanced statistical methods to health and human services related eligibility, medical utilization and expenditure data; coordinates project design, planning, statistical analysis, evaluation, and reporting; writes advanced scripts and code for statistical analysis. Assists in identifying and interpreting data patterns and trends.

Provides consultation and assistance to internal staff and other DHHS agencies in developing methods and strategies for more effective reporting of data and analyses. Coordinates across divisions and works closely with ITD to define and develop the data systems necessary to fulfill the functions of the Data Office.

Defines requirements for development/modification of agency interface files and APIs and tests for accuracy, reliability, and validity.

Ensures data integrity and provenance; develops and implements tools to track the accuracy and integrity of data reporting; defines and documents business rules for data validation; enables data provenance and auditing. Establishes processes for analyzing and validating data used to calculate outcome measures.

Works with interdisciplinary teams to research and correct data issues. Responds to ad hoc data requests.

This position also requires the ability to learn and apply new technology, work independently or in a team environment, and collaborate with all levels of staff within DHHS to satisfy business needs.

Works under minimal direction with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

Qualifications

Demonstrated experience with SAS Analytics Software. SQL, Crystal Reports, Business Objects. Highly desired. 3 Years

Skill in graphical and tabular presentation of data. Ability to develop and interpret statistical data charts and tables. Highly desired. 3 Years

Demonstrated ability to manage, manipulate, and analyze complex databases producing accurate output. Highly desired. 3 Years

Direct knowledge of scientific research methods, statistical techniques, and their application to research analysis. Highly desired. 3 Years

Job_Title: HRIS & Analytics Specialist - FT Days - Human Resources - INTEGRIS
Job_Description:
The HRIS & Analytics Specialist is responsible for creating and maintaining the analytic infrastructure to successfully measure workforce efficiency and effectiveness in linking HR strategies to business outcomes. In addition, the HRIS & Analytics Specialist is responsible for supporting predictive analysis and partnering with key stakeholders throughout the system when necessary to develop the workforce planning process, data analysis, insight, and actionable solutions. The HRIS & Analytics Specialist also maintains all existing HR system applications.

INTEGRIS Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Job Code: 1919

Essential Functions

The HRIS & Analytics Specialist's responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Detailed workforce planning with input collected through the COE's partnership with key stakeholders throughout the organization, using sophisticated analytics required to develop recommendations to align HR strategies with business outcomes
Supports the Lead's engagement of leaders/key stakeholders around key role segments
Reporting and data analysis to support all of organizational workforce planning and HR analytics needs, automation of reporting
Conducts internal forecasts on talent demand, enterprise strategic changes, productivity, and turnover
Conducts external forecasts on talent supply, healthcare environment assumptions, and competitive changes. Identifies operational gaps and strategic impact on business objectives.
Drafts the workforce plan in collaboration with the HR System Manager that serves as a guide for decision-making in relation to workforce strategy
Develops metrics, gathers data, and analyzes information to drive solutions that mitigate future workforce problems
Supports, maintains and develops new or existing HR system applications
Analyzes and evaluates current systems and procedures and recommends system design and work flow modifications as needed
Reviews, analyzes, documents and reports on current business and system statistical data and provides detailed analysis
Presents and justifies proposals for system modifications, enhancements and new technology solutions to HR leadership
Accountability

Reports to the HR System Manager.

Required Physical Demands (Subject To Reasonable Accommodation)

Keyboarding/Dexterity: Frequently; activity exists from 1/3 to 2/3 of the time
Standing/Walking: Occasionally; activity exists up to 1/3 of the time
Strength (Lift/Carry/Push/Pull): Sedentary (exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally)
Talking (Must be able to effectively communicate verbally): Yes
Seeing: Yes
Hearing: Yes
Color Acuity (Must be able to distinguish and identify colors): No

Basic typing skills used daily. Requires ability to use automated tools for word-processing and spreadsheets. Requires good eyesight for reviewing documents and reports, analyzing user work environment, and using computer equipment. Good hand and eye coordination required. Requires good speech and hearing, verbal and written communication skills. Requires the ability to write legibly. Physical effort is minimal. Extended periods of sitting is often required. Department to department mobility is needed. May require travel. Must be able to reach 18 inches to grasp and move paperwork such as reports and documentation.

This position may have additional or varied physical demand and/or respiratory fit test requirements. Please consult the Physical Demands Project SharePoint site or contact Risk Management/Employee Health for additional information.

Environmental Conditions

Mental and emotional stress related to deadlines for projects. Heavy work volume and high degree of accuracy required. Work may require extra hours or weekends in order to accomplish tasks with minimal disruption to customers or to meet critical deadlines. May require return to work during evening and weekend hours to resolve critical problems. Exposure to serious error is always present. Errors in design, logic, processing procedures, data integrity, data security and system recovery may affect employee and applicant data. One seemingly minor error can severely compromise data integrity. Travel may include air travel. Exposed to weather conditions during travel.

All applicants will receive consideration regardless of membership in any protected status as defined by applicable state or federal law, including protected veteran or disability status.

Job_Description:
The Data Analyst understands the sources of CNO data, how it relates to the application clusters and business areas. The Data Analyst provides the business access to someone who can help define what the data is, how to assemble it in a meaningful way and what simple trends & initial insights they have found. Understanding these simple trends and insights can assist the business in building reports that will capture the domain's behavior. The Data Analyst will identify opportunities to further improve the quality of available data. They will work with the developers to stage the requested data, once staged, they will profile the data and then work with the business to understand the data.

Next, the Data Analyst will work with the Data Governance Council to apply the CNO standardized terminology through transformations. These transformations will be captured by the Data Analyst in the CURe mapping documents.

Key Responsibilities
Profiling, cleaning, mapping and analyzing data
Complete the scoping of straight-forward requests to stage source data
Contribute to and comply with the policies and procedures defined by the Enterprise Data Governance Council.
Convert Business Requirements from Stakeholder, Business and IT into mapping documents
Perform Data Validation to confirm mappings are complete and align with the business requirements.
Demonstrate analytical thinking skills by breaking down complex problems or processes, identifying causes and effects patterns, and analyzing problems to arrive at an appropriate solution.
Simplify complex problems into smaller, logical and manageable activities.
Research application and data technology issues to identify potential resolutions, up to and including initial requirements to support development activities. Organize, prioritize and execute tasks balancing multiple high visibility and priority projects.
Elicitation techniques to gather information at the right level of detail and scope to represent all of the stakeholder’s needs, and the ability to ask questions that lead to an understanding of the business need.
Communicating requirements including the use of presentation skills and the ability to create a requirements package.
Documenting data flows using different approaches such as use cases, activity diagrams, sequence diagrams and state charts, data dictionaries, class or entity relationship diagrams.

Requirements


3+ years’ experience in data related work (modeling, integration, reporting and analytics)
High degree of competency in SQL and relational databases
Self-motivated with a desire to research and learn new skills in the data management space
Above average level of experience in Excel
Analytical and detail-oriented
Observable client-facing skills
Insurance industry experience preferred
Must be able to communicate effectively across multiple business functions, architecture and technology professionals.
Ability to a wide range of data tools and technology, including profiling, cleansing and integration.
Design and articulate solutions for identified Business Requirements
Ability to identify, collect and assemble data.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral, negotiation, and business skills to develop and maintain effective business relationships within the company and business community.
Ability to utilize various modeling techniques such as process modeling, data modeling, system modeling.
Ability to adapt to change and manage competing demands.

Role : Technology Lead | Business Intelligence - Integration | MSBI (SSIS)
Location : Cumberland , RI
Duration : 6 Months
Rate : $70/Hr On C2C All Inclusive

Epic Caboodle or Clarity data model certification SSIS SQL

Experience in below Epic tools/databases are required to support reporting and data analytics from Epic
Clarity Data model
Caboodle data model
SlicerDicer
Radar Dashboard
Reporting workbench
Expertize in Sql development is required along with above 5 tools. SSIS development experience would be a plus

Nice To Have Skills

Detailed Job Description

10 years of IT experience 4 years of experience in Epic Caboodle Clarity data model certification 2 years in SSIS development

Certifications: No

Job_Title: Credit Union Analytics Translator - Credit & Collection
Job_Description:

Credit Union Analytics Translator - Credit & Collection

Reports To

Director of Finance Analytics & Consulting

Department

Analytics & Consulting Services

Location:

Seattle, WA

Reporting to the Director Finance Analytics & Consulting and working closely with our Clients as well as our Business Development & Sales team, this role will act as our Subject Matter Expert for Credit & Collection operations.

This role will identify challenges in the (Credit &) Collection operations of our (prospective) clients (e.g. Credit Unions), translate those challenges into analytics solution designs, develop and deliver powerful solutions and finally provide valuable business and data insights to the clients. A key part of the role includes pre-sales support (consultative selling) in collaboration with our Business Development & Sales team as well as solution design and development in close collaboration with our Data Science team.

The Analytics Translator will be a key member of our start-up like and very dynamic Arvato Finance Analytics & Consulting team that supports the delivery and implementation of analytics projects along the Order-2-Cash process and Member Lifecycle.

Our mission is to revolutionize Finance through Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics & Behavioral Biometrics. Our Finance Analytics & Consulting team contributes to this mission by providing BI & Reporting, Advanced Applications & Analytics, Machine Learning and AI Services from our locations in the US and offshore.

Job Duties
Develop an understanding of our clients’ (Credit &) Collection process and operations to be able to identify use cases and analytical business questions
Develop vision and roadmap on how to transform the client’s (Credit &) Collection department into a data-driven operation
Support client engagements end-to-end: from project acquisition, requirement gathering, and solution development to a successful service delivery to the agreed service level and specification
Contribute with valuable business insights on (Credit &) Collection processes and analytics to support the clients’ strategy and vision
Author processes and procedures for (Credit &) Collections for industry comparison and reference purposes
Develop and maintain a governance model to ensure a strong (Credit &) Collection analytics road map and obtain buy-in/approval on the solution framework from the business users for execution
Compile meaningful presentations about data insights and related business impact
Ensure knowledge transfer within the team and the relevant teams of Arvato Financial Solutions
Support the development of innovative and scalable analytics solutions for (Credit &) Collections in Credit Unions
Demonstrate leadership daily, influencing and motivating others without direct authority, continually identifying and implementing continuous improvement opportunities across the team
KEY RESULT AREAS
Acquire and successfully deliver Finance Analytics consulting projects within our clients’ Credit & Collection departments
Identify use cases throughout the Credit & Collection processes and address them by leveraging your (Credit &) Collection process knowledge
Manage client engagements end-to-end at a high level of customer satisfaction
Ensure transparency during the entire project delivery towards internal stakeholders, partners, and our clients
Measure and document ROI/business impact for business enhancements
Create case studies and success stories on successful projects to emphasize our capabilities
Generate new projects with existing clients and support the acquisition of new clients and projects
Foster collaboration between the client teams and Arvato project team
PERSONAL SPECIFICATIONS

Essential Qualifications, Training, And Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance or related field plus 5 years’ experience or Master’s degree in Business, Finance or related field plus 3 years’ professional experience
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in (Credit) and/or Collection operations
Significant experience with (Credit &) Collections activities within Credit Unions or financial institutions
General knowledge and awareness of US GAAP, Federal laws and regulations related to (Credit &) Collections activities
Record of accomplishment in providing thought leadership on Collection operations/initiatives
Ability to design and implement Collection operations solutions
Self-organization skills related to competing projects and multiple clients
Competent and professional presentation skills
Ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of experience
Ability to communicate across varying levels of executive management
Ability to present complex topics in an easy and understandable manner without losing the business impact
Up to 80% travel expected
Desirable Qualifications, Training, And Experience
Experience working with BI, Reporting & Analytics tools and solutions (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, MS Azure, R, KNIME, SAS, Python)
Ability to conceptualize and develop reports and advanced analytics solutions
Knowledge of operational excellence programs or similar quality frameworks (e.g. Lean Six-Sigma)
Personal Attributes Required
Highly motivated self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit and can-do attitude who wants to deliver results quickly
COMPETENCIES
Leadership
Self-Starter
Advanced Analytics
Change Management
Creativity and Innovation
Commercial and Business Acumen
Integrity, Values, and Ethics
Customer Focus
Team Work
Results Orientation
Organizing and Planning
Performance Monitoring
Decision Making
Problem Solving

Arvato Financial Solutions is a part of Arvato Digital Services LLC (ADiS) an internationally networked outsourcing provider. There are more than 7,500 employees who design and implement solutions for business processes across integrated service chains for customers around the world. Our portfolio includes robust services related to the creation of professional and custom IT services that revolutionize finance through advanced intelligence and analytics by employing a value-driven model to serve our business partners in the consumer electronics, high-tech, telecommunication, networking and banking sectors. With more than five decades of experience and our global footprint, we bridge data and operational change for our customers to ensure they are well equipped for the challenges of their markets.

ADiS LLC is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Bertelsmann SE & Co. KGaA.

“Arvato Finance is an Equal Opportunities Employer, Embracing Diversity in the workplace”

Are you looking for a place to jump start your career in software development that offers in-depth training programs and career advancement opportunities? If so, MRI Software is the place for you! We are currently looking for a Entry-Level Software Engineer to join one of our Product Development teams! Under the Agile development methodology, this developer will work cross-functionally with other groups both inside and outside the department including Product Management and Documentations as well as create and test code in our dynamic team setting. You will be able to gain a deeper understanding of specific programming languages such as C# and VB.Net, through our in depth training program.

Founded in 1971, MRI Software is a leading provider of innovative real estate software applications and hosted solutions. MRI’s comprehensive and flexible technology platform coupled with an open and connected ecosystem meets the unique needs of real estate businesses—from property-level management and accounting to investment modeling and analytics for the global commercial and residential markets.
