Assist performing Financial Management support including, but not limited to, business case analysis, invoice research, invoice analysis, invoice processing, invoice reclassifications, cost benefits analysis, funding models, financial research, financial reporting, performance management
Assist performing business case development and cost estimates for the DHS enterprise IT service programs.
Support the development of acquisition strategies and approaches. Coordinate and facilitate receipt of OCIO Spend Plan requirements to assist the Government in finalizing the OCIO Spend Plan.
Coordinate the finalization of the OCIO Spend Plan requirements in accordance with the OCIO Fiscal Year Budget Planning schedule, which will be communicated by the Government annually
Access PRISM, FFMS, C-FIT, APFS, electronic files, physical files, legacy systems and other financial systems to research finances, budget, accounting, contracts, invoices, obligations, expenditures, performance and to generate accurate payment instructions
Research and analyze invoices and invoice transactions for accuracy, validate the accuracy of invoice payments and coordinate reclassifications or corrective actions, as required
Perform Spend Plan analysis to verify the accuracy of financial transactions, obligations, expenditures and requests in accordance with the approved Spend Plan

Bachelors or Advanced Degree
2+years of Financial Analysis experience.
Project Management Professional Certification (PMP)
Must be a confident communicator and presenter.
Must possess excellent organizational and planning skills.
Superior project management and time management skills.
Staff and team management experience.
Strong knowledge and understanding of current trends in financial analysis and federal IT.
Self-motivated with a positive and professional approach to management.
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate complex ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.
Ability to foster collaborative relationships with other cross-functional teams.

Ability to obtain and maintain a DHS Suitability clearance

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

This is a full-time position. Hours of work are Monday through Friday.

Job Description

Do you want to make a significant impact? Do you want to utilize your analytical skills to drive improvements and pursue excellence. True Value has a need for a Systems and Support Associate.

This techno / functional role will require a hybrid of technical knowledge and business process capabilities that have a high degree of problem solving capabilities. To be considered for the Systems and Support Associate role, experience working with legacy systems and supporting processes is required.

You will need to be able to prioritize activities daily. The incumbent will understand our data and reporting for a subset of defined support areas (system, reports, etc.). You will work cross-functionally on solution quality issues (system tuning) as well as maintaining and executing daily reporting and analytics. You will also play a supporting role in identifying improvement opportunities where appropriate. This person will assist on these opportunities by providing input on the need for change.

The Systems and Support Associate will have foundational technical and consultative skills, so they are
looked at as problem solvers.

Joining True Value Offers a Culture That
Embraces personal and professional growth
Recognizes diverse perspectives
Provides competitive compensation
Committed to volunteerism and community outreach
Your Value = Our Value. True Value.

Position Description

Essential Duties And Responsibilities (in Order Of Importance)

Business support / Help tickets
Identify issues and resolve as needed through analysis and tuning as issues are escalated though the business systems help ticket system.
Analytics (Data mining and reporting)

Respond to customer reporting requests by pulling data and using blending. Identify the data requested and, in some cases, identify complimentary data and analysis if appropriate.
Anticipate reason for request and offer up approaches that help the requestor solve their problem.
Measurement and Continuous Improvement
Respond to help request with a sense of urgency and quality. Support opportunities that will drive efficiency and improvement of key True Value metrics.
Support system tuning and end user adoption as directed. This will require analysis of the request for help that are more consultative than transactional.
Change Management and Training
Assist with helping drive better user understanding of the systems, data and processes we support.
Deliver ad hoc training and identify gaps in user understanding.
Closely collaborate with the Trainer and Continuous improvement.
Technology Enablement

Assist with solution validation through testing and error trapping, root cause analysis, quality control, and IT collaboration/liaison.
Keep apprised of anything new being introduced to the system from a settings/business rule perspective as well as changes introduced in our batch nightly processing.
Monitor any upstream data changes that could influence solution quality.

Work Experience

Experience in Supply Chain required, APICS certification preferable
Experience working in databases for reporting and data mining
Logistics, Supply Chain, Technology and/or Business Consulting, Technology or Wholesale experience preferable

Education

Energy Advisor

Position Summary
The primary role of the Energy Advisor position is to analyze interval  (60, 30, and 15-minute) smart meter electricity data, building information, and prospective customer account information to identify low and no-cost operational and maintenance energy saving opportunities (e.g. HVAC scheduling). Once an opportunity is identified, you will engage the utility-partner business customer through email and phone calls to provide recommendations and necessary remote support for the business customers (with the support of an Energy Engineer) to implement energy reduction actions. After the customer has implemented the recommended changes, you will monitor their smart meter data and work with our internal Measurement and Verification team to confirm the immediate and continuation of savings. 
Additional responsibilities include: 
Listen to and collect customer and market feedback to provide Power TakeOff’s Product Development team to enhance Power TakeOff’s service offering.
Assist in the creation of marketing material to help generate market interest and verify savings claims
Assist in the referral of clients to other energy efficiency programs, when applicable

Success in this role is primarily defined by:
Energy (kWh) savings achieved
The number of energy-saving actions taken by participants 
The level of outreach and engagement to participants 
Support for program marketing (case studies, testimonials)
Additional contributions that benefit the team 

Overall, the most successful team members are:
Invested in making an environmental impact
Good teammates (confer with others, improve through feedback, delegate appropriate tasks)
Communicative (speak clearly, openly, and honestly with the goal to improve their performance and others)
Goal-oriented (interested in working a strategy towards defined, achievable goals). 
Creative (in their approach to problem-solving)
Patient (in the time it takes to see results)
Flexible (ready and able to change direction) 

Required Skills, Knowledge, Abilities
Demonstrated ability and comfort engaging and talking with prospective clients
Demonstrated ability managing a sales pipeline
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and keep notes and maintain systems records
Demonstrated enthusiasm for working with data to solve problems
Ability to work in a team environment, offering support and willingness to receive and provide feedback to achieve shared goals 
Interest in analysis and data interpretation to solve practical problems
Proficiency using a variety of CRM systems (Salesforce, Outreach) is preferred
Higher Education degree
Exceptional oral and written communication skills
Self-motivated and goal-oriented
Must be able to successfully pass a pre-employment criminal and drug screen at random notice
Exclusively based in Denver, Colorado office

About Power TakeOff
Power TakeOff is a software and implementation company driven by making an environmental impact by helping business customers reduce their energy consumption. Since its founding in 2007, Power TakeOff’s products and services have centered around three core competencies, which still apply today: 1) to exclusively serve and specialize in the non-residential market, 2) the use of interval (daily, hourly, 15, or 1 minute) electric data to help this market better understand and reduce usage, 3) to use software and analytics as tools to cost-effectively deliver services at utility-scale. While our end-user customers are businesses, much of our work is generated from utility-scale contracts with the likes of Xcel Energy, Southern California Edison, and ComEd, among others.
Over the past two years, Power TakeOff was quantitatively able to help its customers reduce electricity equivalent to what 2,250 houses or 70 railcars of coal use in a year. Goals for 2020 are to triple this impact, with even more upcoming opportunities to expand this impact. 

We’re a fast-moving, nimble, and growing company with a need for a self-motivated energy efficiency enthusiast who enjoys helping businesses reduce energy usage. We look forward to your interest and the opportunity to get to know you.

Your Salary & Benefits
Salary, based on experience
Health insurance coverage through the Company’s plan with a $5 monthly co-pay 
Monthly Company Health Savings Account (HSA) contribution, up to the pro-rated IRS contribution limit 
Position starts with (pro-rated) 15 days of paid time off annually 
9 paid vacation days
6 flexible well-being days
6 remote flex days
9 paid holidays
Significant potential for growth within the company
Retirement savings plan with company match 
Work Remote Fridays (to reduce the carbon footprint of commute) 
RTD EcoPass (to support cleaner transportation)

Position Summary

We are looking for you - dynamic, best-in-class talent - to join the Cadreon team as a Senior Associate, Campaign Management. In this role you will be responsible for assisting senior team members in delivering successful audience-based programmatic media programs across a portfolio of Cadreon clients. This individual will have an active role on audience strategies, optimization approach and analysis, troubleshooting, pacing, and ad hoc reporting. This role requires a highly collaborative individual who is analytical and uses data-enabled problem solving capabilities to deliver flawless campaign execution - meeting and exceeding client business goals and KPIs. The ideal candidate will have experience in programmatic campaign management (display, video, mobile, social); in-console experience with DSPs and exchange-based media buying; superior analytical thinking ability, excellent presentation /client servicing skills.

Essential Functions
Serve as resource in terms of gathering and distributing research around the programmatic industry or our clients
Ensure proper pacing of impression/click delivery of campaigns, prompt delivery of reports to clients and accurate/useful performance reports
Maintain a deep understanding of Cadreon capabilities and our client business
Work closely with the senior team members to contribute to the success of cross-channel programmatic client campaigns
Assist team with all executional aspects of the campaign management processes - campaign strategy; tagging recommendations; console setup; delivery management (pacing, budget, spend); analysis and reporting
Liaise between key internal groups on the account (marketplace, product, client services, research/analytics, operations)
Help in designing and delivering performance updates, business reviews, new audience-based programmatic solutions and growth opportunity presentations to key agency contacts
Generate supporting documentation for post campaign presentations and provide insights to client teams
Responsible for the overall success of programmatic client campaigns
Support the performance media lead in defining audience strategies and tactics to maximize economic outcomes within campaign limits


Education

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required


Work Experience
1-2 years of experience digital media experience across display, video, social and mobile; a minimum of 1+ years in-console audience-based RTB media


Skills
Knowledge of digital media systems and tools (ie. ad servers, attribution, tagging, ad verification)
Knowledge of ad targeting methodologies
Knowledge of media optimization methodologies
Familiarity with general IT and internet technologies
Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills
Can multi-task, prioritize, and balance time across clients, multiple partner relationships and internal initiatives on a daily basis while maintaining a profound attention to detail
Understanding of ad networks, exchanges and/or auction marketplaces, with the ability to manage bid pricing and optimization levers to meet client goals
Knowledge of online media metrics and analysis
Proficiency in MSFT Office; deep experience with data analysis in Excel, including pivot tables and advanced functions
Data analysis experience
Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills
Excellent written and verbal communicator
Outstanding relationship and business builder
Collaborative team-player yet comfortable with independence


About Us

Cadreon is IPG Mediabrand’s Ad Tech unit, responsible for developing best-in-class programmatic technology solutions. In a widely disparate technology landscape, we leverage best-in-class technology to deliver the most comprehensive, highest-performing programmatic solutions on the market. We provide extensive expertise for some of the best and brightest brands across our IPG Mediabrands agency partner landscape. Headquartered in San Francisco, Cadreon operates in 68 markets worldwide.

Web Analytics & CRO Manager at Moz Vancouver, BC OR Seattle, WA Moz is looking for an experienced digital marketing professional to fill an immediate opening for a Web Analytics & CRO Manager. The Web Analytics & CRO Manager reports directly to the Director of Customer Lifecycle Marketing, providing leadership and support for web analytics tools that deliver insights to help increase site visitors, create deeper engagement, and improve online conversions. They will work cross-functionally across marketing, engineering, and design teams to optimize the Moz.com experience for existing customers and prospects and ensure KPIs and success metrics are tightly aligned with marketing objectives. Diversity & Inclusivity. Moz is committed to building diverse teams where people of all identities and backgrounds are welcome, included, and respected. We work to help close the gender gap in tech, and to actively recruit people from other underrepresented groups. We strongly encourage women, gender diverse people, and minority candidates to apply for this role. What You'll Do * Use data to identify insights that inform hypotheses and test ideas. * Plan, and prioritize insights and testing strategies which meet business objectives * Identify, build and execute on A/B, multivariate tests to support campaign objectives. * Analyze and evaluate A/B tests, report on results and recommend next steps. * Perform all duties of an analytics tool administrator including/managing account access, site tagging and configurations, custom dashboards, and user training as requested. * Work with internal stakeholders to ensure proper setup and maintenance of Moz's analytics platform: Google Analytics. * Run regularly-scheduled web analytics reports that contribute meaningful analysis and actionable insights. * Collaborate with Marketing Operations Manager, Campaign Managers, and other team members to collect and integrate website analytics data into campaign, marketing channel, and marketing team performance reports, as needed. * Conduct ad-hoc analysis and reporting for internal clients as requested. * Develop a holistic view of the customer decision journey and apply insights to inform the development of a website experience that engages and converts. What We Want To See * 4+ years working experience in a marketing capacity, preferably in B2B tech, which include 2+ years experience managing a web analytics platform * Ability to work within a content management system (CMS) * Google Analytics certified and expert * Proficiency developing custom reports, advanced segments, and complex goals, and the interpretation and presentation of findings * Experience in assessing website usability and in aiding user-experience optimization * Previous experience with A/B testing programs (and any associated software) * An understanding of various methods for visualizing analysis and presenting data in a way that can be easily consumed by less technical staff. * Intermediate Excel skills; ability to integrate disparate data sets into clear, concise reports * Ability to handle multiple projects and prioritize responsibilities * Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment * High level of accuracy and attention to detail * Strong familiarity with Google Tag Manager * Strong familiarity with Google Search Console * Experience with Tableau, SQL, and/or familiarity with Segment.io is preferred but not required. About Moz We build search intelligence and analytics software that gives our marketing users the technical edge towards better marketing on the web. We are dedicated to the future of marketing analytics. We're obsessed with it. We've been at it for 15 years and we're in it for the long haul. We receive frequent recognition for our accomplishments as well as being one of the best companies to work for. In October of 2018 Moz acquired STAT, an eight year old Vancouver-based software company. STAT is a complex, distributed system that gathers, analyzes, and delivers high-volume SEO analytics data for our enterprise clients, fresh every day. We're thrilled to come together as one company! We are both passionate about our shared values and commitment to developing the best organic search solutions for our customers. Some reasons why you'd want to work with us: * You want to play a big part in growing a young, profitable company * You do your best in a setting where excellent work is what's valued-not face time (a good work-life balance is just how we do things) * You value authenticity and a work environment that values who you are and what you can do * You're looking for a big challenge that involves lots of variety, collaboration, inventiveness, and on your toes thinking * You want to work alongside people who are passionate, friendly, and helpful We value diversity, equity and inclusion.

JOB DESCRIPTION Job Summary This Quality Engineering position is part of the Education Technology agile teams responsible for those world-class education products. This role is responsible for executing the Education Technology Quality Engineering strategy. They will work with peers and leads to enhance testing design and improve process standards, with a focus on effectiveness and quick feedback driven approaches. Join the fastest growing marketing company in Chicago! Arcalea is an Inc. 500 fastest growing company listed #149 in the U.S., #9 overall for Advertising and Marketing Agencies, and #1 in Chicago.

Company Overview

We Lead, We Grow, We Deliver, Together.
Arcalea is an award-winning digital marketing agency with a history of big brand experience. We help brands redefine digital strategy, increase brand inquiry, and drive new revenue. As a Premier Google Partner, Arcalea blends information security with digital strategy to create winning campaigns through the entire search marketing umbrella: organic and paid.

Position Overview

Arcalea is looking for an energetic, detail-oriented full-time Jr. Digital Analyst to support the work of the agency’s Account Executives. Key deliverables for this role include analytics and operational support of 3-5 client accounts, while engaging with the team on day-to-day activities.
As a Jr. Digital Analyst, you will manage multiple projects from start to finish, earning the confidence of and developing a strong working rapport with key internal and external stakeholders. Within this position, you will quantitatively analyze client brand digital posture to provide analytics-based feedback and insights. The position requires the ability to manage multiple projects from start to finish.
If you’re someone who is easily able to absorb technical information and finds joy in problem-solving, this is the ultimate role and career path guaranteed to deliver you personal fulfillment. If you’re a motivated individual who loves doing detailed work and demands intellectual challenge, Arcalea provides a position that will keep you stimulated and inspired.

The Jr. Digital Analyst Will
Provide analysis support for 2-5 client accounts
Provide operations fulfillment and account support to the team on day-to-day activities

Collect, analyze, organize and present an insightful point of view on client assignments or new opportunities

1+ year (or equivalent) of experience in analytics (experience in digital marketing is a plus!)
Proficiency with Google Apps (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Slides, etc.), online business communication tools, and general background with web browsing, college-level mathematics and logic, etc.
Experience with web analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Google Ads, Data Studio, Tableau, etc.) is a plus but not required.
Degree or progress towards a Bachelors/Masters degree in a related field of study.
Benefits
Annual Salary: $30,000 - $40,000 (exact salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience)
Entrepreneurial work environment
Downtown, Chicago Loop office located steps from public transportation
Profit-sharing and 401K program for qualified employees
Rapid growth opportunities
Training: Blend of formal (certifications and off-site training/meetings) and informal (job shadowing, client calls, books, independent research/study)

The leader in real-time TV ad data and analytics is currently seeking a Customer Solutions Specialist who will support the pre and post-sale support for the media partnership team, this means being able to quickly iterate on "ways in", e.g. insights to move deals forward. We are seeking a talent who will share our obsession for data accuracy; someone with an insatiable appetite for learning new things and accomplishing challenging goals in a fast-paced (and not always structured) environment. Self-driven individual with a bias for action and a passion for analytics. This person will architect and deliver world-class platforms leveraging iSpot tools and services. The individual in this role will have a strong business acumen and be able to translate customer use cases and stories into efficient solution design.
We have a product that is changing how brands, agencies and networks measure and assess the impact of TV advertising campaigns. Our software uses proprietary audio and video analysis to monitor and extract TV commercials, movie trailers and other promotional content from TV. At the same time, our software analyzes consumer interactions with TV ads on the digital screen across search, video and social. Interactions are matched with specific ads and attributed back to airings on TV. Our platform collects and analyzes massive amounts of data in real-time.

Responsibilities

As a key member of the Media Partnership team, you will be responsible for a variety of business-critical work that includes, but not limited to:
Translate both quantitative and qualitative analytical findings into business solutions.
Maintain good working relationships with clients and internal stakeholders to enhance customer satisfaction in coordination with our Media Partnership team.
Flexibility and willingness to address client ideas and feedback.
Use advanced business analysis and appropriate analytic tools to support professional services; execute custom reports for clients
Provide recommendations developed during the data gathering process.
Work with and within cross-functional teams, e.g. data science team, to identify appropriate business solutions to client challenges
Assist with business development activities
Understand possible approaches and timelines and communicate expectations clearly to client and/or internal account teams
Leverage ideas across clients and domains to spot opportunities and generate revenue and engagement
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in business analytics, marketing, computer science, statistics, economics, or a related field
2-5+ years of experience in quantitative, analytical and/or client-facing businesses (ideally, consulting)
Working knowledge of in SQL, and back end data pulls
Expertise in Excel (pivot tables, V look ups, etc.)
Working knowledge of tableau is a plus
Deep understanding of how media buying and media planning strategies
Demonstrated success in utilizing data to tell a story and distill various data points down to actionable insights
Possess strong analytical/ logical thinking skills and clarity of thought
Ability to communicate clearly and present technical issues to non-technical audiences as well as senior leadership/executives
Ability to develop relationships and work collaboratively in a consultative role
Passion for and an active interest in the business of media, entertainment and advertising

Progeny Systems Corporation (a DoD prime contractor) is seeking an entry level support candidate to provide earned value management (EVM), risk, and schedule tracking along with other project support activities.
Duties and Responsibilities
Data entry and tracking for Earned Value Management (EVM)
Monitor and assess project Risks with potential project impact (Risk Tracking)
Schedule management and tracking during project execution (Schedule Tracking)
Support project leaders in bill of material (BOM) and procurement tracking
Support project leaders in gathering of materials for monthly, quarterly, and annual reports
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Understanding and ability to monitor Earned Value Management (EVM) information to assess cost, schedule, and technical progress of multiple on-going projects.
Ability to apply risk analytics to project developments.
Ability to track product deliverables for contract compliance.
Proficient in the use of MS Office products.
Attention to detail and ability to spot errors and inconsistencies.
Excellent reading and language comprehension.
Ability to work with a team at all levels of an organization.
Strong analytical and decisions making skills.
Effective communicator, both oral and written.
Ability to multi-task across multiple projects with competing priorities or high workload.
Education/Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Business Analytics, or equivalent.
Experience in Risk Management is also desired.
This position may require the applicant to obtain and maintain a DoD Clearance.
ACCOMMODATION REQUEST
If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please contact our recruiting department at hr@progeny.net or call 703.368.6107. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Benefits

To learn more about the Benefits offered by Progeny Systems, including a minimum $1,000 sign-on bonus for all new hires, please visit our website at http://www.progeny.net/careers.

About Progeny Systems

Progeny Systems is a privately held, high-tech small business that provides premium systems, services, and products for the Department of Defense, government agencies and commercial clients. We are a technology leader in numerous areas including: technology insertion; acoustic sensors; signal processing; combat systems; torpedoes; cyber security; biometrics; knowledge management; undersea vehicles; open architecture; electromagnetic maneuver warfare; electronics packaging; and image/video processing/analysis.
As a small business, Progeny Systems is a participant in the Small Business Innovative Research (SBIR) and Small Business Technology Transfer (STTR) programs. Progeny Systems has a proven track record of transitioning numerous SBIR contract awards into full-scale production, and has also successfully competed with large defense corporations. Progeny System's ability to leverage flexibility, rapid turnaround, customer responsiveness, and encourage an environment for experimental research has been critical to our success in developing, producing and supporting numerous mission critical national defense systems.
Progeny has provided highly complex products/programs to the United States Government in collaboration with the following agencies, among others:
United States Navy
United States Air Force
United States Army
Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA)
National Aeronautics & Space Administration (NASA)

Develop an understanding of the full customer lifecycle and sales process and how marketing contributes to it
Document and communicate best practices for integrated marketing programs, including improvement recommendations to be used on the Franchise Portal
Keep pace with marketing industry trends and developments; stay abreast of changes in technologies and platforms

Assist as an IT liaison as the first point of contact between IT and Marketing when providing any assistance needed from either or both departments
Provide recommendations to website maintenance and updates with content changes, plugins, hosting responsibilities as well as structure changes
Other duties as assigned to support the evolving needs of the business

Problem solver
Confident and assertive
Some marketing knowledge, including but not limited to the following:
Facebook Business Manager platform
Tracking potential clients throughout the sales funnel using available tools
Basic understanding of CPL, ROI, impression share
Web knowledge such as basic understanding of the framework of web pages (HTML/CSS), use of a Web CMS, SEO, SEM, PPC
Technical skills, including ability to navigate Google Analytics, Google AdWords, and CRM reporting systems
Analytical skills such as the ability to analyze data from various sources to create both high-level and detailed reports and to draw conclusions from the data to inform business decisions

2 years of project management experience preferred with marketing background

Job_Title: Lead, Monitoring, Transparency, and Samples- Ethics & Compliance
Job_Description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.

Job Description

Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovation-driven company that will inspire you and empower you to shine? Join us as Lead, Monitoring, Transparency and Samples, Ethics and Compliance in our Lexington, MA office.

At Takeda, we are transforming the pharmaceutical industry through our R&D-driven market leadership and being a values-led company. To do this, we empower our people to realize their potential through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer, we offer stimulating careers, encourage innovation, and strive for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Futureto people around the world.

Here, you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission.

Objectives

As a Lead, Monitoring, Transparency and Samples, Ethics and Compliance working on the US Business Unit Operations team, you will be empowered to embed ethics and compliance. In this role, you will contribute to Takeda’s mission by acting as role model for Takeda's values, ethics and values-based decision-making. A typical day will include:

Ethics & Compliance (E&C) focuses on what the organization needs by ensuring
Ethical behavior plays a fundamental role in risk mitigation
Being a forward-thinking leader in risk identification and mitigation
Building a modern function supporting achievement of Takeda’s Vision 2025

E&C will respond rapidly to changing environment and business needs, it is close to the market, and encourages ethical behavior in line with Takeda’s values. By working in an agile manner E&C ensures the balance between stable structures, governance, processes and systems, and dynamic approaches to delivering innovative solutions to appropriately manage our risks.

E&C commits to
Act as role model for Takeda's values, ethics and values-based decision making, fostering this mindset in clients, partners and team
Enable the organization to take decisions which are ethical and in line with our priorities of Patient, Trust, Reputation, and Business
Collaborate across all E&C teams and partner with stakeholders in BU / BF to embed ethics and compliance as part of the way everyone works at Takeda

Transparency
Act as the business owner of the Transparency system
Program manage issues and system enhancement requests
Develop a short, medium, and long-term system requirements roadmap that will support Federal and State disclosure as well as Compliance Reporting requirements
Benchmark with external sources to evaluate Takeda strategy alignment with industry direction
Develop business process, data taxonomy, and data collection designs and methods that will enable Takeda to support current and future Federal and State disclosure reporting requirements
Prepare, confirm and submit all required State and Federal Reports (Compliance Program attestation, disclosure, etc.)
Assist as a liaison between Ethics & Compliance and the Takeda legal group to creating policies, procedures, work instructions and other relevant material that supports Federal and State transparency and restriction requirements
Develop acute knowledge of Federal and State laws that limit interactions with HCPs and HCEs. Create awareness and communications materials for Takeda business groups to access and answer any ad-hoc questions that arise.
Assist in communicating transparency-initiative status, progress, and data analytics on an as-required basis to the executive compliance committees
Collaborate with business groups on the delineation of responsibilities and protocols for managing non-compliance with data submissions

Samples
Evolves the Sample Compliance program elements to match with FDA requirements as well as leading practice industry processes
Develops collaborative relationships with the USBU Commercial Operations function that is responsible for Sample Operations scope
Monitors and helps define sample compliance significant loss and lost in transit threshold methodology working with 3rd Party Vendors to revise as defined by Takeda policy
Creates or revises sample compliance policies and procedures as required to either support ongoing business activities or to reflect changes in Ethics & Compliance or Legal positions concerning sample compliance business activities
Continuously evaluates sample compliance tracking mechanisms, controls, documents, and systems for improvement opportunities. Implements changes where appropriate and in line with Ethics & Compliance directives.

Monitoring
Determine and execute monitoring and data analytics requirements to support the identification of potential compliance issues
Develops strategies and tools for data analytics and monitoring
Leads the collaboration with USBU Ethics & Compliance and USBU business groups on monitoring remediation requirements, tracking and recommendations for updates to training, communications, policies and procedures
Oversees the day-to-day monitoring initiatives to ensure compliance with Takeda policies involving speaker programs, advisory boards, sample compliance, and other business activities that involve HCPs, HCEs, and Patients
Develop methods to share monitoring and analytics results with USBU business groups. Collaborate on improvement opportunities where relevant.

Capabilities
Lead teams in a highly cross-functional environment
Proactively engage with leaders in line-businesses to confirm roles and responsibilities and obtain buy-in on scope alignment
Ability to design streamlined end-to-end processes
Strong understand how to translate business objectives into system requirements and advocate for key decisions
Ability to work with databases, data marts, reporting platforms, financial systems
Consistently demonstrates the ability to deliver results
Able to work and deliver on deadlines while managing multiple projects and priorities effectively
works cross-functionally / collaborates / manages matrix
Proven ability to work successfully with others and collaborate with cross functional areas to identify needs, provide guidance, and communicate solutions.
Ability to rapidly assimilate to new functional scope responsibilities
Strong customer service skills while interacting with all levels of management, field sales, marketing, marketing and sales vendors and partners.
Proven skills to transform ideas into conversations and materials that resonate (presentations, written documents, email, etc.).
Manage 3 direct reports and 1 indirect report.

Experience
5-8 years of relevant operations experience, of which at least 3 years in the healthcare or pharmaceutical industry;
Experience managing business operations and/or workflow processes
Exposure to laws and regulations relevant state reporting and aggregate spend as it relates to the pharmaceutical industry
Bachelor’s degree required
Solid understanding of state and federal health care laws/regulations
Experience with laws, regulations and industry guidance that affect the pharmaceutical industry including, but not limited to, OIG and PhRMA guidelines, healthcare standard operating procedures, anti-bribery laws, and state price reporting statutes

What Takeda Can Offer You
401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan
Tuition reimbursement Company match of charitable contributions
Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings
Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days
Community Outreach Programs

Empowering Our People to Shine

Discover more at takedajobs.com

No Phone Calls or Recruiters Please.

Opportunity: 

LogRhythm is a world leader in NextGen Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), empowering organizations to successfully reduce risk by rapidly detecting, responding to and neutralizing damaging cyberthreats. Our platform combines user and entity behavior analytics (UEBA), network traffic and behavior analytics (NTBA) and security automation & orchestration (SAO) in a single end-to-end solution. Among other accolades, LogRhythm is positioned as a Leader in Gartner’s SIEM Magic Quadrant. Our corporate HQ is based in Boulder, CO with offices in Maidenhead UK, Dubai, Australia, Singapore, Germany and The Netherlands.

 LogRhythm is seeking a Community Engagement Manager to join our team in Boulder, CO. The Community Engagement Manager plays a critical role in championing community-wide knowledge sharing, so that information, know-how, and experience related to LogRhythm’s products and services are effectively mobilized amongst our employees, partners, and customer community to support the on the job performance of our innovative community of passionate and highly-technical network security engineers. 

This is an opportunity to further your community management expertise with a recognized leader in the hyper-growth, fast evolving security intelligence domain. 
   Responsibilities 

 Community Management: 
"Create the weather" for the online forums and provide the enthusiasm and leadership to keep internal and external participants motivated and engaged.
Compose forum topics, compose direct messages, read and reply to posts as needed, quickly identify and block any bad actors, and in general stay on top of all forum communication.
Work closely with the Partner Enablement, Product, and Marketing teams to drive traffic to the forums and increase measurable participation in ways that provide actionable insight.
Own and drive key engagement metrics and overall success of engagement initiatives.
Compose surveys, polls, questionnaires to engage the forum audience and collect feedback and ideas and share the results and recommendations with stakeholders and decisions-makers.
Identify trends or recurring issues or needs and develop and implement strategies to address these.
Expand reach through various mediums and channels: video, audio, social, external communities, conferences, other offline events

Event Management: 
Support and participate in various LUG (LogRhythm User Group) events.
Host “Ask-the-Expert” style events to connect community members to LogRhythm’s subject matter experts.
Plan, host, record, and share webinars and livestreams.

Multimedia Content Creation: 
Lead the development and marketing of engaging multimedia assets such as video interviews, podcasts, marketing collateral, infographics, job aides, etc. aligned to community needs.

Technology Ownership: 
Conceptualize the community management ecosystem and enabling technologies.
Administrate and develop our online community platform (Lithium) and xAPI features of our Learning Management System (Saba).   

Marketing & Communications: 
Collaborate closely with our internal MarComs staff to create ongoing promotional campaigns via multiple communications channels/vehicles to drive community awareness and engagement.  

Qualifications   

Education: 
Bachelor’s degree or higher in the social sciences, communications, journalism, marketing, business administration, psychology, education, or creative fields.

Personal Characteristics: 
Extremely detail oriented and well-organized.
You are a natural networker and collaborator, have an outgoing, extroverted personality and love meeting and interacting with new people who have a broad range of backgrounds and expertise.
You love data and analytics and make data-driven decisions.
Customer service oriented.

Communication: 
Strong interpersonal and communications skills, and able to interact with all staff and community members with kindness and integrity in a spirit of collaboration.
Exceptional written communication skills. Ability to quickly write responses to forum questions, draft emails, and compose social media posts using a professional and courteous tone with perfect grammar and spelling.
Comfortable and natural public speaking style.
Multilingual a plus.

Technical Skills: 
Strong technological competence across a wide range of platforms and applications.
You learn new applications rapidly, want to know what makes them tick and how they interact with other applications, and are ready to roll up your sleeves to fix issues, improve functionality, or implement new features.
Highly proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite.  

Experience: 
3+ years community management experience within the software domain (required).
2+ years project management experience (required).
2+ years experience with the Khorous/Lithium/Spreadfast community platform (required).
Experience with Salesforce, especially administrative tasks and Community Cloud (desired).

LogRhythm is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, genetic information, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

Mattermost provides an open source enterprise-grade messaging platform to the world’s leading organizations that allows teams to collaborate securely and privately anywhere. With over 10,000 server downloads / month our customers include Uber, Samsung, Affirm, The US Department of Defense and more. Our private cloud solutions offer secure, configurable, highly-scalable messaging across web, phone and PC with archiving, search, and deep integrations with hundreds of SaaS and on-premises technologies. Headquartered in Palo Alto, California, our company serves customers around the world with a distributed organization spanning the globe.

We value high impact work, ownership, self-awareness and being focused on customer success. If these values match who you are, we hope you'll learn more about working at Mattermost and come talk to us!

About The Role

Working in open source means your work is publicly visible. Your code will receive both credit and constructive critique from the community. With the right mindset and support these can lead to you a highly positive working environment and making the best engineering decisions of your career. Core committers include highly skilled volunteer developers from the community, staff employed by enterprises deploying and investing in Mattermost, as well as staff employed by Mattermost, Inc.

We are looking for an engineer experienced in data analytics and warehousing to help Mattermost continue to make effective decisions based on real-world data.

Responsibilities
Architect robust systems for integrating data from multiple sources
Write performant queries to support complex business intelligence requirements
Optimize indices and systems to maintain the quality of reporting systems
Support marketing, sales and R&D in identifying data requirements
Adopt devops philosophies for managing analytics infrastructure
Create and maintain architecture and systems documentation

Requirements
2+ years hands-on experience in a data analytics or data warehousing role
Specific or comparable experience using Amazon Redshift, Segment and Chartio
Comfortable with both row-based databases and columnar stores, and how to define performant indexes and write efficient queries for both
Clear and confident communication skills, especially in writing

Preferences
Experience with Salesforce and Zendesk as data sources and consuming data from SaaS application APIs.
Works effectively while remote, with the ability to travel 2-3 times per year for week-long off-site meetings with team members
Experience working in open source communities and analytics tooling

We're looking for someone who wants to help us build the future of Mattermost and improve the way the world communicates. The right person in this role has the opportunity to have a huge impact on Mattermost the product, and its many users worldwide, but also on our open source community that has been key to Mattermost's success. If this sounds like you - please apply!

About Us

CoverMyMeds is one of the fastest growing healthcare technology companies in the US. We help prescribers and pharmacies submit Prior Authorization requests for any drug and nearly all health plans – 100% free – to get millions of patients on their medications every single year. Our team of highly-productive healthcare enthusiasts, startup junkies and everything in between is the best thing about working here. On-site chef and paid benefits? Yeah, we have those too. But don’t take our word for it. We’ve been named to Inc. 500’s list three times, were awarded one of the top places to work by Modern Healthcare, and twice won best places to work in Columbus, Ohio.

CoverMyMeds is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regards to minority status, gender, disability or veteran status.

Software Engineer (FoundationCORE)

Foundation Medicine is dedicated to helping bring personalized cancer medicine into routine clinical practice. Harnessing advanced technology, Foundation Medicine is developing clinical laboratory tests that will broadly capture the most relevant tumor genomic and other molecular information in a single test, and connect it with relevant scientific and medical knowledge to help oncologists determine the right treatment for each patient. In addition, Foundation Medicine develops technology systems, software, and software products to enable our clinical and biopharmaceutical partners to interact and learn from Foundation Medicine data. One such system is FoundationCORE, which includes the world’s largest cancer genome dataset, containing over 200,000 genomic profiles and growing rapidly.

As a Software Engineer for FoundationCORE, you will play a key role in the technical development and architecture for a platform for integrated analysis across genomic, medical, and clinical data, including its design, implementation, critical upgrades, and scaling for use across the enterprise. In partnership with our genomic scientists and product and commercial teams, you will enhance our understanding of the needs of our clinical and biopharmaceutical partners and how to guide our engineering operations to meet them.

You are someone who has built large-scale data systems, designed and optimized complex queries, and written software spanning the entire tech stack. You enjoy the responsibility and accountability that comes with working on a small core team of engineers. Quality is second nature to you – you believe that untested code is not complete code and that software design and architecture are worth significant investment. You excel at providing insightful evaluations of new technologies and evolving business requirements.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain data assets, cloud platform, and services for FoundationCORE, including architecture & design, implementation, and scaling into an enterprise system that accelerates research and product development
Participate as a scrum team member in defining and delivering requirements
Define and document architecture and functional and design requirements
Interact with internal customers to develop business requirements
Partner with product and science leads to understand critical use cases, and design and implement information solutions that meet them
Drive operations, including scaling, quality control, data model management, enabling analytics, and interface development
Help maintain product and systems health to support the companies’ data needs
Conform to coding conventions and all aspects of the SDLC and change control and product release policies


Required Skills & Expertise
Minimum BS in computer science, bio/informatics, or a related field.
2+ years building solutions for data ingestion, wrangling, quality control, and visualization.
2+ years experience building data solutions in AWS, e.g. S3, EC2, Aurora, Lambda.
2+ yeasr experience in database and application development.
Strong knowledge of Object Oriented and functional programming languages and best practices.
Experience developing RESTful APIs.
Experience in Agile development.
Experience creating and maintaining a CI/CD pipeline.
Demonstrable conceptual, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Experience with common JavaScript libraries and data visualization.
Experience with Node.js and ReactJS.
Experience with RDBMS.
Comfortable developing bash (or other shell) scripts.
Comfortable with Git and Docker.
Applicants with experience with genomic or other biomedical data preferred.


Your Approach
Value-Centric. You will always be assessing requests from a value delivery perspective. Deliver the greatest value, quickly.
Driven. You will be focused on the achievement of major alliance goals.
Solutions focused. Willing to bring creative problem-solving skills to challenges along the way.
Intuitive. You will have a demonstrated ability to work in the “gray zone” and anticipate challenges before they arise.
Process-oriented, yet flexible. You will appreciate and be able to create and drive process, and at the same time recognize when rules are meant to be bent.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with all stakeholders.
Business-savvy. You’ll be interested in new business development opportunities, being able to bring those to the attention of the right teams at FMI and able to support those activities as requested.
A proven cross-functional leader. You will have demonstrated the ability to “influence without authority” and achieve objectives across complex projects and organizational structures.
Independent. You will be able to self-organize and operate effectively without significant day-to-day oversight, while staying tightly connected to key leaders and teams across the collaborations.

Foundation Medicine is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ancestry, age, or national origin. Further, qualified applicants will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability or protected veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also and

To all recruitment agencies: Foundation Medicine does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Foundation Medicine employees or any other organization location. Foundation Medicine is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

OUR TEAM

Acuity Brands is the North American market leader and one of the world's leading providers of innovative lighting systems. We are driving the industry's transformation to smart lighting; redefining how people live, work, and play.

About The Role

We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic individual to be a hands-on Test Engineering Lead and thought leader for our Business Intelligence Team as we transform Acuity Brands analytics and migrate our BI platform to Azure and Power BI. This position will be responsible for development of our test automation frameworks from unit testing through regression testing to crowd sourcing and UI testing. You will be responsible for ensuring quality and risk of releases from Dev to Prod which includes CI/CD pipelines, GIT metrics, and Usage Metrics. This position may also have rotational responsibilities between projects and to support our daily and monthly operations.

Roles & Responsibilities

Job_Description:
About AllianceBernstein

AllianceBernstein (AB) is a leading global investment-management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional investors, financial intermediaries and private-wealth clients in major global markets. Our client base includes some of the world’s leading institutions as well as private-wealth clients and retail investors. We maintain research, portfolio-management, wealth-management and client-service offices around the world, reflecting our global capabilities and the needs of our clients. Partnering closely with clients, our research and portfolio management teams collaborate across asset classes, regions, sectors, and investment strategies to spark new thinking and deliver superior outcomes. We foster an inclusive environment that offers opportunities for team members to continually learn, develop their skills and take on new challenges to progress in their careers.

Client Group Overview

The Client Group has a presence in the Americas, Europe, Asia and Australia, and is composed of five main areas:
Sales & Client Services works with financial intermediaries and institutions to offer diversified investment solutions that help clients build and preserve their wealth
Business Development is a conduit to the firm’s investment teams and supports our clients and internal business partners through investment-platform and product content, messaging, competitive analysis and education
Product Strategy & Development designs, develops and manages the firm’s global lineup of investment services and considers clients’ evolving needs to identify new opportunities
Marketing promotes the firm and its services by creating, packaging and distributing content and messaging to engage diverse audiences through digital platforms and initiatives, strategic campaigns, and events
Business Transformation looks to evolve and scale our business, leveraging digital and data, to drive top-line growth and improve profitability
AllianceBernstein is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or citizenship status.

Job Summary

Responsibilities

The digital marketing team within AB’s Client Group is looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Analytics Lead to support ongoing digital marketing activities. This role will provide valuable analysis and insight to better leverage AB’s digital capabilities, and to quantify the impact of AB’s digital marketing strategies. Based within the digital team, this role will support digital program owners, channel marketers, and investment writers across various activities including content marketing, email campaigns, digital advertising and social media. This individual will help develop key measurement strategies and governance to ensure consistency in reporting and analysis across digital touchpoints.

Key Responsibilities
Work closely with business stakeholders, marketing and digital teams to support digital initiatives and campaigns by
Understanding and formulating the business questions data analyses will answer
Translating business requirements into data analyst requirements
Leading and providing appropriate analysis and actionable insights
Be responsible for analytics reporting and insight in accordance with core KPIs, developing and delivering a range of reporting capabilities to highlight the effectiveness of marketing activities
Develop and deliver regular reporting covering areas such as web traffic, content engagement, advertising & paid search, social media traffic & engagement, email marketing, lead generation & marketing automation
Develop measurement capabilities and lead scoring for marketing automation campaigns, connecting digital interactions to sales & client data to provide actionable insight for future marketing and sales activities
Enable marketing and business stakeholders to gain a level of self-sufficiency in analytics reporting by developing robust reporting dashboards as well as appropriate training and support
Define and deliver appropriate analytics implementation for new initiatives, campaigns, pages and websites, developing business and reporting requirements as necessary
Partner with development teams to identify, architect and implement tagging and analytics requirements for new initiatives, campaigns, pages and websites, developing business and reporting requirements as necessary
Manage AB’s analytics implementation, ensuring new requirements are implemented in accordance with current standards and are tested, identifying issues and remedying as appropriate
Establish a forum with analytics colleagues from Business Intelligence and Business Transformation to share best practices, inform of progress and ideas on key initiatives, best leverage tools and resources, and to keep information flowing seamlessly
Provide subject matter expertise across analytics and reporting, keeping up-to-date with trends and capabilities, leveraging industry thought leaders and technology vendors where appropriate

Required Skills

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required with 8 to 10+ years of experience in digital measurement and analytics
Proven track record of delivering appropriate reporting and analysis in a B2B and/or B2C environment, leveraging relevant technical solutions
Demonstrable experience of using analytics platforms such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics to collect, organize and deliver relevant analytics reports and actionable insight
Adobe Analytics experience highly desired but not required
Experience in analytics tagging and associated technical implementation requirements
Experience in analyzing A/B or multivariant testing and personalization initiatives to measure the success of such activities by documenting results, learnings and recommendations
Experience of working across multiple data sources including web analytics, social media metrics, email marketing metrics, client interaction & CRM data
Familiarity with marketing automation and lead scoring analysis using platforms such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, Marketo etc
Highly organized and detail oriented with strong project management skills
Self-motivated and disciplined with the ability to define and achieve objectives with limited oversight if needed
Strong communication skills, particularly when articulating findings in meaningful, clear ways to business and marketing stakeholders with an emphasis on actionable insight
Excellent inter-personal skills with the ability to build advocacy and respect at all levels, while collaborating effectively to achieve success
Ability to work effectively under pressure with multiple stakeholders (internal and external) while adhering to tight deadlines
Experience in Financial Services, specifically Asset Management is beneficial
Excellent ability in business intelligence and data tools such as MS Excel, Tableau, Microstrategy etc.
Location: Nashville, TN

Our 270,000 team members deliver experiences that enrich and nourish millions of lives every day through innovative services in food, facilities management and uniforms. Aramark is recognized as one of the World's Most Admired Companies by FORTUNE, as well as an employer of choice by the Human Rights Campaign and DiversityInc. Learn more at www.aramark.com or connect with us on Facebook and Twitter.

Description

As part of the Analytics Center of Excellence, the "Director of Advanced Analytics" will support the business strategies by providing analytical services to support various initiatives. In this role, the individual will support the design and implementation of short and long term strategies and tactics to develop an analytics platform to support the business to enable an insights/analytics-driven decision making process. This individual will own relationships and lead tracking, analysis and results reporting of various initiatives within Aramark to support management decisions and strategy development.

This individual will work collaboratively across numerous functions, including Operations, Human Resources, Marketing, Sales, Finance, Information Technology, and Culinary, and Retail teams in our consumer facing businesses.

Responsibilities
Partner with our various businesses to support their efforts to grow revenues and control costs
Manage full lifecycle of analysis. Build data foundation, Translate into action and push out meaningful insights to our individual business units
Build models to support initiatives such as pricing, driving volume and improving retention
Build test and learn models to drive revenue from "other" levers such as menu mix, menu board designs and communication programs
Hire, motivate and develop team members to constantly build and evolve our analytical capabilities
Discover new opportunities to optimize the business through analytics and statistical modeling.
Identify relevant external data to help tell "The Story" and augment our analytical models to achieve greater impact
Leverage existing data warehouses to develop business intelligence reports and analysis that supports the Analytics team's strategy
Think strategically and recognize opportunities
Have a "hands-on" involvement with the analysts
Serve as a key member of various project teams of cross-functional resources to implement analytics strategies – with internal and external partners.
Effectively partner with internal or external resources, with expertise in statistical and predictive modeling, to analyze and look for patterns within customer behavior and/or business performance data and summarize findings.
Perform trend analysis, predictive analytics and data mining to provide actionable insights that inform strategic and tactical decisions and lead to improved consumer experience and business results.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering or related experience
Minimum 10 years of experience in Business Analytics, Data Modeling, Reporting Tools and/or in related disciplines.
Be able to work independently and collaboratively
Excellent interpersonal skills: collaborating, networking, influencing, team player; able to work effectively in virtual international and cross-functional teams
Excellent communication skills: clear oral and written skills; effective questioning; active listening
Strong organizational, project management and time management skills
Ability to present complicated analytical material in a concise and compelling manner to a non-technical audience
Experience in data mining and building data models
Extensive hands-on experience with data modeling tools Ex: (SQL, ETL)
Comfortable working with large, complex data sources
Ability to work with large transactional databases across multiple platforms.
Deep experience in statistical analysis, techniques and predictive modeling
Ability to program in SAS/R/SPSS/Python
Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated ability to solve problems
Extensive hands-on experience building reports with BI tools Ex: (Qlik, Tableau, Power BI)
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office tools such as: Excel, Power Point and Access
Experience with test & learn methodologies like A/B testing
Experience and working relationships within Aramark LOBs is a desired plus

Knowledge of Aramark Data environment is a desired plus

Job_Title: Lease Administrator Analyst - Assistant Property Manager
Job_Description:
Description

Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Lease Administrator Analyst (Assistant Property Manager) based in our Baldwin Park, CA office. The Lease Administrator Analyst/Assistant Property Manager will report to the Real Estate Asset Manager and will help manage the real estate portfolio of In-N-Out Burger. Background in real estate Finance or real estate accounting would be ideal.
General Responsibilities
Responsible for processing monthly Base Rent/CAM/INS and RE taxes, and other misc. financial obligations
Assist with conducting audits and analyze lease documents, addressing any discrepancies, issues and questions, make recommendations and implement solutions
Tracking and maintaining critical lease dates
Reviewing lease documents and databases to ensure accuracy and lease compliance
Abstracting and interpreting commercial lease documents (leases, amendments, sublease, CC&R's)
Assist in completing other tasks within the department when additional resources are needed
Establish and implement a lease audit function to review existing data in the system and identify areas of improvement and maximize revenue opportunities/CAM savings.
Analyze financial budgets and reports as part of the CAM reconciliation process
Understanding of CPI methodology in retail leases
Enhance policies and procedures to ensure accurate and timely data entry and reporting
Responsible for responding to internal and external communication regarding leases and rent charges
Act as a liaison between the Company and Lessors in resolving issues relating to interpretation of and compliance with lease provisions relative to CAM, taxes, insurance & repair items
Ability to analyze data and problem solve
Have a thorough understanding of retail accounting principles including recovery ratios and methods, allocating costs to various CAM pools, accrual and cash basis accounting, reading and understanding financials and be able to abstract information from a lease
Prepare property reports, operating budgets and other management reports
Support to Store Operators
Work Schedule + Benefits
Full-time, Exempt
Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
Real Estate office is based in Baldwin Park, CA
Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan
Qualifications

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Real Estate, Business, Finance, Accounting or related field
Real estate financial analytics experience preferred
Exceptional analytical skills; ability to combine financial analysis and business objectives
5+ years of experience in Lease Administration, Property Management , Commercial real estate accounting
Knowledge of commercial real estate leases and contracts including interpretation and documentation
Background in real estate financial analysis, reporting and real estate accounting
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional groups
Strong negotiation skills; Must be comfortable negotiating business terms and administering to legal documents
Experience and willingness to deal with dispute resolution matters
Ability to work both independently and within a team environment
Able to work on multiple projects simultaneously, be a self-starter
Knowledge of real estate economics and financial analysis skills
Solid experience in Microsoft Office as well as Lease Administrative/Accounting software, including Visual Lease
Knowledge of shopping center maintenance operations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong customer service focus
Must have a valid driver's license
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas and Oregon. In-N-Out Burger's menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.
In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.
Equal Opportunity Employer by Choice

UPMC Health Plan seeks a Data Curation Analyst – Senior to work in Pittsburgh (Allegheny County), PA.
Work within UPMC Health Plan's Population Health Management technology innovation division as part of a broad data, analytics and knowledge management team.

Job_Description:
Sabre Systems is currently looking for a Logistics Analyst with an engineering background to support our customer in Lakehurst, NJ performing Product Support Management in the Logistics Management Integration Department. The selected candidate will
Perform management of Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) program planning, development, and execution
Assist in planning and implementing Integrated Logistics Support for the life cycle of assigned system/equipment from concept through field deployment
Prepare written correspondence and verbally report on assigned programs
Analyze ILS program execution and/or assigned programs’ management/sustainment posture to identify deficiencies in established Integrated Logistics Support systems and resolve critical problems
Provide logistical and administrative support to the government customer
Candidate will be responsible for creating and maintaining spreadsheets, tracking work orders, doing purchase requests, and more
Provide technical expertise in all areas of supply, inventory management, inventory accuracy and warehousing
Coordinate resource procurements

A Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution is required. Educational experience with Logistics, Engineering or Program Management is preferred. Three (3) to five (5) years of direct logistics experience is required.

The Following Knowledge, Skills, And Experience Are Required
MS Office skills Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project (Strong knowledge of Word and Excel)
Good oral and written communication skills
Strong organizational skills, with attention to detail
Ability to work in a team environment
Ability to meet scheduled deadlines
Ability to travel, <25%

The Following Knowledge, Skills, And Experience Are Preferred
Department of Defense experience
Understanding of DoD Logistics and Acquisition, within the United States Navy
Understanding of NAVAIR Systems Engineering Technical Review process
Working knowledge of the CORE System software
Knowledge and understanding of SharePoint
SOLE US Citizenship and either an Active DoD clearance (highly preferred) or the ability to immediately obtain a Secret clearance is required. Candidates who have had a clearance that has been inactive less than 2 years that can be immediately re-activated, may also be considered.

Sabre Systems, Inc. is a quality driven, customer focused large business providing innovative solutions in the areas of Cyber, C4ISR, Business Intelligence and Data Analytics, and Enterprise Modernization to federal and civilian customers. Our mission is to ensure our customers have the technology, services, and expertise to overcome threats, maintain superiority, and quickly adapt to emerging obstacles. At Sabre, we're more than just a job - we're a team - and we care for and nurture our employees like family. If you want to be a part of creating and implementing enduring solutions that transform mission challenges into mission success – join Sabre!

Sabre provides an excellent benefits package, which includes healthcare, paid days off, tuition reimbursement, and a 401K plan.

Job_Description:
SUMMARY The Data Science Specialist will be part of a data science or cross-disciplinary team on development projects, typically involving large, complex data sets. This team includes statisticians, computer scientists, software developers, engineers, product managers, technicians and end users, working in concert with partners in Makino business units. Potential application areas include collected data analysis and diagnostics across multiple metal cutting machine platforms. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Develop analytics within well-defined projects to address customer needs and opportunities. Work alongside software developers and software engineers to translate algorithms into commercially viable products and services. Contribute to technical discussions and reviews as an expert in related areas of responsibility. Maintain state-of-the-art knowledge in related areas of responsibility. Communicate ideas, plans and results effectively via presentations and written reports. Generate reports, annotated code, and other projects artifacts to document, archive, and communicate your work and outcomes. Work with data engineers on data quality assessment, data cleansing and data analytics. Work effectively with peers, management, operations groups, and outside organizations. Work in technical teams in development, deployment, and application of applied analytics, predictive analytics, and prescriptive analytics. Perform exploratory and targeted data analyses using descriptive statistics and other methods. Share and discuss findings with team members. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The physical demands include travel, typing, writing, light lifting, etc. More than 40 hours per week is often required to effectively perform this job including infrequent weekend travel/working requirements. Work Environment: Most of the work will be in an office environment with occasional overnight travel to other Makino facilities or manufacturing environments containing Makino equipment. Overnight travel is expected to be less than 20%. Education and/or Experience: Master’s Degree in Electrical, Mechanical, Mathematics, Aerospace Engineering or Computer Science with demonstrated research capability or equivalent experience. Demonstrated skill in the use of one or more analytic software tools or languages (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R, Python, Matlab) Strong background in diagnosis, prognosis and control systems analysis and synthesis. Background/familiarity/experience with metal cutting technologies Experience with multiple statistical programming languages such as Python, R, SAS etc. Database query programs (SQL, Experience with Pivotal, Postgres) Experience with Github Basic understanding of statistics and predictive algorithms. Background in Multivariate Calculus and Machine Learning. Experience with Data visualization and communication. Domain knowledge in Compute, Database, Network, and Storage Experience in IT Service Management environments. Strong background in diagnosis, prognosis and fault-tolerant control systems analysis and synthesis. Strong background in system diagnosis and prognosis algorithms development and integration. Effective verbal and written communication skills. Excellent interpersonal skills to work effectively with Makino internal and external customers.
