Under the direction of the Performance and Integration Manager, the Performance Integration Specialist performs highly advanced (senior-level) analytic, consultative, and technical assistance in support of the Health and Human Services (HHS) Office of Performance. Working on the Performance and Analytics Integration team, this position plans, develops, coordinates, and implements major agency programs and high-profile performance and analytic initiatives designed to measure, monitor, and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the HHS services system. The position works under minimal supervision with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.
The Performance Integration Specialist consults with Executive-level staff, builds cross-department and division relationships, and provides ongoing support to a variety of HHS program areas. This support may include: performance management training and consultation; performance measurement consultation, development and business planning; planning and directing functional organizational assessments, including making recommendations to increase efficiencies or reduce risk; assistance with continuous improvement strategies; development and management of performance and data analytics related projects; needs assessment and reporting methodologies assistance.
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

Essential Job Functions

EJF 1.(25%) Develops solutions to highly complex performance management and measurement issues and concerns, develops implementation plans, and helps coordinate and support implementation. Develops components, including performance measures, for the HHS Annual Business Plan and implements associated process steps. Develops and implements effective techniques for evaluating agency programs, including outcome-oriented performance management, and provides guidance to program staff in the development and integration of new methods and procedures; completes performance reports, studies, and specialized projects, and recommends appropriate changes. May use/interpret data to monitor outcomes and identify opportunities for improvement.
EJF 2.(20%) Oversees the delivery of consultative services and technical assistance related to planning, implementing, and monitoring of program and service performance. Builds effective working relationships with program staff and develops expert level understanding of their business operations, performance measures and data capabilities; consults with programs to resolve problems, identify training needs, and discuss program effectiveness; collects, organizes, analyzes, and prepares materials in response to requests from program; and manages performance and data analytics related projects to support program goals and the HHS system as a whole. This includes determining and analyzing trends to help understand and resolve operational problems and improve performance.
EJF 3. (20%) Oversees the collection, organization, analysis, and preparation of materials in response to requests for program information and reports. This includes preparation of high quality written reports, analyses, communications, presentations, summaries, updates and other documents as assigned or needed by the Office of Performance or by HHS program areas or requested by HHS executive staff to support leadership in meetings and briefings and to help advance agency priorities as they relate to performance and data analytics.
EJF 4.(20%) Prepares specialized research projects based on analyses of program performance data and prepares administrative reports for the Office of Performance and for other HHS program areas as needed and assigned. Oversees studies and analyses of operations and problems and the preparation of reports of findings and recommendations. This includes conducting functional operational analyses that are used to assess and mitigate risks, recommending and developing policies, procedures, standards, and manuals, as well as planning program activities in accordance with Office of Performance objectives and goals. This may also include reviewing and editing Office of Performance analytic, research, and legislatively mandated reports.
EJF 5.(10%) Analyzes available performance data to help ensure program's compliance with policies and procedures, statutes, and rules; and recommends corrective action(s) as needed; determines trends, provides recommendations and coordinates the resolution of departmental operational problems. This includes coordination and communication with program area staff to discuss performance information and develop recommendations to address issues, monitor and improve operational performance. This also includes assisting HHS staff to implement recommendations for policy and programmatic issues relating to the implementation improvement, and/or expansion of performance management initiatives.
EJF 6. (5%) Serves as team lead and subject matter expert in HHS program area(s), as assigned. This may include leading internal workgroups and assigning and overseeing the work of other team members as it relates to specific projects or assignments.

Knowledge Skills Abilities

Skills in analyzing and evaluating policy, program, and operations issues, particularly performance outcomes.
Ability to translate programmatic goals and operations into quantifiable and measurable performance outcomes.
Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to collaborate among multiple parties, work with people under pressure, resolve conflicts, and establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Knowledge of measurement concepts, including research planning, needs assessment, and evaluation methods; mixed methods research approaches including quantitative (statistical analysis) and qualitative (including focus groups, interviews, and other methodologies) data collection and analyses. Strong knowledge of outcome-driven measurement.
Knowledge of acceptable and appropriate management and strategic planning techniques, to include analysis, planning, measurement and achievement of established goals.
Knowledge of program business processes and operations.
Advanced written and oral communication skills, including public speaking.
Highly skilled at gathering, analyzing and reporting program and operational performance data.
Skill in developing, implementing, interpreting, and evaluating policies, procedures, rules, and laws.
Skill in providing guidance, counseling, advice, and recommendations to managers and leadership.
Skill in summarizing complex information and issues, evaluating alternatives, and developing creative and workable solutions.
Skill in managing multiple and competing priorities.
Skill in self-motivation and taking initiative.
Ability to interpret data and draw meaningful, real-world conclusions and make recommendations.

Job_Description:
Summary

The Sorenson Data Science team provides data analysis, modeling, and forecasting for all departments across our company and as such serves a vital role for our business. This position requires substantial experience in advanced data analytics with emphases on data visualization, data architecture, and the practical application of machine learning algorithms. As a member of the Data Science team, this position will be expected to interact extensively with our Operations and Engineering teams to identify opportunities and implement solutions both with traditional analytics and machine learning implementations.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
Member of a small team focused on creating strategies, discovery, innovation, and development of long-term company data science plans and company goals.
Employ Tableau to build mission-critical reports for multiple departments utilizing advanced analytics while ensuring the end product can be understood and digested by non-technical audiences.
Utilize SQL Server to build out data architecture to support Data Science team and company needs.
Assist with design, development and maintenance of business intelligence applications and solutions.
Utilize data mining and modeling techniques to prototype novel reports.
Build critical report logic for daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports.
Collaborate with IT and software development teams to design business intelligence solutions to facilitate data gathering, storage and retrieval.
Interpret data to identify trends, conduct root cause analysis, and suggest areas for process improvement.
Perform statistical analysis on business data based on requests from senior leadership or project teams.
Assist with design and development of machine learning applications that provide actionable data with the aim of implementation in the production environment.
Diligently QA your own work to ensure accuracy, functionality, integrity and relevance.
Work with and assist software engineers to integrate forecasting services into production applications.
Stay current and informed on the latest data science trends and techniques.
Other operations assignments as required.
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Required
Intermediate knowledge in data analytics, machine learning, and statistical inference.
Ability to read, interpret, apply and computationally implement advance topics in data science (such as probability and statistics, signal processing, queueing theory, Bayesian data analysis, artificial neural networks, time series analysis, etc.).
Fluent in the use of Tableau or other data visualization tools.
Intermediate understanding of full ETL process in SQL Server.
Expertise in R, Python, or another data analysis language.
Demonstrable experience working with very large data sets.
Prior experience in parallel computing, with cloud computing experience a strong plus.
Detail-oriented and able to manage own schedule and time.
Ability to meet strict deadlines and handle complex algorithms and business problems.
Communication/Language Skills
Excellent communications skills including the ability to communicate complex mathematical findings to management in various departments.
Must have strong interpersonal skills, non-verbal skills, and listening skills.
Able to effecitively communicate in various team settings using clear and concise language, proper tone, and with a positive attitude.
Is flexible and open to the ideas and opinions of others.
Experience/Education/Certifications
Four-year degree in a quantitative discipline. Masters or PhD in a quantitative discipline with research experience would be considered a plus.
One or more years of experience with large data sets.
Other General Requirements/Additional Notes
Ability to travel up to 5% of time.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, tools, and to handle other computer components.
Ability to sit at workstation for long periods of time completing analysis, testing, documentation, or other assignments.
Lifting and transporting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals.

Responsibilities

Position Summary:

Directs the planning, implementation and coordination of University wide learning and development excluding clinical specific L & D within URMC. This position will serve to drive organizational strategy and align the development of people and leaders with the business goals of the organization. A full complement of skills, from business analytics, technology, learning theory, performance consulting and scientific inquiry are important for success. Understands the vision and goals of the University and develops learning opportunities that align with the strategic plan. Additionally, working with the Senior Director of Systems Optimization, Chief Diversity Officer and education leaders disseminates high quality, culturally-appropriate training and education on accessible, user-friendly media. The Director of Learning interacts closely with the Senior Director of Learning for the Clinical Enterprise and other senior educators in the development of the strategic plan for workforce learning and career development.

Responsibilities

Under general direction and with latitude for independent judgment:

Provides leadership for and oversight of the initiation, implementation and monitoring of the newly formed campus office dedicated to learning and organizational development. Forming the office will include a campus-wide effort to improve organizational effectiveness, engagement and retention.

Directs the implementation and ongoing transformation of the University culture through learning opportunities associated with its Vision and Values, including collection and follow-up of engagement data, interpreting group assessment data, recommending and overseeing implementation of next steps for improvement, and small group Leadership sessions to facilitate sharing of best practices.

Provides organization and structure around curricular domains to assure consistency across programs. Creates and disseminates educational material, both online and classroom to support staff in developing their behavioral and cultural competencies to the highest level. (Living visions & Values). Directs process improvement efforts that relate to improving operations and/or processes, enhancing the customer experience.

Ensures learning is continuous and just-in-time when needed bringing diverse learner populations together to enhance interdepartmental and interdisciplinary work group activities.

Provides an organized process for evaluating learning initiatives, strategies and programs to measure the ongoing results and achievement of established goals.

Establishes a standardized individual development planning process accessible to employees/leaders at all levels to achieve collective, institutional as well as individual career goals.

Responsible for all related activities to align daily operations with on-boarding, orientation, performance improvement and career ladder opportunities for staff, including creation of on-boarding materials and oversight of education session to create and maintain a continuous learning culture.

What do you get when you bring together the brightest minds and place them into an exciting, fast-paced environment that fosters intellectual growth and rewards based on impact, not tenure?

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer

Location: Rogers, AR

Background & Purpose of the Job

You Will

For Unilever to remain competitive in the future, the business needs to continue its path to become data intelligent via improved capabilities and models. The Advanced Analytics and Automation team is responsible for building data connectivity, analytics, and platforms as a core capability to help the business become data intelligent and drive business and organization performance. The team will deliver advanced products at scale and work closely with the cross-functional teams to ensure that decisions in Unilever are augmented with insight and recommendations wherever possible.

Work with Analytics teams to connect and iterate data sources, providing a simpler and more effective means of accessing information for reporting, analysis, and modeling.
Work with Key Business stakeholders to identify business issues / opportunities. and develop the product or capability features that will make a step change for the end user.
Translate requirements to and insights from data scientist team needed to address opportunities / problem areas

Who You Are & What You’ll Do

You’re a strategy guru: You understand the importance of the details and ensure the work is done with accuracy, but you also know that this field is changing rapidly, and the future is bright. You anticipate the changes and have a plan to adapt. You bring a vision of what could be and lay the groundwork to get us there.

You’re a dot connector: You quickly understand the disparate data and underlying questions to be answered. You look inside and outside for the insight which will bring a solution. You’ll raise the team by teaching new ways of processing information.

You’re a teacher: Everyone has unique skills and talents. You want to share yours with the team. You know what matters for long term success and thrive on building others. You take your knowledge and help others understand the value of ideas and work that may be foreign to them.

You’re a changemaker: You are thoughtful and question the status quo. You’re continually looking at how to bring improvement to the team by taking in the whole picture and making sense of the disconnects. You pursue the right course of action and don’t let others slow you down.

You Will
Support the Sales and Category Management functions for the Unilever Walmart Sector, including the transformation of the wider organization into a data driven team across functions and categories
Partner with the US Customer Marketing Insights and Information & Analytics teams as well as local business owners to define how data can drive value across the business.
Ensure quality of data by performing quality checks on processed data, find ways to improve data quality and work process so that we can provide accurate and timely data to clients.
Identify opportunities to apply diagnostic insights to data, aligning to the Unilever Corporate strategy.
Facilitate data integration and data exploration across internal or external data sets that are relevant for market and sector.
Deliver data & insights for the sector - that includes commitments to:
Democratization of Data across functions
Proactively identifying enrichment/growth opportunities, unlocking innovation through experimentation
Use recognized data analysis & visualization techniques to make sense of data in a way that helps the teams to discover useful information to improve the overall business objectives and performance
Recommend and extract the value attributed to data as a critical organizational asset and competitive advantage.
Priority areas include External Data exploration, Consumer data, Shopper data, Media and Market Share and extends to include all other data sets relevant for Customer Development.
Consult on data components of projects with sector wide impact; establishing data as a product, data as an enabler, then data as a service.
Masterfully executes and collaborates with stakeholders and users to drive cultural shift around data within the organization.

What You’ll Need To Succeed
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, data modelling or similar technical background
Proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in one or more programming languages- eg.C#, Python, Java (ability and willingness to learn is essential)
Minimum 3+ years in demonstrable enterprise value realization from data and business intelligence
Experience with data modeling, data analysis and visualization techniques
Ability to manage multiple requests and priorities simultaneously in a highly VUCA environment
Ability to communicate analytic and data science solutions in an actionable manner to business managers

Conduent is the world's largest provider of diversified business process services with leading capabilities in transaction processing, automation, analytics and constituent experience. We manage interactions with patients and the insured for a significant portion of the U.S. healthcare industry. We are the customer interface for large segments of the technology industry and the operational and processing partner of choice for public transportation systems around the world.

Whether it's digital payments, claims processing, benefit administration, automated tolling, customer care or distributed learning - Conduent manages and modernizes these interactions to create value for both our clients and their constituents. Learn more at www.conduent.com.

Overview


Otsuka Pharmaceutical Company is a global healthcare company with the corporate philosophy: “Otsuka-people creating new products for better health worldwide.” Otsuka researches, develops, manufactures and markets innovative products, with a focus on pharmaceutical products to meet unmet medical needs and nutraceutical products for the maintenance of everyday health.
In pharmaceuticals, Otsuka is a leader in the challenging area of mental health and also has research programs on several under-addressed diseases including tuberculosis, a significant global public health issue. These commitments illustrate how Otsuka is a “big venture” company at heart, applying creativity in everything it does.
Otsuka Pharmaceutical Company is a subsidiary of Otsuka Holdings Co., Ltd. headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. The Otsuka group of companies employed 50,000 people worldwide and had consolidated sales of approximately USD 11 billion (€ 9.9 billion) in 2016.

All Otsuka stories start by taking the road less travelled. Learn more about Otsuka Pharmaceutical Company on its global website at www.otsuka.co.jp/en. Learn more about Otsuka in the U.S. at www.otsuka-us.com.

In this role, he/she ensures team and management alignment on program objectives, deliverables and timelines to support the organization's overall goals; works with teams and management to create the development strategy, establish objectives, and monitor team progress; and makes recommendations regarding project priorities, resource requirements, and strategic considerations to established governance committees for endorsement. As an Associate Director, he/she contributes to portfolio-level review and reporting, leads PM Departmental initiatives and manages junior PM staff.

Provides program management for complex development programs and special projects.

Manages established cross-functional teams and relevant functional areas to lead the development of quality Global Development & Commercialization Plans (GDCPs) which integrate the development strategy and project plan (inclusive of timelines, milestones, interdependencies, issues, risks and actions).

Contributes to due diligence activities to support business development.

Contribute to the design and drive utilization of advanced analytics and data visualization tools to deliver insights to key stakeholders for portfolio-level and program-level decision making.

Drives PM's collaboration with data science and analytics team in delivery of projects.

Identify opportunities to increase flexibility, efficiency and speed of development programs through innovative/adaptive trial design efforts and streamlined execution.

Supports Executive governance committees.Operational


Supports the project teams toward implementation of the strategic and operational plans and tracks progress to goals.

Manages and tracks program progress as assigned on a continual basis, identifying and tracking both cross-project and cross-functional risks and issues related to scope, timelines and budget. As appropriate, informs Senior management and ensures timely resolution.


Manages project information for assigned projects and is responsible for developing and maintaining good relationships with other functions fostering positive interactions and ultimately support achieving desired project outcomes.

Responsible for supporting departmental and corporate initiatives to drive process improvements.

Responsible for maintenance of the project actions, decisions and risks for project team interactions.

Provides input to Finance team for finance modeling, data analytics tools and reporting; reviews quarterly forecasts, mid-to-long-term plans, key variances and potential impacts for moving forward Leads design of innovative solutions (e.g. automation) to business operations and PM's collaboration with product development teams in the creation and deployment of new solutions

Demonstrated flexibility and approach to process changes, technology and new responsibilities with and open curious mind.

Financial management knowledge

About AllianceBernstein

AllianceBernstein (AB) is a leading global investment-management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional investors, financial intermediaries and private-wealth clients in major global markets. Our client base includes some of the world’s leading institutions as well as private-wealth clients and retail investors. We maintain research, portfolio-management, wealth-management and client-service offices around the world, reflecting our global capabilities and the needs of our clients. Partnering closely with clients, our research and portfolio management teams collaborate across asset classes, regions, sectors, and investment strategies to spark new thinking and deliver superior outcomes. We foster an inclusive environment that offers opportunities for team members to continually learn, develop their skills and take on new challenges to progress in their careers.

Client Group Overview

The Client Group has a presence in the Americas, Europe, Asia and Australia, and is composed of five main areas:
Sales & Client Services works with financial intermediaries and institutions to offer diversified investment solutions that help clients build and preserve their wealth
Business Development is a conduit to the firm’s investment teams and supports our clients and internal business partners through investment-platform and product content, messaging, competitive analysis and education
Product Strategy & Development designs, develops and manages the firm’s global lineup of investment services and considers clients’ evolving needs to identify new opportunities
Marketing promotes the firm and its services by creating, packaging and distributing content and messaging to engage diverse audiences through digital platforms and initiatives, strategic campaigns, and events
Business Transformation looks to evolve and scale our business, leveraging digital and data, to drive top-line growth and improve profitability
AllianceBernstein is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or citizenship status.

Understanding and formulating the business questions data analyses will answer

San Francisco, CA | Growth Marketing Team | Reports to the Director of Product Management

Looking for an opportunity to create and drive program level visibility into the product roadmap at a thoughtful, sustainable start-up? Rothy’s is looking for an experienced program manager to champion cross-functional and third party coordination to deliver product, UX, and technology initiatives. You will coordinate deliverables from concept, development, and launch, advise relevant partners on process execution, and drive continuous improvement to ensure success.

About The Team

Growth Marketing is an exciting, ever-evolving aspect of the business. This team is dedicated to growing our online presence through thoughtful digital strategies. They’re SEO ninjas who work closely with brand marketing. Their first love is data & analytics—tracking growth and engagement really gets their motors humming. Beyond that, as connoisseurs of digital media, they’re also incredibly aware of what’s happening online. This team is just as likely to show you a complex spreadsheet as they are a viral meme.

What You'll Do
Provide day-to-day facilitation across Rothy’s Product, UX, and Tech teams.
Identify and organize dependencies across systems for cross-functional initiatives.
Create high visibility into progress and completion timelines across teams.
Serve as the scrum master for three cross-functional squads and lead in best practices to strengthen Agile workflow muscles across the organization.
Create and regularly update deliverable schedules across scrum teams to keep Rothy’s informed on roadmap plan vs. current progress.
Evaluate, identify and share out risks and tradeoff opportunities from a technical and team perspective across the product portfolio.
Lead efforts to resolve key project conflicts and establish appropriate resolution paths.
Own release management practices and support deployments from scheduling to post-deployment action items.
Coordinate communication and collaboration between Rothy’s team and third-party vendors.
Define and establish documentation processes across product, UX and tech teams.

Experience in project scoping, forecasting and planning, risk management, and change control management

Fluent in best practices for deployment efforts

Collaboration
Experience building supportive momentum for common goals across the organization
Thrives working with distributed teams and remains calm under pressure
Experience mentoring and managing people by influence

Execution
Self-starter, able to work well with individuals at all levels and across functions
Experience managing multiple projects simultaneously
Passion for establishing processes for documentation across teams and third parties

Leadership
Strong organizational skills coupled with highly effective communications across a variety of tools and communication channels
Demonstrated ability to align and lead cross-functional teams to a common goal


Benefits
Employer paid medical, dental and vision insurance
4 weeks of paid time off, paid sick time, plus paid holidays
401(k) with employer match
Flexible Spending Accounts
Commuter benefits
A shoe allowance (like the allowance you got as a kid only better)!
And did we mention the great snacks!?

At Rothy’s, we take a whole brand approach to sustainability. That means we consider the impact and longevity of everything we do, from the materials in our products to the way we treat our people. To date, we’ve transformed over 30 million plastic water bottles into beautiful, comfortable, washable shoes—and that’s just the beginning. Join our team and see where we’re stepping next.

Company Overview

Brookfield Properties has an immediate need for a Geographic Information System Data Analyst at our corporate headquarters in Chicago, IL.

Brookfield Properties is a retail real estate company headquartered in Chicago, Illinois and owned by affiliates of Brookfield Asset Management. Our regional shopping centers are destinations for retail, lifestyle, dining, entertainment and so much more. Our extensive portfolio of properties spans the nation, encompassing over 150 locations across 42 states and representing over 146 million square feet of retail space. All of our properties are strategically located in regional and coastal areas that constitute the "heart" of America.

Our passionate team is comprised of experts across a range of specialties who share a goal of ensuring our properties are continuously evolving and innovating to meet the needs of our communities. Our company culture celebrates collaboration, encourages an entrepreneurial spirit and values diversity. We are very proud to have a team of premier talent who are in it to win it. We invite you to be part of our success story.

Position Overview

As part of our Business Intelligence & Strategy team, the Data Analyst will join a group of strategic professionals who are charged with providing actionable insights and business intelligence to the organization. This position is responsible for managing and reporting on the key data metrics as it relates to the growing real estate assets of Brookfield Properties. Assist the BI&S Data Strategy team in 1) gathering and accurately embedding pertinent property level information across all real estate sectors into a master property database, as well as Microsoft’s Power BI visualization tool 2) partner with relevant teams across all real estate sectors to ascertain core performance metrics and incorporate within the property database and dashboard 3) Assume a proactive role in communicating property metrics data and other real estate based analytics to the all levels within the Brookfield organization.

Key Responsibilities
Prepare and maintain key real estate related data metrics for Brookfield Properties Real Estate assets across all sectors and worldwide geographies
Present information, data insights, and recommendations to management, internal customers, and other key personnel as deemed necessary
Initiate contact and maintain partnerships with relevant data owners of real estate metrics across Brookfield Properties, including proactively leveraging key property level information and key performance indicators from the data owners on a timely cadence as defined by the BI&S team
Maintain current and future database enhancements to ensure accuracy and timeliness of the data
Manage corporate resources effectively and efficiently. Focus resources on corporate goals and on high-success probability projects.

Qualifications
2+ years' experience with developing dashboards in Microsoft Power BI, Tableau or Qlik
2+ years' experience with business analytics, data mining, geospatial analytics, or statistical analysis
2+ years' experience with geo spatially focused analytical software tools (for example Alteryx, ESRI Arc GIS, MapInfo, Tableau, and/or Power BI).
Ability to effectively communicate quantitative analysis to a broad audience
Strong written and oral communication and presentation skills
Bachelor's degree in Real Estate, Geography, Geographic Information Systems, Business Analytics or related field
2+ years’ Experience working for multi-sector real estate firm, covering asset classes in residential, office, retail, industrial and others

Job_Description:
Data Analyst, IT Operations

Location: Santa Clara, CA

This position reports to: Director, IT Operations

Description

ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our Customer, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.

The successful candidate is a high-energy, self-starter with an established, documented competence in the data and operations space. You have strong experience building out actionable insights from monitoring systems supporting mission critical data for the business. You have a solid foundation in data analytical tools such as SQL, Python, data visualization tools along with an excellent statistics background (machine learning a plus). The candidate should also have excellent communication and stakeholder management skills that can partner with various cross-functional teams to understand requirements, develop, test, and deploy quickly.

About The Role

As ServiceNow continues its unprecedented growth, the company seeks to further establish its data and advanced analytics foundation and capabilities. ServiceNow is seeking an analytic and strategic thinker to be a member of IT Operations team. The Data Analyst will be creating and maintaining metrics for IT Operations team and driving data driven decision making culture. This role will ensure the company leadership and stakeholders has the right insights and recommendations based on high quality data to grow and build the operational efficiency.

What You Get To Do In This Role
Lead with end-user thinking, keep the long term strategic objectives in mind and the customers and end-users at the core analytics product development.
Build scalable/actionable analytical insights to monitor the metrics of IT Operations organization (Service management, Operations management, Governance etc…)
Work with cross functional teams to consolidate data sources across critical functions and to set up processes to triage any data quality issues
Create and drive metrics standards and frameworks to ensure inclusion into telemetry
Create metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor operations quality for our most critical business functions
Proactively seek out metrics improvement opportunities to evangelize a data driven decision making mindset across IT Operations

Desired Outcomes
Become champion of operational metrics for operations team at large to drive increased confidence and adoption of analytical mindset
Create a repository of best practices, KPIs and all known data quality issue and its impact on business
To be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field
5+ years of quantitative research/ data analysis/ insights experience resulting in product enhancements, customer satisfaction, efficiency improvements.
3+ years’ experience using query languages like SQL, MySQL, Python for analysis, reporting are a must
Prior hands-on experience with BI tools such as Business Objects, Tableau, Qlikview, OBIEE, etc and experience in evaluating and selecting the optimum tool on a use case basis
Strong appetite for carrying out data intensive discovery and assume pride in high degree of accuracy when delivering analytics products
Demonstrated experience analyzing data from multiple sources using tools like MS Excel/ Access, Tableau, etc
Experience in machine learning especially in data quality applications a plus
Highly detailed oriented
Excellent judgment, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills; can balance attention to detail with swift execution
Able to identify stakeholders, build relationships, and influence others to get work done.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills and ability to engage effectively at all levels of the organization.

The Economist II is responsible for assisting in the data collection, design, development, deployment and maintenance of data driven econometric models applied to the lease business and the used vehicle market. The Economist II plays a key role in the production of research and analysis to quantify the impact of economic, legal and auto industry factors on the portfolio performance and asset values. This research support strategic planning, as well as the specific needs of Pricing, Asset Remarketing, Accounting, Investor Relations, Structured Finance, Dealer Services and Credit Risk Management. This position will assist the Economics team in modeling efforts through an in depth knowledge of econometrics, diligent knowledge of economic and market data, and providing insightful interpretation through outside of the box analysis. To improve ad-hoc executive decisions, the Economist II applies advanced analytical skills and processes through data analysis, model development and strategy testing. This position is also responsible for summarizing, reporting and providing a polished presentation on findings to a variety of internal clients as well as interacting with other departments in the interest of achieving the overall company objectives.


Job Duties
Develop econometric models and perform statistical analysis in order to solve business problems. Monitor and validate model performance and update models as needed.
Research new methods of analyzing large and highly complicated data sets. Combine traditional econometric tools with cutting edge machine learning techniques. Apply these techniques to analyze the impact of used vehicle price trends on the lease portfolio.
Subject matter expert for the Economics team on in-house data. Maintain expert level knowledge of economic series and databases
In conducting ad-hoc research projects, incorporate project design, data collection and analysis, summarizing findings, developing recommendations and effectively communicating to leadership the impact to the business
Apply economic principles, knowledge of third party data sources, and creative econometric expertise in developing new models to new business areas.
Provide modeling and econometric to ensure that the delivered products meet the business needs of the company.
Partner with and provide recommendations to business leadership on the appropriate application of econometric analysis, market data and predictive analytics to business strategies and effectively communicate risk analysis and implications to senior leadership.


Knowledge
Auto finance related quantitative risk modeling. Advanced knowledge of applied methodologies including least squares regression, logistic regression, sampling methodologies, time series, survival analysis, cluster analysis, categorical data analysis, decisions trees, multivariate methodologies, non-parametric techniques, principal components, linear programming techniques
Statistical learning techniques including decision trees, bagging, boosting and support vector machines.
Ability to identify and understand business issues and map these issues into quantitative questions
Must have experience analyzing, merging and summarizing large datasets from different sources
Ability to design and implement model documentation and monitoring protocols
Demonstrated understanding and experience with technical systems, rational datasets, data warehouses, and data analysis techniques
Skills
Proficient in MS Office: Word, PowerPoint and Excel (including pivot tables and macros)
Advanced skills in SAS, R or similar programming package
Proven knowledge of SQL or similar database programming language
Ability to interact collaboratively with internal customers and external vendors
Effective written and verbal presentation skills with an ability to communicate well with Senior Management
Capable of managing multiple and varied projects, including the ability to coordinate and balance numerous tasks in a time-sensitive environment, under pressure
Education
Master's Degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Operations Research or similar quantitative field required
Experience
2-3 years auto finance experience (leasing and residual value forecasting) preferred
3-5 years programming experience - SAS preferred
5-7 years experience presenting highly complex analysis required

Normal office environment

Job_Title: Tableau Cloud Data Steward and Dashboard Specialist
Job_Description:
Tableau Cloud Data Steward and Dashboard Specialist

The Challenge

Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data.

We have an opportunity for you to use your analytical skills to improve our client's processes and support the advancement of their important missions. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll develop algorithms, build predictive analytics, compose data visualizations, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into objective answers to help federal customers make informed decisions. You’ll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we use data science for good in support of our federal customers.

Empower change with us.

Build Your Career

At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you can expect:
access to online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunk
a chance to change the world with the Data Science Bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition
participation in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government

Job Summary

The Data Analyst is a highly trained individual who specializes in organizing and analyzing data from various resources with the purpose of turning numbers into information to influence decision making. The Data Analyst uses a range of tools and methodologies, including statistics and technical expertise, to generate results that highlight useful insights and expose areas of opportunity. Data Analysts are naturally curious, have a strong sense of urgency and focus on how their analyses impact our business results. This team member is specifically dedicated to the Marketing business area.

Responsibilities
Drive analytical decision making on a wide range of initiatives
Field and prioritize strategic requests from senior leaders to help everyone involved better understand the impact of key business decisions, make projections and enhance our mortgage-related processes
Analyze data with standard statistical methods, interpret results, and provide written and verbal summaries of data analyses
Effectively summarize and simplify analysis results that are to be shared with teammates and business partners through a wide variety of mediums
Work closely with our business intelligence peers, including Business Analysts, Engineers, Data Scientists and Modelers to ensure we're creating a holistic analytical approach that solves for analytics needed, technical solutions and models to transform a business initiative
Work as an extension of business partners to consult with and communicate needs back to our Technology team

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree or higher preferred in economics, mathematics, applied statistics, computer science or finance or equivalent experience
1 year of applied experience working with complex data sets
Basic understanding of SQL or other querying languages used to create data sets
Advanced Excel skills
Great accuracy and a talent for identifying and resolving data issues
Demonstrated experience visualizing and presenting data (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
Comfort with a high learning curve regarding software platforms and new analytical concepts

What’ll Make You Special
Experience with web analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics Suite and Google Analytics
Experience with customer relationship management software as a service, such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Basic statistical software program knowledge, including R and Python
Ability to ramp up quickly to understand the business and industry
Experience creating strategic actionable takeaways, providing solutions and exposing areas of opportunity
Capacity for being responsible for data within the organization to reach conclusions and drive solutions and/or recommendations
Comfort presenting in front of a large group when necessary
Self-starter with a strong sense of career ownership who seeks out opportunity for further growth and development
Strong project management and prioritization skills
Ability to work in fast-paced environment where flexibility is key and directions can change frequently
Extremely high level of attention to detail and outstanding organizational skills

Job Description

This role will play a pivotal part in building the future of Kimberly-Clark’s data driven marketing capability, enabling brands to maximize consumer lifetime value through personalized experiences. The role of using 1st party data to achieve this vision is critical. This person will also be responsible for including these efforts into standard ROI, CPA, and incremental value measurement processes across all Kimberly-Clark markets.

Essential Accountabilities
Work with business partners on first party data strategy to ensure we Acquire, Activate, and Measure our 1st party data.
Understanding the role 1st party data can play in the paid media channels. Partner with our media managers and media agencies across our markets to ensure the use of data is appropriately reflected in our media plans.
Partner with our business partners and IT organization to deploy consumer engagement frameworks that can leverage a rewards component that drives ongoing consumer engagement and loyalty
Ability to create economic business cases that will be shared across our global markets that help put a value to an acquired name into our database
Working with our business partners to incorporate a consumer first framework into our strategic business planning
Work with business partners and Global Marketing Capabilities leadership to develop, articulate, & enable a vision for leveraging analytics to drive enhanced targeting and personalization
Work with our global markets on using data to achieve business objectives in a Crawl, Walk, Run, Fly approach based on market maturity.
Collaborate with IT to ensure we have the marketing technology needed to enable business objectives in way that can deliver global scale and local personalization. Develop and enable and embed these capabilities into core analytics teams.
Partner with the global analytics team to raise awareness of these efforts and analytics CRM IQ of the organization

Role is based at the K-C location in Neenah, WI or Chicago, IL

Proven ability to leverage K-C partnerships with agency partners, internal marketing resources, and the core analytics team to build capabilities that precisely target our consumers in key parts of their consumer journey.
Demonstrated ability to build new capability in complex organizations
Demonstrated ability to understand brand objectives, prime prospects, and targets

Strong leadership skills including proven communication skills to explain the complex in layman’s terms

The Team Leader is responsible for advancing the promotion analytics function at Whole Foods Market. Leading and developing promotional insights for a group of categories using statistical software and analysis. This position requires experience drawing conclusions from imperfect and incomplete data, application of various analytical techniques, and developing overarching promotional strategies. A key differentiator for this Team Leader position is leading the design and communicating the impact of promotions in attaining organizational goals.

More specifically, the Team Leader will directly support the Purchasing Category Managers with promotion analytics. Day-to-day duties will include influencing the design and development of our promotional analytics capabilities and using software to manage promotions for a set of categories. We also need someone capable of communicating insights using advanced reporting and statistical analytics. For example - using Microstrategy and SQL to pull and merge a complex data set from internal and external sources, applying linear regression (or another appropriate technique) to gain insight, and using Tableau to create a visualization that clearly shows what we’ve learned.

Responsibilities
Promotion Strategy:
Collaborate with pricing and purchasing leadership to conceptualize business issues, develop and translate recommendations into the appropriate promotion strategies
Leads the integration of advanced response models for evaluation in the strategic merchandising initiatives
Analytical Influence and Leadership:
Determine areas of business where innovative analytical solutions may be used to drive business growth, create analysis, and develop recommendations
Educate and influence business partners to improve understanding/reliance on quantitative methods for evaluation of promotional events
Design and lead analytical presentations and communicate them to purchasing leadership
Provides leadership and vision to a team of promotional analysts
Promotion Analytics:
Recommends promotional changes with category managers for revisions that directly contribute to improved category performance
Lead the development of relevant analytical tools/reports/dashboards that encompass promotional data in connection with consumer, customer, and competitor insights.
Ongoing Promotion Management:
Integrate robust data analysis and variables to develop and maintain promotional strategies that reflects the category’s strategic vision.
Manage, analyze, and recommend effective promotions across a set of categories, assess optimal margin rates, maintain sell through goals, and evaluate customer price perception.
Develop strategy and provide leadership for determining promotional events through the use of quantitative methods and report category performance
Works collaboratively to ensure analyses are in alignment with strategic objectives and are executed in stores.
Drives the analytical development of the team while managing a team of 2-3 Promotional Analysts
This job profile is not meant to be all inclusive; may perform other duties as assigned or required

Qualifications
BA/BS degree and 4-6 years’ relevant experience OR equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.
0-2 years leadership experience
Proficient in a wide range of analytical, quantitative, and statistical techniques and tools to derive insights from large, complex data environments
Experience with statistical analysis software packages (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS, Stata) a plus
Excellent communication skills: listening, verbal, and written
Strong organizational, planning, and time management skills
Strong work ethic complemented with a positive, can-do attitude
Ability to deal with ambiguity in a collaborative environment

GoHealth is looking for Data Engineers who will be responsible for the design, development, and delivery of data transformation tasks used in transforming data into a format that can be easily analyzed. We are seeking candidates who have experience in data analysis, collection, and optimization for the purpose of informing business decisions. The Data Engineer will work with other team members in owning data pipelines including execution, documentation, maintenance, and metadata management. In this role, you will also support the development of the data infrastructure necessary for full scale data science, predictive analytics and machine learning.

Responsibilities
Design, develop and deploy optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from various GoHealth and external data sources.
Monitor, execute and report on all data pipeline tasks while working with appropriate teams to take corrective action quickly, in case of issues.
Perform unit testing, system integration testing and assist with user acceptance testing.
Adapt data components to accommodate changes in source data and new business requirements.
Create and maintain documentation of the technical detail design, operational support and maintenance procedures for all data pipeline tasks.
Ensure data quality and compliance with development, architecture, reporting, and regulatory standards throughout entire data pipeline.
Collaborate with the rest of the Data Engineering Team, subject matter experts and department leaders to understand, analyze, build and deliver new data-related processes and/or reports.


Skills And Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or equivalent experience required.
2+ years of experience in the design and development of data pipelines and tasks.
Good understanding of data warehousing concepts and dimensional data modeling.
Hands-on experience with troubleshooting performance issues and fine tuning SQL queries.
Experience in Python including in modules/libraries such as pandas, numpy, Flask, scikit-learn, and sci-py.
Proven experience extracting data from structured data sources (SQL, Excel, CSV files, Couchbase) and unstructured data sources
(Splunk, log files) both on-premise and in the cloud.
Experience consuming data from web services, REST and SOAP, HTML, XML and JSON.
Knowledge of version control systems using Git, Bitbucket, SVN, or Team Foundation.
Experience in Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, Power BI, or Azure is preferred but not required.
Familiar with other data warehouse platforms like AWS Redshift or AWS Data Pipeline.

Role Overview:

As an Azure Data Engineer you will collect, aggregate, store, and reconcile data in support of Client business decisions. You will help design and build data pipelines, data streams, reporting tools, information dashboards, data service APIs, data generators and other end-user information portals and insight tools. You will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring that business partners can access and manipulate data for routine and ad hoc analysis to drive business outcomes using Advanced Analytics.

Day-to-day, You Will

Key Role Responsibilities:
Translate business requirements to technical solutions using strong business insight.
Analyzes current business practices, processes, and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for demonstrating Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.
Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.
Delivery of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies.
Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.
Design and Build Data Service APIs.
Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.
Expose data to end users using Power BI, Azure API Apps or other modern visualization platform or experience.
Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes.
Able to travel approximately 80%
Your technical/non-technical skills include:
Demonstrable experience of turning business use cases and requirements to technical solutions.
Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions.
Ability to conduct data profiling, cataloging, and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows.
The ability to apply such methods to take on business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration.
T-SQL is required.
Knowledge of Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL DW, and Azure SQL, Azure App Service is required.
Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning.
Knowledge of Lambda and Kappa architecture patterns.
Knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) and Data Quality tools and processes.
Strong collaboration ethic and experience working with remote teams.
Knowledge of Dev-Ops processes (including CI/CD) and Infrastructure as code fundamentals.
Working experience with Visual Studio, PowerShell Scripting, and ARM templates.
Experience with Git/TFS/VSTS is a requirement.
Nice to Haves:
Azure HDInsight + Spark, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Databricks, Azure Stream Analytics.
Knowledge of Python.
Demonstrated experience preparing data and building data pipelines for AI Use Cases (text, voice, image, etc.…)
Designing and building Data Pipelines using streams of IOT data.

MCSA

Preferred Education Background

You likely possess a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or another relevant field. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice.

Preferred Years Of Work Experience

You likely have about 3-5+ years of relevant professional experience.

Job Description Summary

In keeping with our mission and vision statement, Maryville actively seeks adjunct faculty members who are experts in their fields and have a passion for teaching. Adjunct faculty are an integral part of the University's learning community.

The John E. Simon School of Business is accepting applications for an ACBSP academically/professionally qualified adjunct faculty member to teach online graduate level coursework in Business Data Analytics.

Course Subjects Include, But Are Not Limited To
Data Analytics/ Descriptive Analytics
Database Principles
Data Warehousing
Data Visualization

Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities:
Teach assigned course as specified in the schedule and course contract.
Participate in welcome orientation to become familiar with the University's mission, academic policies and procedures, expectations, and Canvas (Learning Management System).
Prepare essential learning objectives, lesson plans, and assignments. Develop course syllabus.
Clearly communicate course objectives and learning outcomes, teaching methodology, and assignments and deadlines.
Employ a variety of teaching styles in order to effectively deliver course content demonstrating both academic and real-world applications of concepts covered.
Encourage active learning through discussion topics, class assignments, group projects, etc.
Provide feedback and grade assignments in a timely and thorough manner.
Establish office hours to provide additional assistance with student questions/concerns.
Report early alerts for students who are not actively engaging in the course.
Additional duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

Master's degree in Data Analytics, Database Administration, Statistics, Management Information Systems, Mathematics or related field from a regionally accredited institution, or Master's degree and at least five (5) years relevant industry experience.

Proficient knowledge of business analytics tools. Examples include Power BI, SQL , DAX , Tableau, R and Python.

Preferred Qualifications

Doctorate with at least 15 graduate hours in Data Analytics from a regionally accredited institution. Teaching experience at the college level and industry level certifications, or industry experience with big data tools such as Spark, Hadoop, TensorFlow, Elasticsearch, Neo4j, MongoDB, etc.

Special Instructions To Applicants

An offer of employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background screening.

Applicants requiring University sponsorship to obtain employment authorization will not be considered for this position.

Maryville University is committed to a policy of equal opportunity and prohibiting discrimination on the basis of age, disability, gender, genetic information, marital status, national origin, race/color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other status protected by law. This extends to all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruiting, hiring, training, on-the-job treatment, promotion, layoff, and termination.

Job Type: Adjunct

Work Hours

The School of Business is using this position announcement to build a qualified pool of instructors to fill teaching needs as they arise. This position is not designated for a specific course or semester.

Sphere Software is looking for an entrepreneurial and progressive leader to lead the growth and success of the big data and analytics practice. The Practice Lead advises and partners with our sales teams and clients on solving their business problems by leveraging Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Analytics, Data Engineering and Data Science offerings and capabilities. This leader will work closely with the sales and marketing teams on sales campaigns, pre-sales activities and increasing the opportunities at existing accounts. Further, this leader will work with the delivery teams to ensure delivery excellence and customer success, while partnering with customers to achieve growth through the implementation of tangible business results.

Responsibilities

Leadership of the Data and Analytics Practice, including driving sales, recruiting, account management, consulting, and all operational aspects.

Practice Building and Scaling – Drive overall growth of practice area through a combination of business development, talent management, oversight of delivery work, and thought leadership. Build processes to scale the practice’ business, and collaborate with other company leaders to implement lessons learned to drive overall company growth.

Business Development – Lead business development activities, leveraging professional contacts for the benefit of the Company. Create service offerings aligned for market segments/verticals, including value positioning, scope of services, marketing collateral and pricing.

Team & Individual Development – Maximize team performance through an effective team approach that increases productivity and job satisfaction. Foster a culture of career growth and measurable goals for individual contributors and managers.

Establish a certification plan for practice consultants, architects and project managers.

Hiring - Responsible for hiring and interviewing consultants, architects and managers for the practice.

Engagement Management – Manage engagement risk and project economics including planning and budgeting, manage account billings, define deliverable content, and ensure buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the client.

Culture & Core Values - Enhance the Company’s culture and exemplify our core values on a day-to-day basis.

Develop proposals, presentations, statements of work (SOWs) and proactively recommend strategies to grow the Big Data and Analytics Practice presence in existing and new accounts

Work with account and sales teams to manage the pre-sales process with clients and provide the leadership throughout the opportunity lifecycle from initial qualification to closure of the deal.

Provide thought leadership & services delivery roadmap to customers.

Provide technical & architecture guidance, for both internal teams and customers, focusing on big data, analytics and machine learning.

Execute short term and strategic consulting projects, assessments. Map solutions to client business processes, and develop value proposition and business case.

Act as an evangelist for services, assisting sales with selling and serving as an executive sponsor for our strategic customers.

Develop and manage the partner strategy and ecosystem in partnership with our Channel team to maintain a global network of certified partners that deliver with consistent quality Requirements.

A Successful Candidate Will Have The Following Characteristics

Proven experience leading and scaling professional services organizations or practices in fast paced environments, including managing the organization financials (bookings, billings, utilization and margin).

Prior management consulting and data and analytics industry experience.

Be fluent with data solutions, tools, cloud platforms (and their individual technologies), delivery life cycles, common conceptual solution architecture and risks.

Deep understanding and experience in the big data, analytics and data engineering space (Hadoop, Spark, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Python, Scala, R, Tensorflow, ETL tools, etc.).

Experience with information management / data practices and technologies including data lake, data warehousing, data integration patterns (ETL, services, messaging), and analytics.

Excellent Communication and Board Room skills

Ability to establish a relationship with C-level and SVP level customer stakeholders.

Experience working withSoftware Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Agile methodologies (Scrum, Lean Startup, XP) and working with multi-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Designers, Data Analysts)

Ideally familiar with Design Thinking, Behavior and Test-Driven Development

Strong leadership, communication and collaboration skills with a track record of taking solution ownership.

Ability to travel to meet with customers (estimated at 40%).

Preferred: PMP, CSM or PSM certifications.

Description

John Snow, Inc. (JSI) is a technical assistance and research organization that works to advance public health in the US and globally (www.jsi.com). The JSI Center for Health Information, Monitoring and Evaluation (CHIME) is a technical assistance, research, and knowledge group within JSI dedicated to improving the quality of health information and increasing evidence-based decision making in the health sector. We respond to the growing demand for information-driven health services planning and management and the use of data for program improvement, adaptation and innovation. The Center provides assistance and resources within JSI and to governments and other health-focused organizations to strengthen collection and use of high-quality data to improve health program and system performance. We also coordinate JSI resources and experience in health information systems (HIS) as well as monitoring, evaluation, research and learning (MERL) to ensure access to essential tools and techniques, and support peer networks.

The CHIME Data Visualization & Analytics Advisor, based in JSI’s Arlington, VA, office will provide leadership in the International Division and technical assistance to various projects related to research, evaluation, data visualization, communication design, and data use, focusing on the development of charts and graphs, infographics, data dashboards, and other information design and visual content. The ideal candidate will be able to easily work with program and research teams to design or support research and data analysis activities, distill concepts, research and data, and effectively communicate them through visual design to make a meaningful impact. The Advisor also leads a portfolio of data visualization and analytics work, coordinates a team of professionals, and advances JSIâ€™s practice in data visualization and analytics. The role involves both program-focused technical assistance, and strategic and managerial responsibilities related to JSI technical assistance and strategy, as well as internal and external networking and communication.

Responsibilities

The Data Visualization & Analytics Advisor works under the supervision of the CHIME Director and/or Technical Advisor to carry out a range of activities to support JSI projects and corporate teams and advance data use strategies through visualization of health information, training and advocacy. Major areas of responsibility include: coordinating a team of data visualization advisors after a transitional period, providing technical assistance to JSI projects in data analysis and data visualization, leading internal capacity development activities on data visualization design, strategic planning for JSI communications focused on health analytics and data visualization, and new business development, including identifying and managing relationships with potential visualization partners.

Specific Responsibilities Include
Coordination of the CHIME data visualization team and portfolio:
Providing leadership on technical standards and quality related to data visualization and visual analytics
Serving as the focal point for the Centerâ€™s data visualization work portfolio, work planning, support for other advisors providing strategic and technical support within JSI teams and projects, and after a transitional period, supervision for a small team working on data visualization activities and
Training and orientation of new data visualization staff
Leading Center policy, technical and strategy discussions related to data visualization and data use
Liaising with external professional groups, partners and funders to advance and advocate for JSIâ€™s work in data visualization
Contributing to CHIME's work in maintaining strong, collaborative and supportive communication with the other JSI centers, working groups, centrally funding and bilateral projects (i.e. information sharing meetings, listservs, etc.)
Representing JSI/CHIME at meetings, events, and conferences, and contribute to CHIMEâ€™s work maintaining strong collaborative and supportive communication with other JSI centers, working groups, and projects
Contributing to key functions of CHIME such as strategic planning for JSI MERL, HIS activities, data visualization and new business development
Providing data visualization and analytics technical support:
Providing a focal point for technical assistance requests within JSI related to data visualization
Providing technical assistance on research and analytics related to JSI projects and new business proposals
Advising projects and corporate teams on data visualization, design, and analytics, including supporting discrete project activities and broader strategic thinking and framework development
Developing data visualization guidance, reports, and publications, as required
Understanding the story within data, and developing clear, accurate, and engaging information design products and tools in a variety of formats that organize data, research, concepts, processes and other information into a cohesive visual story
Leveraging knowledge of design to translate ambiguous concepts, complicated problems, and/or complex data, into clear and compelling visualizations to reveal insights and facilitate decision-making
Approaching information design from an audience-centered perspective, focusing on who the target audiences are, what information they need, and how they access information in order to make concrete, practical recommendations for different visual products
Participating in project strategy and discussions, and leading facilitation sessions with teams to translate data into stories and visualizations to meet project requirements.
Working with the JSI communications team to ensure consistency with the overall branding requirements to serve funder communications goals
Building internal data visualization design capacity:
Leading internal efforts to build JSI staff capabilities in data visualization design, including facilitating routine training sessions, providing direct training and coaching to teams, and managing a repository of data visualization tools and resources for JSI staff
Providing routine capacity building and advocacy for data visualization across JSI promoting the uptake and use of data for decision making through visualization, developing training materials and facilitating hands on workshops
Facilitating trainings on data visualization (and use) and related topics; supporting remote coaching with field based staff, including taking creative approaches to providing training support in low-bandwidth environments, and advocating within JSI for data visualization.
Building excellent relationships with teammates and stakeholders across projects, and provide guidance, knowledge sharing, and capacity building, including through facilitated workshops
Researching and recommending software, data visualization, and design techniques to improve core visualization practices and expand information design services.
Qualifications
Masterâ€™s degree in public health, international development, information design, communications, statistics, or related with a concentration in data visualization, monitoring & evaluation, or a related field.
8+ years of professional design experience working in the field of data visualization/ information design.
Experience coordinating teams and managing/supervising professional staff, developing scopes of work with clients, and managing projects and client relations.
Experience developing materials for and facilitating training on basic or advanced data visualization design principles
Strong design eye and demonstrated experience in understanding and interpreting complex ideas and/ or data into visual information.
A strong design portfolio with samples of information design work, highlighting strengths as a visual communicator.
Experience networking professionally and expanding ties within professional and global health networks.
Advanced experience using Tableau. Experience using Power BI a plus.
Advanced experience using Microsoft Excel. Experience creating dashboards using Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) a plus.
Experience using Adobe Creative Cloud software highly preferred.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to work independently and manage a wide range of activities on a daily basis with limited supervision.
Ability to solve problems creatively and work under tight deadlines.
HTML 5 / CSS 3 / Javascript knowledge and web page design experience a plus.
English fluency. Fluency in foreign language a plus.
Experience working in international development, preferably global health a plus.
